title: Improvements
review: So far I like this app to get a couple bucks in my pockets. I think it's a great app and has a lot of potential to grow a lot more. I used to use another buy & sell app (not mentioning the name because I don't want to be on here promoting another app) but that other app has made me A LOT of money simply because that app made it so so easy for users to find my listings. I think Depop should me make a couple improvements when it comes to the listings. 1.Create a new feature where we can actually share our listings therefore i listings are getting views and are not forgotten in our feed. By us being able to share new listings are listing are going to be visible to others because it will go in the feed. The more we share the more are listings get views. So for example we we have a homepage and everytime our friends share a listing of their own items or other friends items it goes into our feed"homepage" and walaaah! We are able to see new items and have a lot more potential sales. Also having a "favorite" option to add our favorite users would be great because that way we can always easily go back to their feed and see if they posted new things. I have a lot more feedback. Hopefully these ones are taken into consideration as I do believe that making the listings more visible would me great for the app.

title: The future is bright
review:
There is a lot about this app that I like! The shipping process is very simple! Leaving buyers & sellers reviews is super easy! The percentage Depop earns is low so you get a larger portion of what you sell in comparison to similar apps. If you’re looking for unique items this is an app for you. Unique items are everywhere & not everything has to be name brand. I find beautiful items all the time that are stylish & aren’t name brand. The focus should be on esthetic & how you style an item. My absolute favorite part is the expression of creativity. Depop is a place where you can bring the creative vision you have for your shop alive! Everyone puts a lot of thought into bringing their vision alive! Each shop has its own vibe, & I think that’s so cool! My only complaint is that it is very hard to get ahold of anyone at Depop. If you ever have a pressing issue the process is really annoying & time consuming. Returns & exchanges should be easier. But above all else communication should definitely be improved! Whether it be through email, phone, or through the app there should be a point of contact. It means a lot to hear a voice on the other end of the phone, or knowing there’s a real person emailing you who is concerned & willing to help. In my opinion this app could use some work here & there but 90% of it is working & very user friendly! I can’t wait to see what this app will be like in a year or two. 

❤️

title: Good enough for me
review: I’ve had Depop for a while now and I’ve enjoyed it a lot for the most part as a buyer (haven’t experienced selling yet). I thought I hated shopping for clothing before I found Depop. I guess I just hate leaving my cozy home and the general styles I see at the mall and whatnot, but while using Depop I’m able to shop from the comfort of my house and find a variety of cute options of clothing in much lesser time than I would at a physical store. It’s easy to use and I’ve found so many nice outfits that I adore, and most are vintage meaning it’s likely I never would have had the opportunity to purchase without Depop. Plus, buying second hand clothing is environment friendly :) One complaint I do have though is that the app exits me out after a certain amount a time, which can get a bit irritating because I lose where I’m browsing. I hope this gets fixed, or that an option to check our browsing history is made available. I’m also glad that the app doesn’t give annoying notifications, except when they’re necessary, like follower updates/pm messages/comments from other users etc. I’ve seen that a lot of people have other (less positive) things to say about it, but for a shopping app, I think it’s a lot better in comparison to others and that it’s done a great job for the most part.
developerResponse: {'id': 3315644, 'body': "Hey there - thanks for the 5 stars and we're glad you're enjoying the app! Please do get in touch with our support team (support@depop.com) who can look into the glitch you reported. Happy Depop-ing!", 'modified': '2018-05-01T11:49:43Z'}

title: Great app, still has room to improve
review:
I have been buying and selling through Depop for almost a year now. It’s very easy to use on both counts, and I’ve found some really unique pieces I love. I have very alternative taste in clothing, so I can’t generally find things in typical high street stores, but Depop always has stuff that’s perfect for me.
My main complaint is the massive influx in dropshipping. If Depop won’t ban it outright, they should create a separate section for it. It’s difficult to search for anything when the app is clogged up with hundreds of people selling the exact same cheap Chinese knockoffs, and annoying to see listings for something for $50 that you can buy from Wish or Aliexpress yourself for $5. It’s especially scummy that they never disclose that this is what they’re doing, and often explain the 4 to 6 week shipping time as the item being ‘made to order’, which implies that *they* are the one making it, not some Chinese sweatshop. That’s borderline scamming, and I think they should at least be required to make it clear when they’re dropshipping. The misusing of tags also needs to be fixed, because as is, it’s almost impossible to find a specific brand when sellers flood the tags with unrelated items. Finally, I wish they’d ditch the fuzzy searching - for example, searching the keyword ‘clown’ will also return results for ‘crown’, etc.
developerResponse:
{'id': 9893390, 'body': "Hey there! So great to hear that Depop provides the niche clothing that you're looking for.

Thanks for the super helpful feedback on dropshipping and fuzzy searching - will be passing these along to the team so we can look into creating some positive change for you.

Happy shopping,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-29T09:14:04Z'}

title: awesome, but
review: I love this app! It’s so much more aesthetically pleasing and simplistic compared to other apps, and it’s super easy to get a hang of! The app itself is great in function, but it can be really difficult to find good stuff since a lot of people find a $3 toddler shirt thrifting and then sell it for $47 as a “rare baby tee”. It’s also REALLY common for people to put the brand as Brandy Melville just for exposure when it’s actually something from H&M. The app tried to discourage from doing this, but everyone does it anyway. However, you can still find a gem at a great price every once in a while. I have a suggestion that would make the app easier to use- while there are filters on the app to easily find what you’re looking for, I think it would make it even easier if there was a “sort by” option- ex. newest to oldest, lowest to highest price. This would be especially helpful for the “saved” section. I also think it would be great if you could automatically see which items you liked are already sold, similar to how you can see the word “sold” on top of items that you’ve saved. There are a few things that aren’t perfect, but overall, this app that’s structured almost like social media makes buying and selling secondhand clothing really easy and fun!

title: Great finds
review:
I used to use depop to both sell and buy but I found it quite hard to sell even trendier items at the most affordable prices. But something is up with Depops featured/explore page. It’s ALWAYS the same sellers and even items that were sold a week ago that are still being featured. That’s frustrating for both sellers looking to be noticed, and buyers looking for good items. I hate when I click on something from the featured page thinking “oh this is cute” only to find that it was sold 6 days ago — why is it still even there?? It’s also frustrating to be scrolling down that page and you see... the same of everything. 90% striped clothing. Two days later, 90% blue things. Few days later the explore page is 90% belts, or some other random accessory. Does that happen to anybody else or am I crazy? I hate it. 

That being said, I have found some great stuff as a buyer. Some of my favorite items in my wardrobe are from depop and I love the sellers that go the extra mile to create a good transaction. I believe depop recently began giving buyers a tailored page “just for you” and your individual interests. Is this supposed to be based on your personal searches? Because at this moment, my “just for you” page is mainly comprised of dad sneakers... which I have never searched or clicked on once during my entire time on depop. I’ve shown 0 interest in them ... so why are they all I’m seeing?

title: Nice App but has a Lot of Bugs
review: I love this app for selling clothes. It’s an easy way to make your items accessible to the public as well as find quality items to purchase. I spend lots of time on this app buying and selling because it makes buying clothes sustainably and second hand more easy! That being said, I have a lot of issues with this app because of the innumerable amount of bugs it has. To name a few, it does not recognize when you have looked at your notifications and therefore the red alert on the iphone will not go away, and if an account is disabled or deleted, you can’t unlike the posts from that account and therefore they will remain in your liked posts forever. There are many other bugs that are a pain to deal with on a daily basis. A few other issues with this app are that there are many sellers on here that are rude, try to scam you, or overcharge for simple items - but that isn’t really Depop’s fault. Depop takes about 10% of your earnings each time you make a sale which definitely adds up over time so if you’re planning on selling a lot of clothes and/or having a larger business, then Depop is not the place to start your shop. But if you have a very small business and sell just your old clothes then Depop is a great place to do that! I prefer Depop to other selling apps such as Poshmark and Ebay immensely! I only hope that Depop can fix a lot of the bugs that currently exist on the app.

title: Best Buying/Selling App Ever
review: I started using Depop around 4 months ago, because I was really into vintage clothing at the time and was looking to find some nice deals. I was so used to using eBay and other apps, but I was very excited to find an app dedicated to mainly clothes only. I found some awesome stuff, and was buying avidly on Depop. I just loved the way the app was set up and just everything about it. The format and everything. It was awesome. Then, one day I decided to try to sell some stuff. I wanted to give it a shot to see if I could get some extra cash. I started off my selling my old clothes. It took a couple weeks of likes on items and messages until I finally had my first sale. It was very exciting for me and I thought I was the coolest person ever that at the age of 14 I sold an item. But my business took off after that sale. It then became a habit of myself and my brother who also has a Depop shop, going to thrift stores every weekend to find cool vintage pieces to re sell on our Depop accounts. Since my first sale, I’ve made about 60+ more sales, and have great feedback from all customers. I’ve made a bunch of money, and I just can’t believe I’m doing this as a 14 year old. It’s truly a great way to become a young entrepreneur. 5 stars.

title: Well I'm happy with it
review: I see a lot of mixed reviews here that I've taken the time to read. I think people are expecting a lot from this app, which is very good; though demanding all of the kinks and tweaks to be made ASAP I don't necessarily agree with. In my opinion the app does what it is supposed to. I'm seeing a lot of complaints about the explorer page but come on. Okay yes, I get that it helps sell items but is it really that big of a deal? So the same, relatively well known sellers get a spot more frequently than the rest of us but that's just something that needs to be worked out. And, if you asked me, doesn't take away from the functionality of the app. To me, the app is lovely and I spend a lot of time paroozing through clothes just to pass time. I know the app has a couple of things that need a bit of TLC but I'm going to stick by the app and support it because I think it's a great concept. All apps have things that they need to work out, I mean come on.. that new snapchat update?... Instagram's chronological issue that they haven't changed bc they won't acknowledge that we all loath is? No. That is not this app. This app, as I have seen, listens to the critique of its users. I love this app for that. And I think it deserves more than people care to give it.

title: Users take advantage of you
review:
I started using this app a few months ago and all was good until I bought from a user that deleted their account before shipping their item. Depop does offer customer service however, they provided little to no help in getting my money back. Instead told me that their was a dispute with the user’s account and to wait for my money to possibly and/or item to come, both which never did. I was also sent a link by Depop to handle the dispute with PayPal even though I didn’t pay using PayPal. It seems that accounts like these that take advantage of people don’t get any serious action or consequences. Issues like these can be handled better and Depop can at the very least notify those who purchased items from an account that’s having issues or give those a refund for their product. It makes me wary to use this app to buy anything knowing this could easily happen again.

Edit: PayPal did not pull up any transaction history used through the Depop app. Which is why I state I did not use PayPal to pay for my item. This creates an issue when reporting a problem to PayPal due to there being no history. There’s little options for those that have made an in-app purchase due to lack of history. Instead, the only option seems to be go through the same process of filling out a description of your dispute, which was the same process being used by Depop to handle the situation.
developerResponse: {'id': 2913195, 'body': "Hey there! All transactions on the app are handle via PayPal (even if you paid with guest check-out) and therefore issues that crop up are also handled by them. They have a straightforward process in place for buyers and sellers alike and so we do believe this is the best way for our users to resolve any issues. Nevertheless thank you for the feedback around notifications, we're working on this! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-23T11:00:43Z'}

title: I need help!
review:
So I really loved this app but would never really get any shells but I thought I would keep selling in there anyway. Then I accidentally logged out of it and when I tried to log back in it wouldn’t let me. Sooo I thought okay maybe I need to reset my password so I reset it from my email and then tried again  and it still wouldn’t let me:( so then I looked it up and it said to try and delete the app and download it again and so that’s what I did. But then it still wouldn’t let me and it says “the operation could not be completed. Please try again later” and I don’t know what to do because I have tried to get back in and can’t. And I fear that someone may want to buy something and I have know clue. Or my account will be taken down due to “inactivity” but I simply can’t get in. I really need help.       

UPDATE:!!!! I am back in!!!!! I looked it up for more research and I found some info! So it said to try and turn your phone off and back on to see if it works and then if it doesn’t then turn off your WiFi and try again( that’s when mine worked— when I turned off my WiFi— ) and then if it doesn’t work when you turn off your WiFi, you can email depop about it! Hope this helps anyone with the same issue!:)
developerResponse: {'id': 16866303, 'body': 'We love to see it.\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-07-25T16:54:32Z'}

title: Suggestions
review: The idea of this app is smart and could save people lots of money and help clear out closets; however, I am a little wary of the depop protection after what I recently experienced. I bought an item that never was shipped to me and made sure to wait a decent amount of time after contacting the seller (approximately a month) before contacting depop about it. When I contacted depop they said they would contact the seller and if they did not respond in a few days I should make a claim/start a dispute through PayPal. After a few days and no response, I went to make a dispute; however, I realized that PayPal never sent me a receipt so I did not have a transaction number nor proof through the PayPal app that I made this purchase. Although, looking at my bank account, it was clear that money was taken out of my account through depop. I then called PayPal customer service and was on hold for almost an hour waiting to talk to a real person. The lady on the phone was very nice and helped me get my money back; however, I do think this process could have been a lot easier if depop took it in their hands instead of making their customers figure it out. I also would suggest having a “cancel order” option (like Poshmark) to cancel an order that was never shipped and get money back an easier way.
developerResponse: {'id': 5472129, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for your feedback. We're understand that the process can be lengthy so we apologise for that. Our goal is to make sure our users are protected as best as possible as we put in place PayPal protection and also Depop protection should this be needed. We do want to make sure our users have the best experience with us so your feedback is highly appreciated.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-10-12T09:15:56Z'}

title: Great, but can be amazing 4.5/5*
review: I’ve been using Depop for a little around a year now and believe it is one of the better sites/ apps for “cleaning out your closet”. They make everything very straight forward and anybody can begin selling in less than 24 hours! But once you begin to use Depop on a daily basis you start to recognize the room for improvement they have and even just some small changes could help some top sellers drastically. There have been a few changes done to Depop throughout my year of use and some have been very necessary including Depop payments! But even Depop payments is in its early stages of development and has a lot of work to be done. What Depop really needs is an update focused on the sellers, and making their jobs easier since they are the ones keeping it alive! There are many small tweaks and changes that can happen that will make selling a greater experience for everyone on the app ( Refreshing items, more than 4 pics, etc ). These changes will not only benefit sellers, but it will help the community and Depop as well. If the sellers are able to put out their best content in the most efficient way possible, customers are happier, and in turn Depop is happier!

title: Depop is a freaking MESS. Poshmark or Mercari is way better
review: I’ve been on depop for 6 years so I’ve seen a ton of things go down. A lot of rude people on this app. It’s caused me so much anxiety since depop doesn’t seem to care about situational issues. Customer service has been nothing but blunt to me and always walk around my questions. my account recently got hacked and it’s been 2 and half weeks and I STILL CANT GET IN. I’ve emailed them countless times and they keep saying they email me a password reset that I never receive... I’m beyond frustrated as someone did not use PayPal to pay and I can’t ship their order, or contact them. Customer service is awful... I’m surprised they don’t have a phone number to call so things can move along quicker... yet I see them posting on all these social media accounts. Yeah after 6 years I’ve had enough this app is just a joke now. When you search anything you get all these scams that pop up or people trying to drop ship from China. They use to have a worldwide button where you could only search worldwide and took it away, which is super inconvenient as some brands aren’t worldwide so I have to scroll for 5 minutes straight just to get to the worldwide section...which imo is going backwards?! I have no idea who runs this app but they are beyond stuck up if they don’t care to better their customer service....Please DO BETTER.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15625050, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-28T10:10:24Z'}

title: Had a bad experience
review: I recently got Depop and made two sales last Week. However it said I was unable to download the shipping label because my bank account or email wasn’t confirmed. I then went to my PayPal app and it said that my bank and email were confirmed. However it still would not let me download the shipping label because the same message came up saying my email or bank account was not confirmed, while they both were because my account said they were. Today is Thursday(5 days later) and when I click on the shipping label from both my email and the depop app, the same message shows up. This is very frustrating to me because I have 2 packages I need to ship out and feel bad I have had to make them wait so long just because the apps I am using are not functioning. I have contacted PayPal about it and they have said that I need to enter my social security number(which seems unsafe, and nobody else I know has had to) and they have said that it’s Depop’s issue not theirs. And when I contacted Depop they responded saying they would like screenshots, which I sent to them 4 days ago, and they have not responded. It’s just really frustrating because Depop took their cut of the money out of my account but the money I am supposed to receive is pending, also, I am making these people wait a very long time on their packages which is unfair to them.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14972472, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-04-28T16:57:11Z'}

title: Buyer Beware
review: I have been using both Poshmark and Depop and have come to conclude that Depop is unsafe for Buyers. One you have experienced an unreliable Seller, it is so difficult to get a refund. The app claims that you should try to work it out with the Seller, but if the issue is that the Seller is unresponsive, have accepted the Buyer’s money through Paypal, then what is the point of making the Buyer contact the Seller to resolve a dispute. Poshmark allows the Buyer to withhold payment for the item until it is delivered and tendered in the specified condition advertised by he Seller on the app. It is safer for a Buyer to go through Poshmark simply because in failed transactions between Seller and Buyer, Poshmark is well invested in ensuring that both parties act and perform as promised. When claiming that an item has not been delivered, Depop send you standard response e-mails telling Buyer to try to contact the Seller through the app as well as Paypal. They provide no help and have no authority in taking appropriate measures to keep their community safe and free from scam. Selling and Buying online is a risky thing to do. Once you have contracted to sell or buy, you subject your identity as well as your address and location to the opposite party. Operating without any authority makes Depop a dangerous way to make simple purchases online. Simple purchases are not simple at all when you run into an issue like the one described above.
developerResponse: {'id': 3458266, 'body': "Hey Grace! Using PayPal as our payment provider provides users with a thorough PayPal buyer/seller protection process, and we can assure you that in this case they'll help you retrieve your money. If for any reason we deem their resolution to be unfair, this is when Depop Protection steps in. Nevertheless we are working on improving what we can do to help during transaction issues and there'll definitely be noticeable changes coming your way in 2018. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-14T11:12:40Z'}

title: Took a turn for the worst
review: Honestly, when I first downloaded this app in 2018 I loved it. It was so nice and had a great community with affordable clothes. I was able to start selling in 2019 and it was really easy and I got quite a lot of sales in 2019 and overall enjoyed the app. For the past few months in 2020 Depop has literally gone SO DOWNHILL. To start, they barely had any brands from the get go and it’s really hard to try and put brands for items when they don’t even have a category for it on the brand section. And all the updates constantly make me hate the app so much more. The fees are also ridiculous as well, I sold 2 items for $25 and only got $7..?????? They take a huge percentage and even when the money goes to your PayPal, PayPal takes money off too. The newest update is what makes me hate depop the most. They have it so it’s automatically on free shipping and you have to manually change it EVERY time you want to post. It gets annoying and sometimes I forget and end up only getting $4-$5 off of a shirt I sold for $16 because they take fees AND since it’s “free shipping” they pay for the label. The only reason I haven’t deleted this app yet is because my shop has lots of sales and followers that are constantly interested in my items, but if I hadn’t have a shop and sold things, I would’ve deleted this app a long time ago.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18690923, 'body': "Hey there,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-25T22:59:12Z'}

title: Room for improvement
review:
I've been using depop for over 2 years now and have just a few suggestions to make it better (in my opinion)
1. The option to cancel/refund a buyer immediately through the app. It's virtually impossible to refund someone without losing money as a seller, since payments are sent directly to PayPal where a fee is taken out (my next suggestion for improvement) sellers will always be out a few bucks for refunding someone due to PayPal feels. Like depops competitors Mercari and Poshmark they have easy ways to cancel orders and refund buyers.
2. There should be a way to receive payments through PayPal to avoid fees. I don't want to raise my prices to accommodate the fees because I always raise my price 10% to accommodate depop fees. 
3. Very often shipping on my items switches from USPS (which I chose) to arranging my own shipping (which I do NOT want). I have had this issue several times and I am then at a loss bc shipping within the app is much cheaper and efficient. When it glitches and people buy my items with this shipping chosen I then have to pay more for shipping and visit my local post office which is difficult due to their specific hours and the fact that I'm a full time student and work a full time job.

title: Help the baby shops too!
review:
I love selling and buying on this app. It’s so cool to see what everyone is selling and it’s awesome to make some extra cash by cleaning out your closet. 
However, I agree with some of the other reviews. The explore page is full of the same people. Big shops are automatically featured several times a day on the explore page. My shop has been running for more than a year, and i have sold many items, but I’ve only been featured once. It’s hard to catch up to those guys when Depop is putting the spotlight on the same people. Also, the 10% fee that Depop takes is understandable, but also makes it a bit hard to actually make some money. I liked the week where Depop only took 5% and I wish they’d do that permanently. 
This app is perfect for buying vintage items, but difficult to sell unless you’re in the 1%.

UPDATE: the new update has a “staff picks” section of the explore that picks their favorite shops... all of which are shops that have skinny people modeling small clothes. A friend of mine that is currently on that page even got an email that told her to keep up with modeling her clothes and it had a bunch of “what not to do”’s. Unfortunately, I cannot model most of my clothes because I have outgrown them, so I suppose I’ll never be featured on explore. :/

title: Overall company improvement
review: I sold with Depop for about 6 years and have had no issues with the app up until recently. My PayPal disconnected from my Depop account so I could no longer make purchases or sales. I tried multiple times to reconnect the accounts but in the end couldn’t. At least on my end. This caused me to use other methods for payment means. I only made two transactions with other Depop accounts (who were also dealing with the same PayPal issue). Less than a few weeks pass and Depop suspends my account indefinitely. The emails I received explained that there had sent me many warnings which they did not and when I tried to explain this they defended themselves and said that their decision would not change. This has happened to many Depop stores. I had read under their one of Depop’s twitter page posts that a girl’s store was suspended for bullying when one of her buyers called her a racial slur. She provided screenshots as evidence and they never gave her account back. Depop needs to open up the payment options and allow users to dispute suspensions if the seller has proof and Depop should HONOR it. PayPal is a very buggy website and does not work for everyone. Instead of punishing the stores that are honest and true they should focus on better means for transactions, policies, and dispute customer service needs.

title: I love it..but..we got some issues to solve Depop
review: Hi, I’ve been using Depop for a couple months now. It’s been awesome. The energy of the people on this platform is amazing. Some people aren’t as nice but that rarely happens. On the other hand lately I’ve noticed people have been contacting me regarding how they try and purchase something from my shop and it comes up as an error. This issue is not just happening to me. I tried contacting Depop about it but they have not gotten back to me. I also contacted them them the same day reporting someone who was not being very nice and they got back to me in 24 hours about that incident but not about my PROBLEM that involves my customers. Considering this is my only income at the moment this is a very big problem that’s going on. I would also like to point out how their only payment option is PayPal. I’ve had so many problems with PayPal it’s insane. If they could have another payment option that would be so helpful. Going through you’re bank card or even Venmo. Please Depop, if you could just add Venmo or anything other than just PayPal that would be amazing.

title: BANNED MY 1000 FOLLOWERS ACCOUNT FOR NO REASON!!
review: I really needed money for my career and then i started depop and i worked really hard on it and got my first 1000 followers after weeks of non stop work and sold many items. Then this elementary schooler followed me and asked me to buy something from her shop. I said no. Then she kept on forcing me and being really rude about it. Then she said “are you black?” (Shes white) And i said “yea why?” Then she said “That’s why your so stubborn” And i was never disgusting in my life as of that moment!! And she kept on spamming with “👩🏿👩🏿👩🏿” and said things like “your people makes america worse” “going around killing people and blaming white innocent cops” and i just ignored her and then she stopped. And this morning i got a email saying MY ACCOUNT was banned for being racist and i was shocked af😔😔 all my hard work just went to waste like that.. i should have blocked her im so stupid. But depop really didn’t care and banned me plus my account was pretty big she had 10 followers and 0 sales and she was the one being racist i dont even know why I WAS THE ONE THAT GOT BANNED. Please bring me back my account you dont know how much i need it..😔😔 and i still have sales, like people paid their money but now since im banned i cant send them their stuff and thats so unfair. Please dont ignore this like you did the last 7 times..

title: SELLERS BEWARE!! HORRIBLE SELLER PROTECTION!!
review: I started using depop and really liked it to start. Like many other selling apps such as Mercari and Poshmark they offer shipping labels through their discounted shipping program set up with SHIPPO but UNLIKE other apps they don’t provide any help whatsoever when a shipment goes missing and you cannot file a claim on their shipping account. I lost $30 on an item that was lost because they refused to file a claim or do anything to help. On top of this I had to refund the customer (no problem when protected) $30 so one item cost me $60 in losses due to their crappy customer service and absolutely clueless seller support. I do not recommend this app to sellers who expect any seller protections because they are nonexistent!! I used this apps labels in good faith that they would provide the necessary help if an item got lost but they DID NOTHING to help beyond calling me a liar over and over. It’s a shame because the app has promise as an app but as a company they are beyond unbusinesslike and I cannot send a warning loud enough to sellers who are used to feeling safe selling to NOT TO USE THIS APP!!
developerResponse: {'id': 4841058, 'body': "Hey Kristy - sorry to read you're not happy with Depop. As we use external providers for shipping, ultimately if something goes wrong with a shipment the best way to resolve your problem is via the shipping carrier themselves. This is because they have more visibility on context on your issue(s) than we do. We're sorry if this came as a surprise to you. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-28T10:44:43Z'}

title: Great
review:
The app overall is wonderful! especially for those just trying to get rid of clothes they don’t wear anymore, but for those trying to build a brand / business, it’s a little difficult. I’ve been using the app for months now and this is MY PERSONAL case. 
I eventually want to start my own brand so months ago I found the app to be a great platform to do so. They used to feature such a variety of people. Now they don’t so much, I don’t want to say they pick favorites, but it’s the same people time and time again being featured. I have been lucky to be featured a handful of time, but every time I do my feature is always at the bottom bottom and I feel like that puts me at a disadvantage. Sometimes I can’t even find myself on the explore page even though I’m featured. 
The percentage they take is REALLY FAIR considering all the other apps I’ve tried using, take an outrageous percentage, so you definitely can make some cash. 
There’s a lot they can improvement on, but they’re definitely on top of their game & personally I think the best app to sell in right now.
developerResponse: {'id': 2620341, 'body': "Hey Liltothelay! Thanks for this honest review; there's food for thought for us indeed - Team Depop.", 'modified': '2018-02-19T16:31:47Z'}

title: THE WORST OF THE WORST
review:
I’ve never bought anything from a peer to peer online service before. But I had heard a lot about depop and I wanted to look for some secondhand designer shoes. After a long search I found some I found a seller who I was able to make a good deal with. I made the purchase through PayPal so I could be covered by the protection policy. After a long and tedious process with the shipment (where I was forced to pay extra because they were being held at customs) I finally received my shoes and they were nothing like what I was paying for. First and foremost they were a COUNTERFIT!!! I was in shock I immediately got in touch with the seller but he denied that they were a counterfeit and pretended like he did not understand what the problem was. He said he was just reselling the shoes and that the came from a store that was legit. Even if I wanted to give him the benefit of the doubt and believe that he did not know they were counterfeit he still did not sell me the shoes as he advertised them. He had assured me that the shoes would come in a size 11 in the original shoebox, and with the receipt. I didn’t get any of those things. He just threw them in a plastic bag and shipped them off. And they weren’t even in my size?!
So all around horrible experience! I already reported him on the Depop app but didn’t get a response.
developerResponse: {'id': 8502838, 'body': 'Hi there, that does sound like an awful experience. Do know that items that are not as described is also covered by buyer protection. Can you let us know your username? We can reach out to the support team and see if they have received your report and have been in contact with you about this.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-04T06:00:18Z'}

title: NEEDS IMPROVEMENT
review: Ok, I NEVER do reviews, but felt the need to do one about Depop. Initially, I fell in love with the app bc of the aesthetic and how much time and effort some people put into taking nice pictures. But I decided to start selling, bc being a college student, I definitely need the extra money. Well, I'll keep it nice and short. THEY TAKE MONEY FROM YOUR ACCOUNT RANDOMLY WITHOUT YOUR PERMISSION. I got an email saying $8 was taken from my account randomly!! Not even part of the percentage they take from you after a sale, it was just so random! If you email them for help they WILL NOT answer!!!! Also, they need a "retweet" button to get your listings out there again, instead of going to edit and posting your listing again, Whenever i use poshmark they answer their emails in less than 24 hours and always help!! Never a problem on there. Depop is probably the most confusing app I've ever used. They should stop using Paypal, and use bank accounts instead, and focus on the customers rather than the whole aesthetic. There are TOO many fees (depop fee, paypal fee, and just random money they decided to take out) Anyways, I will continue to buy on there, ONLY bc they have good finds! But be very careful!! As for selling...idk they just need to change a lot.
developerResponse: {'id': 2866187, 'body': "Hey there! Please be aware we don't take any random fees beyond our 10% fee. Being a US user, it sounds like this additional fee is the price you would've set for shipping which is taken from your account and then returned to you. Please reach out to our support team if you need more clarification. Many thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-19T13:44:51Z'}

title: THIS IS A BUYER REVIEW NOT SELLER
review: My style is constantly evolving and this app is the best for that. It's v easy to find cheap, CUTE AND HIGH QUALITY CLOTHES/VINTAGE. Every seller I've dealt with on this app is super sweet and generally pretty fast! A lot of negative comments seem to be from sellers feeling this site is unfair with the way they charge an extra fee to seller and don't seem versatile with explore page. Buyer negative comments are mostly people who don't seem to understand how busy some of these sellers are or don't message the seller asking about a product before buying which definitely isn't too smart.  I feel like you have to check someone's profile out before buying just to ensure if they are active/have good reviews which is not hard to do. also make sure you check the quality of the photos and that they have multiple of one piece, because sometimes things can look different online than in person . Besides that I love depop and haven't had a single bad experience, and that's coming from someone who has purchased over 30 items y'all!! 🎉💖🌟✨

title: PLEASE LISTEN TO YOUR SELLERS
review: I think the app is good but there’s obviously some bugs. This isn’t really isn’t about my experience because I was lucky enough to have a good experience with depop so far. I convinced my bf and sister to get depop to let go some of their items & make cash. However both of them experienced not receiving shipping labels EVEN WHEN THEIR PAYPALS ARE VERIFIED. And I’m sorry depop but your support team needs a lot of work. For my bf it took two weeks to get the shipping label for ONE out of TWO items people bought from him. My sister is STILL WAITING for them to get back to her. My bf deleted his old depop account to try and see if it’ll work on his new account and the SAME THING HAPPENED. Plus the support team sent the same advice to verify your account to my bf when he had already made it clear that it was already verified and he couldn’t get the label. He ended up paying out of pocket for shipping for one of the items because he wasn’t able to access the shipping label. Now that the same incident is happening again to my bf it is stressing him out because he might have to go through this process all over again. He’s going to check one more time to see if his account is verified for sure. He told me that if this doesn’t get resolved he’s going to quit depop and sell elsewhere.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15472637, 'body': "Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-21T15:42:56Z'}

title: What’s going on Depop?
review:
This used to be my favorite selling app. I just felt it is where my niche fit best. Lately my sales have decreased so dramatically, I haven’t been featured on the explore page but once in 4 months? Over the course of the last few months I’ve spent my energy listing elsewhere! I don’t know what changes were made but the smaller and newer sellers don’t stand a chance, regardless of how good their merch is. You just don’t see us because you’re constantly putting the same shops featured on the explore page. I hate how the items featured are from just about whenever, I’ve seen items featured that were listed a year ago, and that were SOLD! is it some kind of bot you people are using to choose? It’s so discouraging I’ve contemplated just saying F it and giving up on depop and shutting it down. Too much work for nothing. I’m strictly a seller and have had no issues with my customers so I can’t comment on your customer service. If things
Don’t change it’s time to move on from
What was once my fave app!
developerResponse: {'id': 3269062, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for letting us know your feedback, and sorry that things haven't been going so well recently. The Editorial team that look after the Explore page are currently in the process of making some changes to this part of the app, as we hear that we're perhaps not giving enough exposure to the many great sellers on the app. We hope you'll notice some improvements in due course. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-26T10:35:44Z'}

title: UNPROFESSIONAL - failure to own up to mistakes
review:
I don’t know what is up with their engineering and PR team, but Depop has been experiencing so many glitches and does not handle them appropriately, citing user blame or another company to blame (Paypal) in response to criticisms by Depop buyers and sellers. Recently, they had a huge glitch obviously caused by a problem with the newly implemented Depop shipping methods, causing Depop seller accounts to be automatically suspended despite following community guidelines. 

Depop has barely responded to any of the instagram comments or tweets about this and failed to make any kind of announcement regarding their plans of action. Once a few accounts finally got unsuspended, they were sent an email recommending that they verify their Paypal account and link their bank accounts to PayPal. HOWEVER, users stated they used DEPOP PAYMENTS, NOT PAYPAL. So Depop basically blamed the user for a problem that was obviously their company’s. 

For some people, Depop is their only income and for the company to disregard how this app is inherently serious since it deals with money and any glitch would be a huge issue for sellers depending on Depop? it’s sickening. Instead of spending money on collabs, trendy edits, and PR that obviously isn’t even adequate, maybe they should focus on making sure their app actually works.

title: Can’t get a refund? Help is ignoring me???
review: This app is perfect for scammers and my luck I got scammed in the first one. I hate that this is app only, the website is barley functioning and it’s impossible to follow all these things on a phone. I made two purchases right away one from Hawaii I received in a week and a half The other from Texas still has not been shipped over three weeks in. I’ve contacted the seller who said Halloween was a lot for her and then ‘shipped it’. She did not. Radio silence since it’s been a week.  Now that’s not the apps fault, what is is that I sent an email for help two weeks ago and never heard anything back through the app and this app is impossible to navigate efficiently I would much rather work on my laptop but I can’t. I can’t leave a review for the scammer untill I receive an item so. I used PayPal but did not make an account as Depop talks a big talk  about how secure they are when I reality they will leave you in the dust and that’s only if you buy on depop whatever that is. PayPal doesn’t recognize my email so I literally can’t do anything and no one will help me. Most people in this app are just capitalizing off thrift stores and price gauging used clothes. I love vintage and whatever but it’s not worth this risk. Do not use this app

title: Buyer Protection is Not What it Seems!
review: I have used Depop for awhile and have gotten some great clothing pieces through this app. When the sellers do their job, Depop is fine. However, Depop’s “buyer protection” that they market is complete BS. Depop has no customer service (you can’t even call or email a real person) and doesn’t deal with refunds in app. If you don’t receive an item or a seller ghosts you after payment, you have to go to PayPal and file a dispute yourself in order to get your money back. The only thing Depop does when this happens is send an email with some bullet points on how to do this on PayPal. I bought an item over a month ago and I’ve been trying to get in contact with the seller or get a refund for weeks and it is taking FOREVER to get my money back ($150+). Not only this, but you can’t even review a seller unless you’ve received the item so I can’t even give a review to warn other buyers that this seller is potentially going to ghost them. This means that the whole seller rating system on Depop is skewed. Honestly I used to really like Depop but now I don’t feel comfortable using it. Depop needs to adopt a system like Mercari where the seller doesn’t receive the money until you receive the item.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10972124, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the BUY button. 

Follow these steps so we can put this right:
https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001772448-I-haven-t-received-my-item

Our Support Team is located within the app by going to 'settings - support - need help - technical issues - I've still got an issue' and either chat to us or send a report, alternatively you can reach us at support@depop.com (I promise we're real people).

We're here to help you,
Team Depop ", 'modified': '2019-09-30T10:14:36Z'}

title: It’s alright
review: I mean Depop is a good app to buy or to sell its very straight forward but man, I advise any seller joining this app to only use Paypal and not their “Depop payment” feature. It honestly has been the worst, I understand it takes time to receive money directly into your bank account but man Depop takes a little too long for this to happen. It’s fine I mean I get to be patient and I wouldn’t be complaining because I’ve accepted the feature and it is okay but it gets annoying when they will send you a notification saying, “you should receive the payment today” and then not receive the payment (As of now, I still haven’t received my payment and it’s been two days since they have sent me that notification). The feature is okay if you’re not in a struggling with money. A lot of college students use Depop to make money and to have enough money for rent/bills and if you are one of those people struggling please do not use the feature, my bank account is now in negative because of bills being charged to my account and I have no money (because of this Depop feature) to help take it out until Depop finally decides to deposit it in my account. Thanks Depop! (not) - From a struggling 18 year old who just graduated and barely has time to work
developerResponse: {'id': 19700968, 'body': "Sorry to hear that you haven't received payment for your sold item yet. Check our the possible reasons for this here → http://bit.ly/depopmypayment\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-11T15:12:26Z'}

title: Customer service needs to be improved
review: I really like this app and the aesthetics it involves but I’ve recently been having a lot of problems with my account and I’ve seen reviews from others all concerned with the same thing. The process of customer service is so long and frustrating. It takes forever to get a hold of someone and for the problem to maybe get fixed. I just wish I could talk to someone on the phone or email someone that was actually concerned with my problem and was one on one with me. I’ve recently been locked out of my account and i had to wait 2 days just for multiple ppl to tell me that they detached my number so I could make another account instead. I tried to sign up for another one today with my number and it wouldn’t let me.. so my problem has still not been fixed and I don’t know what to do. All I wanna do it log in and buy a cheap wig 😭. Anyways thanks for listening to my TED talk and I really hope y’all can do something to fix this. Thanks~

title: Total Waste of Time and Money
review:
I have a lot of problems with this app and the way it is run...
Firstly, I have ordered so many items on Depop that just never came. I gave it a chance multiple times, and I have wasted a good amount of money buying accessories and stickers that never arrived at my door. Since Depop customer service wasn’t at all helpful with this, the store owners had to just give me store credit. The problem is that I didn’t end up using that store credit because I didn’t want anything else; I wanted the items I had ordered. So essentially I never got my money back for the packages that never came. This has happened so many times that I am done purchasing anything on this app, not wanting to spend money on something I’ll never get. It really makes it look like a scam, the fact that this kept happening. 
Secondly, customer service is pretty awful. NEWS FLASH DEPOP - deleting and reinstalling the app is not a universal fix for all problems. You need to look into your consumers complaints and problems and figure out how to fix them, instead of giving a half assed assessment of what could have caused the problem. 

Be very careful, consumers and sellers - you could easily lose money unnecessarily on this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2815265, 'body': "Hey z33girl - sorry to read about this experience. In instances where you don't receive your item we always suggest that you open a dispute via PayPal, our payment provider. They will judge the case and will side with the buyer if it's clear that your item was never shipped or never reached its destination. Whilst we appreciate that offering to delete and re-install an app doesn't always work and can be a frustrating message to receive, this is a first step that we've found fixes many small glitches that occur on the app. If we find this fails, we always go into more depth with our users to understand the root problem and fix it for our users. Sorry we've let you down here! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-13T14:06:50Z'}

title: Fun, But Has Issues
review:
DePop is a fun site, resembling Instagram in the formatting and use of emojis. But there are major issues that need to be addressed before I purchase items on here again: My biggest complaint is that sellers get paid immediately and then have SEVEN DAYS to ship your item before you can ask for a refund because they never shipped it. Another site I use - Mercari - only gives a three day shipping window and the money doesn’t transfer into the seller’s account until the buyer confirms the purchase has been delivered. This gives the seller an incentive to make sure their stuff gets delivered. There are accounts on DePop that haven’t been visited by their sellers in months yet the items are still for sale and the site is still collecting payments! Not cool. Also, there is no way to determine whether or not the seller is offering free shipping, nor can you see prices on the thumbnail pictures when you’re scrolling through shopping. Mercari has a ‘free shipping’ icon and pricing visible on all the thumbnails, and you can also save your search parameters for later. 
Please address these issues and I’ll buy on DePop again because it’s a fun site!
developerResponse: {'id': 11515164, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-28T15:04:47Z'}

title: Filters don’t work
review:
I’ll pick a category, my size in the category, then click the check mark on the top right hand corner. I’ll find something I like and look at the size and it’s nowhere near what I’ve selected. I go back into the filter tab, and it says that my parameters are still in place. This is especially frustrating because sellers are always tagging their things with irrelevant tags. So not only do I have to sort through all the crap that has nothing to do with the keyword I’m looking for, I have to make sure that the relevant things I *do* find in my search are even the right size. I’ve tried closing the app, uninstalling and reinstalling, the issue is still there. As well as random crashes too.  I’ve never had this kind of issue on poshmark or Mercari. I came back to this app because i thought the service and ux had improved and it clearly hasn’t. 

New users should be aware that they’ll have to this if they want to find anything remotely decent on this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 4688654, 'body': "Hi Mia! Have you reached out to our Support team to take a look? They're available via email on support@depop.com. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-16T12:56:51Z'}

title: I had a very bad experience
review: So last week I was looking for MacBook pro because I start my college classes soon. I wish I had been more considerate knowing that the price for a 2018 MacBook a person was selling was for $220. I thought nothing so I purchased. The seller told me shipping was free, that it would take 24 hours to ship, and just the basic details. However, the next day I noticed the users account was deleted by paypal and they mentioned that he violated some terms. Thankfully, I followed my gut and knew to reach out to pay pal. I disputed my case to a claim right away because I wasn’t going to wait another 30 days for this seller to reach out to me (they never did). It took about 2-3 days for them to figure out my case, and once they issued a refund I got it right away which I was very happy about. Just here to warn others and make sure you check the sellers account before purchasing. I’m honestly not going to use this app anymore considering that buyers get paid before they ship the item. To be honest, I rather depop get ahold of our money first, and then release our money to the seller once they our tracking number is active. Because honestly this just wasted my time, and in the end I never got my item.

title: App Problems, It’s Okay
review: Depop is overall a decent app for selling clothing, it has a lot of really helpful features and makes the shipping process fairly smooth. However recently there’s been a LOT of bugs, including app freezing/crashing, slow loading screens, items not showing up in tags, and jumping when scrolling (clicking to look at an item and then backspacing during a search will send you back to the top of the list.) There’s also a lot of things they aren’t exactly transparent about that you might want to be aware of before you start selling there, like the fact that they take a 10% fee off of anything you sell, and they take all of whatever shipping cost you add if you ship through them, which is already often higher than shipping outside of Depop and not an option for international shipping. Plus, of course, the ridiculous amount of scammers, people who sell for way overpriced amounts, drop-shippers who fly under the radar, and inactive sellers that aren’t properly marked as inactive, etc., but that’s a common theme with any app like this, you just need to be careful!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15300614, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-13T16:47:58Z'}

title: such a scam
review:
I’ve been using Depop for several months now, and most of my experiences have been very good! However, working with their support team is awful. They patronize you and ignore your emails, and the two major issues I’ve had have been with giant accounts that Depop doesn’t seem to regulate at all. Depop’s system seems to punish the small accounts and reward the large ones. They do this in their explore page, where they’ll just feature the same big accounts over and over again (I’ve never once been chosen for it, due to the small size of my account), and in their feedback system, where I was punished for leaving a 2-star review (which was not rude in any way) because it was going to damage the reputation of a big account with over 4 times as many followers as me.
Not to mention, Depop also keeps a record of everything you’ve ever posted (even if it’s deleted) and they look through your private messages. This app is pretty amazing but the people who run it make me sick.

EDIT: they also have practically no recourse for scammers, an item I purchased in 2017 was never shipped and they did absolutely nothing to help. They wouldn't even contact the scammer. I’m literally done with this app catch me on Mercari

title: My favorite app now!
review: Alright, so i had just gotten a job, and was wanting to buy clothes because it’s the first time I’ve had money, but a lot of the stores I was looking at were just were too expensive, sketchy, or didn’t have what I wanted. Then I got Depop, and it was great! The clothes are affordable because they are resold, I usually don’t have to worry about my item showing up and not looking like the image, because the sellers are people just like me, and not some big company. Also there’s such a large variety and amount of sellers that I can usually find what I want. The only problem I think is that there are not a lot of plus size clothes, although that’s not exactly the app’s fault, I guess there are just less sellers in that part of sizing. Overall though I really like the app, it’s affordable, easy, not sketchy, and the layout is really simple (it’s similar to Instagram). I’ve recommended this app to a few people cuz I really like it. Thanks!

title: Traumatized
review: I’m am heartbroken. I was extremely excited to start my self journey on having a better style and being more optimistic and up lifting with my body shape. When the unthinkable happened I slowly entered my number after pushing the sign up button and my eyes widened with horror when it said “invalid number” I shook it off because I thought it was really just my fault but when I tried again making SURE I definitely had typed the correct number it said again “invalid number”. I was horrified and so I decided to try a different tactic by copying and pasting  my number and it said again “invalid number”. I was so insulted by this accusation and so I tried to sign in with my Apple account instead and to my absolute DISGUST i open my eyes to see that it says that my attempt to sign up with my Apple account was a failure and since i don’t have a Facebook account I had no where else to go. I closed my eyes and when I did I saw the apocalypse and a tear, a lone tear left me right eye this app has not only brought horror and filth into my life it has caused the apocalypse and now I am horribly traumatized I hope for the sake of my life and everyone on this earths life that Depop fixes this IMMEDIATELY ~ Karen
developerResponse:
{'id': 17298926, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this must be. Sounds like your phone number is already connected to an account. Refer to this article (https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001792427-My-Depop-app-isn-t-working) on our Help Centre, and submit a request for support with your phone number and email address. Once we've received your report, one of the team will be back in touch via email as soon as we can and will connect you again from scratch.
We’ve got you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-15T21:20:10Z'}

title: It's alright.
review:
It's, for the most part, simple to use. If you take clear photos and interact with people, you should get sales. I love how some people let you swap with them. It makes it feel less risky that you can trade clothing you're unable to try on instead of spend money on  it. I agree with other negative reviewers that the featured page is frustrating. I have no idea how some people get on there with 5-word descriptions and one picture, and how some people can be on there 5 times at once. 

My biggest issue is the app itself. I feel like more than 50% of the time I have to contact customer service because there's a technical issue. The option to leave feedback is there for some transactions but not for others. I also wouldn't recommend choosing the option for Depop to make your shipping label because if someone has a change of address, you can't edit the label once its made. It takes multiple steps and days to fix it and get a refund. It's better to choose your own shipping and go thru PayPal or the post office.

I appreciate that their customer service has been quick up to this point, it's just an extra hassle.

title: Infuriating Support and Glitch
review: I’ve used Depop for about a year and I’ve loved it up until recently. 2 weeks ago I sold my first item and got an error message saying I can’t view my shipping label and can’t receive payment because “my PayPal isn’t verified” and that I needed to contact PayPal to verify my account. But I contacted PayPal and they completely verified my account and I still got the error message. When I contacted Depop support and reported the issue, they told me it was still PayPal. I’ve tried EVERYTHING. I deleted and redownloaded and signed in and out of both apps on my phone, waited a few days, contacted support for both companies (and have been in a back and forth in an endless cycle of replies that are getting me nowhere) and for Depop it takes them up to like 5 days to respond! I sold my item almost 2 weeks ago and I still can’t view the shipping label or receive payment! I’ve googled this problem to see if anyone else had solved it, and there are ENDLESS forums of people who have had the same issue and NO ONE has any idea of how to fix it! Overall infuriating experience with a problem that so many people have/are experiencing that Depop has not fixed.

title: Glitchy and it’s a problem
review: Lemme start off with the fact that I love depop! I love selling my clothes on there and I’ve tried other apps, depop by far is the best, safest, and easiest. However there is SO many glitches. When I first started I had to make a new account because the shipping labels wouldn’t form. My new account is perfect now and I don’t have that problem however my latest depop issue is that every 10 seconds the app glitches out and crashes. Literally every 10 seconds, I’ve written emails to depop and have they gotten back? Nope. I’ve written reported about other sellers to depop and they’ve gotten back to those so it’s like I guess I’m being ghosted by customer service??? I have to sit down and delete the app and then redownload it EVERYDAY just to get rid of that problem. I sell a lot of stuff everyday so it’s very irritating. Another thing me and others have seen is that when someone buys your listing and the notification pops up and you click on it, it says item not found. Problems like this are normal for depop and I truly believe they should fire whoever is in charge of tech because they’re doing awful. But besides from the tech problems, Depop is a great place to sell!!!!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 16515211, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-09T16:26:04Z'}

title: not a good selling platform
review: first of all this app is instagram with a different font, it’s simple and familiar but there is nothing innovative about the design and there are many glitches their technical team don’t seem to be addressing. there is no option to offer discounts to likers to increase sales. it’s a popularity contest, you go to the discovery page of depop and they feature the same 10-20 “depop famous” sellers every single day, you’re not discovering anyone new. the shipping costs are outrageous, if you’re shipping anything heavier than a small accessory shipping is at least $9 compared to other apps with USPS partnerships and discounted shipping, like mercari or poshmark. the execution of payment is confusing - rather than keeping tabs on your balance within the app, everything is on paypal. they deposit the whole balance the buyer is paying (cost of item + shipping) and then withdraw cost of shipping, because of that my paypal flags their transactions as suspicious. and it’s not a safe platform, every day for the past week someone has messaged me from a fake account asking for me to contact them out of app via email or cell phone, i spend more time addressing spam on the account than i do making sales.
developerResponse:
{'id': 13465842, 'body': "Hey. We work super hard to keep Depop unique and special for our Community, and design is all part of this. As for bugs, we always recommend keeping your app up to date, and reporting any bugs you may come across. We've got teams on hand round the clock to help with any issues you may have. 

We also have a discounts feature now, so this is well worth a try. In addition, we're always on the hunt for new sellers. We love uniqueness and expression at Depop, and being varied in who we feature is all part of this. 

Shipping is something we're currently working on, and should have some exciting updates for you soon. Stay tuned. As for payments, we've also got exciting developments coming here. We really value your feedback on these features, and will be passing it onto the relevant teams.

As for safety. We prioritise this above all else, and have strong processes to ensure our users can buy, sell and discover in the safest way possible. If you ever notice anything suspicious, we'd recommend sending us a report by clicking the three dots on the users profile or the item. We'll investigate from there. As for users reaching out, we always have the option to fully block them. Something we'd recommend here.

Hearing what we can do to improve our Community's experience is so valuable for us, and we're always working super hard to keep Depop fun, exciting and safe. If you have any other thoughts, do let us know, we're here to listen.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-13T13:08:42Z'}

title: If I could rate zero stars I would!
review: I sell on other selling platforms but what drew me into selling on this app was due to the fact I could reach a bigger audience, other than just selling in the United States! However, what I didn’t know was how they take out their fees!! They take out their payment not from the sale but from your bank account!! If you don’t have sufficient funds, they keep charging/overdrafting your account!!! Didn’t know that til, I got hit with 2 return check fees!! FYI, since Depop goes a third party (Paypal) they have their own rules of receiving your money and if you’re a new customer and make a pricy sale over $200 they hold your funds until the buyer receives their product! So here I am, negative in my account on top of still haven’t gotten paid for the sale because the tracking stop updating! Needless to say that will be my first and last sale I make with Depop! Oh and if you have any payment issues and not receiving a product from a seller they can’t help you...you have to go through paypal for your refund!!! So they are basically USELESS! I’ve had nothing but bad experience after bad experience! I’ll be going back to Mercari & Poshmark!!!

title: Address system is awful
review: As a first time user in college, their system to enter apartment/dorm addresses is not user friendly in any capacity. I understand they use usps to ship, but depop’s system totally ignores anything other than the street address. As someone ordering to a college campus with 17 individual on campus residence buildings and only 1 mail room, it will be literally impossible to receive my packages without my any of my building information and only a street address. I reached out to customer service, and the solution they suggested to reformat my address didn’t work at all. They wanted me to reformat my address, have the seller refund my order, re-list my item, and they I rebuy it. But that is a complete waste of time when their address system is so poorly formatted that even their suggested solution doesn’t work. I tried to contact customer service again through replying to an email, but I received no responses there, and I tried to open a chat but it said no available agents online. So in summary, if you are at college or live in an apartment, don’t waste your time, customer service doesn’t understand their company’s own app well enough to help you when things go wrong.

title: wooeeeeewww
review: so depop.. its a very good app to find cute and trendy clothing/accessories, BUT in my browsers it has HORRIBLE reviews leaving my parents, “shook” therefore, I’m not able to get anything. Selling items is really easy and shipping is questionable at first, but it gets understandable as you continue shopping/selling (:: my only concern is how much people are getting ‘scammed’ on this app, and some are even leaving FAKE reviews on their stores, this not only makes buyers confused but it also leaves empty money in their pockets- once you get scammed depop ‘company’ blames you for getting your money scammed therefore they won’t refund you, or punish the sellers :( it’s really annoying (please fix this) this is a good app, but has/had MANY problems. A new problem i’ve had recently is some sellers don’t ship where I am- so the cute trendy clothes I want can’t be shipped to me :/ this is SUPERRRRR frustrating but anyway, happy shopping (if you get things lolol) and good day ;>

title: Great app but 2 issues
review:
Awesome app and community. My only complaint is that when you search for an item on depop the results are littered with random, unrelated listings just because some sellers (usually smaller ones) add random words or tags into the caption in hopes of getting more views on their listing. This makes it really frustrating to try to search for a specific item or to get one of the items I am selling to pop up on the appropriate tags. I hope depop finds a way to fix this. 

Also, the should create an iPad friendly version of the app. DEPOP SHOULD ALSO FEATURE A LARGER VARIETY OF ACCOUNTS ON THE EXPLORE PAGE. It’s always the same few depop famous people when there are soooo many smaller sellers that post great quality photos and could use the help and exposure of the explore page. Having the explore page be the same few people (sometimes with multiple items from one seller on it at the same time) also makes it boring if you are trying to find new sellers to follow. This is my biggest complaint.

title: My dna Home Screen layout lack of engagement bad updates
review: I’ve been on depop since August 2019 Farley new but ever since I started selling and shopping I’ve had no complaints. Everything was very simple straight forward. Lately the updates just keep getting worse and worse. They are trying to do too much and it’s deeply affecting sellers and buyers. SELLERS ur items will not be seen anymore BUYERS u will not see the cute stuff ur favorite sellers post anymore. MY DNA and the EXPLORE feature is causing this issue of lack of sales and engagement. Depop is obviously not an app that cares about their sellers that make and break this app. They keep making it even harder for sellers to sell their items. Please consider changing back the Home Screen layout to buyers seeing the feed when they first open the app instead of my dna and the explore. My dna is terrible not only is full of a lot of items I would never wear but it is taking up space for the sellers that ppl actually choose to follow and see their items when they get listed. As a seller and buyer I will be listing all of my other listing on ETSY and I will be shopping on other resell apps until this terrible update is removed
developerResponse:
{'id': 18358833, 'body': "Hey Rayjikko,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-08T21:40:22Z'}

title: Frustrated
review:
The app is difficult to work with, and is poorly organized. I enjoy scrolling through items posted by other people, but I am interrupted due to buffering/general lag (not normal for my phone) while using this app. Furthermore, the means of communication from buyer to seller are limited and untimely as I’ve had issues turning on notifications.
My first- and only- time using this app was a complete disaster (but was not at the hand of the developers— just a poor seller). I purchased an item that the seller had “lost” and after asking the seller through direct message for a refund, the seller vanished and I lost my money to them. 
I would recommend creating a paypal account instead of using “PayPal guest”, as PayPal is the only accepted in-app form of payment. If a situation arises when you would need to settle a dispute over an item you did not receive, you cannot conveniently move forward without a PayPal account.
*TL;DR* Overall, this app was difficult to navigate and was littered with untrustworthy sellers. I give it two stars as it could be better with some changes, but just isn’t what I’m looking for right now.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15624947, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-28T10:06:54Z'}

title: buyer review not seller
review: Depop used to be a good place to buy affordable clothes or whatever. From my point of view depop is supposed to be an online thrift store. Suddenly everything is so expensive. Sellers are either selling things they bought from sites like AliExpress of Shein way over priced. Or there are others that sell their thrift store finds for $50 when they got it for less than $10. Also there are a huge number of sellers posting Brandy Melville items for hundreds of dollars, when they aren’t even worth $50. This app has gone downhill, thanks to capitalism and the rich. This was supposed to be an app to find/buy affordable unique clothing. Lastly when you search for a specific item or brand, it doesn’t pop up immediately because people have tagged their items to get exposure. Depop should set a limit for how to price certain items. I don’t mind paying a lot for designer goods, but for brands such as brandy, urban, etc I do. Or paying way over the price for someone else’s thrifted or used clothes. Wish depop could go back to depop in 2016. :(((

title: something to read & consider!
review: this app is a bit buggy, it occasionally and you have to close the app to get it to work again, therefore losing what you were looking at. there also needs to be a "sort by" option so you can sort by price lowest to highest or however you'd prefer, almost all shopping sites have this. perhaps a bigger issue, though this is no fault of the developers, is the app is overrun by middle class teens/young adults selling overpriced clothes and labeling them as smaller sizes than they are to appeal to the thinnest people instead of the people that may fit the clothing best. (for instance! a size L tee shirt described as fitting sizes XS to L depending on desired fit and then being marked as an XS size) this is VERY common and feeds into a feeling of everyone on the app being incredibly thin and creates borderline body dismorphia. this also can make it harder for people who wear larger sizes to find clothes that fit them bc nothing is marked correctly if they search by size. i find this to be repulsive behavior by the sellers. just something to be aware of.

title: Great Platform, Mediocre Service
review:
Depop is a great platform to start selling your clothing/items/start a shop because the following and liking system really helps you quickly grow and interact with the community, which I love!!!! It really boosts sales a lot, especially if you are an active user who posts daily or weekly. The interface is great!

The customer service however, is not the best and usually not very helpful. I don’t find this an issue because as long as you are 1) buying from a trusted seller 2) directly paying with paypal and 3) don’t buy something that seems too good to be true, you will be fine and have a great time. Basically just be smart because you can’t rely on customer support to handle trouble.

I would love if there were better search algorithms and less spam messages from scammers, but overall Depop is one of my favorite buying and selling platforms and I definitely recommend using it!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 3641611, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for taking the time to write this review and some really interesting ideas around search and spam. We're keen to know more about why you've come to this conclusion about our Support, and if you'd be inclined to update this review to include a little more information that'd be super-helpful. We hope to hear from you again. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-29T16:32:46Z'}

title: Good app but could be better.
