review: Overall good app For selling. But need to be able to post more than 4 photos. Even just 2 more would help a lot. And need to be able to have the option of having a video NOT be the default for your items feed. I’d like to have the video as my last post if possible. Also if I choose to ship an item on my own, a big help would be if I was still able to print a shipping label through the app. It’s incredible inconvenient to have to go to the post office every time I wasn’t to ship packages on my own. The default shipping options aren’t broad enough especially for small items. I can ship items weighing less than 1 lb through Usps for a $1.00 cheaper if I choose my own shipping. It would be helpful if I could choose my shipping options through the app and print through the app like I do on eBay. Also some notifications could be better. Good app but could be better.
developerResponse: {'id': 7341477, 'body': "We always believe that there's room for improvement so your feedback is greatly appreciated! I will make sure to pass on the shipping feedback as this can definitely be of help in order for us to improve our features to our users.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-18T09:07:18Z'}

title: Please offer something other than PayPal
review: Hello all was well until just recently PayPal started closing down accounts left and right . They will give you no info won’t tell you why etc . Please consider allowing bank transfer like poshmark Mercari Kidizen etc for sellers . I had perfect feedback and hundreds of sales . A very active depop member and now I can’t sell at all because I have no PayPal account . Also since you allow minors on your site it would be nice for them as well since you can’t have a PayPal when your under 18 . That basically forces them to use someone else’s PayPal if they want to sell . Please please consider adding additional ways to get paid like cashapp or a wallet that you can then bank transfer your funds . It also encourages money to be spent back into the app ! Think of it as depop dollars ! Yes ! I’m holding onto hope someday I can sell again . Please seriously think about this .
developerResponse: {'id': 7753163, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for leaving this feedback. We're aware that PayPal is currently changing requirements and we're at the moment reaching out to our personal PayPal representative to find out more information on this and how to help our users with this issue. We're also looking into adding more payment methods in order to increase our user's experience. Can you let us know your username? \n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-15T14:49:29Z'}

title: dont get me wrong
review: Don't get me wrong I love this app. It is a very simple interface making it easy to navigate. But i hate the explore feed feature. It's the same clothes everyday and it barely caters to my likes and saves. It's ALWAYS things I've already liked, things that are already sold, but mostly clothes I just don't like and have been purposefully ignoring only for it to be there for the next few days. (maybe a dislike button or something would help there😅) For example the majority of my likes are modern streetwear yet all the clothes I really see are vintage sweaters and pants. I'm assuming it's due to people using the wrong tags/key words for exposure, but it's still annoying having to look at the same clothes I don't like every day. Which brings me to my next issue. Exposure. You'll notice at the bottom of almost every listing people shove in any possible trendy word just so people will see their clothes. It's irritating that sellers have to do that and buyers have to deal with not being able to see what they like.
developerResponse: {'id': 11773583, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-11T11:19:29Z'}

title: Started off promising
review:
Edited based of their response- yes, I have done these things several times. None of the issues I had have been resolved with your team. I’m not wasting my money on this app; either receiving junk in return or just never receiving my item at all (happened twice the last month). Also, it goes a long way if you don’t just copy and paste the same thing to everyone with a 1 star review. 
—-
Original review: 

I enjoyed this app for the first year or so that I used it. I was able to get good deals on items that I couldn’t find anywhere else. Now, it seems like Depop has lost all care and protection for its buyers. 2 packages in the last 3 weeks have been lost, and Depop doesn’t care to help me get my money back. I’ve reached out several times. I would be cautious buying from this app, because even though it says you’re protected by PayPal, you aren’t. You have to dispute all issues with the seller. Sellers lie about the condition of items, and then you’re stuck with a piece of junk you can’t get a refund or return on. There is no protection for buyers. BEWARE.

{'id': 15798227, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-06-05T10:24:36Z'}

title: YOU ARE NOT PROTECTED BY BUYERS PROTECTION!!
review:
First and last time I order here. I bought a bag on here and it never got to me I called USPS emailed them, talked to depop, and talked to buyer never got anything back. No bag or money so I just lost money and never got anything and depop won’t do anything about it I’m really disappointed and scared to buy from here now because I don’t feel protected. They told me they can’t do anything about it so I didn’t get any of my money back so take your chances buying on here.

Also guys just go ahead and look at all the most recent reviews, do you see how many are one star ? if you get this app and never get your items or app shuts off every second you’ll see why you should’ve have gotten this app

-DONT even try to tell me to look at your buyers protection I read the whole thing and it literally tells me that depop will give me a refund if I don’t receive my item, WHICH DID NOT HAPPEN so take your response somewhere else or update your buyers protection, or give me my money back for something I did not get.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17825681, 'body': "
Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-09-11T11:34:07Z'}

title: Great app...
review:
(This app just keeps getting better! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼)

I'm new to Depop...I'm loving the simple platform and wide array of items in the feeds. I love how easy it is to snap a pic and list it. I love the fact that they offer video product listings...no other marketplace I'm on does that and it's incredible! The only thing I would like added or refined is the desktop platform. I noticed that it's basically a page that shows the feeds...I'm unable to edit my profile or list anything via the main website. I'd like to have this option to avoid using up my phone storage due to all the pics I take. I for one, like to offer more than 4 photos of items to give buyers every possible angle...especially when it comes to clothing. 

I'd really love to use my camera and shoot at will. This way I can easily crop photos and work on listings on a larger screen. Please consider. Thank you so much! I love this app!
developerResponse: {'id': 3159440, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for leaving this review! We're looking to improve the desktop version of Depop throughout the year, and although it won't exactly replicate the full functionality of the app we do hope you'll notice the improvements. Watch this space! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-17T10:42:29Z'}

title: Drop shippers are ruining the app
review: I’ve been using depop for a couple years and I’ve found and sold some great items but it’s getting increasingly difficult to find pieces due to the redundant tags that many people use. In order to get exposure, people flood with tags. Because of the excessive tags, people don’t get exposure. It just makes the buyers’ experience more difficult. The most upsetting is the recent influx of “drop shippers,” or people who purchase items online from stores like AliExpress or Wish and send them from the supplier to their buyer on depop making 200% profit on a $3 item. Not only does it make buying/selling that much harder but it discourages the sustainable lifestyle that I originally downloaded depop for. I’m disappointed that drop shippers are not only allowed but encouraged and placed on the explore page. As a buyer, I wouldn’t download this app now because finding the right item is incredibly difficult and frustrating. As a seller, I wouldn’t download this app now because selling an item is almost impossible when put against drop shippers and flooded with tags.

title: Suggestions!
review:
I really enjoy Depop, it’s an app that is relatively easy to use and all of the people are very sweet! Although, I don’t have experience from the seller’s perspective, I do have it from the buyers. 

I have one simple suggestion, which has been bothering me enough that I really felt the need to make a review in hopes of it being seen. It would be very helpful if there was a feature that allowed users to scroll continuously down, and instead of receiving suggestions, it goes in order of the posts. Now that may sound confusing, but let me give an example. 
I wish I had the ability to go to my “Saved” items page, click on the first item which I have saved, and when I scroll down the next post is the next item I have saved. It would make it so much easier to view all the items I have in one place, and allow me to more quickly edit said posts.

title: iPad
review: I am scaling up my selling on Depop and it’s become too much to handle just using my phone. My thumb is exhausted. Unfortunately the desktop version of the app is just too limited to be efficient. I decided that the best solution is to use an iPad because it’s a bigger screen, easier to edit photos, easier to organize files etc. The Depop Apple app description says it supports the app on iPads. But I was super disappointed to find out that meant it is exactly the interface of the iPhone version just disproportionally enlarged/stretched out, clunky, and vertical-only. I remember when the iPad first came out like 10 years ago, that’s what a lot of apps did to say that they have an “iPad version.” They just translate exactly what is on the iPhone, just obnoxiously stretched out. Developing for different devices has come a loooong way since then so I’m bummed that Depop hasn’t got with it yet. At the very least please make the iPad version proportional and horizontal.
developerResponse: {'id': 13666363, 'body': "Hey. We're really sorry to hear this, and understand how frustrating this must be. We've escalated this internally and are looking into it as we speak. It's not something we've experienced as yet, so we'll get back to you as soon as we have an answer and a fix. In the meantime, we'd suggest resetting your preferences. If anything changes in the meantime, just reach out and we can update the relevant people. Stay tuned, we've got you.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-24T11:33:10Z'}

title: IF YOURE SELLING HANDMADE ITEMS, DONT USE THIS APP.
review: The people behind this app are a dumb group of 20 year old people pleasing self absorbed jerks. All they care about is verified sellers. I sell handmade earrings and I built my small business from nothing and worked so hard for it, then I came across a seller who bought a a pair of my earrings (and received an additional pair for free) and is reselling my hard work. First thing I did was email Depop will all proofs of her receipt, our messages from her purchase, my original posts, and her replica posts. So I made a post to warn my customers to not buy from her because she’s profiting off my hard work and then Depop deletes my post. Her fraudulent activity clearly violates rule #2, but they don’t care because they say “it’s ok to resell items” As if she bought those earrings from Walmart or Clair’s, she DIDNT  because I MADE THEM! Now I have to figure out how to switch to a BETTER and more mature selling platform.
developerResponse: {'id': 7176617, 'body': 'Hi Syd, I am sorry to hear about this whole experiencing. We do understand that this can be frustrating as these are your own amazing handmade products. Unfortunately, if a buyer decides to buy an item and no longer wants it, we cannot stop them from re-selling this. However if you let us know your username we can investigate this further with the support team and see how we can try to solve this together with you.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-02-06T09:19:02Z'}

title: Great platform, a bit hard to navigate
review:
I’m finding it a bit hard to sell & build a following. I feel like I have great quality listings however the search algorithm really doesn’t appear to cater to newer users. The “famous” front page  Depop users seem to be at the forefront of each style you want to shop which does not allow much exposure for newer members wishing to sell unless you’re selling name brand hypebeast type clothing. 

This dynamic leads to a bunch of random followings which takes you down a rabbit hole of other users who seem to be having the same problem desperately trying to increase their follower account so their clothes can get featured. Not sure how to remedy this but, maybe the format is too simplistic and therefore not specific enough? I’m not really all that sure but it looks great & feels great to use I just might be missing the mark somewhere.
developerResponse: {'id': 7216445, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you so much for your feedback. We are always keen to expore new members. Afterall, the bigger we grow the more options we want to give our users out there. We have a FaceBook community group with bunch of sellers, this might be helpful should you want an external perspective on how your shop is looking, have a look into this! Might come in handy.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-02-09T05:10:58Z'}

title: Drop shipping
review: I’ve been using depop as a buyer for at least 2 years now, there was never a problem i loved this app, about 5 months ago i started as a seller everything has been good until recently i've been noticing a lot of people drop shipping which is supposedly “against the rules” . what these people do is so wrong and they’re literally scamming people with items that are sold on aliexpress or wish for $2-$7 most and they list them with pictures that aren’t even theirs which is also against the rules for $20-$50 even sometimes and in their description it says “items are being made allow 2-5 weeks to ship” that’s a giveaway that they’re literally just ordering a $2 shirt for whoever buys it and sometimes they don’t even reply back if there’s any problems!!! this is so wrong and annoying as a seller now! please fix this or at least ban all these pages and it makes me more angry that some of these drop shippers are VERIFIED!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 11467414, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for sharing your concerns on Drop Shipping. We acknowledge that this may be having an effect on both Buyers and Sellers. We're investigating our options on a company-wide level to assess its impact on our Community. Our priority is to ensure that Depop highlights the type of items you want to see.

We will do our best to give our Community the answers and policy you deserve. Read the article 'What is drop shipping and is it allowed' on our Help Centre:

https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360026573794-What-is-drop-shipping-and-is-it-allowed-on-Depop-

Stay tuned,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-25T10:01:54Z'}

title: Almost There
review:
I love depop once I finally found people to follow. It took a while but I got there. I’ve already made 5 purchases and am IN LOVE. 

I have a few suggestions though:
1) Featured Page: It’s unclear wether the featured page is curated to items the app thinks I’ll like or if they are trending items on the app.
2) Sold Items: My BIGGEST pet peeve is how items don’t have a sold banner across them in people’s “likes” or the featured page. Nothing is more frustrated than clicking on an item only to find out it’s sold. I think the sold banners should not be exclusive to people’s stores. This brings me back to the featured page... why are sold items still listed there? I’m not too interested in using this app as a style reference as much as I am using it as a serious customer. I don’t want to see items that are sold on the featured page unless that have a banner tagging them as such.
3) I think some sort of saved search and notification feature would be really useful since there are certain things I am looking for and I wouldn’t have to manually enter the same things every couple of days.
4) Like I mentioned at first, it took me a bit to get into this app. Unlike other apps, it doesn’t help you find people to follow. It would be cool if there was some feature where you could click certain tags you’re interested in and the app would pull up shop suggestions who met those tags.

title: You can be scammed
review: When I first used Depop, I was very happy to find a platform where I could find good clothes. However, I soon figured out that many Depop users were not reliable. It is very easy to get scanned on Depop. In my experience, the Depop user led me to believe that they had sent the package but in reality they hadn’t. I had no way of reporting them because the Depop user had told me to use PayPal instead of doing this through the app. I followed their instructions, but I was scammed. I couldn’t report this account because there was no way of reporting accounts that you didn’t have a “receipt” from. Even if i could’ve reported the account, the account could no longer be found because I suspect that the user had deleted their account. I know that this was partly user error but there are still things that Depop should improve. There should be a way to report any account and they should be some way to trace back the user. I think that Depop is nice platform for people to find clothes, however it might not be the best option for young girls/boys because their are many opportunities for others to scan you.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15248559, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.
We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-11T18:32:38Z'}

title: Users are HORRIBLE
review:
After about 2 months of using the app, I’ve been using it as a buying platform. The app itself is great but there are some features that makes the issue that I’m talking about terrible. 
The user community is horrible! About 30% of the users I’ve run in with have no clue how to conduct a deal or are just trying to scam. One case I sent $100 to a seller who voided me for days and when I finally threaten to call PayPal they refuse to ship the items and won’t process the refund but make me create claim with my bank. 
Another experience I bought another item in which the seller immediately blocked me. This feature is app breaking as I have no way to communicate to the person I just did business with; this is ridiculous. Not only can I not talk to the seller, I can’t even leave feedback to notify that this person is a scammer. 
Overall I know depop can’t take all the blame, but they need to make the app more buyer friendly and be more involved with the people who face these issues.
developerResponse:
{'id': 9439706, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for the feedback and sorry to hear about your previous experiences. We currently monitor the app every day to search for scammers or anything that may look suspicious.

With getting a refund, as long as all your purchases are made in the app, we offer Buyer Protection through PayPal. If you're not sure how to set up a claim, hit us up via in-app support or drop us a line at support@depop.com with the details and we'll sort you out.

Let's get you happy again,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-01T11:09:57Z'}

title: Beware they set up an auto pay on your account!
review: I downloaded this app and checked it out. I listed stuff but then pulled them down because I figured it’s an app I have to learn more about. I deleted the app from my iPhone months ago. Today when calling PayPal for another matter I asked if there where any other auto pays on my account. They informed me that there was one from depop but it was set to zero. I asked them to delete but I was mad because many times you connect your PayPal to these apps but doing an auto pay is a different matter. The autopay was set up for zero but depop could have adjusted that amount any time they want. Depop promptly sent me a message about reconnecting my paypal account when I no longer have their app on my phone. They use the term reconnect your account but they aren’t telling you that they are setting up auto pay on your account which is set to zero until they want to change it!!! Super misleading and dangerous! I never purchased anything off this app or sold anything so this auto ship should not have been on my account especially since I deleted the app! Just be careful.
developerResponse: {'id': 8347107, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback. Depop only takes payments once a sale is done - this would be 10% of the total amount of the transaction - this would be the only autopay made from our end. We're sorry to hear if this seem to be a misunderstanding. If you let us know your username we can reach out to the support team and they can try to explain further how the process work. \n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-04-24T11:08:11Z'}

title: goodish
review: i love buying and selling from this app but it needs some work. my phone is very good and all my countless apps work great except depop. its always glitching and super slow and the fees are really annoying. i want to give people affordable prices but its hard when you have to pay for shipping AND pay additional fees to depop with each purchase. kinda makes me want to move to a different platform? ive found really cute things on this app but i hateee how many bugs it has and how slow it is for me every single time i open it. also the “for you” page is quite inaccurate and is all one brand that i dont even like so i feel like its not really “for me”. i will continue using this app especially bc i cant shop anywhere bc of covid but the bugs really frustrate me and it makes me not even want to open the app. also depop has taken a few of my items down for NO reason that were perfectly fine. really makes me want to delete everything and start over on another app
developerResponse:
{'id': 17348670, 'body': "Hey! Thanks for your feedback. The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. 

With regards to fees, our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.

We'll be passing all your feedback along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-18T09:13:23Z'}

title: Too Glitchy
review:
I get on the app a few times every day to check my listings & messages. They keep deactivating my listings saying that I am inactive on the app. Then I received another email saying if I do not use the app soon then they will deactivate my listings again. I have even responded to buyers & sellers on there so I’m clearly active on the listing.

**Update - The app is still doing the same thing as far as deactivating my items regardless if I get on the app every day. There’s no resolution even if you contact them. I finally sold 2 items on there & both times Depop charged me way more for fees then it stated they would. Also, I received emails on both items stating that the weight was over “But we will take care of it this time”. I checked my receipts & neither box was over weight. Also, on one of the items that sold, Depop didn’t mark it sold so I had to manually mark it sold, luckily nobody bought it a second time so I didn’t have to go through the hassle of refunding. With the over charges of fee’s & crazy amount of glitches I have decided to cancel this account & strictly sell on Mercari like usual.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18738294, 'body': "Hey there,

We can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-10-27T15:19:56Z'}

title: Scam
review: I purchased one item and the seller deleted their account which after reading the reviews is common so I went about the refund process and never heard anything back as many people has said happened to them, I was told to reach out to paypal even tho I don’t have a paypal account so obviously I didn’t use paypal to pay. So I made a paypal to contact paypal like they told me to, only to never get a response. I just figured I got bad luck on my seller so when I found something else I wanted and I did a lot of searching and reading their reviews and seeing how active they were so I pulled the trigger and purchased, after 7 days I message the seller just to get an update and they tell me it’s gonna take a while so I wait, and I wait, and I wait. When I text them again no response and still no response to this day I reaches out to depop but I already know how that’s gonna go so I will be deleting this app and I highly recommend not using it unless u are selling which I haven’t heard bad things about but I also don’t know. I have lost over $50 and will not be recommending this app to anyone at any time.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17348367, 'body': '
Hey. We moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-08-18T09:02:14Z'}

title: An App That Actually Works
review: I’ve been using Depop for a few months now and my experience has only been positive. I’ve both bought and sold items only in the U.S and all transactions have gone smoothly. I think this is mostly due to the community on this app. The users that I have done business with were equally enthusiastic about fashion and treat style with the same respect I do. The app’s controls work well and Depop does take measures into making shipping out items as easy as possible. I also have to give Depop’s customer support props for being nothing but A+ to me. I’ve used their help both through the app and on Twitter. They are friendly, easy to understand and their directions are clear. Plus they get back to you in a timely manner. There are just a few minor technical kinks that could use some work, but for the most part, I really like this app a lot! And I would recommend it to anyone who loves fashion.
developerResponse: {'id': 4540751, 'body': "Thanks for your review! We are super proud and thankful for the community that exists on Depop, so we're glad you've noticed this too. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-06T12:06:58Z'}

title: Don’t waste your time using depop.
review:
First thing I have to say is, they side with dishonest people before they will side with you. 

I have had such good experiences up until now. But not because of depop. Because of the sellers I’ve worked with. Depop offers buyer protection through PayPal. What does that mean? I’m not sure, because the description of buyer protection is not what they offer whatsoever. It’s a pit against the seller & the buyer. I had EVIDENCE that I never received my item & they still sided with the seller because I didn’t want to open a police report against the seller. Which is some crap honestly. If I never received my order, shouldn’t “BUYER protection” mean I am covered? Well you would think so, but that wasn’t the case. They also deleted the review I left for the seller because IT WASN’T FAIR!!! Are you kidding me? It was completely fair! Get your priorities straight. I refuse to ever use depop again with how unorganized, how awful their customer service is, as well as how long it takes for them to reply. Good luck ever keeping your app running with people complaining about buyer protection.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18195712, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

Our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we always aim to respond ASAP.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-09-30T11:52:24Z'}

title: Problem with notifications
review: I like the app and I'd recommend if you want to sell clothes. The people are super nice on here and it's super easy to figure out (it's laid out exactly like instagram) The only problem is that I'll get a notification multiple times even after I've viewed it in the app (like I'll look at it in the app, turn off my phone, and then two minutes later I'll get the same notification pop up).  Also the little bubble on the icon of the app will always say I have one notification no matter how many times I look at what the notification was for and it's really frustrating.  Sometimes it will go away after awhile but will just come back after someone else buys something and I get a notification for that. I know it isn't really a big deal but I'm someone who will go through my emails and mark every single one as read so I don't have the little bubble on my mail icon
developerResponse: {'id': 8888596, 'body': 'Hi there, we are aware that there some issues with notification and our team is working hard to get rid of this to get you running smoothly again. Can you please pop over a report via our in-app support Settings - Need Help? - Technical Issues and then we can get this sorted together. Keep us posted ❤️\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-28T05:40:04Z'}

title: Great finds, some features need fixing
review: I enjoy this app for its great finds and ease of swapping. However, there are many issues that have caused me to use depop less. 1) If a seller uses depop labels and they never ship, there is no way to leave a review as the status will remain “awaiting shipping.” As a buyer, this has happened many times, and I would find it helpful to see how many times a seller does not carry through on their end. 2) Sometimes it will not let me leave feedback EVER. Super confusing glitch here. 3) It would be very helpful if there was a way to hold/deactivate my whole closet in one go. As a uni student who lives in two different places, everytime I go on break, I have to mark every item as sold. It’s very time consuming. 4) The search feature is the worst! Every time I search anything these shops come up just because they put a bunch of irrelevant tags in their descriptions. It makes it hard for buyers to find what they want since the results are so diluted
developerResponse:
{'id': 10374212, 'body': "Hey! Thanks again for your review and suggestions. We love hearing from our Community and do all we can to implement as many of their wishes as possible. As for your technical issues, please go to 'settings - support - need help - technical issues - I've still got a problem' and send a report.

Let's get this sorted,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2019-08-27T10:04:56Z'}

title: Don’t use- a total scam. Takes unapproved charged from your PayPal!
review:
I started using a few months ago both as a buyer and seller, and have noticed at least half a dozen unapproved withdrawals on my PayPal account from “depop limited” usually around $6 but going over 20$ as well. These happen on days I have no activity on depop whatsoever!!! I have no received any response from costumer support although I’ve waited weeks and sent multiple messages! I still have pending transactions on PayPal for items that have been delivered weeks ago, and some payments that say received I didn’t receive in my bank account at all. Still no response or accountably from depop whatsoever!!! These withdrawals are not the 10% listing fee like I’ve seen them respond to other reviews!!! I have no items that these transactions would be 10% of and like I said, they happen on days where there are no activity whatsoever! 
SCAM ARTIST!! CHECK YOUR PAYPAL ACCOUNT FROM ANY UNAPPROVED WITHDRAWALS FROM DEPOP LIMITED!! I’m not the only one who’s experienced this! I will be calling PayPal today for my refunds!
Going back to my eBay store!

title: Employees are JERKS
review: I used to LOVE depop I was making my own business I had 300 sales within 2 months and all 5 star reviews I had a problem with another account who had been harassing me and my customers and posting my items as hers and when I told depop about it they did NOTHING I made posts to have people report her and help me out since she wasn’t stopping and depop threatened to have my account deleted because people were reporting that other account and trying to help me I told them that other account kept messing with me and reporting my items and they didn’t care at all she reported me so many times and since Depop doesn’t actually check stuff before deleting items they counted all those incidents as actual problems which makes NO sense since some items weren’t even items and since Depop workers had actually decided my items and said they were okay they’re a total joke and have banned me while the other user continues to use the app I would Iove to get my account back since it was my only source on income and I was doing so good but they have NO compassion at all
developerResponse: {'id': 10233771, 'body': "Hi there, sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community a safe space we ensure that all decisions made to permanently suspend users are taken after careful consideration and deep investigation. If you feel as though an unfair decision has been made, please reach out to us at support@depop.com with supporting proof as to why you should be let back on the app.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-08-19T10:08:28Z'}

title: Depop is LIFE
review:
Depop is hands down my absolute favorite way to re-sell clothing! It’s like a breeze! Easy navigation, doesn’t freeze up too much, just great!!! I can’t get into Etsy & Poshmark seems very hard to navigate....
Unfortunately though my account (Grimebunny) has been suspended and I’m not totally sure why! I have over 250+ 5 star reviews and have made SO many amazing pals through this app. The fact I can’t log is is totally breaking my heart right now. I got an email the other day about selling items for 1$ and how they don’t want me taking advantage of the shipping label system (I absolutely understand) 
The only thing is I really don’t remember ever selling anything for only 1$!
I hope this is a mistake </3
My account was suspended last Friday and i sent a couple emails to support (I do apologize for bombarding with messages... I’m just poor and depop is my means of income!)

title: Loved it in the beginning but....
review: I’ve used Depop for a few months and it is great. But these past few days I’ve noticed some of my listings have disappeared on the hashtagged items. I’ve even deleted a listing and relisted it again. It’ll show up for a few moments but when i check back it’s gone. My listings looks fine on my end but since it disappeares on the hashtagged names buyers don’t see it at all. I’ve even stopped using hashtags and relayed on my description to hopefully help but it still disappears. This is causing my listings to suffer because no one is able to view it. Pls fix this issue asap. Not sure if this is an isolated issue but it’s a serious one. I don’t want to have to delete all my listings only to relist it again (even with the proper hashtags or no hashtags) and have not show up for buyers to see it. My sales will dramatically suffer.

title: i like it but...
review: Depop itself is very clever. It's a way to bring different communities together to buy. And it's mostly small businesses!!! We love support supporting the small ones 🥺. However, there ARE many accounts that price their offers WAY TOO HIGH. $30 for a pair of “vintage” socks???? I understand this is mainly the op’s problem but is still affects the app in my opinion but (ik there’s most likely no solution for this) anyway- I like how we can search up an item and find products that are related to what we searched but I recommend having two types of “hashtags”. Like hear me out- when someone posts a product, in the description, there should be a # for what it ACTUALLY is and then another hashtag section where they add other things that are related to their product. In that way, other people can find their account just as much as people finding what they’re ACTUALLY looking for. I’m not sure if I explained myself well, English isn’t my first language:(

title: Disappointing
review: Depop is an amazing platform to sell and buy unique and creative items, and I have absolutely loved using this app. However, it is disappointing to see that Depop has done close to nothing to hold user’s that violate Depop’s policy accountable. Dropshipping in itself is not a violation, however, a majority of them mislead buyers by using stock images and lie about their shop location. With delivery times of up to 50 days, it is obvious that items are shipped directly from cheap manufacturers and sweat shops in countries like China. This not only a scam but it also violates Depop’s ‘Rules of Acceptable Use’. As a brand that supports ‘entrepreneurial’ sellers and promotes sustainability living through campaigns such as ‘#nothingnew’, it is really disappointing to see Depop respond to reports of accounts like these with copy/pasted responses and to be in support of user’s that not only mislead customers, but also promotes fast fashion and the terrible working conditions of sweat shops. Please hold accounts that violate Depop’s policy accountable.

title: Listing items is awful
review: Love to sell clothes on this app but listing items is an absolute nightmare. The typing is delayed even when I have good connection and it often takes about 5 minutes just to save one items to my listings. I click to add photos and it just sits there and loads for a while and I find myself refreshing the app multiple times for each item I try to list. and then when I go back to my listed items when I am ready to post them, all the pictures have been deleted and it just posts a white screen. I’ve contacted depop about this and they have done nothing. listing items wastes so much unnecessary time taking about 2 hours when it should only take 10 minutes. I tried reinstalling the app and everything else I can, but I do not have another device to list items on besides my phone. this app works great otherwise, I just wish they would spend more time making this work better because it is such an inconvenience and it makes me want to use another app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17495191, 'body': 'Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 
We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-08-25T17:45:38Z'}

title: It won’t let me purchase anything
review: I really like depop because I feel like it is great way to find many unique things that you can get from anywhere. Although I can not even use it because of an issue with the app. Whenever I try to purchase an item from anyone, I click credit or debit and enter in my information; once I press pay, it just shows me an error message. It says error with purchase and it’s driving me nuts! I know that the card is perfectly fine and that there is money in it and it makes no sense for it not to work. This means that because of this, the app is useless to me! I have even tried deleting the app and then reinstalling it although that did nothing. I also even created a new account but that also did nothing. In addition, I have seen that a lot of other people have run into the same issue although somehow this issue has not been fixed? It would be amazing if it got resolved because I found so many things that I want to get and that’s very hard to do so because of this! Hopefully they can get this done quickly!
developerResponse:
{'id': 12646313, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. This isn't an issue we're aware of, so it may be worth giving your app a little refresh.

Please try removing cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 

Still crashing? Drop us a line by going to 'profile - settings - need help - technical issues - send us a report'. Don't worry, we've got this.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-30T10:45:56Z'}

title: Good app but needs more attention to details
review: I actually really like the app.  I have it a 5 star Rating at first.  However after reading some of the other reviews I must say that I have to agree with them.  While using the app especially the explorer page I have noticed that for long periods of time the same uses and products on it.  Now typically I would not concern myself with expressing that to anyone else but I did say to myself what’s wrong with this and why is it still the same or why hasn’t this been updated.  Again normally I would not even mention it it would not be something that I would thing to do but after reading some of the other reviews it is clear that some people are bothered by it and I do believe that The overall experience in the app would be heightened if that was resolved
developerResponse: {'id': 3074474, 'body': "Hey there! We're really looking to re-define what the Explore page is throughout this year, improve our curation of the section and also add new ways for users to gain visibility for potential buyers. This is a big piece of work, and we really hope you'll see small improvements as the year goes on. Watch this space! Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-09T10:59:49Z'}

userName: Yay this is great fun ya
title: great but always needs improvement
review:
I love depop for buying and selling second hand things. I like buying more basics and well know brands on the cheaper side. This makes it pretty easy to find those without hassle. 
One thing that i’ve noticed is that when you want to know the shipping amount on a item to find out you have to put that item in the cart and then check your cart. if you leave that item in your cart then you will get a notification that it’s still there along with an email. There should be a quicker way to check like something in the corner or just a little +____ next to the price. 
Secondly can you fix the notification problem. The notifications just never go away for me so when i see them im wondering maybe it’s a new message or something and it’s not. This is a really minor detail but i like not having notifications. 
Thanks for reading:)
developerResponse: {'id': 13397072, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-10T12:14:37Z'}

title: Love it- but needs more features
review:
UPDATED: I love all the new features Depop has been working on. Thank you! A few features I’d still like to see: 
-rearranging items in the app: maybe similar to the way iPhone icons can be arranged- press and hold.
-sending photos through private messages so potential customers can see more images of the items
-be able to add more than 4 photos to a post
-let customers post photos in their reviews!! 

I’ve been on Depop for 4 months now and love it! When I was consistently posting 4-5 items a day, I was getting featured on the explore page daily. If you’re active and post nice photos, you will be featured! I love the clean and simple layout of the app. The newly added features like search filters are amazing and this app is definitely improving. I would really like to have the same features that the computer site has, though. For example: “Move all sold items down” and “Rearrange”. Sending photos in messages would be a plus, because sometimes customers ask for a photo of a specific part of an item and with only 4 photos allowed, it’s difficult to do this. Which brings me to: let us add more than 4 photos of an item! We want to show all views and flaws of items and 4 photos is just not enough to do it. 6-8 would be best. Otherwise, I love the app and won’t stop using it anytime soon!
developerResponse: {'id': 3052586, 'body': 'Hey there, thanks for leaving this review. We love receiving in-depth feedback like this! We hope to have a few of these ideas delivered throughout 2018. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-06T14:43:32Z'}

title: Require Buyers to Review!!
review:
There needs to be a way for Depop to require buyers to review their purchases!! Mercari and Poshmark have found ways to require buyers to review the purchase within 3 days after the product has been delivered and then the sale is closed or completed regardless of if they left a review or not! I wish Depop would do the same. I have made so many more sales than I have received reviews, which means these sales have technically never been completed, even if the buyer messages me that they received and loved the item (they just didn’t leave a review). It’s annoying to us and the buyer to have to hassle buyers to leave a review on the purchase, so I usually don’t and am left with an uncompleted sale! There has to be a way to change this!!

Other than that, I love using Depop and have been using it for years. I highly recommend it for finding or selling vintage and unique pieces!!
developerResponse: {'id': 5096652, 'body': "Great feedback Nicole! Definitely an important part to make sure we have great seller's on our platform too. Will keep this in mind.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-09-18T09:24:35Z'}

title: customer service👎🏼👎🏼
review: So ive been selling on depop for quite a few months now, almost a year. They closed my  account suddenly on tuesday morning because i was refunded for an item that the seller claimed to have shipped (she did not ship) this seller was trying to scam me out of my money and eventually the seller sold to someone else so clearly this item was not shipped to me. I answered the depop support email IMMEDIATELY because this was clearly a huge misunderstanding, i have 300+ sales and 200+ reviews so i thought for sure they would understand and see that this was a mistake. I have emailed them, sent a dm on instagram and have sent a dm on twitter and it has been a week and NO RESPONSE. I am very upset, i understand it is a busy time and a lot of things are going on in the world but they cant respond to an email after a whole week? The only reason i didnt give depop 1 star is because depop is a very nice & easy platform to sell on and i would really love to get my account back. but the customer service is really not the best.

title: needs improvement
review: I personally like depop and what there is on there. I’ve found cool clothes and good deals too, but the way it is set up doesn’t have as much structure such as Mercari. Mercari makes sure that customers don’t get scammed and buyers have to ship in 3 business days which is fair. Sellers on Depop are allowed to take more time then that, it took a seller 1 1/2 weeks to ship an item. Also, I recently got scammed by a seller. She blocked me after I purchased something and it turns out she did the same to a few other people. I have to personally file the claim with Paypal. I think Depop should be like Mercari and hold the funds until 3 days after the item is delivered and the buyer rates. If there was more structure with Depop I would like it a lot more but they don’t provide a lot of help. I do use it because I think there’s more options sometimes than Mercari. But if I had to choose one that’s safer and provides more help and support it’d be Mercari. I really wish Depop made it so that there weren’t scammers on the app.

title: Hard for new sellers, horrible bugs
review: Honestly, I never write reviews.  I enjoy the IDEA of Depop, but the way things are implemented is so poor it is discouraging me away from ever using this app again.  I am a new seller, and for some reason a couple of days ago absolutely none of my listings show up in any of the hashtags, keywords, or by brand.  I follow all guidelines and only tag words related to my items.  Meanwhile thousands of big sellers whom already have hundreds of sales are using incorrect tags and brands and are refreshing their posts several times per hour.  If you are a new seller it is near impossible to make sales, even at low price points with the way this dumb algorithm is designed. I contacted support who told me they had no definite timeframe of when my issue would be fixed, and I receive little to absolutely 0 interaction with my items.  Like I said, I never write reviews, but I am so frustrated with this app, there are so many problems with it. Such a great idea but so poorly executed.

title: Unreliable
review: I used to love Depop but I’ve had a few experiences where I’ve purchased something and the seller didn’t follow up with any sort of tracking or anything after taking my money. Basically I haven’t received an item and I paid money for it and the seller isn’t replying to me. The reason why I’m blaming the app is because I feel that it doesn’t do enough to help customers who have been scammed or have had any inconveniences. I’ve pretty much tried every single thing I can to find my tracking info within the app but it simply will not give me this information. I am now scared to buy things from this app because there is no assistance when it is needed.  Hopefully someday I’ll figure out how to get my 35 dollars back :)! Imagine if I paid 200 dollars or 900 dollars on something and this happened!
developerResponse:
{'id': 17283864, 'body': '
Hey. We moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-08-14T11:50:21Z'}

title: Great selection but needs a little work
review: My view point is coming from a buyer only. I love the unique and hard to find items on this app. It is user friendly and allows for easy navigation. The message feature is cool if utilized. My main issue is that sellers should be held more accountable to orders. While some sellers have been great to work with, the communication with other sellers is sometimes non existent. Knowing whether orders have been shipped or not isn’t super obvious unless the seller updates you. You also have to be careful when placing an order to make sure if the seller is still active. Perhaps accounts that haven’t been logged into for a certain length of time should be temporarily disabled so buyers do not think an item is available. That aside, I really did appreciate the care and effort of some of the sellers. With some updates this would be a great app!
developerResponse: {'id': 7937247, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for the love. We do have a process in place for account that haven't been active for some time, but there's always room for improvement so we appreciate you pointing this out to us. Will make sure to pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-27T19:11:33Z'}

title: Bad customer service
review: Depop is a great app however, customer service is awful!! I had a huge problem as a seller with switching to depop shipping. I didn’t have the option to do that as well as I asked fellow sellers how and none worked. So I contacted Depop s support email and instead of solving my problem they sent me the exact same email several times after continuously stating the problem. It was obviously just a computer so when they sent me a link in the email saying I should go there for support it was a page explaining the exact same stuff on the email instead of an actual support. This is going to continuously cause me to pay 10-20$ just to buy labels to ship the items. Depop if you read this please get a real support group instead of a computer because I am really disappointed and even though I lost 6$ on my first sale I am going to try to keep selling my clothes. This is the worst customer service ever. One of the worst apps I have had to experience!:(

title: Great App
review:
I’m a seller on the app, not the most popular, but I’m about 10 sales away from hitting one hundred sales. I’ve also bought some items from the app. So I’ve got experience as a seller and buyer! I don’t have any complaints as a seller. I like this app the most compared to other selling apps because its easy to navigate. I think the app also shows items in a functional way. It’s easy to look at items and search for things. It’s very appealing to the eye compared to other app layouts.
As a buyer I’ve only had one “bad” experience that wasn’t even bad since PayPal and Depop were very responsive. I bought a pair of shoes that had never arrived after a couple of weeks of trying to contact the seller. After filing a claim I got my money back pretty quick! So for any buyers, Depop definitely has your back ;)

title: Unfair commission, a lot of problems for more serious sellers
review: Depop takes a 10% commission from all of your sales, which is fine except they take 10% of the sale price + shipping, not just the sale price. It's messed up they take money out of what the buyer paid for shipping cause that money goes straight from the seller to USPS. Its also a huge hassle to get this depop fee refunded if a buyer cancels a transaction or whatever. The private message feature is buggy af also. Sometimes messages look like they've sent but the other party doesn't receive them and you have no way of finding that out. this has happened to me several times and idk how many sales I missed cause people think I ignored their messages. If you're trying to use depop as an actual business platform it's doable just very frustrating. But if you're a casual seller who only plans on listing a few items occasionally you'll probably really like this app

title: Slow start but worth it once you get going, be sure to have PayPal linked or you can’t get paid.
review: This app really threw me for a loop at first. It had so many options with international shipping and so many sellers on here that it felt overwhelming but it had something different to offer, a love of vintage and since I love buying & selling vintage o decided to go outside my comfort zone and start listing here too! I didn’t make my first sale for months like maybe 5 but eventually as I added more sales started coming and I have only made 9 sales so far, that’s not a lot but I’m adding more and getting more interest and I feel like this is the right app for me. Just make sure you have PayPal all sorted out or you won’t be able to get paid, but once you get that figured out you will be glad you joined!

title: Great app, needs improvement
review: Amazing system, great way to sell and communicate with other retailers or customers. The whole idea of the app is really great, and the process is pretty decent, but the app in a whole (regarding running quality) needs improvement, sometimes the app might freeze which can only be fixed with closing the app, which is frustrating when in the middle of some fairly deep searching, not to mention the app glitches a lot when moving from or going to the private messaging tab. But all issues are fairly small and overall it’s a decent app for selling or buying clothing. If I could add anything else other than the bugs, it would be amazing if when you block a seller, all those seller’s items would not be visible on your feed, because you won’t be able to purchase the items with the seller blocked anyways.
developerResponse: {'id': 8502360, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for the loving feedback. We always believe there's room for improvement. We're working hard on adjusting the blocking features for our users. I will make sure to pass your suggestions down to the team.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-04T03:32:28Z'}

title: Great App
review: I’ve had Depop for awhile now and I’ve enjoyed it mostly so far. When I first saw the app I thought it looked interesting enough to try. If your a fan of unique and vintage clothing I’m sure you’ll find something for yourself here. Even if you don’t like clothes that stand out, there’s always a good deal somewhere on name brand clothes/more average things you would find. I’ve ordered lots of things from here and there’s only one order I wasn’t completely satisfied with. The seller never messaged me about it and it took about 3 and a half weeks to arrive. That’s the sellers fault though, not the app. Always check and make sure the seller is legit and it will be a safe purchase. I gave the app 4 stars just simply because I feel there’s always room for improvement. You should definitely try!

title: Awful customer service
review: My first time making a purchase on Depop, I made sure to follow Depop guidance to only pay in-app and communicate with the seller in the app. I paid via Apple Pay in the app but then never received the item and the seller stopped responding after I paid. I spent over a month emailing with Depop customer service to try to get a refund. While they kept reassuring me my payment was protected bc I paid through the app, they kept pushing me to dispute the issue with PayPal. PayPal has no record of my transaction bc I didn’t pay through PayPal. I had to explain this several times in talking to Depop customer service personnel which seemed to change even though I was responding to the same email chain. Nearly two months later, I’ve decided the amount of time and energy it’s taken to try to resolve this is not worth it. I’m never using this app again. If you successfully purchase something on this app, you’re probably fine. But if there’s ever an issue, it doesn’t seem like Depop has your back despite their claims.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19698281, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-11T12:55:02Z'}

title: Overall Bad
review:
Downloaded the app to see if I could find any graphic tees or local sellers, only to find that the majority of the items sold on Depop are sold at RETAIL PRICE. Not all styles are catered to as well, you’re only going to be able to find vintage clothing as well as certain “trendy” aesthetics such as Y2K or E-girl/boy. Seriously not advisable to shop here for much else. If you dress casually, you won’t find much that will be worth the asking price. If you’re wondering, I usually shop at vans or Tilly’s, I found many vans tees being sold for more than the retail price. 

I would highly suggest that you check out your local thrift shops, garage sales, or even other buy and sell apps, far too many people on here that think it is acceptable to sell used items for retail price. If you’re looking for something very specific this might be a place for you, if you’re just looking to buy clothes to add to your closet, definitely not a good place to look. Likely the worst buy and sell community I have ever explored. Deleted the app after a day of using.

title: Done
review: I like the concept of the app, but it’s poorly designed. I bought an item and the seller put in that they would be using depop’s label for shipping. well they didn’t, which is fine. except the notification never went away because in depop’s eyes the item never shipped. i contacted support (which is a joke - for every problem they just tell you to delete and reinstall the app) and they said there was NOTHING they could do and the notification would reset in 90 days. 20 weeks later, yes over 140 days, the notification is still there. contacted “support” and what do they tell me? delete and reinstall the app. so i do it (again) giving them some benefit of the doubt. before i even open the app and actually log in there’s a red notification sitting on it. logged in, looked through my notifications and it won’t go away. also depop only highlights the same “depop famous” people so the “explore” tab isn’t really exploring once you look at it once. i like the concept of the app but not enough to deal with how poorly it works.

title: Do not get this app
review: I have been using Depop for almost 2 years, I had a whole store through them with over a 100 transaction and 57 5 star reviews. They randomly banned me claiming I was purchasing outside of their app which is not true whatsoever. If I was trying to make a bunch of money outside of Depop I wouldn’t have over 100 transactions. There customer service is absolutely no help at all , it’s just a bunch of copy and paste responses , I sat there typing paragraphs to them trying to explain I didn’t do nothing wrong and I even apologized if I had done that. Just because I value my Depop account a lot , I have made a lot of friends and a lot of sales through Depop. And instead of giving me the benefit of doubt , they called me “a threat to their community” like I have all these good reviews and a lot of transactions yet I’m a “threat”. If you use Depop you see all the time people saying cash app and PayPal only yet they still have profiles ??? I have never asked for payment outside of Depop. They won’t help you at all and they’re very rude.
developerResponse: {'id': 19042822, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.\n \nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-11T13:02:56Z'}

title: A wonderful selling space
review: I’ve been a member of Depop since May of last year. I joined as a seller and it has been a completely new selling experience all it’s own. Unlike other platforms, Depop lets you get personal about your personal style. They have a simple 10% sellers fee that’s taken at the point of sale, and not billed to you at the end of the month like most other platforms. I prefer it this way, no end of the month surprises and they also don’t charge you to post items which is a major life saver for those running a small business. All those extra fees can really add up. Aside from this Depop also cares about their community, constantly reaching out to help you grow as a seller and them grow as a platform. It’s really a wonderful space. And the community is so welcoming ❤️

title: Love and frustration
review: I use Depop for both selling and buying pretty equally. I love the ease of the app and its features, but there are some improvements that would make it infinitely better - 1)The option to show 5+ photos as 4 is just not enough to show the item off fully. 2)The option to send photos directly to potential buyers via private message. 3)More shipping size options - as there’s an 8-lb different between the small and medium package sizes and that doesn’t work for my package most of the time. Somewhere in between would be very helpful. **4)The option to edit photos in the app, such as how zoomed in/out the displayed photo is. In order to edit one, I have to delete it and then re-post. It’s very time consuming and seems like an easy fix. The last two are the most important to me. Overall, I love the app, but some changes are needed.

title: has some problems
review: this app is overall really good and i’ve used it for a while now and sold about 40 things so far and bought a lot and the process is so efficient and pretty secure! i love how this app is set up but there are a few bad things. this app has crashed on me multiple times and everyone on the app was effected by it since this app holds a lot of personal information and shipping info, it’s super frustrating when this app glitches and crashes!! it only happened like 2 times so far but i can tell this app needs some technical work to improve it and also, i wish the app would have a way to set location preferences because almost ALL the requested items on my “for you” explore page, is in £ and UK and i’m from the US and i would like to not see any posts from any other country but it’s not a option:(
developerResponse:
{'id': 16938249, 'body': " 
Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-28T21:36:58Z'}

title: What is the point of the “interests and sizes” feature?
review:
I love Depop, I’ve been using it for over a year now. I mainly buy clothes but I’ve sold a few things as well. Buying and selling is great, no complaints there!

However, this one thing bothers me. In settings, under My Account, there’s a section where you can put your sizes in tops, bottoms, and shoes. I’ve yet to see what this does! I thought it was to filter the items that appear under “Made For You” but nope! I still get clothes and shoes that are too small or too big. I think if it actually did anything it would be a handy little tool, especially since Made For You is where I look the most for clothes, since the suggestions come from the things I have liked. I’ve discovered lots of cute things there and I just wish the sizes feature actually sorted out things that don’t fit. :(
developerResponse: {'id': 11283591, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-16T10:20:06Z'}

title: Love the app except for 1 thing
review:
Love the app I sell here and there a few pieces a week but lately I hardly ever get my Feedback left. It isn’t hard to say thanks or I Got it from a buyer.
 I have sold tooor purchased from sellers too!
If Depop could added automatic positive feedback after 3 days or something it would be awesome!
 I have asked politely and some buyers are active daily or sell themselves and in their listings always have ask answer questions and I’ll reply ASAP but when I ask for them to leave feedback that it helps my shop I get ignored 😭
 I like to check other peoples review Feedbacks as a buyer or seller perspective I like to read to see how fast they ship and if item they sent was in good condition and what not! Overall the app is awesome! I just really want automatic feedback added please 😬🙌🏻 get those numbers and the stars all lit up ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️

title: Great in the beginning
review: I loved depop when I got it! I found so many incredible things to buy, and was able to sell a bunch of stuff! Though I have had issues where, depop’s service fee is a 10% cut, but they will start to take a little more and more of your profits the more you sell. I sold something for  $4.30 and they charged me $3:60!!! Obviously The amount is so low that it didn’t put me in debt, but SERIOUSLY?!? This is like the fourth time they’ve taken wayyyyy more than they said they would. Depop’s charges are automatic, so I can get a refund. They are so hard to get in contact with if you have a problem too. Honestly this used to be my favorite app I’m I’m just kind of upset. Little things have piled up over time. I’ve had to pay almost double when I’ve had to give somebody a refund because depop IS CHARGING ME WAY TO MUCH FOR THE SERVICE FEE.  Come on man. Just makes me sad to see you behave this way. All my friends use depop and have noticed this. Be better bro.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18384037, 'body': 'Hey there,

Rest assured that Depop can only take payments for sales and shipping labels, so you won’t be overcharged. Check here for more info or to contact our support team

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-10-09T18:56:52Z'}

title: great but always breaking
review: this app is good but there’s a tonnnn of problems i’ve run into while using it and selling items. 1. when an item is sold it sometimes doesn’t get marked as sold, meaning another person can come by and buy it as it’s not listed as sold. 2. sometimes i cannot edit the listed item after it already has been listed, meaning the price or an image, even though the app ALLOWS u to edit it 9 times out of 10 never works for me. 3. whenever i’m chatting with someone over the private messages, they just stop working. the messages stop loading and this really causes a problem for when i’m talking to a seller about something i’m interested in or visa versa. i don’t know, i’ve been using this app for a while and a lot of other people seem to have these same issues. maybe a whole diagnostic should be done to better the app and the seller and buyers who use it.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16718284, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-18T20:04:38Z'}

title: Depop
review: I think the fees are a real killer when you get taken money not only from depop but from PayPal too. Depop also takes fees from shipping included which takes away money from how much we actually need to ship out. Refund processes need to be better and we should be able to edit tracking numbers. I’ve messed up typing them before but once you hit ok, you can’t go back to edit. I see that feedback is hard to find for newcomers so I don’t get one when a purchase is complete, either a notification or a better explanation of where they can be done would be great. I think a seller should have to give feedback first before a buyer, a lot of sellers wait to see what the feedback they get is and if it’s bad then they also give a bad review or don’t give one at all. Some little things here and there for improvement but overall it’s a pretty great app. My biggest complain are just the fees.

title: Solid experience
review: From its advertising the impression I got was this was a space for people to sell their weird backstreet-handmade stuff if you were in to alternative fashion....... totally not the case. While it does include quite a few unique finds and interesting pieces, this is the most reasonable fashion trade I’ve come across. I use other apps like Poshmark, and Curtsy but this one not only charges a low and fair cost for shipping (with no added fees that skyrocket the price of your item) but it also seems to have the best prices of things in the first place (maybe because it doesn’t take a portion of whatever the person sells it for? Idk) love this and my only drawback from giving it 5 stars was that it’s a little confusing to navigate as a new user, but I’ve picked it up over the course of a few hours of tinkering with it. Give it a try :)
developerResponse: {'id': 12704388, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for your feedback! We love this. There's something for everyone on-app. So keep exploring.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-01-03T10:20:43Z'}

title: ban drop shipping!
review: Many people use this app for secondhand, affordable clothing for the purpose of living sustainably without fast fashion. However; this app is ruined by the large amount of users buying clothing from shein/zaful/romwe, and selling them for double the price. Many people are getting scammed by these sellers, believing that these clothes would be good quality and ship in less than 3 weeks. it reflects poorly on this app as a whole, as you allow for this to happen purely because you guys are greedy and love amount of money that you guys make from them because of the 10% depop fee that is taken out. It’s exhausting to see so many people being scammed, and if you all truly cared about your users and sustainability it would have been banned MONTHS AGO. besides that, it would be super convenient if there was a select tool that we could use to add stuff from our likes to our collections quicker and easier than having to relike it and then add it.

title: Why no TRACKING#?
review:
****UPDATE: since the developer responded, that shows good faith & caring about the users feelings- for that I give more stars & a chance to see changes

Why isn’t the buyer given the tracking number?  ask the seller & not all of them will give it to you. feeling of not knowing, being super anxious & in the dark.  Would give ease & peace of mind if they automatically gave tracking information like the other apps do.  Do I have to cancel? Not knowing when or if they’ll ship it - why would you put People thru that nuisance of having to harass the seller to send tracking information?  It gives too much open gate to scammers - yes you get your money back, but I don’t see why so much wasted time & energy when you can nip it in the bud sending tracking info after you buy.  Terrible part of the app. Otherwise it’s fine.
developerResponse: {'id': 2590577, 'body': "Hey Melinda - we ask sellers to provide tracking information for your peace of mind and to make sure that our sellers are covered by Seller Protection, so this really should be coming your way. Please be aware that if for any instance your item does not arrive and your seller doesn't have proof of tracked postage then PayPal are highly likely to judge any dispute in your favour. We hope this helps, and don't hesitate to contact our Support team should you have any other questions on this. Many thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-02-15T10:22:53Z'}

title: BUY WITH CAUTION ⚠️
review: Depop seems amazing, however theres a ton of scammers. Most sellers are very lazy and never respond unless you offer $. Took one user two weeks to answer me (most just don't answer) only because i reported them, & they said they'd ship asap then next day came up with “oh i’ll just refund you”. Uh yea thanks. You'll probably never see the money again in some cases. Or they take extremely long to ship out your things and don't scale it right so you have to pay double to usps to receive your item. Not to mention deleting accounts right after you purchase something. Now NOT every one scams on here, but with my and many others experience i have to warn others to be very very very CAREFUL. Look at reviews, make sure the reviewers are REAL & make sure they're legit sellers. Message them about items before buying, ask for proof of shipping etc , do not let these people scam you!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 3159595, 'body': 'Hey there - please rest assured that we work hard each day to remove the presence of any scammers on the app. We have mechanisms in place to detect these users, and we also work closely with our community who report any users who may have slipped through the net: please be sure to notify us if you come across any such users! If your item does not arrive or a refund is not arranged, PayPal protection kicks into play to ensure that as a buyer or a seller you do not lose out. Please reach out to us if you have any doubts on this at all. Many thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-17T11:00:38Z'}

title: Horrible customer service
review: This is the first time I have ever taken time out of my day to write a review on the App Store, and I feel compelled to after the horrible experience I have had because of this app. I loved the diverse selection of vintage clothing, had owned the app for quite a while but never made a purchase, and looked forward to using it, when I suddenly got an email that I was banned for scamming. When I contacted their customer service multiple times, I was met with the same copy and pasted emails, saying that I would continue to be banned. The fact that this company can make baseless claims against their valued costumers shows little to no respect for consumers, and the frustration of dealing with multiple service reps who refused to have a real conversation with me really shows the mark of a company that only cares about making a profit. I was really looking forward to making purchases on this app, but in the end was left extremely frustrated and disappointed.

title: lowered my review, just...awful now
review: I love selling on depop, I really love it. it was such a great way for me to make extra cash and even if you don’t have a large following, keeping your shop updated and having an appealing look makes it easy to get sales UPDATE: I’m TIRED this new update is god AWFUL. not only is it awful for sellers but it’s terrible as a buyer to look for anything. I have no idea why you changed it I never saw anyone complaining as much as I do now, rightfully so, it’s horrid. You also haven’t added options to get payments in ways other than PayPal, PayPal has been providing me with tons of issues and I’ve had to close my shop until it’s resolved when you could literally just make the bank payments more accessible. I KNOW you’re letting some people use it, so why not have people sign up like beta testers??? I don’t care if I have to sign a waiver. You guys keep ignoring everyone’s pleads to make the app better depop has became a chore to use rather than something I enjoy. I’m so saddened.

title: Deceiving Buyers to Make $$$
review: I have been a seller on the app for two years, and in the past I’ve had no complaints. I LOVE the layout, customer service, and overall vibe and how user friendly the app is. But they just announced today that they’re changing their policy on dropshipping. This is when people never even own their own stock, they just pluck photos from AliExpress (and other cheap Asian sites) and post it quadruple the price, and then when someone buys, they simply type their address into AliExpress and it ships directly to the buyer. This is a deceptive marketing tactic that supports underpaying Chinese factory workers that live in horrible conditions.
