What’s so upsetting is that Depop has always been marketed as a safe space for selling secondhand and handmade clothing, outside of the traditional fast fashion market. Instead they have chosen to change the rules so they can make their sweet 10% fee off of dropshippers, hurting the planet and the other sellers who are trying to make money the right way. Beyond disappointed and ashamed.

title: Improvements
review: This app really really could use improvements! I wish it had in-app notifications for private messages (like Instagram has the bar at the top). If a buyer messages me while I’m on the app I miss it and they lose interest in the item. Also I hate going on the computer every time I want to move sold items down. I wish the app offered that feature so I would have to go through the hassle of logging in on my computer when I could press a simple button on the depop app. Also the explore page always shows pages I already know of. I wish depop gave a chance to new people trying to start up; like me. I’m very thankful for this app and the money I have made to save up for a car. I just want the app to be better because I know it can.

title: The Only Place I Shop
review:
I’m a vintage lover with bad dust allergies and not a lot of patience - as much as I love the concept of thrifting, I have a hard time committing to the task.

Depop offers amazing curated shops at great price points; the search engine allows me to almost always find exactly what I’m looking for, whether it’s a very specific novelty item or a basic item in just the right size.

The community that comes with depop is almost as appealing as the items sold; I know I’m lucky here, but I’ve never had a bad experience with a seller, and have even made some sweet friends with people around the country (I’m in NYC and talk almost every day with a delightful gal in Tulsa, OK!). Even when I’m not in a buying mood I love just looking at what people are finding, selling, and styling in their shops.

title: They value their scammers more than the sellers/buyers.
review: Apparently, they value scammers more than the sellers/buyers. I saw another post calling out this exact same scammer, and I decided that I share the same type of post as well. It was a screenshot of the interaction with the scammer and the name of the scammer. All I was trying to do is let other fellow Depop users know to beware of this scammer. However, someone reported my post that was calling the scammer out and what to do when you are in the situation, so my scam alert got taken down right away, which was not fair. I got an email from Depop giving me “warning” [wth???just for alerting fellow Depop users of a scammer, when their are a ton of other post similar to it already and they take mines down] I replied back to the warning because their was an option to reply and I still haven’t heard back, but keep in mind it took Depop less than one hour to investigate my scam alert post and take it down. I am new to this app , however I am already 100% disappointed.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17002588, 'body': '
Hey. We moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-07-31T11:13:29Z'}

title: i love it...but there are some issues
review: now i’ve been on depop for maybe the past two years? through the past two years i’ve lived the app! i can sell old clothes and get new ones for a pretty good price. my only issues are 1) there are a decent amount of people trying to scam 2) so many people list there items alone tag them as things that are completely irrelevant to the item 3) people put insane prices for things and 4) i see so many people selling items they bought off of places like aliexpress or other cheap online stores for a huge markup and not dying that’s where they got it. i understand depop can’t go through every single listing and account to check for these things, which is why i suggest a section where we can report sellers or items for review. you could select what is wrong with it (it’s not what it says it is, the seller is a scammer, or it’s using irrelevant tags). i also suggest that instead of just putting a tons of words at the end of the description, we have tags that’s we can click on so we can see other things similar:). overall i love. the app and will hope to be able to enjoy it for a while more. i really don’t want to have to quit bc of people using the app incorrectly:((

title: Rethink this app
review:
At first I thought this app was cool but the more I used its features the more frustrated I became. 
The depop shipping is hard to use in my opinion. I feel like they charge so much when in reality if I just went to USPS and had them weigh it, it would cost the buyer less. 
Depop also takes 10% of your earnings, not including the shipping so if you as the seller pay for the shipping, they take that out and then the depop fee, then whatever’s left gets transferred to PayPal and they even take a cut. When everything is said and done I feel like I barely scrape by. I’ve tried marking up my items to then receive what I feel is just but then my items don’t move fast or at all. 
I think depop takes too high of a percentage. For example, etsy takes 5% and charges 20 cents per listing, way better deal. 
Not sure about posh mark or other used clothing specific apps but I’ll be figuring out an alternative.
I recently had to refund a buyer that bundled and got free shipping, I emailed depop all the info to receive a refund on the depop fee and the shipping. They never emailed me back but refunded just the fee and not the shipping. So I had to refund the buyer in whole and I’m out $17. I emailed them again with all the info, and again, have not received an email back. I’d be surprised if I receive that refund ever. 
Also, I always have this glitch where I have to open the app 2-3 times to get rid of my notifications.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12059426, 'body': "Hey. We provide Ship with Depop as an option for our US sellers to make the selling process smooth and easy. You always have the option to ship with an alternative provider if you like.

With regards to fees, we only charge for sold items, no insertion charge. This fee allows us to keep Depop up and running, and introducing the features our Community love.

As for your above refund, I'm afraid a shipping refunded wouldn't be included here. A seller is responsible for delivering the item to their buyer, so we couldn't step in here.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-26T10:16:27Z'}

title: Love but improvement is always needed
review: I love depop and I buy a decent amount of items from there. I only have two problems with it. The first being that no matter how I set up shipping as a seller, I somehow always pay for something to be shipped out. Even if the customer is meant to pay it. I’ve found that adding the shipping price to the amount I want to sell the item for works best. It took a few tries but I got it figured out. The only other problem I have is that depop uses paypal and nothing else. My paypal is entirely setup, yet I have multiple transactions from selling that are pending or have been cancelled. Personally, I feel depop should also allow venmo as a payment option. It’s easier and much faster. Other than these two things, I do love the app and have found many unique pieces on here.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12038162, 'body': "Hey. If you're using Ship with Depop, double check the initial payment you receive. This'll include the shipping costs, which we then deduct with your fee on behalf of the buyer. You'll not pay any extra for shipping, as we'll send more initially.

With regards to PayPal transactions - it sounds as if you've received some echeque payments. if you drop PayPal a line, you can choose not to receive these.

Good news - we're looking into new payment options as we speak.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-25T12:21:44Z'}

title: Easy Peasy
review: I love this app. It makes selling super easy and buying dangerously easy lol. The app is very simple and easy to use/navigate. Posting items for sale takes minimal effort.  Getting discovered is simple- just use hashtags to show up in searches.  The shipment can be calculated for you, directly through USPS, and the shipping label is emailed to the seller immediately after an item is purchased, which is super convenient.  It’s nice to be able to watch buyer trends.  You are also provided selling and photography tips, which I found to be very helpful and you really get the opportunity to have your shop highlighted, through the explore page!  I had an issue with one of my posts and the support team emailed me back immediately.  I’m truly obsessed with Depop!

title: Such a unfair selling platform
review:
What a messed up and all over the place team. I got suspended because I didn’t ship my part of a swap to a person because she sent me a fake palette and I reached out to the them stating I was scammed and I wanted my money back and they just said said “PayPal resolution.... blah blah blah.... we removed her negative feedback.... blah blah blah” BUT AS THE SCAMMER CONTACTED YOU GUYS YOU JUST SUSPENDED MY ACCOUNT ON THE SPOT. 

she had 3 reviews and her reviews are at 2.5 stars. And IM A 5 STAT SELLER WITH OVER 180 POSITIVE FEEDBACKS; NO NEGATIVE. But this team member decides to not only try and dig more info but immediately suspended my account. Okay. “Soooo fair” 

You guys did nothing when I sent you guys screenshots and PROOF THAT IT WAS A FAKE MAKEUP PALETTE AND IN UR POLICIES IT STATES “NO FAKE MAKEUP” I get suspended because I was only a victim into getting scammed and she only got a warning basically. You guys can step up your team and be more of a “team”. I guess this is why people don’t choose Depop as their main selling platform. Not to mention your support team is pretty useless if you guys don’t take the obvious.

title: Unbelievable scam
review: This is the first time I have ever been so disappointed with an app that I sought it out in the App Store to write a review. In summary, beware that: if you have *any* problem while using depop, they basically don’t have customer service. You can try as you might to email, Facebook message, Instagram message, etc. but they will either not respond for a week, send you copy pasted instructions that aren’t helpful, or just not respond to you at all. I have had multiple legitimate problems with the app and it has been a nightmare simply trying to get a response about them. And then to top it off my boyfriend bought a $20 hat from this guy who just never shipped it, and when he contacted depop go report it, guess what? No response. So I guess we just got scammed out of $20??? The idea of this app is great but it’s 100% a facade, any service that involves the exchange of money needs to first and foremost ensure good customer service and this is so, so far from it. I will never use this app again.

title: NEEDS FIXES PLS!
review: don’t get me wrong , this app is great and its been pretty useful since I’ve been using it. However, this new update, has really got to go. A lot of people agree the 2x2 format when searching stuff is not convenient at all, and a lot would prefer to have the regular 3x3. Also, now for some reason when I look up an item it brings up the most irrelevant items I am looking for. This may be due to clogged tags under items (tagging something as brandy Melville when its not, etc.) but its really annoying and its been so hard to have to take foreverrr to scroll to find items AND having clogged search tags with items I wasn’t looking for to begin with messes up the algorithm for what im trying to look for:/ ive been using the app less and less because of this. Depop was great and it still is I just feel a lot would agree the new update was not it and i’m hoping Depop takes this into consideration and switches it back or improves it
developerResponse:
{'id': 18548554, 'body': 'Hey there,

We experienced some issues yesterday that may have resulted in you not being able to use the app as normal. Rest assured, this is now fixed, and won’t occur again. You’ll now be able to discover, shop and sell as normal.

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-10-18T16:44:44Z'}

title: Good app, horrible customer service.
review: I used to love this app, but my account eventually got deactivated because I went against TOS, completely my fault and I don’t blame them for that. HOWEVER, after my account deactivated, I emailed their support team and asked if I could have access to my ONGOING orders (items I have already bought, and items I have already sold) so that I could update people with their tracking information and get my own updates on items I have bought, and they keep sending me the same automated “you can’t appeal the decision because you went against TOS” message. I’m not asking for my account back or to continue buying and selling! I literally just want to inform the people who have purchased from me that their items are on the way, and I want to make sure items I have purchased are on the way, and they don’t even have the decency to have a real person respond to my emails. Ridiculous! Imagine if you had a real problem regarding funds or whatnot.

title: Happy with depop
review:
I’m really happy with depop. I’m glad there is an alternative to the giant auction site (hint-hint) and that buyers are pretty cool and communication is easy! There’s a huge mix of high and low-priced items/sellers and it seems like a lovely community. I’ve been selling successfully and it’s a breath of fresh air. One thing I especially like is that you pay your selling fees straight away whereas on a certain other ‘auction’ site you pay them every 4-6 weeks and get a huge bill-paying the few each time avoids that unpleasant surprise. Also, I love that you get the shipping label sent to your email so you can just print and ship. You don’t have to go through any extra steps. 

I hope they grow and get even more buyers and sellers. 

I definitely ❤️ depop

title: Needs More Safety!
review: I never write reviews, but I feel the need to. I have actually used this app since the first time it came out and I been a seller the whole time and bought a few things. I’m complaining because it seems like there is more hackers and depop does not do anything to help you if you are seller getting scammed. For some reason, a customer was able to purchase an item and it said “pay through paypal.” I checked my account and there was nothing pending or on hold. I got no notification from paypal and I usually do after depop sends a notification someone had bought. I already contacted paypal and depop to see what may be the problem. I followed depop’s seller safety protection rule and they did not help me. I even reported the user and nothing was done. It shows even though you have been honest and loyal on the app, they will not help you out. The app has really gone down hill and I would NOT recommend using this app anymore. Too many hackers and scammers now.

title: Great is most ways
review:
Mostly I like this app but they raised already high shipping prices saying USPS raised their prices when I know USPS didn’t. Also you have no way of knowing how much shipping is going to be when you buy an item so you end paying $53 for an originally $45 item. (These are real numbers it’s how much it went up when I bought something recently and that was before they raised the price.) Other than that I like this app and think it is a good way to find unique clothes and make a little cash. 
BUT let me warn you things do not sell fast on Depop and Depop take $1 of the cost of the item you sell as well as the cost of shipping. (You have the buyer pay for shipping but then Depop takes it from your bank account not the amount the buyer paid you.) 
I do still recommend this app though.

title: I like this app BUT.
review: I like this app  I have been selling on it for over a year now. BUT I use to sell more items.  I am not sure  why it slowed down. I have great items and get compliments often. I use to get a few items a month shared on the explorer page.  It rocketed my sales but now they hardly ever share my stuff. If I could get my items seen they would sell. I also personally don’t care for what they have been sharing on the explorer page recently as much either. I generally only like a few things.  They share the same people who have 10-20k + sellers over and over.  Multiple items a week.  Other than that I love the simplicity of the app and any time I have questions the tech crew is awesome!!!  If only there was an easier way to grow your following and get your items seen
developerResponse: {'id': 6289656, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your time and for your feedback. Will make sure to pass this along.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-07T13:43:54Z'}

title: Love it but needs some work.
review:
I’ve been selling on depop for about 6 months and I love it. However there are several things that need some work. 
Pros: 
Very personal friendly environment 
Beautiful photography
Very clean professional looking app

Recommendations:
1: Caters to very small people, please! add more clothing size options. Women’s pants sizes should go up to at least 20 or 22 not 12. You have a large plus size community but it’s hard to find anything without the correct search filters. 
2: Frequent glitches, every few weeks there seems to be a new glitch. Sometimes messages stop working for a few days, right now I’m not getting any notifications. Please fix this. It’s not a new app. 
3: We should be able to re arrange our shop! A drag and drop editing screen would take care of this. 
4: Vacation Mode! If a seller is gone they have to make an announcement but it someone doesn’t see it and buys they might get angry about how long they have to wait. 
5: Store wide discount. An option to add a temporary discount to every item in your store would be nice. 
6: More chances to get on the explore page, it would be cool to have a weekly theme or something and a hashtag people could put on their listings that fit that theme for a chance to get featured. Might make it a bit more fair.
developerResponse: {'id': 3800163, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for taking the time to leave this in-depth review. You've raised some really interesting points that we'll be sure to bring up with the relevant teams here @ Depop HQ. Thanks again! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-11T14:54:05Z'}

title: Fair to new sellers
review:
I have only been on Depop for a few days but I have found, as someone interested in selling my art, that Depop is much more accessible and fair to new users wishing to sell than Etsy. Within a day I’ve already made my first sell and I love how you don’t have to have a decent amount of followers or sells to become seen. I’m even noticing a bit of traffic towards my page, whereas on Etsy, I’d tried my hardest for around a month to make a sell and had been unsuccessful with little to no engagement, and they ended up suspending my account for being under 18 which I can understand but the rules and steps to recover it were ridiculous. I would recommend Depop over Etsy to any artist with no current platform.
-ryleegraceb on Depop
developerResponse: {'id': 16866726, 'body': 'We love to see it.\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-07-25T18:02:43Z'}

title: Depop is the perfect example of online thrifting.
review:
I’ve been using Depop for over a year now, and I got to say, I love it! Depop is the perfect example of online thrifting, where you could get luxuries and nessesities for decent prices, used and new! Also, the customer service of Depop is pretty good too. Once there was a seller that I bought an item from that never responded to any of my messages and I never received this order. I got PayPal and Depop involved, and they take these measures seriously. They far enough to claim the seller as scammer and had her account removed, which should be done. Many apps let this get away, but not Depop.
This app is a great way to have a miniature online business as well. Although I have sold very few, the money I’ve earn is beneficial :)
developerResponse: {'id': 8680410, 'body': "That's amazing to hear! Start small but grow big. \n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-15T09:14:01Z'}

title: Just getting an acct
review: I kept hearing about this website/app and I’ve finally wanted to see what it had to offer. BUT I CANT EVEN MAKE IT PAST LOGIN IN. First I make an act simple directions I follow and I’m ready to go, after having to reset my password 5 times. And than as well being locked out WHEN USING THE RIGHT ONE. Than saying I can’t make another acct because I’m using the same phone number. And than when all login in info is correct “an error has occurred” and than restarting my phone and app, and even the website as I was hoping to make through either. AND STILL NOT GETTING THROUGH! Why make it so difficult, I’ve been waiting to see and was hopefully gonna buy something. But now I can’t even reach past the sign up or login in. VERY disappointed. And surprise I’m not an old person, I’m a teenager. I’ve made probably hundreds of accounts and might’ve have a problem but it was fixed in a couple minutes. But this is very disappointing.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14214600, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-03-24T12:32:34Z'}

title: Stupid refund info system
review: Depops report system is horrible. I bought an attire from one of the sellers and they didn’t respond. I waited 6 days for them to ship and it still hasn’t shipped. I have contacted the person numerous times only to figure out that they were active on the app but decided not to respond to me. I went to report this person and it does absolutely nothing. It has instructions on where to go but when you actually go to where they suggest you literally can’t do anything. It just tells you to wait 7 days, contact the buyer for a refund, and so on with info that is useless. They need to do better on their refund or buying issue system. I want to refund but it’s so hard to and I wouldn’t want this to happen to another buyer. Also I bought from this person because they had a really good review. I then stumbled upon this one person review and it was just like mine. It talked about how it never shipped, and just like mine the seller never responded.
developerResponse: {'id': 13015344, 'body': "Hey. We're always here for you in the event that something doesn't go to plan. You can visit help.depop.com for all the answers you need. However, if you need to get in touch, just go in-app to 'profile - settings - need help', you'll be able to send us a report from here.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-01-20T11:36:34Z'}

title: great app but I have some recommendations
review: I love depop! I’m both a buyer and a seller. The app is really good for finding things, but there are some aspects I’d want to change. 1. I wish we could hold down on a post in my DNA and click “not interested”. I’m tired of finding stuff that isn’t in my size, or finding the same listings over and over again. 2. I wish there was a way for small accounts to get more traction. I know selling isn’t as easy as it looks, but obviously the bigger accounts get more sales because you see them more on the explore page. Other than those two recommendations, I have nothing else to say! Please keep the first recommendation in mind though, I think it would really help the my DNA page.

title: HORRIBLE customer service
review:
Depop did not give me a shipping label during the “free shipping” event. This was the fault of THEIR app, since I clearly remember selecting in-app shipping. My customer bought the item within the time frame, but when I was ready to print the label the next day, it wasn’t there. I reached out to team depop and I had to explain it about 5 times in the SAME email chain (they couldn’t have gone back to read the previous emails?) and I got NO help. On top of that, one of the responses from them was pretty passive aggressive. Just horrendous.

Also, I miss being able to mark messages as unread! That was really useful for me, who also works 2 full-time jobs over the summer and is a full-time student in the other seasons. I can’t always respond to messages right away and being able to mark them as “unread” made it possible for me to keep track of inquiries that hadn’t been solved. Now it’s really confusing for me to keep track of everything.
PLEADE BRING THIS FEATURE BACK
developerResponse: {'id': 3878145, 'body': "Hey Eva! We'll bring this one up in discussion with the right teams here in the office - thank you for your feedback. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-18T12:49:23Z'}

title: Fun, can sell if very active
review:
I’ve been on Depop for about 4 months, I have a very small amount of followers but have made a few sales. I’ve been on the explore page multiple times: its not just big Depop shops, you just need high-quality photos and TAGS! Its also important to update your items so they appear higher in a search.

However I think the app should develop guidelines for how to grow shops/get exposures, and it should DEFINITELY develop a way for users to reorganize their store page without updating individual items. 

As a shopper, it can be really hard to find an item if you know what you want. So while its great for browsing, you can only apply one filter and one search term at a time. More filters would be useful. A “condition” category would also be extremely useful-and might thwart who sell stained and ripped clothes for really high prices.
developerResponse: {'id': 2933561, 'body': "Hey there, this is great feedback - thank you so much! We're constantly trying to improve the 'exposure' side of things for our sellers so this is super-relevant right now. We hope you'll notice improvements to the app as the year goes on. Thanks again! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-26T11:34:10Z'}

title: ZERO protection for buyers that receive damaged items, and tons of fakes
review:
Warning: Let me tell you why you should never use Depop. 
You buy a dress. It arrives damaged and not as described. With Poshmark, Mercari, Vinted, Tradesy, Curtsy, hell even EBay, all you do is click the not as described button. Fill out the description and attach a photo. A couple days later, you have a return label sent to you. Easy. 
Depop? It says all buyers are protected. Oh great! Nope. Click on the area to report a transaction, and it says that they do zero to help, won’t even get involved, and you need to file a claim with PayPal. Which means you PAY to ship this broken item back. Depop says, “sorry not our problem!!”

 I bought a dress. It arrived, and she lied about the size. Not only that, but the zipper is broken. I know have a dress that doesn’t fit, and it is broken. 
Depop will NOT help you . I tried to open a case and it just says that they don’t get involved, and you need to open a case with PayPal. 
Again. Poshmark, Mercari, etc. protect you. Get a damaged item and they handle it all. Not Depop! 
Also, most of the anime items are fakes, yet you can’t report the item, you have to report the seller and list what the item is. Then it doesn’t get taken down.
Next time you want to buy something? Choose ANY other app. Avoid Depop.
 It’s not worth the hassle of getting a defective item, and being forced to jump through hoops to return it.
developerResponse: {'id': 13396682, 'body': "Hey. We don't say that we do zero to help. We're always there in the event that things don't go to plan. If you processed your transaction through PayPal, they'll be responsible for the refund. That said, we're always there to lend a hand, and will guide you through the process. \n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-10T11:59:05Z'}

title: I use it but I’d be willing to sell elsewhere
review: I love depop over Poshmark in terms of aesthetic and organization. It’s so easy and accessible. One thing I hate is how when you search for a brand or item it automatically organizes the items by “most relevant” which are usually popular items instead of “newly listed”. I kept searching for a specific item forever and it wasn’t until I realized you can sort the search differently to bring up completely different items. I also think depop could improve on its customer service. I never get good customers service through email. I have gotten responses through twitter but they aren’t always active on that platform. I love depop but I might be switching to a new app to sell my closet
developerResponse: {'id': 3499508, 'body': "Hey there! Sorry to read about your customer service experience - please note that we're available on Twitter 7 days a week, but if you have any more feedback specifically about what you didn't like about the support we're all ears. Any kind of feedback we receive that can help us improve is much appreciated. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-17T09:50:23Z'}

title: Suggestions
review:
I’ve been using this app for quite a while now and as much as I like using Depop, here are some suggestions to make the app more enjoyable.
1. Seeing the shipping price could be easier. Pressing “Buy” on an item and having to go to your bag is too much, maybe have it displayed next to the price of the item. 
2. Please look more into the bugs in the app. Sometimes when I select “My sizes” as a filter it doesn’t budge. When I open the app it sometimes crashes. When I want to select something like “Most recent” the menu doesn’t even pop up. There are many bugs that make this app an inconvenience.
3. Please handle the drop shippers better. There are still so many of them scamming people.
Thank you. I really enjoy using this app and would like to see improvements.
developerResponse: {'id': 15249281, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\nTeam Depop\n", 'modified': '2020-05-11T19:19:05Z'}

title: Great potential
review: This is app is great and I love seeing everyone’s creations and finds but it still needs some work for sure. The app has some bugs like I wasn’t getting and notifications for messages or anything even though I checked to make sure notifications were on, I had to delete and redownload. This has happened twice. Also I keep scrolling my feed and it just refreshes automatically which pushes everything I’m looking at down my feed, very annoying!! Almost makes me not want to look at anything. Some people really be selling beat up stuff for high prices which slightly angers me tbh. It’s good way to make money if you know how to hashtag everything you list and they only take %10 profit which is cool!

userName: A person that likes this games
title: Love it but have minor suggestions
review: I absolutely love depop and the interesting people/styles it attracts! I was able to score a lot of great deals such as getting brand new chacos for $50. It feels really safe to use especially since payments use PayPal. My only issues are that I constantly get a little red number in the corner of the app icon but when I open the app I can’t find any new messages or notifications, and that I wish you were able to create collections in the “saved items” section like on Instagram. Since the app layout is pretty much the same as Instagram, I feel like this feature should be on there because it would make it easier to compare items i have saved and am considering buying. Overall love it and check it at least once or twice per day!
developerResponse: {'id': 3053031, 'body': 'Thank you very much for sending this feedback over! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-06T15:39:55Z'}

title: “Add to cart”
review:
The “add to cart” addition is terrible. I often click “buy” to compare how much buying one item w/ shipping will cost vs another. Now that it adds everything to a cart it’s extremely inconvenient when I’m comparing those prices and the items happen to be from the same seller. Please fix this. Some possible solutions: go back to how it was before. Or now when you click “buy” two little buttons can pop up like “buy single item now” or “add to cart.” Or make it so in settings you can turn off “add to cart.” 
    Overall app is good tho. All my other suggestions are pretty minor and mostly just personal opinion stuff not like functionality improvements such as the “add to cart” dilemma.

title: Meh
review:
Updated review:
Explore page is featuring more diversity & not the same repetitive sellers 🙂

One bug that should be fixed is getting random ghost notifications for sales & messages.

Some room for improvement to increase sales in my opinion:
1. Offer more brands when categorizing listings. Not many brands are in the app as opposed to Poshmark & Mercari
2. Allow more than 4 pictures per listing. It would allow for more transparency when advising customers of any signs of wear on items 
3. Add a “make an offer button” that binds your offer to your payment method for 24 hours, seller would have the option to accept, counter or decline. It would prove to be a faster way to barter than messaging.

- - - 
March 27, 2017: Same sellers being featured on the explore page, giving less exposure to other shops who don’t have a huge follower count. Explore page & “staff picks” shows favoritism toward slim people I rarely see people of color, plus size, or older people there, which is strange considering that it’s an international app. No way to make on offer with the press of a button like Mercari or Poshmark. If you arrange your own shipping as a seller, Depop takes their commission out of your own money, unlike other reselling apps. Room for improvement but it’s still my #3 app for reselling
developerResponse: {'id': 3459726, 'body': "Hey Judy, thanks for the review! We truly are working towards making your wishes a reality and we hope you'll see small but regular improvements throughout the year. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-14T13:02:38Z'}

title: No improvements on this app
review:
I started selling on this app a year ago. I have been apart of the depop Facebook community as well and everyone agrees that they need to do more updating on this app. We are only allowed to upload 4 photos!!!! When you’re an online seller you cannot work with JUST 4 PHOTOS! Everyone has been asking for this for a long time now and nothing has been done about it. I hate doing this and leaving bad reviews but when it’s been over a year of people complaining about this app and not working to help their sellers and buyers, it’s extremely frustrating! 
Every selling app has changed their platforms to make it easier and BETTER for the sellers and buyers. I feel as if our emails never go through or they just read their emails and never respond.  There’s apps out there that have updated and why can’t depop do the same thing? I would like to see change ASAP!

title: ♥ I N L O V E ♥
review: This app is one of my favorite distractions (and it is my main clothes source as well). Every person I've bought an item from is extremely reliable, understanding, and always willing to make a deal. I love the fact that most shops let you "bundle" so that you can get discounts off of multiple items you'd like to purchase from them. The only thing that would make this app even better would be a post notifications feature, because sometimes it's disappointing to see that I've missed a shops items by a day or two (or maybe even just a few hours) because I wasn't checking the app every minute. Thank you for this amazing app, and I can't wait to see what the next update brings:).
developerResponse: {'id': 2913205, 'body': 'Thank you for this lovely and interesting feedback! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-03-23T11:01:09Z'}

title: Some negatives as a buyer and seller
review:
Depop app does this dumb thing where it changes shipping to “my own shipping” even though I had the Ship with USPS option checked. Which I’ve had a problem with more than once and then have to find out after someone has already purchased an item and go through the whole process of making my own shipping label and trying to find a good price.

It also cancels the app out when I go deep enough into the explore page.

And although, it’s not entirely the apps problem I’ve had problems with lying sellers and buyers.
People that think adding “vintage” to something excuses all the defects with the item without showing or mentioning it in the description. And they just simply add “no returns, not my problem after I ship” to there bio like that changes anything.

Also if you’re a buyer you have to watch out for petty sellers that give you a low rating because you’re honest with them and their inconsistency and immorality. And Depop rarely does anything about bad sellers/buyers even if you have proof.

The good thing is you can get your money right away, but I guess that can be somewhat bad too if there are smart scammers lurking about.

Also it’s fun to see the creativity, passion and efforts sellers put into their pages and items.

title: Good, but...
review: This app is great. Super user friendly, it is easy to buy or sell. My number 1 issue is that there has been a glitch for MONTHS that doesn’t allow you to leave feedback for random people. I had two really bad issues with sellers that I would like to let other people know about but Depop still has not fixed this since JUNE! Also, I can’t reward the good sellers with good feedback. Depop, PLEASE FIX THIS! Also, if the seller of an item never marks that the item has shipped, it does not allow you to leave feedback. So I have an item that says it has not been shipped since July, and I can not warn other people about a horrible seller who never sent my item, never messaged me back when I inquired about the item, and never messaged me back when I requested a refund. If this does not get fixed in the next few months I will probably leave Depop which is a shame because I am a great seller and buyer.
developerResponse: {'id': 6290151, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for the feedback. This should have been fixed if you have the latest version of the app. Can I please ask you to pop over a report via our in-app support Settings > Need Help? > Technical Issues and then we can get this sorted together.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-07T14:20:00Z'}

title: Use at your own risk
review:
I downloaded depop and my items didn’t sell for a while. My app crashed and could not locate it anywhere on my phone (did not delete it and my App Store said i still had it downloaded). I gave up and later on was notified my items would be deleted. Cool. Then I apparently started selling items. I could not use the app because of the said “glitch”. Not my problem. But that created many problems for me that I was basically forced to deal with on my own, seeing as their customer service is hardly helpful and not too friendly or easy to work with. I had a specific question I couldn’t get figured out on my own so I emailed them and got back copy and pasted mass answer from sections of their FAQ. Which you can obviously find out for yourself.

The shipping fees are weird and hard to work with because of how separated they are from paypal so it isn’t user friendly by any means. And somehow I feel like I lost money out of the deal.

title: GARBAGE!!!
review: This app is literally horrible for selling.  I sold two items and delivered them on here over month ago and my funds are on “hold”. They told me to wait 21 days for my funds to be released but it’s been over 21 days and I have received nothing not only that depop has tried to take 20$ from my account out of no where and whenever I send an email about why I am being charged they don’t respond or it’s some stupid automated message that doesn’t answer my question there is no call number or anything only an email that I get no response from.  I’ve used other sites like Poshmark and the process was SOOO much easier and I was paid for the merchandise and  for depop to be much more popular I would have expected so much more but the whole process of selling with this website was so stressful and I most definetly would never recommend it. If your a buyer it is better I’ve ordered shoes from here and it was easy but for selling it’s trash.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16268101, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-06-28T23:06:38Z'}

title: Love it
review: I’ve moved over completely from my old website to Depop as I seem to get much more engagement on here than my old website. I love everything, but I think it would be awesome to be able to sell multiple items to one customer without having to create a new listing for bundles. It would also be really neat to eventually see an option to show the product via gif or video format or some sort of 3D way to get as close to seeing the product in real life as possible. I would love to see more features as well, such as monthly reports, daily engagement such as views, clicks, revenue, things like that to help better understand just exactly how sellers are doing. Hope that made sense lol. Love the app though!!

title: Please change the search user interface :(
review: I LOVE Depop, I buy a lot of my clothes on there and sell too. Its super easy and fun, what prompted me to write a review now though is that the new user interface when searching for items is extremely distracting. The filter and sort icons pop up in front of items in the bottom of the screen exactly in the place where my eyes are drawn to look, and I can’t scroll back up without them popping up to block my view, hope this isn’t being to picky just wanted to say the UX was better with those icons at the top, and I feel inclined to stop scrolling purely out of frustration at those little buttons getting in the way. Overall keep up the good work!
developerResponse: {'id': 11103809, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-07T15:26:08Z'}

title: It’s okay.
review: I am trying Depop and so far it has been such a headache! Setting up PayPal is really difficult and confusing. Depop takes fees from you when you make a sale. However I wasn’t under the impression that these fees would be taken from me BEFORE I received payment for the sale yet they did. I have not received any payment from my sale yet and they took $18 out of my personal bank account. So I made a sale, got no money from the sale yet, and am out $18 until the person receives their item. How does that make sense. I wasn’t expecting that and now I can’t pay bills because of it. I looked it up and it says if your PayPal is empty then they will take it from your bank account. Still don’t understand why they would take their fees before I even get my money from MY sale. But okay.

title: Terrible Customer Service and Algorithm
review:
As other fellow Depop sellers have voiced out, Depop’s recent algorithm update has dramatically decrease sales and traffic for many sellers, including myself. The community has been frequently voicing their constructive criticism regarding this, just to receive standoffish and redundant responses that elude the actual problem. At this rate, I’ve been strongly been considering to switching to Etsy. 

Sellers pay for fees, out their sale transactions, to support changes to benefit the community yet I have yet to see that implemented. The updates have been incredibly useful, if not counterproductive. Not to mention, it’s always been quite hard to contact customer support, which is ridiculous. Other selling apps, such as Mercari and Poshmark, it’s easier to contact customer service. Depop needs to recognize they have competition and if they do not use our fees to fulfill the needs of both buyers and sellers on the plarform, then we will LEAVE.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18784146, 'body': 'Hey there,

We’re always making changes and improvements to Depop to help you get more views and sales.
For more info on search, just take a look at this FAQ page: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360050410093-Boost-your-chances-of-being-found-in-search

Team Depop', 'modified': '2020-10-29T14:52:37Z'}

title: Love it, but tired of seeing the same sellers
review:
Agree with other comments here that the explore page tends to feature the same already famous Depop sellers. Give attention to other less famous individuals who don’t have an army of resources to make their page professional and who don’t upmarket a simple thrifted item 10x the price. Make it DIY again. Half these famous sellers also sell on Instagram, Etsy, websites etc. 

I do appreciate depop improving their search functionality and ability to cater your search page and what’s specific to your individual tastes. More sellers need to be featured - tired of seeing the same ones. 

Also appreciate the free shipping promotions and other deals they offer on occasion.
developerResponse: {'id': 8619723, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback. We love all the appreciation you send us and we're definitely having a look on how we can improve further for our users. I will make sure to pass on the feedback to our team.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-11T11:41:48Z'}

title: Don’t forget about the little people!! ☺️
review: KoolNicole — I couldn’t have said it better myself!! I love Depop. Love it! But lately I have become increasingly frustrated by the fact that the same high-volume sellers (with already massive follower bases) seem to appear more and more frequently on the explore page. I didn’t mind when it was 1-2 items at a time but it’s pretty disheartening to see that these users continue to gain followers when there are so many other smaller shops that don’t get recognized. When I started using Depop I appreciated the fact that “little people” like myself seemed to have a fair chance at starting a small business and gaining a following. But I’ve seriously begun to question whether or not that’s still a realistic possibility. So please Depop, please let the “little peoples” have some more space on the explore page 😅

title: Scam
review:
BUYER BEWARE:
I used this app to purchase & buy.  A seller by the name Y2VINTAGE never sent me an item that cost me $45.  I got it as a gift for my brother, I had to show up empty handed at his party.  I left a honest review about it, the seller ended up reporting me to DEPOP falsely.  Even though I had tried working it out with her before.  The app has come down on my account when all I did was leave an honest review about how I never received my item & that the seller doesn’t help.  She had written me a huge temper tantrum message about it, claiming it’s not her fault.  If a buyer doesn’t receive an item, it is 100 percent your fault.  I’ve sold on the app before, I’ve never done this, but you can lie about tracking.  All it requires is that you write the tracking # down.  It’s not verified.  Know that depop lies about “protecting buyer 100%”
I’ve been at it for over a week now & they’re punishing my account I made to get by in the pandemic.  Horrible.  Disgusting.  This is theft.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17671245, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.
 
We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-03T11:45:16Z'}

title: BUGGY APP
review: I love Depop. Its a really easy to understand marketplace that hosts more diverse styles and products than other selling platforms, which I love. However. For such a mobile-heavy app that has minimal laptop support, the app should function better. Sometimes it freezes when you’re scrolling or working in it and you have to restart, but what’s the worst is the notifications! The app always has little red bubbles even if nothing new has happened - opening your notifications and viewing them does not make the bubbles on the app go away. This is a big deal for an app where you need to be attentive to sales and whatnot so you can’t turn off notifications but super annoying to keep opening the app because you don’t know if there’s something new that’s happened. This really needs to be fixed!
developerResponse:
{'id': 16191200, 'body': 'Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 
We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-06-24T10:39:39Z'}

title: So so close
review: Very rad that there’s so much opportunity for international purchasing etc... but... no joke HALF of the items that people list and I’ve purchased people have wrote me after the fact and said “oh oops this already sold or i can’t find it”. That happens every now and then on other apps but for some reason it’s so frequent on here- i would say that isn’t the apps problem- but because they don’t offer refunds directly on the app (it’s super time consuming to get things figured out. I’ve spent so much time on the phone lately disputing charges because the sellers are unresponsive). I wish the app would actually penalize sellers for not keeping up with their listings. If you sell an item that you no longer have etc, and didn’t bother to take down, you should be charged for wasting other people’s time.

title: PAYPAL
review: DEPOP PLEASE PLEASE develop your own money transaction bc pay pal is literally the worst. my account was put on limited and i don’t even know why because i know i haven’t violated any of their rules and when i provided the correct documents like my card history and passport id. and now i can’t use paypal and over $200 is on my paypal and i have to wait 180 DAYS to receive it. i can’t even contact paypal customer service because their lines are off due to covid which is such bs. now i can’t sell anything bc u depop requires paypal to sell items pls someone help me find a way to fix it. i also now have to use my moms card so that i can sell and depop limited took payments off her card and i still haven’t been able to receive my customers shipping label even though i verified my account and card

title: Recent update makes the app barely tolerable
review: Depop is fine for what it is, a buying and selling app. However the recent update has made it so that when I’m scrolling through searched items and I click on one to see the item, when I go back to the search it takes me all the way back to the top. Sometimes when I’m scrolling the app will freeze and then randomly show me an item I didn’t even click on, so then I’m forced all the way back to the top of the search page for no reason. It’s incredibly infuriating!! It also frustrating to have to sift through all of the unrelated items whenever I search for something. I’m searching for Pokemon related things, not activewear, not women’s intimates, not purses, so why am I shown so many things that I DIDNT SEARCH FOR??? I hope the app improves because I used to love it a lot but for right now I will probably stick with eBay.
developerResponse: {'id': 15444200, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now.\n\nTeam Depop ", 'modified': '2020-05-20T11:36:58Z'}

title: Lots of glitches and horrible costumer service
review: I feel like I have some kind of technical issue with this app every other week. And, my account was recently suspended because there was apparently an issue with my PayPal account not being verified, even though it is and obviously has been for me to be buying and selling on this app for months now. They said to email them when I resolved the issue and they would get my account back up and running. It has been hours with no response. I have lost a whole day of business, as well as customers probably being sketched out that my account is just gone, not knowing the reason why. There is also no other way to contact them besides this email they apparently don’t check, not even any kind of phone number. Seriously not impressed.

title: Great app with small issue that bothers me
review:
I love this app so much. I’ve bought several items from here. The only thing that bothers me is that when you sort items by newly listed, it’s not accurate. For example, I looked up doc martens and sorted by newly listen. The first several to pop up were from 9 hours ago. But when I sorted by relevance, the first listed were from the past hour. It bothers me bc I want to find some things really fast before some people buy them, and they aren’t sorted properly.

ALSO I think it would be really nice if there could be a section where if you look up, say “doc martens” then you can see what has sold. This would be a very helpful feature because then I will understand what prices sell well for certain items.
developerResponse: {'id': 4361485, 'body': "Hey there - this is very useful feedback so thank you for taking the time to jot this down. We'll take a look into the search issue you reported too. Thanks again, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-07-23T16:49:54Z'}

title: What happened :(
review: I was doing extremely well during the entire summer, building my shop & making lots of sales. All the sudden that came to a halt. I’ve barely been selling anything the past month. How am I supposed to make a living when people don’t see my items anymore? I don’t know if it’s because there’s a different algorithm, or because of the fact that I had a buyer report me because her items “didn’t fit the way she wanted to” (they were items in perfect condition) and I was writing upset emails to the depop team that were completely valid, explaining why she was wrong. I’m very unhappy with this app right now and they’re going to lose my business if it continues this way. During the summer I would have rated this app a 5, but that’s not the case right now.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18384464, 'body': "Hey there,

We get it, this can be frustrating. However, we've created a dedicated Seller Handbook on our Help Centre to help our Users shoot, style and sell. 
Learn more about highlighting your shop by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in Sellers Handbook.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-09T19:24:43Z'}

title: message flaws notif center
review: please allow buyers and sellers to make and accept offers to each other next to the buy button 🖤 once the offer is accepted payment should be processed instantly!!! 🖤 sells would increase as people do not like being messaged every time they like an item and it would save time going back and forth bargaining 🦋also, whenever i get a message and read it i will leave the tab and will keep showing i have messages until i switch back and forth 3 or so times and refresh it. notifs should be like insta where it shows how many follows, comments and likes you’ve gotten but be placed into diff tabs on the notif section PLEASEEE. app would def be 4-5/5 stars also pressing follow button takes a few tries it is not smooth like ig twit etc. and should be easier to unfollow as well
developerResponse:
{'id': 16784955, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-21T15:12:54Z'}

title: Something smells fishy...
review: Depop is raising their shipping prices and claiming it's due to USPS raising their prices.  USPS raised their prices in January and Depop raised their prices around that time (although it’s difficult to pinpoint exactly when as they seem to have removed all info about prior price increases, hmmm...).  Depop uses Shippo to generate the labels and on Shippo’s own blog you can see a price chart showing that Depop is now overcharging for their shipping labels, ESPECIALLY for lighter packages, which I’m sure comprise the majority of Depop sales.  Is Depop overcharging for shipping labels so they can pocket the difference?  Sure seems like it.  You’re better off using flat rate envelopes or PayPal’s shipping for most things now, although Depop tries to strong-arm you into using their shipping by taking 10% of what the customer pays you for shipping if you choose to arrange your own shipping.  I have shifted my focus to Poshmark and it’s a much more professional and pleasant experience, I highly recommend jumping ship.
developerResponse: {'id': 3052639, 'body': "Hey there Alice! This bug is one that a small number of users have reported but that we're having some issue re-producing. We apologise that we don't have any news on this at the moment, but we'd be happy to return the money you lost out on if you contact our support team with the details. Many thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-06T14:48:55Z'}

title: Worth it for that one perfect find...
review:
It's crazy that clothing and shoes I used to wear in high school and college are now being called vintage. I was only born in the 80's. Am I really that old?!? It's surreal and disheartening. lol.  😩😂😂

I will say, however, that I love this app and it's ability to take me back in time with the incredibly wide selection of old and new findings. It's like visiting a 2nd hand store. You'll do a lot of looking through junk, but then find those 1-3 absolutely perfect finds - diamonds in the rough, if you will, that make all the searching worth it - vintage items in perfect condition in just your size. Maybe an exact twin of your favorite shirt you used to wear in your 20's. Snatch 'em up. They will be sold fast.
developerResponse: {'id': 5354825, 'body': "Don't you worry my 80's baby, think of it as aging fine like wine.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-10-04T09:51:35Z'}

title: No shopping cart
review: I had to buy 4 things here for my daughter. I found the app navigation confusing, and was very annoyed that there is no shopping cart feature. Having to purchase multiple items individually is time consuming and frustrating. I ended up deleting the app and purchasing through the web site instead. Then when I didn’t receive 2 of the items, I Emailed the sellers, and got no response. I had to download the app again in order to report the purchases. The fact that I couldn’t do this on the web site was, again, very frustrating. I finally got messages from the sellers through the app, but nothing alerting me of that via Email. Maybe this way of operating works for younger people, but they are not the only ones with a credit card, and I am extremely unlikely to agree to buy anything through this app again.
developerResponse: {'id': 6451658, 'body': 'Hi Marie, we very much appreciate you taking the time to send us some feedback about your experience. This is very helpful for us when want to make our users experience more friendly. I have pass this feedback to our team. Please know that you can also report any issues via the email support@depop.com.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-19T02:55:23Z'}

title: Amazing way to buy and sell used and new items!
review: I love this app. I’ve had it for a couple years and used to just browse items but I recently started buying and selling. I’ve sold around 15 items and I’ve been selling for maybe 2 months. They make it so easy to buy and sell. I also bought an item that was lost by the post office and I was able to get a refund from the post office. Everyone I’ve spoke with has been extremely kind as well as the depop customer support people. If you are hesitating selling your items like I was just do it. Incredibly easy process! The fees are a little annoying but my clothes would be sitting on the floor of my closet unused so it’s worth it.
developerResponse: {'id': 2913264, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving this review! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-03-23T11:06:49Z'}

title: One star because it’s easy to sell
review: But other than that it’s horrible. They have bad customer service and only care about making money. There are many dropshippers in the app but they don’t do anything about while I’m just trying to sell clothing but my listings get removed for supposedly breaking the rules, which I admit I used to use 5 tags that are not related to my item but then there’s always people who post 80 spam tags and their listings don’t get removed. Many times I’ve thought of quitting because they don’t care but I need money. Also the 10% fee isn’t going anywhere because there’s still many bugs in the app and when I make a listing I can’t see the pictures that I used, they’re all blank. Most importantly, with the 10% fee the least you could do is get better customer service, take pirateship for example they are such sweethearts. Get your app together.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18004495, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

In an effort to keep Depop a creative marketplace with quality products we decided to update our policy on drop shipped items. As of March 1st 2020, we don't allow drop-shipping on-app.

If you can report any accounts that you believe are drop-shipping, we’d really appreciate it!

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-21T16:11:20Z'}

title: PLEASE FIX BUGS<3
review:
(from an iPhone) I love this app a lot and I think its so great and easy. But recently theres been problems with holding filter settings on my search page. Also, every time I am going through my searched and click on an item, it sends me all the way to the top of the list, which at first didn't bother me, but the farther I go down the more of a hassle it is to find where I was to begin with. 

I also suggest bringing back the scrolling option on searches. I think a lot of us would be happy if we were able to scroll through listed items one by one in a continuous feed but also view things in grid view (kinda like instagram's user profiles). 

Another thing I suggest (sorry if I'm going on) is being able to send posts in the pm's rather than through other apps. Me and my friends all have Depop and constantly send stuff to each other, but I feel like its annoying to have to exit Depop, open messages, only to be redirected to the Depop post. 

If you guys would do this I and many other people would for sure hop on the app more often, since these minor altercations would make this awesome app so much more convenient!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15340445, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 

Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-15T12:00:37Z'}

title: Cool idea, many problems.
review:
I've used this site many times with successful purchases, but I have two problems with this app that keep me from being able to raise the rating over a 2 stars. There's no good way of telling the quality of the item in a photo. I received many shirts with a layer of white fuzz over the top of the fabric or severely faded colors. 
Second, I've made two purchases and the seller never contacted me back. That would be no problem if the buyer protection was in tact. But it's not. I've contacted the site many times and reported the items I haven't received with no response at all from depop in the year I've been attempting contact. 
All in all, I enjoy this site, and its idea, but it doesn't have enough rules and regulations and I've ended up disappointed as much as satisfied. Please be wary of using this app so you don't lose as much money as I did.

title: Fix the photo selection when listing a product!!
review: Love this app, love the community, love the things being sold. I have moved from p*shmark to m*ercari to mainly this now and have been selling on apps for years, and I have some issues with it but I literally just wrote this review for now to say to FIX the photo selection feature when you go to list a product!! I'm pretty sure this is just in the recent update? It was perfectly fine before, now it numbers your pix off for you and you have to click it, and then unclick the pic in your camera roll again before trying to select a new one. Super annoying. Let me just click on a few dozen please before deciding which is my cover pix etc lol. Change it to how it was before please!!!

title: Payments/PayPal/Shipping Label
review: I've just recently joined depop to sell a couple of non-needed clothing I have in my closet. I was so excited to use the app and in a day I got my first buyer! I was so happy that someone decided to purchase one of my items, so I wanted to ship right away. I set it up where Depop made the shipping label and the buyer paid for it. Every time i've went to try and print out the shipping label, it tells me i need to verify my Paypal account. My Paypal has been verified for months now so I wasn't really sure what that meant. I decided to wait a couple days and still nothing. Keep in mind, the payment is in my Paypal, but it's pending. It has been 2+ weeks now and nothing has happened. I've emailed customer service twice and haven't gotten a reply. At this point, I have just made a new shipping label, shipping it, and hoping i get my payment. I am very disappointed.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16938456, 'body': "
Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-28T21:58:42Z'}

title: PLEASE FIX
review: Depop is by far my favorite & used app , with that being said I’ve grown disappointed & frustrated lately finding myself having to close the app out due to the fact that PayPal is the only option to purchase with on this site. Unfortunately PayPal isn’t always the best & preferred way to pay for some people , I large amount of people in the vintage community avoid depop because of this. Please give your users more options that just PayPal , it would be so much more convenient & easier. I don’t wanna sign up for PayPal , but I’d like to use Depop , I don’t feel like I should HAVE to be tied to PayPal when they aren’t my preferred payment option on a day to day basis or at all actually.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15340226, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 

Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-15T11:51:00Z'}

title: Good idea poorly executed
review:
This app is such a great way to buy sell clothes that are no longer worn and I really do enjoy using it but there are many MANY cons to it. A few examples.

Cons :

Follow limit. Like honestly. Some people follow 500k+ and then you put the limit on us to 7501? That decreases not as popular sellers ability to have our account seen or find new people to follow it. My biggest pet peeve about the whole app.

Constant crashes. Whether it’s opening someone’s shop or even after you purchase an item. The app is ALWAYS crashing. You don’t know if your purchase completed or not because it crashed halfway through or you lost someone’s account you were looking at. So many bugs.

Depop goes through faces of only putting certain accounts on the explore page. There will be 5 items from the same big seller rather than a small account that really needs the publicity.

10% is taken from what you sell. I really use this app as an extra source of income whether it’s to pay for my dog food for the week or buy my lunch it’s really helpful to have a little extra but when you sell something for 100$ you really get 90$ it doesn’t seem like much but it’s a definite annoyance. At least have like 8%.

title: Small business owner screwed by depop.
review: Hello fellow Depop seller here. I was emailed and notified that 1/4th of my entire stock shop listings were removed due to “term infringement” (inaccurate keywords?) and that I can’t repost at risk of being banned. As I was not aware of this and it was a large portion of my product inventory I would like the option to have my posts reinstated so that I may edit the items captions or that I may have permission to repost the items since they are simply my clothing pieces. It seems unfair to not give sellers a warning before removing products for sale. Typically I have had great experiences with the platform but I am appalled by how this situation has been handled. Depop, I have sent you two emails, two DM’s, one Instagram post and two comments. No reply. Hold all sellers accountable not just small business owners like myself that don’t make you the big bucks.

title: Don’t give any of your money to this business
review: The process of selling one item could have gave me grey hairs. it took well over a week just to get a payment off hold. As soon as depop got my card information ( which i was expecting to add ONLY for depositing money i made from selling an item) they started charging my paypal AND my card directly for a total of $35 in charges. after the first charge i took my card off the depop account and even disconnect my paypal from my depop account and i STILL got another charge on my bank account 2 days later. i’ve also emailed them all week long because of how frustrating selling one thing has become, no one has answered any emails and they of course have no number to call. they put my account in the negatives but still refuse to reply to any emails or release at least what’s left of my payment from selling my item. Depop is a scam!!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 17752817, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but if you've contacted us we'll be in touch ASAP to get this sorted.
 
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-08T08:48:27Z'}

title: Amazing app/few suggestions
review: This is such a great way to sell things, super easy and quick. I love how a label is provided. Now they have different shipping price options which is amazing. I feel there should be a place where you can write your own shop policies (such as when and when you can’t ship, shipping details, trading details, bundle details, etc) I made one of my own but it’s difficult because I have to keep reposting it to get it at the top of the screen and I have to move things around to get it where I want it. I just think it would be super easy! I also think there should be something where you can put an item on hold for someone!!

title: CHANGE BACK TO OLD ALGORITHM
review:
I went from getting maybe 50 likes a day to maybe 2, and I haven’t made nearly as many sales since the DNA update. Depop tries blaming sellers for this decline in engagement, but I have been working extra hard on good quality pictures and good descriptions. The first search results are always people BREAKING COMMUNITY GUIDELINES with spam tags and marking as false brands for exposure. 
ALSO, I refunded a buyer for purchasing a dress that I made clear was unavailable, I refunded her ALL her money but the item it still awaiting shipping. It is completely ruining my estimated shipping time, and the dress is still marked as sold. When I tried reaching out to depop I got NO help, it was some computer generated answer that was incredibly vague and it had nothing to do with my issue. Depop needs to improve their customer service and actually HELP their users that are making them an insane amount of money.

title: Depop TAKES YOUR MONEY
review: I sold an item and I tried  to ship it to the customer but depop won’t give me access to the shipping label because it claims that my Paypal isn’t verified however when I go to my PayPal app it tells me my account IS VERIFIED. I tried contacting depop but have gotten no response and PayPal says everything is good on their end, so it’s an issue with Depop. NOT ONLY THIS, but depop also did not ask me for permission to access my bank account and they directly took money out of my account to pay for a shipping cost. The money for shipping should come  out of what the customer pays NOT my personal account!!!! Especially since I haven’t even gotten access to the purchase yet!! It also states on depop that sellers are only protected if they send their product AFTER the payment is “received” not pending, but on PayPal it says they hold your money in “pending” until the customer received the products.

title: For You section
review: I dont know what happened in the update prior to the last two recent ones but my For You is horrible. I compare the items I have saved and liked versus what I see in the For You and I am utterly confused. I used to never have to search as often because my For You had everything. Now, I find myself searching stuff more or just looking through my Likes deciding whether I want to purchase or not. I really hope the algorithm gets fixed. Also, a lot of sellers have been misleading buyers when they do auctions which is very prevalent amongst Brandy Melville sellers which is really annoying and I don’t want to see BM anywhere which is the partial reason why I don’t like my For You page because I see so much of Brandy Melville but I have never liked any if their items. Depop should create an auction function to mitigate the issue

title: Well
review: I guess since this is an app where regular people send stuff that they have lying around their house and not everyone is 100 percent honest with what they’re selling or sending there are a few precautions that you as a buyer should take. In my case my first purchase was 2 hair products and I only received one and “bait and switch” for the second one . Which is a bit disappointing but since it wasn’t a large investment I’m not that pressed on the matter. The seller is still getting docked stars by me on that and I’m not putting every seller on the same level as this one. I’ll try purchasing again and see if it happens again. I probably won’t continue using the app after that but hopefully that’s not the case.

title: Great but makes me crazy
review: Let me tell you, this app is great but it make me absolutely insane. Whenever I get a notification, even when I open the app and check whatever it’s notifying me for, it still will show the red dot on my app. It makes me bonkers, I will go through every possible section of the app and in the app it says I have no notifications, but once I exit, there is that red dot!!!!!!!! Please fix this depop, for my sanity. Also, I wish you could choose to scroll through the items like you could on instagram (you click one picture and when you scroll down it shows the next item instead of “items like this”). Overall, there’s some really awesome stuff on Depop and I’m a regular buyer off it. I’ve never had issues with purchases. I recommend checking it out.

title: Could be Great if Not for The Drop-Shippers
review:
As a vintage and second-hand enthusiast, I really love the concept of Depop. Their Earth Day promotions, in addition to their platform against fast-fashion, really drew me to use the app to buy and sell used clothing. 

Recently, customer service has confirmed that Depop is now allowing drop-shipping, which, in my opinion, has the potential to ruin the app for buyers. A lot of sellers are marketing cheap fast fashion as “handmade” items, and they are drop-shipping from sites like wish and aliexpress for a huge markup. The move to officially allow drop-shipping goes against their mission statement of being anti-fast fashion and pro-sustainability. 

This ruins the experience for buyers, which, in turn, hurts sellers and cheapens the overall experience of using the app. 

I enjoy Depop for many reasons. I like the layout, the simplicity of buying and selling, the option to ship internationally, and I love the community of sustainable fashion enthusiasts. And I understand that not everyone cares about sustainable fashion, but promoting drop-shippers and dishonest sellers hurts everyone that uses this app. If things continue to move in this direction, I may find myself sticking to local thrift stores rather than buying on Depop.
developerResponse: {'id': 8920364, 'body': 'Thanks for this feedback, class of 2015 is the best. We hear you and you’re right - we are all about buying and selling amazing unique things between our amazing community. We do always want buyers to have the best experience, which is why we ask Sellers for original pictures in their listings.\n\nIt looks like there’s been some confusion - We still stan for our love for sustainability and adding new stories for secondhand clothes to tell through the fashion grapevine. This is why we’re looking into how we can make our rules around ‘drop shipping’  clearer for users and want to assure you that we’ve been discussing it in detail this week to ensure we are all doing the best for our Depop community', 'modified': '2019-05-29T14:59:35Z'}

title: Waste of your valuable time
review: I will get straight to the point. I have been using this app for a few months and I can strongly back these issues. My main issue is I was banned when I literally didn't do anything wrong. I am very respectful on the app and trust me, If I knew I did something wrong I would be honest and tell you. But I didn't. And when I emailed them they never got back with me. I even reached back out to them and got nothing. 😒 Also it doesn't help that my last purchase, a $uicideboy$ shirt that was advertised as "brand new" came with holes and stains all on it. I would also like the say that a lot of people you meet on this app have their head up you know where. They think that they are doing you a favor by selling you something and they make sure to treat you with an attitude. And don't get me started on the lowballs. If you made it this far into my review, take it from me, don't bother with this app!

title: My favorite shopping app ever!!
review: This is the perfect app for buying clothes. Everything is so easy to use it makes me question if i’m doing it right lol. I usually never review apps unless they really deserve it and let me tell you this one deserves it. I’ve found super rare items at such a low price. If you like not spending a lot of money but also like shopping this is 100% the app for you. Not only does it have super cute and good quality clothes but some of the prices for items are so good. I could go on for days about how much I love this app but that would get boring fast but the point is if you’re questioning on getting this app just definitely get it is sooo worth it!

title: One of my fave apps
review: I love to shop and am trying to be more environmentally conscious, so naturally I fell in love with depop. The app is very easy to use, but I have a few suggestions that I think would improve it, at least for me. It would be so convenient if we could scroll through a seller’s posts (like Instagram) instead of having to go back and click on a new one.
