Also, if there was a way to sort/filter through your own likes, that would be super helpful too. I also think it would be nice if there was a way to see which products you’ve liked on a seller’s profile. I hope these suggestions help and am looking forward to more updates!
developerResponse: {'id': 12550702, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing these along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-23T16:18:01Z'}

title: Weird changes
review:
I’d like to mention multiple things. 
To start off with, the dna function used to be way better and would continuously change every time i refreshed it and now it doesn’t do that and stays the same no matter how many things i like or save. I used to be able to see clothes just posted and get good deals since I saw it first. 
Second of all, I’ve been selling for a couple of months and have had no issues but now i notice some days I get no likes or barely any on things when i continuously post and then i noticed when I would go to the brand and look at newly listed things, my posts were never there and they don’t show up to other people which makes it extremely hard to sell to people if they can’t even see my item? Why am i basically being shadow banned for no reason?

title: too many karens
review: This app is addicting for when you wanna buy things but if u start selling i would beware. You’re better off selling on other sites with much less restrictions. Depop doesn’t hesitate to take your post down if even one of your hashtags is less relevant than the others. They take down your posts for dropshipping and tags while letting larger accounts do whatever they please. If you gonna have rules at least don’t bend them depending on how many followers or sales a shop has. All these large sale stores on the website sell you trash quality drop shipped items while us smaller sellers get flagged for tags. Literally the worst app ever. Also there are so many Karens on this dumb app which like to slide into ur messages and tell you your tags are wrong and report you for doing nothing. This app is full of Karens the biggest of all being depop itself.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16440798, 'body': "Hi, our community spoke and we listened. In an effort to keep Depop a creative marketplace with quality products we have decided to update our policy on drop shipped items. As of March 1st 2020, we won't allow drop-shipping on-app.

If you can report any accounts that you believe are dropshipping, we’d really appreciate it!
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-06T16:55:41Z'}

title: I used to love this app
review:
It has the cutest clothes and lots of vintage and hard to find stuff but recently as I've been buying more and more from it I'm realizing that getting your items really just comes down to how honest the seller is.

 I've had 2 issues now on depop with people not sending the items I bought (it's been 2 weeks since I bought something and it still hasn't shipped) and being asked for more money outside of the app (which you shouldn't do bc it's scammy) AND I always only buy from sellers who have 5star rating already so at least there's a chance they're honest and have sold before.

I've reported both times which went absolutely nowhere. I just get automated message after automated message and the problem doesn't get fixed. Getting a refund is really down to the seller and like I said if they're not honest, well depop doesn't really care and it'll take 180 days to make a dispute with PayPal.

 I use mercari a lot now and they float your money instead of giving it directly to the sellers PayPal so you don't have to worry that the sellers are taking money and not shipping items or else they don't get that money. They make you rate your seller and that's when the seller gets their money so it's just less scammy overall on that app. Just a better option all around imo.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14114778, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-03-19T10:09:21Z'}

title: Good but extra
review: A ton of trendy items on this app which is great when you are a clothing guru BUT... people take the modeling of the clothes to another level... when you want to see how a shirt looks like and to be shown booty cheeks for no reason . The app has a youth vibe to it . Also prices make it hard to work with sellers and shipping is expensive sometimes . These are second hand items so tell me why people like to charge above retail sale. I have used this app for over 2 years and the prices for clothing have gone up so much it’s ridiculous sellers think they can overcharge buyers. I have noticed a trend of  accounts using items from Chinese websites and tripling the price. Great app though recommend for sure. Just people need to focus on the usage of the app and not treat it like it's instagram.

title: I can’t thank depop ENOUGH
review: I’ve been using Depop for a bit over a year now and I really have nothing but positives to say about this app!! I’ve been using multiple different selling apps in the past 6 years to sell my vintage clothing, and depop takes the cake from my experience so far. Maybe it’s the easy layout that is similar to Instagram, or the way you can easily communicate with buyer/seller, or even the EXCELLENT customer support they provide. As a seller, I’ve come to realize that the more interaction / effort you put into your page is what you get back, and to be patient! Forever grateful for finding this app and being apart of the depop community and also sustainable fashion!
developerResponse: {'id': 3877449, 'body': 'Thank you so much for this review, it means a lot to read of your positive experience with Depop so far. Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-06-18T12:01:20Z'}

title: Depop doesn’t care about most sellers
review: At first depop was so inspiring and motivating for me because I love vintage fashion. I started selling quite a few things which was so awesome I wanted to make it full time! But they changed the algorithm so that my items don’t show up in the search when I refresh them! Instead they show popular sellers and dropshippers. My activity has gone down drastically even though I take great pictures and accurate descriptions. They also let people drop ship items that are not in the sellers possession now. They don’t care about the unethical practices of dropshippers because they make money off of them. These dropshippers literally just put the info of the buyer into a Chinese website and have it sent to them and they lie saying it’s “handmade”. I was selling lots of items before...why doesn’t depop want to make money off of my sales anymore? Not smart for themselves or sellers or buyers
developerResponse:
{'id': 9845166, 'body': "Hey hey! Thanks for your honest feedback on drop shipping. We aim to encourage all levels of creativity on Depop and therefore feature different Sellers on our Explore Page. 

To help amp up the visibility of your shop, check out our Sellers Handbook for some great tips: https://sellers.depop.com/SellerHandbook_UK_18.12.18-1.pdf

Let's turn this around for you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-25T13:11:41Z'}

title: Fast Fashion who?
review:
I used to shop primarily at UO, H&M, and Nasty Gal. After discovering Depop, I've found better quality clothes for cheaper, or the same items I'd fawn for at these Fast Fashion brands for a fraction of the cost. 
I love that I get to see clothes on women who look like me before buying it from them. 
I love how personal it feels to buy from these vendors because they take good care of their shipping, products, and often offer discounts if you bundle. I also like that a lot of the girls I've purchased from put goodies in their packages (like scrunchies and pins!) 

This is a great option for broke college students like me, or anyone who wants to depart their toxic relationship with unethical retailers.

title: Terrible Customer Support
review: I have never used an app or dealt with a company with such a horrible customer service/support. Team Depop offers absolutely no help for technical issues with their app. My account was deleted, and I could not even create a new account because I kept getting some bizarre error. I tried different phone numbers and e-mails and usernames. I contacted support over four times in the past year trying to get help solving the error, and I was told to log into my account.... but I have NO ACCOUNT! I know multiple other people who have had issues regarding depop overcharging them for shipping, taking more money than just their fee, and technical problems with their app. They all had the same problem with customer support. I am so confused on why this app is so highly rated. In the short time I have had experience with them, I have had nothing but problems. So confused.

title: Depop, listen to your customers
review: Depop keeps adding new features without fixing the essentials and looking at what people are really asking for. We want excessive tagging and spamming to be fixed, dropshippers that sell crap of AliExpress and sweatshops to be band. But they don’t because the dropshippers are making them money but it completely contradicts the entire meaning of reselling. They send out contradicting messages like the fact that they said the algorithm changed and then when everybody complained about the algorithm changing they stated that there were no changes even though there’s email evidence to prove it. I think a really really big thing they need is a customer service option. Whatever they have now is obviously not working, Unless you like automated bots and no one that actually cares about your problems or your money and time.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18128976, 'body': "Hey Gandalf,

Our community spoke and we listened. In an effort to keep Depop a creative marketplace with quality products we decided to update our policy on drop shipped items. As of March 1st 2020, we don't allow drop-shipping on-app.

If you can report any accounts that you believe are drop-shipping, we’d really appreciate it!

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-27T19:27:12Z'}

title: HATE THE NEW FORMAT
review: i used to love depop and have bought multiple things from there and loved almost all of them, but i recently updated the app and i HATE the new format. i hate the new “DNA” section because literally NONE of it is similar to the things that u actually like and favorite. i miss when it just showed the one of stuff that was similar to what you have liked and favorited because it was more accurate. now i can find literally nothing because the “DNA” section literally just gives you general categories to choose from but it takes literally no info from the things that you actually like and favorite. I normally like y2k inspired clothes so i picked the y2k category but literally NONE of it is similar to the stuff that i actually like so i really don’t know what us going on. DEPOP PLEASE CHANGE IT BACK TO THE OLD FORMAT OR ELSE I WILL LITERALLY HAVE TO DELETE THE APP BECAUSE I AM FINDING NOTHING.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18548504, 'body': "Hey there,

 Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-18T16:35:42Z'}

title: Hated Selling on Depop
review:
So I had a good rare hoodie to sell and I didn’t want to sell it to friends or on my other selling apps so I could try to get it for it’s worth. I got depop because people sell things like that there the most. I wanted it for $60, a customer and I came to an agreement on $50... i ended up with less than $30!!!
Little did I know, you have to connect paypal to it. Depop takes out their fee for selling on their app which is a hefty percent. Paypal takes out a fee as well. AND even though I had the shipping (which I much rather sell local and in person but had no option) marked as customer pays, I payed $13 TWICE for shipping because my shipping label wouldn’t load. 
Then I had to update the shipping tracking which was impossible when you bought two labels and couldn’t find which was the one you used on the box. 
And now here I am with no hoodie because it’s with the buyer and NO MONEY. because paypal has my money on hold. Which apparently happens when you’re new to paypal or the shipping needs updating. Then I tried a million ways to update it and void shipping labels. Paypal says it needs a day after the package arrives to lift the hold...
BEEN ABOUT TWO WEEKS! 
So pretty much... I sold a hoodie, gave paypal and depop money, and paid $26 on shipping... and I’ve made 0....
developerResponse:
{'id': 17654851, 'body': "
Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-02T17:55:29Z'}

title: selling platform
review: I’ve been a seller and buyer on Depop for almost three months now and I have to say it’s one of the best selling platforms I’ve ever used. You’re earnings are directly deposited into your PayPal account and the platform is easy and simple. Would definitely recommend to anybody just starting out as a seller. I feel the only downside is slow sales though I understand that this comes with any selling platform I feel frustrated that after being very active and putting up a variety of items with reasonable prices I’ve only sold two items in the span of three months. Again it is still a great selling platform in itself.
developerResponse: {'id': 6668483, 'body': "Hey Diana, such great lvoe coming from your feedback. We really appreciate it and we're happy to have you part of our community.\n\nKisses, Depop", 'modified': '2019-01-04T04:08:29Z'}

title: Worst selling app ever.
review:
Worst app for selling ever. Outrageous fees. Unfair treatment. They will remove listings for no reason and then provide 0 user support. No response to emails. Only use it if you wanna sell your dirty used stuff for a couple of bucks. But if you sell unique hand made items, then there are so many better options for selling. Use Etsy instead. 
Update - they are still ignoring my emails asking to close my account. Do not sign up to this app because It’s impossible to delete the account. And mister developer, thanks for your response trying to explain your outrageous fees, but no thanks, my beautiful items are selling very well on Etsy where I’ve been selling for years, been treated like a valued seller, have sold thousands of items, my listings were never removed, never had any issues like I’ve had on your app. all I ask is that you stop ignoring my emails and CLOSE MY ACCOUNT ASAP.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14659458, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-04-14T12:45:33Z'}

title: “Buyer Protection” is a scam!!!
review: When I had an issue with a seller not shipping my item, I went to Depop to help since I followed the guidelines and purchased within the app, and I -thought- I would be protected with their “buyer protection” policy. I explained my case and sent in my dispute. Immediately I’m sent an automated response telling me to go to PayPal to do it. Odd. This app takes ZERO responsibility to protect its users and as a joke keeps emphasizing that it “has your back” or whatever, but that is CLEARLY not the case. They don’t do their job. They push the refunding responsibilities to a reliable and renowned company, so they don’t have to do a thing. It’s hilarious because they seem very diligent with striking accounts of users who attempt to make money transactions outside of the app. When it comes to making money, they’ll do something, but when it comes to helping you with your money, I doubt they’ll care. How sad.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12038933, 'body': "Hey. We're always here to support our users, regardless of whether a payment was made through PayPal or not.

When you pay through PayPal, they receive, process and distribute the payment. We never touch the funds. For this reason, PayPal have to be the ones to adjudicate on disputes. If at any stage through the process you need a hand, always drop us a message, we're here.

With regards to out of app payments, these present a real safety risk for buyers. This is why we don't allow them, and remove people who attempt to do so repeatedly. These decisions are made with the safety of our Community in mind.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-25T12:49:36Z'}

title: sustainability
review:
very important app! it helps to not only make some money but also encourages people to shop sustainably. I have found some of my favorite clothes on here and I can buy them with a clean conscience knowing that they didn’t come straight from a factory. it’s such an important cause that everyone should be putting some effort into—not to mention there are such great styles!! 

the app’s payment and buying system is very safe and trustworthy. sometimes the app seems less user friendly, but it’s not unbearable. once you get the hang of it, it works great. I’ve used this app for three years and never had issues with depop or the app itself.

title: Starting to go downhill
review: So I’ve been using this app for probably two years now. I had nothing but good things to say about it, but now I’m just frustrated. I have nothing but 5 star reviews, but Depop recently started picking on me and deleting my Makeup posts. Used or sanitized makeup is no longer being allowed to posted or sold. Or so they say, cause I see a crap load of posts with highly used makeup that they don’t delete. Makes me feel picked on and it’s not fair. Makeup was one of the things that I sold the quickest on there and now I’ve had to switch to Mercari and start all over. It’s very frustrating and upsetting. As buyers, they should have the choice whether they want to buy used makeup or not. I feel like I work so hard on depop just to be punished while others aren’t.

title: i don’t know why i still use it...
review: Sadly, a user on here decided to scam me. At the moment, paypal wasn’t working correctly but I needed to buy it that day (the purchase was supposed to be a gift). So anyways I decided to go through with my purchase offline on paypal as a “guest”. I bought a bundle (a sweater and a top and a Tyler the Creator vinyl) and the user listed it all together. The following week or two after I received the sweater and top and I had asked the user when they thought the vinyl will come in, all they said was “sorry I’m not sure they only gave me one tracking number” after they said this I knew something was wrong. A month passed and still nothing. Now it’s been 9 weeks since my purchase and I’ve contacted Depop and the seller and no response what so ever.
developerResponse: {'id': 16190631, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. \n\nRead more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.", 'modified': '2020-06-24T10:17:16Z'}

title: Depop took $4.50 out of my paypal as an automatic payment, terrible customer service
review: I made my first sale but couldn’t access the shipping label until my paypal was verified. I did everything I needed to verify myself, yet I still couldn’t access the shipping label. The money was also pending. The next morning, I get an email saying that depop has taken a fee out of my account. Sure enough, $4.50 was missing. I email them numerous times asking about it, saying that I would like my money back. I refunded my customer as well, but the only response I get is from a bot asking to be more specific when I’m as specific as can be. No one has contacted me and it’s been hours. If someone from depop is reading this, please email me immediately so I can get my money back, I didn’t know I would have to pay automatic fees and I don’t want to use your app if that’s the case.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14869818, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience, it sounds like you selected a shipping label, which is why you were initially charged $4.50

See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-04-23T17:08:40Z'}

title: avid depop user
review: I’m literally obsessed with this app and use it every single day. I’ve sold and bought hundreds of dollars of items from here and not all were successful but enough were so that I still love using this platform. Recently there was an update that changed the format of the search page; Now when scrolling through search items, there’s a little tab at the bottom of the screen that says “filter | sort” and it bobs out of the way when scrolling, but comes back into view if you stop scrolling. This is extremely annoying please take that tab away and make the filter button the icon at the top right corner like it used to be PLEASEE. It’s literally effecting my enjoyment of using this app. Don’t fix it if it isn’t broken.
developerResponse: {'id': 11104821, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team. \n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-07T16:22:14Z'}

title: Thanks Depop! Love this App
review:
Hi Depop!
Love the App! Is it just me or did the option to swap the order of pictures go away? Please bring it back please! Also, when I edit an item I would like it to go to the top of my listing like it do before. Should I still use the # symbol for listings? Omg where did the option to add filters go? I live in Chicago without access to sunny days 10 months out of the year, so those filters helped me show items in their true color. I’m still saving up to purchase a light kit in the meantime. 😆 Also fix my feed! I keep he the same listings every 30-45 mins. 
April 2, 2018, meela

Like an IG cool yard sale. Sell all your previously loved closet items for direct deposit 🏦 or trades! Thanks Depop for giving new adventures for all these things I don’t wear anymore! 😁💗🤑💁🏽 ~Meela312

title: Issues With App & Notifications
review: I like selling on depop but their app has major issues and has for a long time. The main one being that no matter what you do as far as turning on notifications, the app does not send a notification when something is sold, or when a customer messages you. This is especially problematic because depop is not my full time job and I am not checking the app constantly. Since the app literally won’t send notifications, this has caused issues with customers thinking I’m ignoring them, when really I just am not being told that I have a message. I rely on notifications to know when I need to reply to someone or when to send out an item. This has been an issue since I first got the app around 2014. My app is always up to date, and I have a new iPhone, but yet not notifications. It is extremely annoying and frustrating.

title: In constant need of improvement
review: As much as I WANT to love this app, I find there to be consistent problems that seem to be neglected or go unnoticed. Whether it be glitches in the fluidity of something as simple as scrolling through the feed of those who you follow or tuning in for a notification you’ve received- there’s always a glitch that prevents the ability to smoothly catch up with the simplistic navigation. No matter how many ‘updates’. It’s unfortunate, being as how the seller fees (which effect the buyer, as the sellers hike the prices to make up for the fees that Depop charge) should include the ease of the buyers’ experience. This site/app has a lot of potential, if they could just get their act together and make the cost/navigation/incentive an ease and make it work properly.
developerResponse: {'id': 2620417, 'body': "Hey _kataclysm - we want you to love us too! Making the app run faster and smoother is always at the forefront of our priorities - thank you for this feedback and we hope you'll notice a difference soon. Thanks - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-02-19T16:43:12Z'}

title: Depop and PayPal percentages
review:
Hi everyone, I was having a huge problem with getting any money at all since Depop and PayPal both get a percentage from my sale. If anyone else has this problem I’d try shipping without using Depop and using your own shipping when posting your item. Here’s how they do things here in Depop (this is from an email i received from them) 
**Listing items for sale on Depop is completely free but we apply a 10% commission fee on all items sold. This could show up on your PayPal activity as an "advertising" fee but this is just how PayPal have chosen to word it. We won’t ever take a fee for listing.

Be aware that a PayPal transaction fee also applies to all successful sales which is 2.9% + $0.30 PayPal commission. These fees are automatically deducted before the payment reaches your PayPal account.

If the fee is higher than 10%, this is likely because you selected Ship With Depop. When you Ship With Depop, as a seller you’ll be charged the cost of the shipping label and the Depop fee in one go, these deductions wont show up separately on your PayPal activity page. This is the case even if the buyer pays for shipping as they pay you the additional amount for shipping, but we then take the payment for the shipping label from you.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17841009, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-12T19:50:01Z'}

title: Being cheated out of $ as a seller
review:
I am so upset and feel cheated out of my money.
I ended up having to reship a package that was returned to me because the packaging needed to be changed. So I dropped it back off at the USPS office, however, I didn’t get an updated tracking for my package as it only says it’s been returned to me. This is not true as I have sent it back out multiple days ago. It should be delivered by now but the buyer has still not responded and tracking still does not reflect the fact that I reshipped it out. I’ve contacted depop 3 times now and still NO RESPONSE about my payment. If the buyer doesn’t respond she is trying to keep the product without paying!!! The PayPal money STILL has not been released, I paid depop the fee, AND the buyer has my product! I am the LOSER and will not be using depop again if this is not taken care of.
Do not use if you don’t want to be scammed.

title: Dont waste your time
review: I loved the app when i was just a buyer. I decided to sell a shirt on there and depop recommended i do their shipping option because it guaranteed the item would sell better if i did. So a couple days later the item sold and depop told me i needed to verify info with paypal before they would provide me the shipping label. I verified the info with paypal and paypal told me im all set on their end for depop. 7 days later depop still wont provide me the shipping label they owe me. They took money for the shipping label on top of the 10% they take for every item. If you’re just buying clothes of there youre good and maybe if you just dont fall for depops shipping scam you would be fine but im honestly going to refund the customer that bought the item and delete the app. They refuse to help me and paypal wont do anything either. You’re better off only being a buyer.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17559303, 'body': "Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-28T10:14:42Z'}

title: Ridiculous App, Terrible Customer Service
review: I had a user purchase an item without reading the description, then asked for a refund. When I issued the refund, the full refund amount was taken FROM MY BANK ACCOUNT and Depop has refused to reissue the $20 in fees associated with “advertising” despite me not even selling the item and the mistaken being on the part of the user who has gotten a full refund. I have since exchanged 14 emails with customer service where they have given me the run-around and told me to “close the dispute then the money will be returned” (meaning that if my money is never refunded I won’t be able to escalate the matter, and since it’s been two weeks already I have my doubts!) I’ve been a seller for over three years but this is ridiculous and I will be closing my account. Use Poshmark if you want to sell your clothes, they have an actual helpline that responds to you.
developerResponse: {'id': 12746212, 'body': "Hey. All we need to see to issue a fee refund is that the refund has been processed. If you send us proof of this through, we're always happy to refund your fee.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-01-06T11:18:39Z'}

title: Improvements
review: I love depop so much, I’ve been using it for a long time now and so many of my clothing items are from there. I have been noticing though that there have been some issues with the app. So just today I was scrolling through my for you page when I get glitched out and it takes me to the login page. I was very confused but I filled out the information and it let me back in and so I thought it was all good until it kicked me out again. So I signed back in and it says that this option is not available. I’ve tried updating the app, redownloading the app, and changing my password but nothing is working! Please help.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12380141, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for sharing this. We're sorry things aren't going to plan, it sounds like some unusual behaviour.

Could you please email us at support@depop.com with the subject line saying 'Login Issues'. Please remember to include your:
 
- Username
- Email address
- Phone number
- Phone operating system, example iOS 13
 
Let’s get this sorted,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-13T11:43:26Z'}

title: Lots of scammers, BEWARE!
review: This app is perfect if you like to get scammed. I got scammed twice on this app and customer service was no help whatsoever. They just sent me an automated email basically saying that it’s not their problem and to contact either the seller to discuss your options, or contact PayPal to open a case. Never once did I actually speak to anyone, and the seller never got reprimanded or faced any penalties. Definitely be wary of buying  and selling off of here, because the buyers are just as bad as the sellers. You will get a lot of lowballers as a seller (I used to be a seller first, then a buyer), and people will leave you negative feedback for the most trivial things. Please be mindful!
developerResponse: {'id': 7401361, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for the feedback, we're sorry to hear about the awful experience you're having with us - that's definitely not our goal. Please do know that whenever a report has been send to us regarding a transaction gone wrong, the account of the user will always be investigated. We also advise to go to PayPal to open a dispute as this is the process in order to start a refund - should this be somewhat confusing, don't fret! Our support team is always there to help you out. \n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-21T14:02:15Z'}

title: Horrible. Mercari, Poshmark& OfferUp better options!
review:
Really wanted to like this app. Sold first item 2 wks ago that just so happened to be broken when I went to ship it the next day. Hit up the “Help” section on the app about how to handle refunds-said to log into PayPal & process it that way...so I did. Almost 2 WEEKS ago. Get an email today that a dispute was closed in buyers favor since depop received no info on refund or postage tracking. ARE YOU KIDDING?! I did not get one message from depop, either on the app or an email (or a carrier pigeon for that matter!) about an issue or a dispute! I handled the refund EXACTLY as the site said to do so. The email I received tonight also included this:
“If this happens again, we may need to remove you from Depop temporarily to give you a chance to resolve things.” 

Needless to say, I will be removing myself from depop PERMANENTLY because this site is a joke! Don’t waste your time.

title: Disappointed
review: I am a longtime Depop user with 80 items sold and over 150 purchased, but I am extremely disappointed in their new drop shipping policy and will probably switch to another reselling app. Dropshipping is a practice in which sellers list items being sold on AliExpress or similar sites for 3-4x their actual price, and when Depop users buy them, the seller orders the item off AliExpress and inputs the sellers address as the shipping destination. The item is never actually in the seller’s possession. I, along with many others, have enjoyed using Depop because it is a way to escape the exploitation of fast fashion and support small businesses, and this new approval of dropshippers goes against all of that. Dropshipping exploits the buyer and most of all the factory workers who make the clothes in horrible working conditions. Sad to say that I am leaving Depop, I just can’t morally continue to give them my money.

title: Nothing but great!
review:
As a huge thrifter, I love this app because I have found things for my closet that I have been ACTUALLY looking for. I have no complaints for this app, there is a huge variety of sellers and sales always going on! I never had any shipping issues with different sellers, and the fact that if you purchase through this app it provides buyers protection. I have probably purchased 6 items from this app and I’ve gotten everything all in one piece and within a reasonable time! I’ve recommended this app to multiple people! 

Note: 
If you’re skeptical before purchasing an item, I would review the seller’s reviews then go from there.

title: Great app, except they take a big cut of your sales.
review: I love selling all the stuff I don’t need that is in good to great condition. This app however, takes a big piece of your sale, which I do not find fair. Yes, they are providing a free platform for you to sell your stuff within your country or possibly internationally (may be an off-app transaction) but, that does not mean you scam your users into thinking you only take 10% of their sales, when in reality, Depop takes more. I sold something for $50 the other day and received $42. 10% of 50 is $45. What happened to my other three dollars worth of profit? Depop needs to clear up their waters when it comes to fees. ALSO, I have never been featured on the explore page. Hmph! Lol. They need to feature small accounts as well! Total BS.

title: Get Poshmark Instead
review: I use both Depop and Poshmark, and if I had the choice I would have never even bothered with depop. While I have had a few good transactions (both buying & selling) I recently sold an item where I was honest to the buyer and told them I did not purchase shipping with tracking. Tracking is not required on the app and shipping is bought by the seller. The buyer then opened a dispute with me and claimed she never received her package. When Depop contacted me and I expressed my concerns about not doing anything wrong & not having protection.. they pretty much said, “Sorry get tracking next time then”. Poshmark includes a tracked shipping label when you sell an item - SO much easier and does not cost the buyer anything. GET POSHMARK INSTEAD!! Also, Depop does not require buyers to allow refunds which I think is funny because if a dispute is opened then you have no choice. Now I have no item and no money.
developerResponse: {'id': 3224697, 'body': "Hey there - could you please update this review to include your Depop @username so we can better understand what's happened here, and whether there is anyway that we can still help. Many thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-23T11:24:32Z'}

title: A little too simple
review: I love depop & the depop community! But I really REALLY REALLY wish they would let us add more photos already! Sellers and buyers would totally love having more photos available for their listings. Why is it only limited to 4? We would seriously benefit from an extra photo or two. It would also be awesome if it had more categories for items or subcategories and some more brands could be included in there as well. It’s almost like the app is a little bit too simple for me. Besides that, I love everything else about it- it’s incredibly easy to ship and buy things and interact with people. Really cool app just needs a bigger upgrade.

title: favorite app!
review: This app is great! they (the owners) offer free shipping an other deals every so often at no expense to the shop owner. awesome. the only things i don’t like so much with this, is that the search feature searches by keyword and not the actual picture. so if i were to search for “fanny pack” and a bunch of pins come up, it’s because people used #fannypack on a listing for their pins.  :/ also, the explore page has items listed that have already been sold! it’s so upsetting to click on an item that i like on the explore page only to be greeted by that yellow rectangle boasting the word SOLD. other than those two, pretty minor points, this app is like an online thrift store mixed with Etsy. love it.
developerResponse: {'id': 7357793, 'body': "Hey Kenzy, we totally hear you on the tagging. We have a team targetting this but if you do find any listings doing this, we would really appreciate it if you report this to us so out team can get right on it.  We've also received feedback regarding the sold item and we totally hear you. I will make sure to pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-19T06:14:38Z'}

title: My favorite market place
review: I’ve used this app over the last 5 years for buying vintage and recently started selling. Compared to other apps and websites I find this one to be the best for me. Even though you can only reach customer service through email they paid attention and acted fast in a way that made me feel very comfortable and safe. I love the fact that my payment from sells goes directly to PayPal as soon as the item is purchased instead of having to wait for the buyer to receive the item and having to transfer the payment to my bank like Poshmark and Mercari. Keep it up Depop, I love this community!!
developerResponse: {'id': 16731369, 'body': "We're glad you love Depop as much as we do.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-19T22:14:03Z'}

title: S C A M
review: I used to love this app! Have bought tons of stuff and sold a bunch of things as well. The more I use it the more I realize it can be a huge scam! DEPOP support is a joke. You almost never get your money back. I’ve contacted them so many times and they basically say there’s nothing they can do about it and to go through PayPal. Its an automated message, you never get to talk to a real person. It’s funny because DEPOP gets a cut so once you pay for it, they couldn’t care less about you getting your money back. If you are so fortunate to get your money back it takes about a month! Ridiculous! A lot of sellers will delete their accounts or block you right after you pay for an item. I believe that the seller shouldn’t receive the money until AFTER the item is delivered - just like Poshmark. If you want to sell your items or buy items, use Poshmark. It is far more safer.
developerResponse: {'id': 3052749, 'body': "Hey there - please rest assured that we are humans on the other side of the email(s) you're receiving! As you know, PayPal is our payment provider which means that if something goes wrong they'll be handling the dispute resolution process for you. If we ever find that they've judged a dispute in a way that we deem to be unfair, then Depop Protection steps in to cover those gaps. We hope this clears a couple of things up for you. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-06T15:06:01Z'}

title: Around 4 years using this app
review: I love this app a lot! Lots of great qualities such as how easy it is to find the item your looking for, extremely kind people (for the most part), and It’s really easy to sell things. But what it lacks is that they charge you a decent chunk when you sell things making it not always worth your while to sell unless you’re a constant seller who has post office envelops in bulk. Another thing that I notified is that people on Depop tend to sell their items for a lot more (probably because of the tax they put on the seller) compared to Poshmark. I would love if they added the bargain tool “offer” where you can go back and forth on the price. In the end I’m still using this app after 4ish years so that means something.
developerResponse: {'id': 7620938, 'body': 'Hi there, that\'s an amazing time with us! This is why we love our community!! We hear you and the "offer" feature could be a great addition to the platform. I will make sure to pass this on to the team for ya.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-03-07T12:24:09Z'}

title: Not very good
review: Change the colors scheme and the logo it’s hideous. This app needs a lot of work still but it is an ok app to sell on not sure about buying never bought anything from this app. There needs to be a way where you can advertise everyones items on the home page or the explore section not just certain people or profiles. This app only focuses on certain profile pages and certain items that I think isnt good for example the app will advertise 5 different items from the same closet or page. I don’t understand why it is set up this way but I think you guys need to focus on other people as well and show new listings in the home page so people can discover new items and profiles but putting the focus on high profile pages with people who already have a high number of sales and followers isnt fair. Work on this please thank you for your time.
developerResponse: {'id': 3458293, 'body': "Hey there! We're working towards making the Explore page a better way for users to see the real cross-range of great sellers we have on the app. We hope you'll notice improvements in the not-so-distant future. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-14T11:15:55Z'}

title: I buy and sell but...
review: Most of the items I have bought have not been as described. And I hate that I have to reach out to PayPal. For example: a dress did not look like the pictures at all and had holes, and one dress was gemmed with rips and holes as well, when reaching out to the sellers they did not care so I had to reach out to PayPal and that’s just embarrassing because it made me send the items back to them in order to get a refund (the process was also really long for returning) it’s a hit or miss but I wish the sellers posted accurate images and descriptions of the items they are selling. Another recent item I bought also did not look like the image (which was a necklace) instead I received a complete different variation of the necklace
developerResponse:
{'id': 18883570, 'body': "Hey there,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-03T22:57:58Z'}

title: Dear developers—
review: I very much enjoy using the app; it’s a quick way to buy and sell things that I’m interested in without having to search the web for hours in order to find them (a lot of the popular clothing items on here are very niche). The only thing I would change about the app is that I wish you could customize the “For You” section results a bit more towards what you’re looking for; I don’t really use it much because most of the things being recommended to me are a size small or medium (I’m a 2XL). Anyway, other than that I would highly recommend the app; it’s like an online thrift shop (great for introverts who don’t like leaving the comfort of their house).

title: App gets increasingly worse by the day
review: I've used depop for years now, and I've bought and sold so much during that time. I've probably spent over $1000 on clothes over the years. Everyday this app seems to get worse -- it's so glitchy to the point that it's pretty much unusable now. Never in my life have I written an app review but I am just so frustrated in the UX of this god awful app. Depop, I want to love you. Stop being actual garbage. I'm not even going to mention the huge number scammers, drop shippers, sellers who constantly violate the "rules" yet never get banned, insanely expensive shipping, huge seller fees, etc. Just fix the glitches with the app, for the love of god I beg you. Depop has the best UI of any re-selling app and I don't want to go elsewhere but I literally can't even get the app to load anymore and it freezes constantly. Developers, if you're listening... Do better.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14083525, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-03-18T10:09:10Z'}

title: Sellers are not responsible after shipping
review: I bought a human hair wig that came completely destroyed and the seller said they are not responsible for the product after shipping. The wig had pink stains on it, so it clearly did NOT happen through shipping it had to have been shipped that way after purchasing. I am very disappointed and unmotivated to shop on depop again. I was already demotivated as it’s increasingly become more expensive and cheaper quality ($18-$35 second hand shirts!) and it’s due to the small businesses trying to take over the app, pushing out individual sellers. Individual sellers negotiate the best prices and send the best gifts or notes in their beautiful packaging. The past few months I haven’t seen any of that and it’s probably due to small sellers also being demotivated to sell because of big companies. It’s starting to feel a lot like an overpriced Wish app now
developerResponse:
{'id': 12704288, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-01-03T10:14:54Z'}

title: great sellers & items-but the app itself could use some updates
review: I love this app a lot. HOWEVER. It is extremely frustrating that on the explore page super cute items are listed that are already sold. i’m constantly getting excited when i see something and then become so dissapointed when i click on it to see that it’s sold. Listings should disappear from the explore page once they’ve sold. Also, I think the app should have the swipe feature like instagram and many other apps do so that you can swipe away the item after you click on it for easier browsing instead of having to hit the back error. Other than that the app is 👌🏻
developerResponse: {'id': 8502832, 'body': "We're enjoying your feedback 👌🏻.  We do understand how frustrating it can be if you see a cute item and it turns out to be sold! I'll make sure to pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-04T05:58:44Z'}

title: Horrible customer service
review: Depops a customer service is horrendous. A while back I had issues where I was unable to make purchases or sell because “my paypal wasn’t verified” even though it was. I contact depop multiple times to no avail. Recently, I wanted to make a new depop account. They require you to use your phone number however every time I input my number it wouldn’t allow me to proceed. I emailed depop again and again asking for assistance and every time a bot responded saying “sorry for your transaction error, contact PayPal” but my issue has nothing to do transactions. Absolutely Awful. Depop needs to stop being so greedy and actually hire some costumer service reps instead of copping out with less than capable bots. With the amount of money they take from each sale, they should be able to afford it. Capitalist Pigs.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18004671, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this. If you still want to get on the app you can submit a request via this link we'll help you get onto Depop ASAP.

https://bit.ly/depopsignup

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-21T16:20:44Z'}

title: Improvements
review: This app is amazing if you are a buyer! So many nice sellers and vintage chic things to chose from. If you’re a seller, things are a little different. The first sale I had was simple! Payment came right through and i was able to easily obtain their address and email for shipping purposes but now, it’s difficult. I have to wait days for my payment to be received, meaning I can’t send out the packages until this happens. I hate having to wait to send out packages when I know with Venmo I can obtain the money instantly and not have to wait for it to be cleared. I wish we were able to chose what payment system we wanted our buyers to go through. I don’t understand why depop cannot set up through Venmo, Cashapp or other payment apps that are much easier. Just something to consider

title: Great App But Needs Improvement For Business Minded Sellers!
review:
I have been selling on Depop since I was in high school and it has always been super beneficial to me in getting some extra cash and I’m now selling much more seriously. I really enjoy that I’m my own boss and the Depop fees don’t matter much to me because it is a proxy.

What I think should definitely change is when using the the premade shipping labels through the app, Paypal takes it’s fees from the amount sold PLUS the price of the shipping label because that hasn’t been worked out. It’s incredibly frustrating because I’m just losing money off of that.

Otherwise the app is really great.
developerResponse: {'id': 3224779, 'body': 'Hey there! Thanks for letting us know your thoughts on the app. Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-23T11:34:01Z'}

title: great deals, but buyers beware
review:
I have to say that I loved this app, and you really can find cute vintage deals for reasonable prices, but the main issues I find are when it comes to buying. 
I understand depop can’t control unreliable sellers not shipping items, but it seems they do absolutely nothing to stop these accounts (especially ones I read through multiple reviews that scam many buyers). It’s gotten to the point where I’m hesitant to buy anything from this app cause it’s a 50/50 chance I’ll even receive the item. But while the customer service reps I’ve emailed are always nice & professional, any attempt to report these incidents seems to go unnoticed and has me placed on the “we’ll get back to you as quick as possible” list.

title: it’s great but it’s time to stop classifying by gender
review: Depop is one of my fav places to get new clothes, you can find anything and you’re not participating in creating more waste. My only issue is how they are classifying skirts dresses and more feminine clothing as womenswear. Honestly i’m surprised that any stores are still doing that what with all the fluidity, especially in a community like the depop community which encourages breaking fashion boundaries. I just think it’s time to move on. Put skirts in the skirt category and dresses in the dress category and pants in the pants category but we should move away from gendering them. Depop is the perfect place to start this movement.

title: Please add these things
review: Make a story option for sellers maybe you get it when you receive so many reviews or something, this feature would be really useful in being able to engage with customers and run different sales and giveaways. A feature that gives the shoppers the ability to offer on products while making a payment commitment would be awesome as well, making it to were if an offer of at least 60% of the original total is made and excepted by the seller the buyer is then obligated to pay. I really do love Depop and hope that my requests and comments won’t go unheard and would like to become a beta tester if that is a thing.

title: Could be better compared to competitors
review: I wish it was easier to ship and get paid. Other selling apps tell you how much you would make (after fees) while you are posting the listing. Depop doesn’t do that. I don’t like how they don’t send you an automatic label. When someone buys an item from you, you use the money to purchase shipping. Would be so much easier if the app would directly send a label to your email like other selling apps. It’s always hard to know how much you’re actually going to make until it sells AND ships. Plus they only have PayPal as a purchasing/selling option. I personally don’t like using PayPal. It took me awhile to figure out the app. Now that I know how to use it, I don’t really like it compared to other apps.

title: Unfair algorithm- don’t waste your time!!!
review: Unless your depop famous already before this mess, don’t waste your time. I used to get sales. Being a small shop, depop used to be the only place I could receive sales and it was done fairly. But since the algorithm changed only BIG shops are now noticed in searches (as if they need more help getting sales- give me a break) and nothing of mine gets sold because I’m not depop famous: It’s  waste of time for people who are just starting out and are new- or if you have a small shop like me forget about it unless you already have 10k followers from before the algorithm was screwed with. I got sales so fast when I started with 0 followers back a few years ago. 400 followers later and a changed algorithm- zero sales for the past couple years. I’m going to be moving to a different selling app that’s for sure.
developerResponse: {'id': 7357483, 'body': "Hey Noelle, we're sorry to hear that you're not having the best experience with us. We love all of our users and our goals is just to have everyone thrive and create their empires. I will make sure to pass the algorithm feedback to our team as this is important to us.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-19T05:38:06Z'}

title: FAVORITISM
review: Depop cares way too much about their aesthetic rather than the actual important issues to run a selling app. It's nearly impossible to get a hold of customer service. No phone number to call. You can email, but when and IF they reply it's always copy and paste scripted. I'm sick of seeing them making Instagram posts and changing the dang font, fix the real issues! Give me a number to call, keep the app from crashing, let me dispute a bad review if it wasn't my fault at all, get rid of all of these people using stock photos! I'm sick of seeing stock photos in the explore page. I'm sick of the same people getting on the explore with 3-5 items EVERY DAY.  Stop featuring the same people. Dankgirl is in the explore page everyday!!!! Not even exaggerating. It’s enough already. That ain’t fair. Please fix the real issues at hand, depop! Your Instagram followers can wait.
developerResponse: {'id': 1374433, 'body': "Hey, thank you for the feedback. We hear you loud and clear and we are going to be constantly improving the app to make the experience better. If you have a specific issue that you feel wasn't dealt with by community support please feel free to drop us a message at productfeedback@depop.com and we will take a look into it for you. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-09-27T13:26:48Z'}

title: Not a reliable/safe app to buy from
review: There’s way too many scammers or inactive sellers on this app. Poshmark is definitely a lot safer to buy from and I’ve never had issues from that app. Depop may guarantee safety when purchasing because it is through paypal, but it is difficult to dispute any transactions right now due to the pandemic. You cannot call paypal for help due to covid and messaging them would just result in a repeated automated message every time. Depop does not do anything about this and claim that this is an issue between the buyer and paypal, but they should have an easier resolution to items that are never shipped. Poshmark allows buyers to hold onto their money until they get their item so scams are less likely to happen. I even had to make a twitter account just to DM PayPal customer service and still nothing. It shouldn’t be this difficult.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17719713, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-09-06T22:39:53Z'}

title: Great for buying, not selling.
review: I’ve bought multiple things from sellers on depop and it’s great! I’ve decided to put up a few items of mine to sell of my own. I spent hours washing, drying, folding, and taking nice pictures to put up on the site. I had gotten a couple orders but I have had trouble with the shipping labels as I selected to ship with Depop. It said I needed to verify my paypal account and I went through all the steps 5x, deleted and redownloaded both apps, disconnected and reconnected my paypal, and everything seems to be up to date and correct. I have made a report to depop 4 days ago and I have yet to hear back from them at all. I will have to use my own money to ship out these orders since depop can’t get their stuff together and fix their issue. Never selling with them again.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15577511, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop

", 'modified': '2020-05-26T15:58:37Z'}

title: I love it but it doesn’t work on me a lot and having issues with it
review: I love love depop I found clothes I’ve been wanting to dress like and some good deals but I hate how some people overprice items.. when they got it from a thrift store and resell them to a hire price... I also hate how there’s rude people on there and would block you for no reason 😭 but hey that’s every where online. But the app itself is good except it’s annoying how I have to keep unstalling depop because it would not let me go in the app and it exit me out where I have to delete depop and then get the app again. The helpers on depop are very nice tho and good communication.

title: The scams and PayPal
review: Depop is pretty cool but the amount of scamming that happens in this app is ridiculous. I know scamming happens no matter where you are but I have never seen so much in one app. Idk if you guys can do anything about it to help reduce the amount of scamming that happens but please try because it’s so risky. And about PayPal...it was a bit difficult for me and a huge learning curve. I have never used PayPal before and I just simply want to have my money to go straight into my account and not have so many steps to connect my PayPal and put the money in my account, sorry if it sounds like I’m whining I just feel like it should be much easier. Oh and that glitch with the search page scrolling back up at the top needs to be fixed too.

title: Pretty great app! Just a few problems..
review: This app is great for safely buying and selling used items. One problem I’ve had, though, is with shipping. You can choose to ship with Depop and have the customer pay for shipping, or you can choose to ship on your own. A few of my items were somehow switched from “Ship with Depop” to “Handle shipping on my own” without my knowledge, which I cannot afford to do. Some items were purchased, but had to be canceled because the shipping was suddenly setup incorrectly. I’m not sure if this is a technical issue or if somehow it was user error, but I was very disappointed to have to cancel orders and hope the problem can be resolved.
developerResponse: {'id': 3878549, 'body': 'Hey there! It would be great if you could let our support team know about this issue so we can better understand it. Could you please drop them an email (support@depop.com) and be sure to include your Depop @username as well as any relevant screenshots. Thank you, Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-06-18T13:11:16Z'}

title: Glitches Stopped, Thank You!
review:
Dec. 2, 2020: App is back to working great again, thankfully! Glitches have seemed to stop. Thought it may have been my phone, but other people I know were experiencing the same issues. Either way, the app is working well and I’m back to listing and already made another sale! 

Nov. 23, 2020: I normally love this app and use it daily, but for the last few weeks the app has been really glitchy: new listings not showing up, edited listings not updating, organization of my feed appears out of order. I wanted to take advantage of Depop for Black Friday / Cyber Week sales, I’ll check back :(
developerResponse: {'id': 19676218, 'body': 'Hey, glad we could fix it!\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-12-10T15:44:50Z'}

title: I love it! but little things would make it even better
review: i love depop! it’s an amazing app and has made me a lot of money! it’s very easy to list things. but i do have a couple of requests that would help improve depop. i think a sharing system would be good and help smaller accounts to be able to premote their ship easily. also a huge request that would help a lot would be more photos slots. whenever i’m listing I tend to take a lot of photos to help buyers know what they are getting and it’s hard to narrow it down to 4 photos. but overall this app is amazing and i would definitely recommend! <3

title: love it!
review: i love this app! ive been using it for about a year now and its such a great way to sell and express your style! i have almost 6000 followers and 160 reviews! it just proves that this app has a following and everyone is active and engaged! its a super great way to make extra $$ and i have so much fun doing it! even with a full time job i still cant wait for days off when i can shoot my clothing and handmade items! one thing i would love to see depop do make it easier to move items around your page and a cool idea would be to make custom discount codes your profile, or when we want to have a sale on all or select items you could manage the settings to show the original price and the sale price! i feel like that would get people shopping alittle bit more if they can see what they are saving infront of them instead of messaging the shop to ask how much a certain item would be  with a discount and then having to change the price for them. other than that i love it!
developerResponse: {'id': 2784876, 'body': 'Hey Michael, well done for such a successful first year on the app! This is all relevant feedback that we hope to be able to implement as we continue to refine and improve our product. Thanks again! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-03-09T09:40:02Z'}

title: Problem with shipping info
review: I like the app. It makes shopping online very easy especially when it’s other people buying and selling clothing but I keep having this one problem that isn’t getting fixed. I put all my information for shipping in correctly but after I’m done purchasing I check my receipt and it changes some of the numbers. With me it changed my apartment number from 66 to 6 and it has caused me so much trouble trying to message the seller and having them buy a new shipping label. This has happened to me 3 times already. Every time I think it will actually work but WRONG! It does it again. I am not happy with it at all and I’m never going to use this app again. I kinda sound like a Karen but idc.

title: Updated review
review: I’ve been using Depop for almost 4 years now, I’ve made around 100 sales and purchased around 35 things. I’d say 5 out of 135 transactions had a problem in it between seller/buyer. Overall very easy to use app & almost everything goes smoothly. Don’t forget to ALWAYS ship out items with TRACKING to cover urself as a seller. As a buyer make sure to never trust stock images and to always get real pics of the item before buying. Customer support has helped me through a rough case twice so I’m glad they’re able to correspond with u and take less than 24 hours through email.
developerResponse:
{'id': 11283493, 'body': "Hey Alexa. Thanks for the rave review.

So glad I could help you out. We're always on the side of our user.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-16T10:15:39Z'}

title: This is frustrating!
review: I have been using depop for a while, having to use paypal is kind of annoying because paypal has their own issues, but whenever i search fir something and an scrolling, when i tap an item to see the listing, everything is fine, i do whatever. Then when i go back to the search feed I an brought all the way back to the beginning. Sometimes when i don’t even tap a listing I’m brought back to the top! I always an guessing myself because I don’t want to look at an item and not like it and have to scroll all the way down back to where i was. Please depop try and fix this!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15395905, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T15:19:15Z'}

title: awful
review: very frustrated with this app. it’s my only source of income and i just sold two items and when i went to tap on depop it said i was logged out and when i tried to log back in it said i was suspended??? no email telling me i was suspended or why. customer service is bad they take forever to respond and they just said it’s an issue with my paypal bc it’s not verified. WHICH IT IS and it has been since day one!! or that i have to authorize a billing agreement which i have no clue what that is and what needs to be done with that, AGAIN bc there was no email sent out as a warning or ANYTHING!! it sounds like it’s a technical issue that the won’t resolve bc I’ve been looking on twitter and the EXACT same thing has happened to all of them and you left them all in the dust just like me. highly disappointed in this company and the way it works.

title: I would love to see insights similar to Instagram
review: Depop has been great to me so far, and a really fun place to visualize/start my business. Something that I would find super helpful to my business is something similar to insights on instagram. I’d love to know how active my page really is, and see some demographic info, etc. This would help me understand my audience better and take the steps needed to enhance the experience. I love that you’ve created the shopping bag to make bundling easier! I’d be happy to see a feature that lets you create sales on your shop that will automatically change your prices temporarily💗
developerResponse: {'id': 5590676, 'body': 'This is great feedback <3 ... We want our users to feel empowered and have the knowledge to grow. Will def pass this on to our team and find more insight on this.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-10-21T10:05:30Z'}

title: Best shopping app ever!
review: Depop is one of, if not the best app I have used to buy/ sell clothes. Of course depop is not limited to clothes but it is best known for their wide variety of styles and sizes of vintage, trendy and high end clothing. I particularly love depop because it’s straightforward and easy to use, customer support is superb and the Depop community is so amazing and supportive of each other. You’re able to use pre pads  shipping labels which is soooo nice especially since they’re cheaper for me than going to the post office. Depop does take a 10% commission which is a little on the high end but is well worth it for the quality and easy of use of the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 4767155, 'body': 'Hey there! This is such a nice review, thanks so much! We really appreciate you taking the time to write in your feedback. Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-08-22T12:32:30Z'}

title: The best selling app
review: After selling on various selling apps for years I finally decided to start with Depop about a year ago. At first I thought I wouldn’t get many sales as they really promote vintage items, however, I was completely wrong! It’s easy to interact with followers and I love that you get your own feed of follower uploads. The app is hands-off and lets sellers control and design their own shops. What really made me rate though is their new free shipping campaign. Other apps raise shipping with zero notice and zero acknowledgment to their seller base. Depop is doing this promotion independently and I know their seller and buyer base truly appreciates their involvement!
developerResponse: {'id': 3800204, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks so much for this lovely review; we're glad you're having fun! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-11T14:56:41Z'}

title: Vintage Excellence
review: This is the perfect shopping app to use if you want anything vintage- from shirts, sweaters, jeans, and even cameras. Since almost all the items on this app are already used, sellers are honest with any flaws that may be on them. Often times, sellers even put a cute hand written note with the item you ordered. So, the buying experience really feels more personal. You can also message the seller, which is a tool I used A LOT and it was really helpful in the buying process. I bought from here multiple times and I am so glad I found this app. (Note: There’s regular stuff too, not only vintage.)

title: Love this app but hate the update
review: I love shopping on depop. This is from a shopper’s perspective, not a buyers. The worst I’ve ever experienced is sellers either not shipping or not being good at communicating and I tried reaching out to depop about it but ultimately I just let it go because it is what it is. But other than that, I still shopped on depop more cautiously, but now the app is way less appealing to me because the new layout is, there’s two rows of whatever you’re searching for which means more scrolling and more time spent on me trying to find what I want. And I know it’s probably not a huge deal to most especially with issues I was talking about earlier but I just hate it so much. I really prefer the layout of how it was before.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18385960, 'body': "Hey there,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-09T21:40:34Z'}

title: Viewing people’s stores
review: I like viewing items on my home page by scrolling down and it would be easier if I could view people items on there page by scrolling down as well. Clicking on items and having to click the back button then on another item over and over again takes a lot of time. It would be easier just to scroll down and see what all the sellers items have to sell just like Instagram you can change if you want to view them as a collage or scroll down. Just something you can add to the next update :)
developerResponse: {'id': 3159696, 'body': 'Hey there! Thanks for letting us know your feedback - noted! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-17T11:08:52Z'}

title: favors aesthetic accounts; notification bugs
review: I will click everywhere on the app and it will still say I have unread notifications when I don’t- super annoying. Easy to list and item hard to sell due to depops “explore” page only showcases “aesthetically pleasing” photos- photos from their verified people even if the item is sold already it will stay up for days. For people who are first starting out it is hard to reach out to people unless you put a lot of tags- which is actually against the guidelines and over all looks ugly on your photos. Shipping with depop take a giant chunk of your money away when making a sale but if you ship by yourself you are still paying $6/$7 to ship an item AND you still have to pay depop a fee. Disappointed and annoyed.
developerResponse: {'id': 4540698, 'body': "Sorry to read you're not enjoying your experience! Please note that our in-house curation team keep an eye out for great images of fun items rather than specific items themselves. We'd encourage you to try and check out some of the image styles on the Explore page if you're hoping to make it on there. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-06T12:02:28Z'}

title: My favorite app to sell on
review: It's user friendly and looks a lot like Instagram but with instant pay. Overall, my experience with those who have shopped on my page has also been more positive than on other apps/websites. I love that it's connected to PayPal, so I receive payment instantly when the item sells. The appearance is also very clean. Not a fan of the videos & I just wish I could upload more than four photos. I also used to sell much more before all of the updates and category changes, & I’ve been featured on the explore page less than I used to be. I’ve heard other sellers say their sales have decreased as well & it just makes me sad because this used to be my favorite platform to sell on.

title: So Far, I Love It
review:
I have had an enjoyable time using this app. I am both a buyer and a new seller. So far, I haven’t run into any big issues. I do my own shipping (not Depop’s), so the process of packaging and going to the post office is easy/straightforward. 

Depop is a good way to be scammed as a buyer if you aren’t proactive. I typically Google any item (or something similar by the brand) I’m interested in before purchasing, just in case the seller is inflating the price. It’s also better to purchase from someone with a lot of sales/reviews, and who has a consistent feed and possibly poses wearing their items themselves. 

My only complaint is Depop’s large cut. They have to make money somehow, but between shipping, Depop’s fee, taxes, and packaging, the amount I receive in the end is dramatically reduced. This is why, I’m sure, a lot of items are overpriced: The seller actually wants to make a profit. Bundle buying with free shipping is a blessing and a curse for this reason. 

Overall, I recommend the app. It’s a fun way to make extra money, or find niche things for your closet.

title: No customer service
review:
Long story short, I purchased a Louis Vuitton keychain and after 11 days of not shipping the seller told me they did not have the item and they blocked me. 

Depop does not have any customer service. When I emailed them it took 3 days to get a response. Which was utterly pathetic and useless. 

It has since been 34 day’s since my purchase and still no response from Depop or a refund. 

Depop told me that it’s not their problem and only PayPal can help. 

Depop claims to have a policy which after 7 days since an order is placed the seller must ship the item or the buyer is refunded. Well it’s been 34 days and Depop hasn’t given me a cent. 

I have since deleted this scam app as it’s way to risky especially when purchasing expensive items. 

In addition I would also like to note that about 95% of all designer items on Depop are counterfeit. Like most everything is Fake. Depop does absolutely nothing about this. 

Recently I have noticed people are beginning to sell looted luxury items and Depop does nothing.

I am extremely grateful for PayPal as they are the only people who have helped me. They informed me that I will be getting my money back this week after my case closes. 

Depop is trash. 
Thanks for absolutely nothing.

title: Beware the refund policy
review: I really liked this app until I ran into an issue with purchasing something. First of all the seller has a whole 7 days to ship an item before you can even reach out to customer service. Then when you want to cancel it and get refunded they basically tell you there’s nothing they can do and that the buyer has to refund you themselves. After multiple times of me reaching out to the seller and them not responding I reached out to depop again and they told me they emailed the buyer to issue a refund (like that’s going to help) and that I should reach out to PayPal. So there I was calling PayPal. They basically told me the same thing (the buyer has to do it) and that I should wait ANOTHER week. Moral of story I still don’t have my money...they need a better payment method and you should be careful when buying stuff.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10490309, 'body': "Hi there! Sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection as long as the item was purchased using the BUY button in-app. 

We recommend following these steps to get the best outcome: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001772448-I-haven-t-received-my-item

We're here to help you,
Team Depop ", 'modified': '2019-09-03T09:18:10Z'}

title: Can’t create an account
review: I left a previous review explaining how i can not get into the app. A Developer replied and told me to go into my profile on the app and seek support but the app isn’t even allowing me to create a profile to contact the correct people. I push explore and then profile but it prompts me to create the account. I push connect through FB and that works but when it’s time for me to put in my phone number it jumps backs to the apps home screen. I’ve tried to sign up without Facebook but the same problems are accruing. I didn’t receive a confirmation text or anything. This is my first time being associated with the app, I’ve been trying to create an account for over a week but it’s probably time to give up. Depop is obviously not interested in building their community brand. Going to try LetGo, OfferUp, or Poshmark instead
developerResponse: {'id': 6340063, 'body': "Hi there, that's odd! Please pop over a report via our in-app support Settings > Need Help? > Technical Issues and then we can get this sorted together.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-11T14:12:07Z'}

title: Great Way To Sell Stuff, Clunky Social Media Aspects
review:
Some of the features that need a bit of work: 
-Sending photo/video through private messages.
-Submitting money offers through private messages that the seller can accept with one click.
-Maybe blocking people from posting things that aren't items they have for sale.
