-The option to share your shop on Instagram feels dated and looks bland. I know you can't post links in captions on Instagram but the template of items displayed could look better. 
-General tactile feel of the app is a bit slow as far as liking things, clicking notifications, etc.
-This is a bit far fetched, but maybe a sale feature where you could select a group of items and drop or raise them in price by percentage all at once instead of doing it all manually.
-The ability to save shipping settings would be nice, posting multiple items at once can be a bit of a headache.
Don't get me wrong, I love the app! These are just a few things that would greatly improve it if looked into! Thanks.
developerResponse: {'id': 3158988, 'body': "Thanks for leaving this review - we'd love to know more about 'clunky social media aspects' so please do update this review if you'd like to give us a little more info. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-17T10:09:19Z'}

title: App is completely horrible
review: This app is so glitchy. I love the concept of the depop, but the quality of the app is frustrating me. I sold an item today and when I clicked to print the shipping label it shown as a meet in person. I freaked out. But then I exit the app and entered back in and it was back to normal with the shipping label. I also have problems with the messaging. I will get notifications for messages and when I enter the app there’s nothing there. Or sometimes it will have a red dot as if there is something but no notifications. This app is very confusing and I wish for it to be fixed.
developerResponse: {'id': 3269352, 'body': "Hey there, sorry to read about this current experience you're having. It sounds like we definitely need to do some investigation on your account, so please be sure to contact Support (support@depop.com) so we can get your account running smoothly again. Thank you, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-26T11:02:50Z'}

title: I like it, but
review: Ive been using the app for a while now, maybe 2 years 🤔 but more recently it has started glitching and even though I get on the app regularly, almost daily- it doesn’t recognize that for some reason. I was on yesterday and today it told me my items had been removed because I’ve been inactive for so long...while I was on the app making sure my items were still available the status still said I hadn’t been on in over a week. It’s happened before, a few minutes tha ago and it eventually refreshed. No luck this time, I even added another item and it still says I’ve been inactive. So strange and kind of making it difficult to actually sell anything.

title: Got ripped off and never received my package
review:
All the way back in July I ordered a pair of pants for $30. Waited a week for the seller to finally ship it which is typical. But, when I got an alert saying that my address was wrong I texted the seller back to confirm the correct address. It was right but the package was being sent back to the seller. I texted the seller again trying to see if there’s anything I can do to get my package because again, I’ve already paid. Now we’re here in NOVEMBER I have filled MANY cases but NOTHING has happened. I’m honestly really annoyed at this point. I have tried texting back the seller but they never respond. So now I’m sitting here $30 poorer AND I got ripped off. No bueno Depop. 👎👎👎👎

This is an update and the developer has sent me an email back about filling a dispute. BUT I HAVE BEEN DOING THAT SINCE SEPTEMBER AND NONE OF YALL HAVE GOTTEN BACK TO ME.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19470371, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-01T17:18:27Z'}

title: Terrible customer Support
review: My account was suspended when I was selling vintage Louis Vuitton locks on chains because I had multiple listed and couldn't show them a photo of them all at once. I explained to them that the locks were purchased and made upon order, I had 20+ 5 star reviews. They suspended my account in the middle of a transaction so I couldn't get the address to send to, however they reached out via email, but too late the customer asked for a refund after I already shipped the object and contested it with PayPal. They didn't even try to help ammend and the customer service was useless. Years later I made a new account and yet AGAIN they suspended my account mid transaction after doing several 5 Star transactions due to the status of my old account. And the fees are always higher than what they initially say in app.

title: Needs more Payment Options
review:
Used to be my favorite app to sell and buy items!! However, I switched my paypal account to a new email. It said that I needed to verify my account even though I had verified the account multiple times. Depop only gives you the option to Pay or purchase through paypal. There are no other options for paying or receiving. 

Two of my items were bought and I couldn’t access their shipping label OR payment due to the pay pal issue. I tried contacting Depop and I didn’t hear back. My customers were waiting and I had to do it manually where they sent me their address and had to pay me through venmo.... Depop needs more payment options because if your paypal doesn’t work you are screwed.

I also had items that I sold that I never got paid for due to this issue.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15578019, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop

", 'modified': '2020-05-26T16:34:42Z'}

title: Great app, but notification bubbles never go away!!!
review: This app is super great to resell clothes on and explore styles. I do my recommend buying something from a buyer who has no reviews and/or will not give you measurements of clothing. This app is overall great if your smart who to u buy from, but when I get a notification that someone followed me or sent me a message the little red 1 shows up in the corner of the icon for the app and when I open the app and view the person who followed me or whatever the notification was for and then I leave the app, the bubble doesn’t go away! it’s so annoying for someone who likes everything clean on my phone.
developerResponse: {'id': 11639031, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the great feedback and honesty about the notification dot. I'll pass this onto our Product Team to investigate.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-04T12:14:12Z'}

title: Innovative
review: Depop is a great avenue in which to sell and market clothing to a young adult audience. It listens well to its' users, and while there are things that could be better, it is constantly updating and improving. I was surprised when I joined to gain a fair amount of followers each day even with few items. The shipping and service is dealt with by sellers individually, which has benefits and negative qualities. But so far every seller has been great to me! I wish that the new video posts would let you upload an already-taken video, but who knows, maybe that will change. Overall I really like it so far.
developerResponse: {'id': 3073748, 'body': "Thanks for leaving this review, we're glad you're enjoying the experience! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-09T09:52:53Z'}

title: Great for my niche, UX design could use work
review:
I wear and sell jfashion (Japanese fashion) exclusively, which is too niche for Poshmark and Mercari. I love selling on Depop because it has a super active jfashion community and I can always sell stuff quickly. 

However, I must say that the UX and UI design could use a lot more work. Please take a look at Vinted for inspiration. I think they have the best UX out of all the seller apps (unfortunately no users though). 

Some UX issues I have with Depop: every time I add a new listing, I have to choose my shipping details, which is really tedious. Please just default it. 4 photos per listing is too restrictive. Doesn't show me how much I'll get when I set the price. No way to do bundles. Can't change shipping (to correct for over-weight shipments) or cancel order after it's placed. Can't change the tracking to my own tracking if I end up having to change shipping.

Also, it would be great if I don't have to go through Paypal, since Paypal takes an extra cut on top of the 10% Depop fee. Mercari does direct deposits and I love that.
developerResponse: {'id': 2766636, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for leaving this review - some of the feedback you've written around UX and UI is super-interesting and we'll be bringing this up with our Product teams. With regards to your shipping details, the app should save your last used shipping address -\n if this isn't the case then please do reach out to our support team (support@depop.com) so that they can investigate for you. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-07T11:49:47Z'}

title: Life Changing!
review: I have been using Depop for almost two months now and it is the greatest thing to happen to me. It's super easy buy and sell on the app and has helped me keep afloat when funds have been low. I'm a college student and I have sold items in order to pay for textbooks, supplies, meals, and gas. It started as a casual thing but I'm in the process of beginning to take my "shop" more seriously and now spend my free time looking for new items to sell and ways to improve my shop. I have recommended this app to friends and they love it too. Definitely one of the best apps I've ever downloaded.

title: Best online clothing selling app
review: Best app to buy/sell any apparel. Depop has a easy shipping process, not many policies like eBay, takes very small % of your sales and, many buyers looking for all different types of clothing. Buying clothes on depop is also amazing. I find anything I’m looking for on here, for cheap!! Also, there are many great sellers on here who have great shops. Depop allows you to follow peoples shop and, they can follow you so, you can see everything they post/you post. Highly recommend switching from eBay to depop if you like to sell clothes or shoes. Depop is much cheaper to sell things and there are many great buyers.
developerResponse: {'id': 5294543, 'body': 'This. is. an. amazing. feedback. \n\nLove. Love. Love.', 'modified': '2018-09-30T09:45:54Z'}

title: Please allow us to make collections in our saved
review: I don't understand why this isn't a thing yet, but it would be so much easier to organize the things we have saved if we could make collections, that way it's not public for others to see and notifying the seller as well. Nowadays people treat their likes as a style curation thing to represent them and for it to look good together, like one would think of their Instagram page. Sometimes there are items that are being saved for a friend, a specific event, or anything else that don't fit into that, or you don't want to be public.(e.g. birthday gifts for a friend.) This would make the app so much more enjoyable and buying a lot easier.
developerResponse: {'id': 19390709, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-27T11:10:32Z'}

title: Best for hobby sellers
review: Of all the buying and selling apps, I notice this one is the most lacking in customer service. Sellers often don’t reply to messages. I also don’t like that shipping cost doesn’t show until you add an item to your bag. Sellers are usually slow to ship and often don’t supply tracking numbers and you have to reach out and request them. Sellers often put “shirt overalls polo Ralph Lauren Gucci makeup” into their listings so that when you search you find a lot of unrelated items. The app is more anarchical than the others which has its own advantages. Never had a bad buying experience. All sellers have been honest, and it’s a fun, hip, and creative place to buy and sell. That’s what I enjoy about it.

title: please depop
review: after the newest update i can’t even open the app anymore. i’ve been using depop since it was first released and i love it a lot but there are SO many little technical issues that y’all have had plenty of time to fix by now. The refund process is messy and so unnecessarily complicated but you can bet y’all still get your percentage every time, way too many scam sellers, blocking someone is literally pointless because you can still see all of their random items clogging everything i search up, the hashtag system is useless, but the main issue i’m having right now is the app literally won’t even open anymore...
developerResponse: {'id': 16679787, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-16T17:37:29Z'}

title: good, but very buggy
review: depop is my go to app to sell clothes and i have had lots of success with it. however, with every update it seems there is a new bug. right now when i’m scrolling through items and i click on one and then exit the item, it sends me back to the top of the page and i have to scroll and find my place again. i have not been using depop nearly as much because of this. also this has not been happening as frequently but it still an issue for me, sometimes when i go to click on an item and i click on the comments or just any random thing, the entire app freezes and i have to close the app and open it again. it’s unavoidable because it happens at random if i simply click wrong. these are the two most major bugs for me at the time being. another thing that irritates me is that depop’s customer service is just the worst. for example they have a rule that states that dropshipped are strictly forbidden on depop, yet every time i report one no action is ever taken against them. this doesn’t happen only with the dropshippers, it happens with almost everything i report and nothing is ever changed
developerResponse:
{'id': 15396217, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T15:37:22Z'}

title: Favorite Fashion App But I Have Some Ideas.
review: I’ve been using this app all week for fashion inspo and once I get paid, I’m going to make some of my first purchases. Everyone on here I’ve communicated with is so sweet and cooperative. There’s tons of great deals on here if you go deep within the app. A majority of what I see is vintage, trendy styles. One thing I’m having trouble with is finding clothing items my size. If there was a system where I could put in my exact measurements (Ex. Bust, Waist, Hips, etc.) it would be so much more easy and organized for me. This app has become a part of my routine and I spend about 20-30 minutes on it everyday or every other day. I love fashion 💞
developerResponse: {'id': 10315308, 'body': "Annalise, we love this. We're always working super hard to give our Community the best experience, choice and variation. To hear reviews like this gives us life! Keep browsing and treat yourself! As for your measurements, we do have a filter system. If you head to this during your search, you'll be able to narrow results down in terms of size. We hope this helps and you keep enjoying this amazing place!\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-08-23T08:42:40Z'}

title: Waste of Time!!!
review:
So I sell on Poshmark and Mercari and someone said to try Depop. My mistake. If you sell items on apps you always run into the occasional rude person, or scammer. Well, be warned Depop is full of scammers and Depop doesn’t do anything! I contacted customer support/service as I noticed someone was using my photos as their own to do swaps and Depop basically came back and said well you cant prove they are your pictures so we can’t take hers down as they may actually be hers. That was just the most recent scammer incident. For only being on the app for about 6 months, on Poshmark for almost 2 years and Mercari about a year ive had more problems on Depop in those 6 months than in the time I have been with the other platforms combined.

UPDATE—> I did provide proof they were my photos and they still did nothing yet want to respond of them.
developerResponse: {'id': 3053129, 'body': "Hey there! Sorry you feel this way - nevertheless we do need proof that an image belongs to you in able to take another users profile down. We understand this can be frustrating but do hope you'll be able to find proof that these images belong to you so we can take action. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-06T15:46:59Z'}

title: Dislike
review: I was really excited about Depop at first and luckily didn’t have any problems until recently when all of my items changed from “in-app” shipping to “my own” shipping which I did not change myself because paying for your own shipping costs way more. I didn’t have any issues on my first sell but my second (I’ve only been with Depop for a little over a month) I had to pay $25 in shipping fees when I distinctly remember setting my items to in-app shipping. If there was some sort of update or something that flew by without any acknowledgement of changes to shipping items that’s pretty screwed up because I ended up paying more in shipping than I made on my items. I’m extremely disappointed and will continue selling my items on a different platflorm because of this and other reviews I’ve read.

title: Update ruined the app
review: I’m starting out as a seller and prior to the update my engagement was really good, I honestly was excited about using Depop and having such a sleek, refined site for selling. But pretty soon after I started, they released an update that totally ruined the app. I’m putting in so much effort to my store and I’m not receiving the engagement I once was. My items don’t show up in searches, my sales have gone to basically none, and I’ve lost hope for this app. They refuse to actually help the users they’ve affected, instead leaving copy-paste replies when called out and blaming the users for the apps own problems from the update. I’m seriously thinking of moving to a different site, because I don’t know if/when this will be resolved, or if I even want to continue on a site that treats its users so poorly.

title: Beautiful but flawed
review: Ive had this app for a while and just started selling four days ago. I sold my first item, great, and confirmed all my info with paypal and was able to pull up my receipt and shipped the item out. Well I sold another item last night, and now whenever I go to check my receipt print out the shipping label, it says I need to confirm my paypal account. I go to paypal and it says nothing needs to be confirmed. I messaged depops technical issues but haven’t received a response yet. It makes no sense because how would I have been able to ship something out the other day if my paypal wasn’t concerned. I see so much potential with this app but its not working right. I’ve deleted and redownloaded, used a browser, and did the same thing with my paypal and nothing seems to work. Please help someone at depop!!!!!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 18004550, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-21T16:14:43Z'}

title: Great, however...
review: My buying experience has been great, love the filters and the easy learning curve this app offers. However, for selling I have had a hard time, as I accidentally linked a PayPal of mine and I am not 18 (my mistake). So I removed it along with any passwords. When I tried multiple times to link my guardians PayPal for selling, the app continues to try to link me to my old accounts, which are limited. It has been over a week and I’ve contacted support many times and they would not answer or offer any relevant information. I am currently still stuck with my items and cannot sell, and my other sales transactions are pending so so far using this app, I have yet to make a dollar.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17321010, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-17T08:57:46Z'}

title: The new update is GARBAGE
review:
The new app makes it impossible to sell/see anything if you don’t have a huge following. It’s no longer fun or even worth your time. 

I’m both a frequent seller/buyer on Depop and while it’s always been easier for more “famous” people to get featured on the explore page, get away with buying crap from AliExpress and then selling it for way higher, get away with treating buyers like garbage and depop doing nothing, the new update confirms that all these things haven’t just been happening by accident or were just honest mistakes. The new update removes basically all traffic from smaller shops making it almost impossible to both buy from someone who isn’t famous or if you’re not yourself, sell anything. I’ll be taking my purchases and sales to a completely different app because it’s garbage.

title: Great App, Could Use Minor Improvements
review: While I absolutely adore this app and the vintage type clothes that's sold on it everyday, I have to mention some of its slight disadvantages as well. There's a constant bug that makes your badge notification stay even after checking it off in the app. Also, if there was a way to save my selected sizes/measurements instead of re-entering them everytime I search for something, that would be nice too. Finally, if the app was able to suggest clothing options based on my recent searches and purchases, it would be a well deserved Five Stars. All in all, it's a great shopping app that should be on everyone's phone.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5407875, 'body': 'We love your feedback and honesty to us. We understand some these issues might not make your user experience super great. Can you have a look if you clear some of your data with the app to see if some of the issues can be cleared up (e.g. the size issue)

Settings > Apps > Depop > Storage > Clear Data and Cache 

Keep us updated.

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2018-10-08T15:36:27Z'}

title: My two most popular posts got deleted 😕😕
review: I have had many issues with this app. I tried putting items up on my shop but couldn’t because it would act as if I didn’t have a wifi connection (which I did) so I reached out to them but I never got a response. Besides that, recently two of my most popular items have been deleted off of my shop (nobody has my password and I am not logged in on my depop on another device) these two items were about to sell and now they’re no longer in my shop. This is so disappointing because I could be getting money for these items but now Im going to have to post them again and wait for them to sell again. This app definitely needs improvement because it would be a lot nicer to use when your posts aren’t mysteriously getting deleted. :(

title: pls change the “for you”!
review:
Looove depop and have been using it for years. I used to love the “for you” tab where they recommended pieces for you based on your likes. But after they changed it to be based off of your interests, the stuff they’ve been recommending me has been all over the place and irrelevant (people tagging their clothing as a specific brand just to gain exposure when it’s not that brand at all). The way it works now is pointless- why recommend everything from urban outfitters when I can just search urban outfitters myself 🤷🏻‍♀️
Anyways, please bring back how it’s based on your likes! I always found amazing pieces that way, plus, it’s way more curated to what you actually like!!
Thanks :)
developerResponse: {'id': 8502575, 'body': 'Hey Hannah, thank you for your feedback. We hear you. I will make sure to pass this on to the team for you. \n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-04T04:43:30Z'}

userName: I just wanna go on fb
title: Great app- few suggestions
review:
I think this app is very user friendly BUT a few improvements could make this app all the more functional. 
(1) While browsing a seller’s profile, there should be an option to scroll seamlessly through each listing (like on ig) instead of having to click/go back on each listing.  
(2) At the top of each seller’s profile (next to the reviews #) it should show the number of sales. 
(3) I wish the “rearrange listings” and “move sold listings down” settings were available on the app so that I do not have to switch to a desktop computer to do so.
(4) More than 4 photo upload options would be nice

title: frustrating
review:
the new design is so bulky and not aesthetically pleasing like it was before )-: edit: oh goodness the update made it even worse?? reading the stretched out font gives me a headache & descriptions now look horrible !! why can't we just at least have the old fonts back? the bold colors are fine, but the wide blocky letters are displeasing to say the least 🌀

app crashes less now, but is still crashing )-:

i find the explore/discover stores system a bit biased; where only shops, and always the same ones at that, with several thousand followers are featured. perhaps they should have smaller & newer stores featured to help those smaller shops and provide variety.

UPDATE:
am I the only one losing reviews? the first time it happened, I thought I had made a mistake, but this morning I woke up to 94 -> 93 reviews, so I tried looking around. I know we can delete reviews now, but I’m fairly certain someones not going to randomly delete a 5-star review from 12 weeks ago. I checked, and I believe the girl deleted her account - and her reviews for me disappeared. We all work hard to get continuous 5-star reviews, please see if you can find an issue )-:
developerResponse: {'id': 1075495, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review and feedback. Sorry to hear you've been having some issues with the app and with items being banned. Could you please get in touch at productfeedback@depop.com with your username, details about the device you're using (e.g. iPhone 6s) and the iOS version (can be found on your device by going settings > general > about > version). We can then dig into these bugs and also understand better why your items are being banned. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-08-22T11:41:49Z'}

title: Lots of Little Bugs
review:
Depop has a lot of new bugs that they didn’t used to have. The most frustrating one being the search bar. You can’t see what you type past the “clear” button nor can you get to the last letters, so you need to delete the entire thing and start over if you need to change something about it. 

There’s also no longer quick continuous scrolling. It juts to a stop after a certain amount of items, even if I am continuously scrolling. To that end, if you accidentally flick your thumb to the right, it switches pages and you lose your spot. I like that we can flick to go back to the previous page, but I wish it wasn’t so sensitive.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18967745, 'body': "Hey there,

We can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-08T17:20:31Z'}

title: The problems with depop...
review: There are some very cool things about this platform but I’ve found the app itself kind of clunky.  It’s challenging to find where and how to message and communicate with people.  Depop’s communication with me regarding the disappearance of a seller I was mid transaction with was in my opinion practically inexcusable.  If someone gets banned the people with a transaction in progress need to be notified. I also find it annoying that you have to put something in your bag to see what the seller is charging for shipping.  I use the platform cautiously because I find it to be less streamlined than other selling platforms, but it isn’t full of overseas sellers with crappy quality items so that’s good.

title: Great app, lack of customer support
review: I love Depop, it’s the best online used clothes selling platform imo. However, the support is non existent. One time an item I was selling got flagged and removed automatically, and no amount of emailing got any response from them. Also, they didn’t send me a shipping label from one item and the only “response” I got from their customer support was a string of numbers, leading me to believe there’s some issues with the back end support. Please fix this and have a better process for responding to your sellers! I don’t mind Depop’s higher fee if it means actual good customer support!
developerResponse:
{'id': 16444509, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-06T22:30:45Z'}

title: Good app, just a little tedious for some things
review:
The community is pretty reliable and buyers are pretty passionate about selling in their shops, which is always nice to see on a resell app. Lots of creative looks for cheaper then buying the designer version as well as lightly used designer Incase you’re like me and can’t afford a big purchase like that often. 

Buuuut. To bundle any items, i have to find them myself through the sellers account. I’ve wasted tons of time just scrolling to find other liked items. I really wish there was a way to filter a sellers shop just for items you’ve liked. If they fixed that the app would honestly be perfect
developerResponse: {'id': 10125494, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for this super helpful feedback. We love hearing from our users about what we can do to improve Depop for everyone. I'll be passing this one along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-08-12T11:00:58Z'}

title: Getting paid as a seller is extremely difficult
review: Actually getting payed as a seller is so difficult. You need a verified PayPal account before you can actually get paid and they don’t do direct deposits. I don’t believe they tell you this before you start listing items to sell, and getting verified can take up to 7 days. So before you make a sale, make sure you’re account is verified or else they won’t send you a shipping label. I had a Paypal account connected to my depop and after I had already made a sale, they told me I need to be 18 or older in order to get paid. The process to get my money for it was so difficult and I had to send the company multiple emails to figure out how to get my money. I suggest the app Mercari instead because they do direct deposits and it’s much easier to get paid.

title: New update ruins it for sellers.
review:
New update limiting hashtags is going to completely ruin our traffic to our shops. There are some items that can be listed and described in multiple ways to reach out to potential audiences, and now we are limited to only five hashtags per post and only two brands to be tagged. 
I understand the idea of reducing spam but all this really does is make it increasingly more difficult for us sellers to reach out to more potential viewers and buyers. 
Most likely going to have to start using other apps including Ebay now that my audience has been cut so dramatically.

title: out of control tags
review: I like this app a lot, I’ve made quite a few purchases and have not had a bad experience with any of them. My issue, however, is that the search function is basically useless because of the sheer amount of unrelated tags sellers put on their items. Adding a brand filter is totally useless, I just found stiletto boots in the results for “fair isle sweater” even though I had selected the sweater filter. I’m not even sure if there’s anything the app could even do about this since it’s the sellers that are going crazy with the tags trying to get exposure for their items but it ends up making finding things quite a bit more frustrating than they need to be.

title: NOTIFICATIONS
review: Ever since I updated the app i have been having issues with late notifications as well as no notifications at all. It’s important to me to receive notifications in order to communicate with everyone in a fast manner. It’s a huge inconvenience and makes me look unreliable. I’ve check my settings on my phone and on the app and they are both on to notify me ASAP. I unfortunately am not the only one with this issue. I love Depop but at the moment I’m very disappointed and dissatisfied. I hope the Tech Team will be able to fix this issue in a timely manner.
developerResponse: {'id': 4374101, 'body': 'Hey there! Could you contact our support team (support@depop.com) about this issue so they can take a look? Thanks! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-07-24T09:36:49Z'}

title: Sellers are dishonest and disappointing
review: This app is the least professional of any of the online selling apps. I’ve used Poshmark and Mercari with very few issues. All of the sellers I have come into contact with on Depop have sent me items that qualified for a dispute, but I didn’t want to deal with it. The items did not match the description, photos have all been purposefully deceitful. Sellers should not stay on your app or be able to get by with five stars when they ship out damaged merchandise for a pretty penny. I don’t love the layout or shipping options that sellers have. I feel like shipping has been exorbitantly expensive. I sell online too. I get it. It’s why I use these apps and don’t appreciate being treated like this as a customer. I will be leaving depop soon. Highly disappointed with every interaction I have had on here.
developerResponse: {'id': 8771745, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you haven't had the best experience with one of our sellers. Do know that transaction made within the app are protected even if they're not as described. Just send a report to our support team and they'll send some instructions on what to do.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-21T07:35:14Z'}

title: Could use better search features
review: Could use search functions like exact match or exclude “” (adding quotes or using the minus sign does not work). For people who log in knowing what to look for this is a nightmare since people abuse the use of tags and so most searches include a bunch of stuff you don’t care about. Also, there should be a way to search international items without having to scroll past the national items first. Most of what I search for is overseas so this is also a nightmare. Also, there should be a way to remove the items from the reviews that you receive. It’s really weird knowing that anyone can just go to anyone’s reviews and see what they bought.
developerResponse: {'id': 7510536, 'body': 'Hi there,  we are aware of the tagging situation and our team is tackling this as Speedy Gonzalez. We appreciate if our users give us a helping hand by reporting any users with this issue so we can investigate it further.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-02-28T11:57:24Z'}

title: Terrible.
review:
I used to love Depop and would post listings often! Unfortunately, I got banned for commenting on a sellers account about how they are DRASTICALLY upping the price for a thrifted item ($50 for a top). This seller also had a tiktok of how she bought OVER TWENTY trash bags of clothes from GoodWill to resell on her account. Because of this comment, I was flagged as "inappropriate, vulgar, and abusive". Depop is supporting gentrification. I'm in the midst of trying to get my account back but also, Depop did not reach out to me before removing my account, this means that literally anyone can report anyone for ANYTHING to get their account permanently removed. This leaves me to believe that they truly do not care about their sellers AND buyers. How can Depop allow their customers and users to be scammed and how can they blatantly support gentrification. 

Depop, DO BETTER.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18575393, 'body': "Hey Kisam,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-19T15:32:34Z'}

title: THE WORST APP
review: I’ve sold my pair of Travis Scott Jordan 1 highs for 1000 dollars on depop. It has been 2 months of this bs and I still haven’t got paid. There customer service is quite possibly THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. They won’t help you and they don’t have a phone number. All of there emails are automated bots. It took them 3 weeks just to get back to me and it was another automated response. They are holding my money from me and it is not fair. Also not to mention, the app is FULL of scammers. Another thing is that when you first start the app they literally expect you to go through all of their rules of how to sell rather than telling you upfront in the app. This is THE WORST APP TO SELL ON. I will never be selling on this app again. AVIOD IT LIKE IT’S COVID-19!!!! If there was a option to give this app 0 stars, that still wouldn’t be low enough.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17347975, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear your experience has been a negative one, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but if you've contacted us we'll be in touch ASAP. All our emails are read by humans not bots I promise!

 We moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

Team Depop.
", 'modified': '2020-08-18T08:52:00Z'}

title: Feedback/ layout
review:
Please have an automated feedback or make it mandatory. I currently have 15-16 people who have yet to leave feedback either because they don’t know or they don’t want to help out other people’s ship. Please make this a requirement like Mercari does. Feedback helps people come buy from our shops! Take notes from Mercari on this. They give you three days to leave feedback if not you get automatically 5 stars. Please it’s been years and not once has the feedback part been changed.

Also change the layout I hate that now I have to change from explore to my feed when there is another explore page this is nonsense there is no need for two explore pages.

title: Horrible support team
review:
We are told sell through the app because it’s the safest way. But it’s not this app will do nothing to help you get your money and just let people take your product for free like they have done to me. The person I sold shoes to just stoped responding to texts and said she dident revive anything. So I sent her free shoes because of that. And guess who dosent help me figure it out or get my money. DEPOP! This app will not help you if you have trouble so save your time and money and sell  your stuff  somewhere else you’ll lose your money. 

( In response to the review) 
I have. I have reported them for the last 4 weeks and I get no response. The person’s account is still up. She stopped responding to my messages regarding my questions about the money the second I told her I sent out the shoes. You guys have done NOTHING

title: Love $$$
review: I love Depop! Wonderful customer service! I do wish sellers would be notified when an item has been delivered but this is probably more a PayPal/USPS issue. I always message my buyer the day they get their package to see if they are satisfied. I’m excited for videos but I’m trying to not feel like I need to keep up with the Jones. I just ordered a backdrop and lights for pictures but I sell stuff by taking picture with my iPhone and the shower curtain as a backdrop now and it’s fine. Oh, forgot to mention, I hate that my app always shows I have a notification by showing a 1 even if I don’t.

title: A suggestion
review: I love Depop and it’s easy to use. Been using it for many months now. However I would like to suggest that you make the explorer page suited to what *we* like, and from the people we follow. You guys used to have it to where we could see what the people we follow liked, now that option is no longer available. I suggest maybe offering a different section on the Explorers page that we can view who we follow and get things similar saved under that. I don’t want to see what Depop likes and what has the most likes on the Explorer page, so I literally never use it. Make it more aimed towards the individual user please.
developerResponse: {'id': 2572000, 'body': "Hey there PEPSI_BABE - thanks for this feedback. We're always looking to refine and improve our app, so this is super-insightful. We'll be sure to pass this on the right people here in the office. Thanks again! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-02-13T12:31:32Z'}

title: Convoluted Try Hard
review:
Why not just take seller fees out of the transaction like Posh or Merc? Why jump through the PayPal hoops? It’s too much of a hassle for me to bother selling with this app. 
As for the design, it’s nice but some key issues arose for me as a buyer. I should be able to see the price before I click on an item and also immediately after clicking on it. Having to scroll down to a SMALL price is ridiculous. Also, no where during the buying process does it say if the buyer is paying for shipping and it doesn’t even include it when checking out. Only after the payment has gone through does it give the complete total. That’s ridiculous. 
Also, no offer button or bundle option. Very hip and cool approach to the resell app game but the actual process of buying and selling is very amateur hour.
developerResponse: {'id': 2679268, 'body': "Hey there - we choose to use PayPal as our payment provider for the security it offers buyers and sellers alike with their protection policies. Thanks also for your feedback around UI as a buyer, we're open to feedback and this is something that we'll be bringing up to the relevant teams here at HQ. Thanks - we hope you'll be back! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-02-26T10:25:46Z'}

title: Good App!
review:
Pros: I love this app because it’s easy to get views! I can promote my items many times a day, making it fast and easy to sell. You can trade, sell, buy, and even make friends on this app! 

Cons: There are lots of scammers and it’s a hassle to get a refund! I’ve bought from many sellers on depop that either never shipped my item out, or took 2 months to ship! If you pay within the app you can get a refund on PayPal, but it can take up to weeks and is really confusing. The app also crashes a LOT! There are so many bugs and crashes, sometimes it is really annoying to use.

please fix the app ASAP!  It keeps crashing. :(

title: DO NOT DO REFUNDS
review: i’ve really liked depop in the past, it’s an easy way to sell things. but their real issue is if you have to refund someone. depop automatically takes they’re fee from your paypal after you make a sale, so if you refund someone, you don’t just get your fee back. you have to fill out a form which they will probably never get to. and they continuously dismiss people complaining in their comments. they seriously need to improve this. they need some other way to contact them for stuff like this. like a number people can call or an email specifically for this because i know this is a common issue. they keep saying that someone will get to it eventually but i don’t think that’s the case. scammers seriously i would use another app to sell.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19221515, 'body': "Hey, we'll be happy to refund you the Depop fee, just send a request via this link.

https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001790827-How-can-I-have-the-Depop-fee-refunded-

This is due to the fee being taken by PayPal, but if you're signed up to Depop payments the fee will be refunded automatically.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-19T14:00:34Z'}

title: This app is going downhill and they don’t care
review: This app is how I make my living. With the recent updates my sales have completely flatlined and I’ve reached out and they don’t say anything back to me. Almost every seller I take to says the same thing is happening. Instead of them trying to fix it they just ignore the problem. I’m currently not able to pay rent because of depop and it seems like they don’t give a hoot. They are ignoring their clients and haven’t said anything about trying to fix it. It is truly disappointing to see them not care. Hundreds of not thousands of sellers on depop are experiencing the same thing I’m dealing with and it’s extremely unfair. Depop doesn’t give a heck about their sellers!!! Even though that’s where they make all their money :(  please fix this guys you can do better.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19042616, 'body': "Hey. We get it, this can be frustrating. However, we've created a dedicated Seller Handbook on our Help Centre to help our Users shoot, style and sell. 
Learn more about highlighting your shop by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in Sellers Handbook.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-11T12:52:50Z'}

title: Slowly going downhill
review: I have been selling on this app for a couple years now and it’s getting worse! First of all, it began by reporting my items as inaccurate descriptions without warning me, and what was most surprising is that my items listed were not inaccurate and were not scam. This same week i saw other fellow depop sellers complaining about this happening to them, and that maybe it was a way to get rid of sellers depop deemed “unworthy”. I felt a little hurt by that, and recently i noticed this algorithm does a bad job recommending my items to buyers, it also says I’ve been inactive for over a week which isn’t true since i get on everyday and i am scared this will ward off potential buyers. Depop fix this otherwise I’m gonna uninstall this app for good.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18830438, 'body': "Hey there,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-11-01T17:58:36Z'}

title: Great concept, needs a few improvements
review: I downloaded this app originally as a buyer looking for good deals and after looking at the app i noticed it’s less of an online thrift store and more like etsy but specifically for clothes. I think it’s really good how people can make money selling sustainable handmade goods. As soon as I became a seller, I realized how hard it is to grow my platform. The explore page consistently shows the same style of clothing and the same sellers. People often pass clothes off as more popular brands for exposure but really this just clogs up my feed. It NEEDS to be easier to grow as a seller, I would leave this app but no other platform I know of has the same sustainable fashion vibe.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16341329, 'body': 'Hey. We get it, this can be super frustrating. Rest assured, we’re always looking for ways to discover exciting new users. 
Have a read through our article ‘Suggested Sellers’ by going to ‘Settings - Need help’, for some tips on how to become a Suggested Seller.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-07-01T15:50:00Z'}

title: Love but need a little work
review: Great app. I've made nearly 50 sales and have purchased some great pieces! Could use a few updates however... one of them being able to rearrange your items thru the app instead of having to go on a computer. Two is being able to rearrange the order of the pictures that are currently in a listing (or if you can make it easier bc I can't figure it out) and three be able to place an item on hold so no one else can purchase the item besides the person who requested it be on hold. Just some suggestion.

title: cute clothing !!
review:
i really like this app !! i’ve been looking for a cute alternative to shopping in stores with fast fashion that ruins the environment and uses child labor and animal cruelty and this seems to be it. the app has a simple design so it’s easy to find things and the creators understand what’s trendy now. 
my only problem with it is the notifications. when i get a notification that someone follows me i have to look through they’re ENTIRE profile and reload the notifications page and the messages page and my profile. i just wish i could go into my notifications without having to do all that stuff.
developerResponse: {'id': 11372606, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-21T11:22:15Z'}

title: Big fan with some recommendations to make
review:
I’ve been using depop for about a month now. For the items that I am selling I am much happier listing / selling on depop rather than eBay. 
As far as recommendations I think the app would benefit with being able to send pictures to other users in messages. Being limited to only text messaging isn’t ideal. 
As far as shipping I don’t own a printer and only live like 5 minutes from a post office so I don’t mind. 
However with tracking I really think a scan the tracking barcode (like the eBay app) would benefit everyone. 
I’ll continue to use depop as long as I have items in my store.

title: Overall Rating + Recommend Changes
review:
Overall Depop is an amazing app that’s simple & not confusing at ALL to use. The communication through buyers/sellers is very straight to the point. The display through the whole layout of the app is perfect. The only things I have to note is some added features that can be added:

- Post notifications for favorite sellers so you know when they post a new product. 

- “Sold” filter option so we can compare prices if we’re buying a product & what it recently sold for to get best value for consumer/merchandiser. 

- To add more photos if listing an item. I get a lot of requests to try on a product, or post dimensions. I would love to add more photos without creating a new post or removing pictures from current post. 

- Lastly, rearrangement of items. I know this implemented when you’re on a laptop/desktop, but I hope in the future this will added to the app as well.

title: Awful customer service!
review: I downloaded Depop to sell some of my old stuff like one does. I sold something a couple days after I joined and I was super excited. The app will not let me access the shipping label no matter what I do. At first it needed me to verify my email on PayPal so I did that and it STILL won’t let me access it. I contacted their customer support and they told me the basic stuff to do, that didn’t work so I sent another message. They said they would “escalate the concern” but never responded. A couple days later I try getting a hold of someone else and the same thing happens. I’m EXTREMELY frustrated at this point with how bad your customer service is and I will not be buying or selling anything else on your platform. Buyers and sellers BEWARE!

title: FIX THIS!
review:
i use this app all the time and it’s great but in a recent update you’ve made shipping with depop easy for mistakes. when i am posting an item and i click on the shipping price i ALSO have to scroll down to find the “free shipping” button and turn it off! i’ve now accidentally sold an item with free shipping because i forgot to scroll down and turn free shipping off and now i have to issue a refund through paypal in order to redo the sale!!! this is
highly frustrating for both me and the buyer and is an incredibly stupid design to have. free shipping should NOT be automatic and should be a button you TURN ON not TURN OFF.

title: Buggy
review: I’m a seller on the app and while the positives far outweigh the negatives I’ve had while using this app; I’ve still become quite annoyed with how this app runs. I was about to sell an item when the messaging completely stopped working making it so I had no contact with my buyer. I also can’t see any of my receipts. This app has great potential, and I enjoy selling on it, but the bugs need to be fixed for the experience to be the best it can. It’s a shame issues like this arise so often, this has been the 5th time I’ve deleted and re-installed the app trying to get it to work. Otherwise this app is good.
developerResponse: {'id': 16718489, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-18T20:20:55Z'}

title: THE WORST APP
review: This is the WORST APP EVER. I bought something from a vendor on depop. Not only did I NEVER RECEIVE MY ITEM, but Depop flagged my account for cursing at a vendor that was taunting me the entire time, after SCAMMING ME. To make matters worse, the vendor has been able to leave a review for ME, causing my Five star rating to drop, but is preventing me from leaving a review for THEM. DEPOP is knowingly letting this scam artist hurt other people. I say knowingly because I emailed them MULTIPLE TIMES and they did absolutely nothing. They make money from sales, so trust me when I say they don’t care if you get scammed. There are scam pages riddled throughout the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 7936211, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear about this whole mess! Can you please send us your username? We would like to reach out to the support team and have a further look into this.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-27T17:29:25Z'}

title: App works very well, however.....
review:
I love this app! Buying, selling, and searching for items is simple and easy because everything works well. Just a couple things...

I wish the old way of setting your sizes would return. It’s so weird to have drop-down boxes for the specific “types” of sizes.... it’s just a hurdle before seeing the old way of setting sizes for your search. The old way worked perfectly and had no issues. PLEASE change it back!

Also, there’s a recent bug that when you search for an item, tap on a post and go back to the search results, it goes back to the top and then you have to scroll all the way back to where you were in the feed. Extremely annoying.

Also, I wish there was an easier way to arrange your posts on your shop than having to edit the post in some way to bring it to the top of the feed. It’s really tedious to do it this way, and at one point there was an option to make all the “sold” posts appear at the bottom of the feed.... I would love to see that would come back, too.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15396266, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T15:39:55Z'}

title: Please Fix
review:
I enjoyed the app a few months ago. I've made many purchases over time and it feels great to by things that have been sold out or is no longer made. I even found a dress my favorite musician wore after months of searching for it :D (probably my best purchase yet 👉👈).

To the developers:
But I have seen some of the reviews and realized that we’re facing same issue:  whenever I use the search tab and scroll down to look at an item, and go back to the search page, I’m taken back to the very top. I’d have to scroll far back down to where I was at. Its making shopping difficult :(.
Completely ruined the app experience... please help fix this issue?
developerResponse:
{'id': 15395883, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T15:18:08Z'}

title: MAKE IT COMPATIBLE WITH IPAD PLEASE!!!!!!
review: I love this app, I really do. I have no other complains other than it isn’t compatible with iPads :( I just got an iPad and was so excited to use it but the screen image is tiny, like iphone screen-sized. You have the option to zoom in but this results in poor quality photos and you can only view it vertically, not horizontally which is annoying because sometimes i have my iPad attached to the keyboard and I have to detach the entire iPad and turn it to be able to see my feed. Overall, great app and very user friendly. That is my only complaint and i hope it does not go unheard !!!!!!!!!!!

title: Worst customer service and scammers
review: I bought a sweatshirt from a user about 9 weeks ago and the item was never shipped. I reached out to the seller multiple times asking for a tracking number, to which she never responded even though she was active multiple times a week. I asked for a refund, still no reply. I filed a report to depop and they were no help at all. I bought through guest checkout and depop is telling me to file a claim through PayPal?? I don’t have a paypal account so I’m not sure how PayPal will resolve this issue. This girl basically took my money and ran and depop was no help whatsoever. I’m planning on deleting this disappointing app once my money is refunded. I would rate it -5 stars if I could.

title: Be careful!
review: Basically got robbed of $80 by using this app. If you want to be a seller make sure your pay pal is hooked up to your bank account or else if you sell an item the money is not registered / sent back to the buyer and depop does very little about helping you out you basically have to figure it out on your own even if you follow the rules. Also bought $30 shoes and the seller never sent them complained and once again you have to put in claims and do a bunch of crap before your ever going to see your money again. Basically depop needs to step up its customer service to help people get there money back the account klochella on depop has multiple complaints about items not being sent, lets see them actually help their users. would be an A1 app other then these drastic faults

title: Good App but Can Benefit from More Filters
review:
This app is pretty cool. it allows you to connect with buyers and sellers across the world in a C2C manner. 
My recommendation is that there should be more filters created, as the current ones don’t always work in more specific searches. Filters recommended include allowing users to buy from sellers based in their same country or internationally (helps with shipping and seller preference), color of the item, and advance filtering for hashtags, actual header of the item, or other (some sellers tag irrelevant hashtags to increase exposure). This is a unique app would love to see more app development and user customization!
developerResponse: {'id': 16192139, 'body': 'Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We’ll be passing this along to our Product Team.\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-06-24T11:11:04Z'}

title: Freezes to much
review: Lately it’s been freezing a lot and I can’t look at my Items I put like on and sometimes when I wanna post things to sale it freezes during my time describing the item I’m going to sale and while I try take pictures..... you guys really need to fix that little freeze bug because I love shopping in this app and also selling my things but if it’s going to keep doing this a lot then I’m going to have to delete my page and find a new app to sell my things in and shop from ... I’m sorry I don’t like how it acts up lately especially when you wanna purchase an item and it freezes too saying error something went wrong .... 🙃☹️😡
developerResponse:
{'id': 15577444, 'body': 'Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 

We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-05-26T15:53:09Z'}

title: Mediocre
review: I’ve used depop for years, only issue I have with it ~ is sometimes the sellers won’t ship an item for over a week, and since I’m consistently traveling as a photographer and only stayin places 1 week at a time max ~ it makes things super inconvenient when depop doesn’t send them reminders to send the item ~ it should be a 72 hour limit window maximum for the seller to ship the item, once that passes, a forced refund should happen ~ it’s like nobody takes travelers into consideration for these buying apps, which should be mandatory because the people who travel consistently are the people who are making moves in life and prospering, not somethin they should suffer a sale from.

title: Terrible Customer Service
review:
Depop offers NO seller / buyer protection, handles all transactions with a 3rd party, and has a huge scam problem. I have used nearly every clothing selling app there is & Depop is by far the worst. They use PayPal for all transactions - so not only will you be charged 10% of your sale by Depop fees, but you will also be charged with PayPal fees. Poshmark, Mercari and Vinted are all far more worth your time to sell or buy clothes. I highly recommend Poshmark if you want to be charged with less fees, receive seller protection and have acceptable customer service. 

There are far better clothing selling platforms that do NOT make you face more fees by going through PayPal as a third party. Not sure why Depop can’t handle $ on their own without using PayPal as a third party? It means more money for them and less for users.

title: Beware of (fully) setting up your PayPal on Depop
review:
Overall, cool app and cool idea; however it’s easy to get screwed out of money with the app’s big oversight.

I sold an item on Depop, using Depop’s shipping with protection. All is fine and dandy till the funds that were in my account were suddenly rescinded by PayPal, because apparently my Paypal which was linked to Depop didn’t have direct access to my bank account. PayPal refunded the buyer, the buyer took off with the item, and PayPal just said “contact the buyer to receive your money in some other way (which means “you’re outta luck”). I have since linked my bank account to PayPal, but maybe this could have been avoided if Depop mentioned something like this could have happened if my PayPal wasn’t directly linked to my bank. Well, $25 and a pair of Levi’s gone all for a lesson learned...
developerResponse: {'id': 8502869, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback. We do try to make sure that our users are aware that they need to verify their account in order to make sure things run smoothly. However, we're still here for you. If you get in touch with our support team about this they can try to reach out to the buyer for you and handle the situation in order for you to receive payment back. Just send us some love via support@depop.com.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-04T06:04:17Z'}

title: Impossible to get customer service
review: There is no help whatsoever if you have an issue. I have tried help links and it just gives you a bunch of articles to read but no selection to contact them. My buyer says they paid and the money was taken but I never received payment. I have not been able to contact anyone to look into it. It is a really aggravating ap. Does not show order or payment history. Just received an email saying they paid but don’t ship until you receive payment. That in itself does not make sense. How can you say they paid but then say don’t ship until you get payment? So did they pay or not??? It provides their address to ship to. I could see how people would get confused and ship something not paid for. I don’t recommend this ap.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5777780, 'body': "Hi Tyler, sorry to hear about your concerns. Payments go straight from the buyer's account to the seller, from our end we can see when a transaction is made. 
Most of the time if a payment is not showing is due to your PayPal account missing some verification requirements. If it is 'pending' it's likely the buyer used an eCheque so takes 7-10 days to clear. There's an article here with details - https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001790887-I-haven-t-received-my-payment

Can you let us know your username? We can check with the support team and see if they have received any reports from you and help you from there.

Love, Depop", 'modified': '2018-11-02T11:20:26Z'}

title: Customer service is a nonexistent nightmare
review:
There’s a reason Depop doesn’t have a phone number or live chat option. Depop doesn’t take accountability for their actions and good luck keeping in communication with one of their agents without receiving an unhelpful automated response.

I was scammed out of an item and when I attempted to contact Depop about it they had awful customer service throughout the endeavor. I had already filed a dispute with PayPal but Depop reps (yes plural - I talked to someone new almost every day because they continually dropped communication) would play dumb and ask me to file a dispute. I ended up describing my situation no less than 5 times. They finally vowed to do something about it literally a day before PayPal resolved it.
developerResponse: {'id': 13397570, 'body': "Hey. We're really sorry to hear your experience didn't go to plan. If you chose to pay using PayPal, they'll be responsible for processing your refund. That said, we're there to step in and help when things don't go to plan. We're sure your next experience will be a happy one, and please do reach out if there's anything we can do.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-10T12:31:23Z'}

title: Amazing interface tailored to my style!
review: I love depop’s Instagram format, it makes it super easy to scroll through clothing fast and efficiently. Their “just for you” page is well tailored to my style from the items that I’ve  favorited. As a buyer, sellers are responsive and helpful. If a package is lost or something’s wrong it’s easy to get ahold of depop’s customer service to fix it. As a seller, shipping options are flexible and I love how quick and easy it is to post and sell! If you’re looking for an easy way to find secondhand stylish and trendy items, this app is for you.
developerResponse: {'id': 16938893, 'body': "We couldn't agree more.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-28T22:46:41Z'}

title: Good but update your blocking system
review: I love depop, I use it all the time and have been pretty successful with selling items. However I really wish they would update their block system. I have another seller that I used to work with blocked for various reasons, and I opened the app the other day and saw this seller was featured on the explore page and I could see her post?? Other sellers online have listed how people they blocked for harassment can still send them messages or follow them! When I block someone I don’t want to see them or know that they can still look at my shop or contact me if they wanted too

title: Beware of scammers!!
review: So there are a lot of pros to this app, especially the fact that I can sell my clothes and whatnot. But what isn’t a pro is when it comes to “dropshipping.” It’s essentially when a shop owner pick things from an online retailer, claim it to be their own or that they hand make the items, and sell them for 2-3x the price from the original site. It’s completely unfair and nothing gets done about it. There are people who work really hard to sell the clothes that they do have or that they really did upcycle themselves, but then there are people who cheat and act as if they have their own manufactures, and it’s just messed up. Fix this depop!
developerResponse:
{'id': 11638986, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for sharing your concerns on Drop Shipping. We acknowledge that this may be having an effect on both Buyers and Sellers. We're investigating our options on a company-wide level to assess its impact on our Community. Our priority is to ensure that Depop highlights the type of items you want to see.

We will do our best to give our Community the answers and policy you deserve. 

Read the article 'What is drop shipping and is it allowed' on our Help Centre: 
https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360026573794-What-is-drop-shipping-and-is-it-allowed-on-Depop-

Stay tuned,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-04T12:10:49Z'}

title: Wish I never updated
review: So after months of procrastinating updating the app, I finally did it to make sure I wasn’t missing any new features. I was still seeing the original interface and layout of depop. Anyways, I Opened up the new updated app and instantly regretted it. The new design/layout is incredibly harsh on the eyes. Stretched font.. why? It’s hard to differentiate one listing from the next on my following feed because everything looks so cluttered and less organized than how it used to look. I don’t even wanna open the app because it hurts my eyes and head to look at. It’s a shame because it’s the main selling/buying  app I have used for the past 2 years

title: Out Of Touch With Users
review: I love selling on Depop, but Depop does NOT love their sellers. The algorithim changes constantly for no reason and harms us, with sellers questioning why they havent had a sale in months. Listing don’t even show up in search. Constant layout updates that are visually unappealing and harder to navigate. The most frustrating part? Depop constantly sides with creators who break the rules, dropship, or abuse customers. Removing negative reviews for their top sellers? A nonfuctional block button that enables harassment and stalking? Refusing to listen to our complaints on automatic free shipping? It astounds me the lack of basic functions this app has, while they constantly add features that harm sellers. Depop’s refusal to listen to the average user leaves me considering moving my shop to a different app, even though I love the community.
developerResponse: {'id': 19444426, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-30T17:27:42Z'}

title: it works good but frustrated at the notifications
review:
The app works good, I like the suggestions on my feed; it accurately understands my tastes and everything.

I’m just really frustrated at the notification system? Whenever I get a notification for a like on my listing or a message I go to that and mark them as read or click on them so the bubble disappears inside the app. But when I go to my home screen there is still a notification indicated on the app icon. This is just so frustrating to me because I like to open all notifications and keep my app icons bubble-less but Depop does not let me do that

title: Needs improvement with selling
review: This app is very good and I’ve purchased a lot of items through here and have had no trouble. But once I decided that I wanted to sell some items and that’s where is got bumpy. It was hard to retrieve a shipping label. It would say my pay pal account needed to be verified in order to view my shipping label but it was already verified. This happened on multiple occasions leading me to have to refund and cancel a lot of my sales. Again I will stick with the app and make purchases but as far as selling any items I will not be doing that through this all again. It just became a headache I didn’t want to deal with over and over again.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16193531, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-06-24T11:59:59Z'}

title: It’s good but too many scams
review: I love the app really but I wish they did something about all the scams, like people who will charge an item around $100 and say it’s one of a kind they can never find it anywhere and that’s this offer is only up for the day but then you look up the item and find out it’s only worth $20 from the actual brands company. Unfortunately way to many people on this app are over charging items they most likely found at a thrift store for $5 and a if someone doesn’t do their research they would be loosing a lot of money. I myself have bought items and then found out online it wasn’t worth as much as the seller said it was.

title: Include a My Sizes or a Size option in the “for you” search.
review:
I love the app! Perfect place both to sell and buy items and I have yet to have any issues with other users. Main reasoning for leaving this review however, is because i wanted to leave a suggestion. 
Either, inputing a “my sizes” so that we don’t have to re-enter everything with every search we make, or/and putting a sizes option in the “for you” category. Every time I look through it, i find so many things i like but its always mostly small and extra small sizes and Im no where near that, nor do i ever look for those sizes either.
developerResponse: {'id': 6356564, 'body': "That's an amazing idea! Who wants to look at things you can't have :( .. Will pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-12T13:21:52Z'}

title: popularity club
review:
I have made some sales over the past 6 months and made it on the explore page a handful of times when I was fresh on the app. Since then I have beeb uploading items weekly, but it’s now impossible to get featured. Seems like only accounts with thousands of followers or brand new accounts are considered to be shared. The app is a lot better than it was when I first joined so that’s cool, but the explore algorithm is really unfair when people will be featured with stock photos and even items not for sale. 

if this is really meant to be a way for people to sell second hand clothes around the world there should be a more equal and justified explore method. I always support other shops and I would like to also be supported!
developerResponse: {'id': 3458783, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for leaving this feedback, it's really helpful. We are constantly trying to improve the Explore function of our app, and we hope to be able to give more sellers more exposure. Stay tuned! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-14T11:50:40Z'}

title: I got scammed due to Depop's mistake.
review: There are two options to pay during checkout. One being use with a card and the other is to pay through PayPal. I chose to pay with a card, and I never received my item and it is months later and I still have not. I reported the problem and depop instructed me to resolve the problem on PayPal. It is NOT possible to get a refund through PayPal when I did not make the purchase through PayPal because the transaction information is not on PayPal, it is on my card. Even after calling PayPal and being told that it isn't possible. I have contacted Depop MANY times trying to get a refund and I keep getting the same response telling me to call PayPal. I have lost money due to Depop not taking responsibility for their mistakes and I will not be using this app again.

title: Fix the algorithm and I’ll be happy
review:
Many sellers have been affected with the new Depop algorithm. Seems like my shop gets alot of traction some days and sometimes barely at all on others. Before the update, everything seemed to be consistent. While updating listings do seem to help, it really causes such a burnout. The comment section also seems to be unneeded when we sellers focus on  PM’s. Rules should be easier to find

As a buyer, finding specific items is quite annoying because anything in Relevant is not relevant. 

besides these flaws, I really do love the app. I love the array of aesthetics and treasures I’ve got from the shops. :)

title: Won’t send me shipping labels or payment, bad customer service
review: I have used Depop for years and it never gave me a problem. Suddenly out of nowhere it tells me my PayPal isn’t verified and it won’t send me shipping labels or let me receive payment for the items I sold. I called PayPal and they said it is verified and shouldn’t be a problem so no one knows what’s going on. And customer service has ignored me for almost a week. I have buyers waiting for their items that I can’t ship, and don’t know if I can even refund since I never received payment into my PayPal, even though on the Depop app it says that it did. Depop really dropped the ball here and won’t even get back to me about the problem. This is a serious problem! I don’t know where else to complain to get this fixed so here you go.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17246758, 'body': "Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-12T22:36:28Z'}

title: My messages are not working
review: I love this app and it is the number one place I go to when selling clothes. I have been on for a little over a month now and have had no issues what so ever. All of a sudden today my messages have stopped working. Every time I click on the icon it boots me out of the app. I have tried deleting and re-downloading the app but nothing seems to be working. Is this happening to anyone else or just me? Other than this I love the app but I was wondering if this is going to get fixed anytime soon because it is making communication with customers very difficult.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16341213, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-01T15:43:41Z'}

title: New update
review: Hi depop all around is a very great app I’m in love with new things to purchase but recently when the app updated every time I search Nd scroll to click on a item I see Nd try to go bck it’ll strt me from all the way from the beginning of the search but it did not use to do that Nd it’s very frustrating because then you have to scroll down all those items again which makes me leave the app Nd come bck later on... can y’all please fix that because it was good when I culd just view an item Nd leave and be at the same point but as of now it’s just not the same
developerResponse:
{'id': 15394967, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T14:35:58Z'}

title: FIX YOUR GLITCHES!!!
review:
DEPOP! You are killing my softly the past three weeks with the glitch that freezes the app when you go to mark an item as “sold” from the ... button!
