This is making it nearly impossible to mark sold items in bundles or items I sell at flea markets and as a result I have had to refund customers multiple times through PayPal and let down customers because they had purchased an item that was already SOLD because I was unable to mark it as such! 

I have been using this app for almost 5 years and depop is the source of half my income and it’s extremely frustrating that this issue that is not under my control is effecting my business and reputation as a seller so greatly! FIX THIS ISSUE!!!

title: Sounds good in theory, but...
review: I really liked Depop for awhile. I found a few good items but found it increasingly difficult to find things I actually liked because it’s full of people selling awful, cheap thrift store finds, labeling them as “vintage” and selling them at insanely marked up prices. The last few times I have actually found things I want to buy, something goes wrong. Sellers will delete the items I’m just about to purchase, someone will buy it out from under me, or the last few times sellers have claimed to have lost the items after I have already bought them and I have to wait and wait for a refund. I’m never buying anything on Depop again and have deleted the app. I wouldn’t waste your time.

title: Recommendation for easier sorting
review:
I really love the app and the idea that surrounds it. I’ve bought some really cool stuff on here and I’m becoming slowly more addicted.

One thing that could be improved is the area where you can sort your likes into groups. Whenever I try to do it the app kind of freaks out because of all the changes being made and then glitches to say I have zero likes or groups for a bit. 

A recommendation I have is to be able to click on a group and then have an “add to this group option” where you could then pick from your past ‘likes’ to organize into that specific group. Currently when you want to put a previously liked item into a new group you have to dislike it, like it again, and then pick the desired group which is a hassle and causes the app to glitch like I said before if you’re trying to do it too fast. 

Basically, for a quick summary, it’d be nice to organize your past likes more easily into new folders.
developerResponse: {'id': 12793867, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing your suggestions along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-01-08T11:58:22Z'}

title: Love the app! But please make better computer/browser interface.
review: I love Depop; it is such an incredible way to buy sustainable clothes and for people to make money. However, I would really like to see a better online interface that can be accessed on the computer. Online shopping is usually easier online rather than on an app, and Depop is great in that their app is amazing (probably because it’s intended to be an app), but I would also like to shop Depop on a web browser on my computer. Currently that interface is bad and doesn’t even have all of the functioning features the app does. Please make a better web browser interface!!

title: Sketchy app, sellers not reliable
review: More often than not I’ve purchased things on this app and either had to jump through hoops to get them, messaging the seller multiple times, or the purchase has simply been refunded either by the seller or by force thru Paypal because the seller’s item was no longer available. The feedback system is also unreliable because I cannot submit feedback unless an item has been marked as shipped. If a seller doesn’t communicate the shipping info, there’s no way for me to leave a review. So if the seller never sent the item and refunded my money after having it tied up for weeks with little communication, I can’t rate that transaction. Sometimes I get lucky on this app and find some neat things, but more often than not I just get my hopes up.
developerResponse: {'id': 4540776, 'body': "Sorry to read about your experience! We'll be sure to bring this up with the relevant teams here in our office. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-06T12:08:20Z'}

title: It’s like a cross between Etsy and a thrift store
review: Personally I sell clothes I’ve worn like once and don’t want anymore, clothes I bought and modified, and magnets I hand make and people have bought all 3 it’s a really versatile buying/selling platform and I love that there’s no listing fee. Other features I really like are: you can choose how you want to ship and set your own prices if you choose to do your own shipping, super simple to set up if you want to have a %off sale for some or all of your items. But 10/10 would recommend
developerResponse: {'id': 13036136, 'body': 'Thanks for the rave review. Giving you a platform where you can buy, sell and discover is our top priority. So keep connecting.\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-01-21T09:46:38Z'}

title: Great! But...
review:
This app is great!! But recently with new updates, I have a few issues with it. The “My DNA” section is very clunky and does not even appeal to my interests. I much preferred the explore page and the “for you” on the same page! 

Also, I have noticed there are a lot of differences between the desktop version and the app version. Just recently i finally was able to get the desktop updates on the app. It’s nice, but also very frustrating. 

Overall, this is a great app and community, but these are just some things that have gotten in the way of the smooth-running of the app!

title: Ideas
review: I really like this app, but I feel like you should add more to the app to make it more comfortable and simple in mobile. I think you should add scrolling infinity throughout someone’s page; because needing to click to view, then ex out, then click the next one is just too long. Another thing you should add is a slot or make articles of popular Depop users and write abt them or they write something up, and maybe I think what others would agree is have something that would show what’s the trend this month, week, or season like ThreadsObsessed. Overall I rlly like this app! Keep up the work!

title: Was okay at first...
review: I’ve been using depop for about a year, and at first it was pretty good and an easy way to buy and sell clothes. As the updates kept rolling out and the shipping prices kept going up and up the app started to decline and I started to get items removed and emails from depop threatening to delete my account. They recently sent me an email about taking down my account if i continue to list $1 items and try to ship it with their shipping which makes no sense as to why they’re so against it?? I have never tried to scam depop or anyone on depop and dont understand why out of nowhere they’re so trigger happy when it comes to taking down items and accounts who do nothing wrong. It’s honestly ridiculous.
developerResponse: {'id': 3800348, 'body': 'Hey there! Could you let us know your Depop @username so we can provide a little more context around what happened here? Thanks! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-06-11T15:07:54Z'}

title: Push Notifications When Someone Posts
review: It’s a good app and way to make money. However, my only problem with this app thus far is I want to be able to get a notification when someone that I follow posts a new thing to buy . Because If I don’t do that, I would continually have to go back on the app and refresh which gets annoying because what If one day I forget? Also , sometimes when I come back to refresh somebody has already bought the item, so it’s too late. So please Depop If you guys could allow push notifications when someone you follow just posts an Item.

title: NOT HAPPY
review: This app use to be great. I sold a lot of stuff and would ship out all the items the day someone would buy it so I was very fast  After having my account for only a week, depop suspended my account for no reason. Maybe it was glitch or something but i didn’t even receive an email with an explanation as to why my account was suspended. I have items that I need to ship out that people bought and now i can’t. Hopefully they get their money back or they reopen my account because I didn’t do anything. I contacted their support team which took a day to respond and sent a broad scripted email (from a robot) saying how i broke guidelines  The guidelines they listed, I did not break so i’m hoping i can get my account back because this is quite random and pretty unfair.

title: Allows users to scam you
review:
I have used this app for years, but after my last experience there’s no way I’m going to get rip offed again. There is a seller who I purchased an item from who never sent the item after months of waiting and after messaging her directly to ask what is up. 

When I informed depop they said my only recourse was to file something with PayPal, who have been difficult to work with. Meanwhile, this sellers page is still up and I can’t even leave a 1 star review to warn others because technically I never received an item from here. So I left comments on every single one of her items to warn others and ask for my item. I get a message from another depop user who says the same thing happened to them! Why won’t depop ban users who are STEALING?
developerResponse:
{'id': 9609711, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for coming to us with this. All in-app purchases made using the buy button are covered by Buyer Protection. Find out more here: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001772448-I-haven-t-received-my-item

If you're struggling to get help on this, either hit us up via in app support by going to 'SETTINGS - SUPPORT - NEED HELP?' or drop us a line to support@depop.com and we'll do our best to set this right. Remember that you can also report items/users in app if something sneaky is going on.

Let's get you happy again,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-11T09:31:57Z'}

title: good idea, but not worth it in the end
review: This app is a great idea and I was surprised how many people saw my items and were interested. However, when it comes to actually selling and shipping your clothes, I found the process to not be worth it. If you choose “ship with depop”, the buyer will pay for shipping but once you ship, an “automatic payment” to depop will come out of your paypal for “shipping + a depop fee.” Which is super annoying and I ended up paying out of pocket for shipping even though I chose an option that made it seem like the buyer would pay for shipping. In the end, I only made about $7 for an item i posted for $12. Definitely not worth it unless you have a good system for shipping without cost to you. Would not recommend and will be deleting my account.

title: Amazing App
review: This app was the answer to my prayers. That other one posh mark demands high end and near perfect condition items. What about vintage? What about cute stuff that might have a little hole in it but you want to get rid of for a reasonable price? It’s amazing because it brings people together to reuse and make a little extra cash (or a lot of you work really hard at it). For the most part the Depop community is wonderful and I’ve had 98% good experiences. The one criticism I have of the app is that it updates like weekly! It’s crazy, every time I got to open it, it seems it needs a new update and it’s pretty annoying!
developerResponse: {'id': 4690997, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving us a review! We release updates often because we want to provide our users with feature improvements or glitch fixes ASAP; we hope you agree that this is worth it. Thanks again! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-08-16T16:00:01Z'}

title: It is OK
review:
I love the sentiment and general purpose of the app. Second hard shopping is next best to not buying sustainability wise and I love that each seller can curate an instagram-esque vibe for their shop. 

BIG bummer that the prices are done from the search feature. Makes it even harder to sort and find things you find interesting / willing to purchase when doing a general search. This change is part of the reason I don’t really find this app user friendly anymore (along w the many glitches that happen constantly.) But tbh, this is the best app for selling second hand so can’t really complain too much.

title: Bugs and they’re annoying
review:
1. Items that have been sold isn’t marked as “SOLD”. I have to manually do them now. 
2. When changing default photo for the listed item (on mobile app and desktop site), it doesnt change and if I do it on desktop site, it doesn’t change at all. Have to constantly refresh.
3. Rearranging my items on desktop site doesn’t always change on the app. I have to constantly refresh and rearrange. 
4. The messaging interface on desktop site is really confusing. I can easily send a message to the wrong person. 
5. When updating a listing, please stop putting the item to the top of the list! Defeats the purpose of having to rearrange items.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18967835, 'body': "Hey there,

We can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-08T17:29:22Z'}

title: Great design and idea, too much work to build a following
review:
Seems like this would work better if you saw more in your feed than just the people you follow - more like eBay or a Facebook marketplace. That way you don’t have to spend hours building “relationships” with people in order to get your items seen. But then I suppose you wouldn’t get as addicted to the app. Seriously consider what your time is worth folks - are you making more than minimum wage making content for this app?

App is beautifully designed though - like the extended sans serif font - makes it different and funky looking. The creativity of its users is as impressive as Instagram.
developerResponse: {'id': 12336441, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-11T10:26:47Z'}

title: Heads up for Those using the App abroad
review:
My experience from beginning to end was displeasing. 

As an American living in London I would almost always have a UK customer upset or confused about why my items were in USD. I was even called ‘retarded’ for it. Many UK  users of the App are not too educated on how PayPal works. Nor are they aware that PayPal does its own conversion by purchasing from international accounts. Even after reporting a user for his abusive responses from his own lack of knowledge. I wasn’t helped very much but customer service. And the agent ended the chat quickly not caring about a serious problem with the information flaws many of their users have in the UK. 

I’ve taken down my store and deleted the app. eBay is a much easier platform when selling items living abroad.

title: Little girls & awful customer service
review: I have been on DEPOP for about a year & I do like how you can leave reviews, and that the DEPOP fee is only 10%. However...the audience on this app tends to be little/immature girls/women, it’s more of a social media app then selling. I’ve been reported for not lowering my items to please the potential buyer, and I feel as if this made my account a target to DEPOP. Big name brand items, like Reformation or Marc Jacobs started being removed simply because I would say “this reminds me *insert brand* - while countless other accounts, BIGGER accounts were using other brands for exposure with NO consequences. The “DEPOP” team is a joke, it’s like a robot is just emailing you & not an actual person. I will be switching over to Poshmark, a 20% fee is way better then dealing with this all this BS.
developerResponse: {'id': 4691549, 'body': "Hey there - please note that our actions wouldn't be swayed by reports that we deem unjustified, such as those you wrote in about. We discourage 'reminds of of x brand' posts as we find this can be misleading. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-16T16:41:18Z'}

title: DEPOP SHUTS DOWN SMALL BUSINESSES
review:
I really liked Depop in the beginning. I had 11 reviews & 17 orders through them. I wake up one day to find out they shut my account down while I had two open orders which weren’t refunded. one I can’t even tell where it’s supposed to go. They claim they shut down my account because of DRUGS AND DRUG PARAPHERNALIA. I make resin ashtrays with real Mary Jane leaves & actual bud but you can not take the bud or the leaf out & use it in anyway. It’s becomes a solid after the resin hardens. This is a huge disappointment to me. They said they contacted me previously but I have no record of any previous contact from them. 
I’ve sent several emails just to hear back that the decision is final.  Ashtrays can’t be used to smoke or anything of that sort. Very disappointing. It’s decor not paraphernalia.
developerResponse: {'id': 19676236, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.\n \nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-10T15:46:01Z'}

title: Filter function
review: I have some big annoyances with the way things are coming through my filters when I’m browsing. I have the specific sizes I’ve selected to only view when I’m browsing categories, however the entire feed is giving me things that are tagged as ‘one size’, (always brandy melville stuff somehow??) even though I don’t have ‘one size’ selected on my filter function. things that are ‘one size’ do not in fact fit most people, thus I wouldn’t want to look at something made as one size. this makes it extremely hard to really sift through everything on the feed. i don’t know if this is a seller problem, or an app problem, but it keeps me from wanting to even bother browsing for stuff to buy.

title: Needs to fix the app login
review: (rewrite because I accidentally clicked out of the notification where they replied so i wasn’t able to see it) I made an account on here like a year ago with my old email that i’ve tried to get into but i can’t and I can’t figure out my password for the depop account. So you would think that i could just make another account, but no. If i use my number i can’t make another account because it’ll just tell me to log in. When i did have this app i loved it so that’s why the stars are high but please fix your login or please help me. Thank you:)
developerResponse:
{'id': 18883581, 'body': 'Hey there,

We’re sorry to hear this and we can imagine how frustrating this must be. Could you please submit a support request via this link http://bit.ly/depoplockedout
 Please remember to include your:
- Username
- Email address
- Phone number
- Phone operating system, example iOS 13
 
Let’s get this sorted,
Team Depop', 'modified': '2020-11-03T23:00:30Z'}

title: do NOT buy in depop
review: I never do app reviews but I need to warn other people so you don’t get scammed. This online shoppping service is so poorly put together, if you’re a buyer or a seller, you can easily get scammed both ways even if you’re being smart. If you want to cancel an item because the seller won’t respond after weeks, you can’t, you have to do it yourself and file a paypal dispute. This doesn’t seem that bad, right? Nooo, if you purchased using a guest paypal acc there’s no way of accessing your purchases made. Any other shopping service would never make the buyer go through this cancellation process if they used in app purchasing system. This app is a MESS. It make have cute clothes but it’s nottt worth it. Please just use Poshmark or Mercari. Their services are wayy better.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14783965, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-04-20T11:37:09Z'}

title: Mediocre at best
review: The concept of the app itself is excellent and could help bring everyone in the selling world closer. However, depop takes its 10% including shipping so if you ship anything internationally you end up losing a majority of your funds. Not to mention the apps “browsing” or feed is garbage and does not bring a fair broadcasting unless you already have a 1000 followers. Pretty hard to sell stuff if nobody sees it and when you do sell stuff depop then claims a large portion of the purchase so you end up losing money. Great concept, pitiful execution.

title: i love it, but... (edited)
review: i love this app. i’ve bought and sold so many things and it is so reliable and safe. only thing is, i’ve been in many instances where i needed to send or receive pictures of items, and the app doesn’t have that as an option. you have to get the persons other social media to be able to send pictures. i think the app would be way more accessible if that one thing was added. ALSO. i tried ordering a phone from a guy for $200 and i soon as the payment went through he deleted his account. i had to work to get my money back, but depop is full of scammers. please find a way to verify all sellers.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12164081, 'body': "Hey Audrey. Thanks for this great suggestion - we love hearing from the Community about what would improve their experience. I'll pass thing along to the team.

Sorry to hear about your recent purchase, we offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

Keep at it,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-02T15:44:44Z'}

title: Amamzing!
review: I started my DEPOP account exactly a week ago. I started by putting up a backpack and immediately in ten seconds, I got tons of messages asking to buy my product. I was absolutely amazed! Shipping and money transfer was easy and simple for both the buyer and seller. This app is amazing, because not only does it help make money for young people, but it helps boost people’s business minds, and help them improve as a whole (like being aware of spending money). Have your kids start out with something small, it’s definitely worth a try!
developerResponse: {'id': 4797543, 'body': "Welcome to Depop! We love reading reviews such as yours and we're glad you've had a top start to your Depop experience. Here's to many more sales! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-24T15:35:08Z'}

title: Decent App, but Few Problems
review: I like the app overall cause it’s nice for finding unique items while also putting some money in the pocket of a seller. My only problem is with the filter option if the app. I would appreciate if I could filter out what’s already been sold, rather than getting excited, clicking on an item, and then come to a screeching halt when I see it’s sold already. It would make my shopping and browsing experience easier and quicker, because instead of sitting through clothing racks at my local goodwill, I’m sorting through sold and unsold items.
developerResponse: {'id': 6695498, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback and that is such a great point to bring to us. We want you to avoid the clothing racks and enjoy a smooth ride, baby. We will make sure to pass this on to the team and make sure your voice is heard.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-01-06T15:51:37Z'}

title: Awesome
review:
As a buyer and a seller, depop has been amazing to me. The format is user friendly and makes it easy to sell and buy in a safe way, and often an affordable one too. I just wish instead they’d add to the buyer’s cost for a depop fee instead of taking away from the seller’s gain since often its calculated meticulously to make sure that they
make enough and also you could save items to sell later; along with that, a send photo in chat option. I hate asking customers for their insta/snap just to get one little thing done. Other than that, super easy! Way better than Etsy.
developerResponse: {'id': 6142999, 'body': "We do get that it's easier to get more photos within the platform itself, this is something we're looking into. We love your feedback and you're amazing for being part of our community.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-11-28T11:10:49Z'}

title: Best Clothing Resale App To Date
review: I like Depop because it helps sellers and buyers both have a quick, easy, and secure platform to purchase and or sell clothes and other such things. Only bug I’ve encountered is the notification bubble not going away after I’ve checked it multiple times not a big issue to most but it triggers my OCD. Otherwise the app is user friendly has very simple navigation fast loading practically anywhere. Really happy with this app in my opinion it is a lead ahead of Poshmark and other resale apps.
developerResponse: {'id': 19351372, 'body': "We're glad you love Depop as much as we do.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-25T17:26:58Z'}

title: Terrible costumer service!
review: Everything was going fine on Depop until I ordered a sweatshirt from this 12 weeks ago girl and it still has not came, i messaged Depop because I was supposed to have buyer protection they sent me email saying I needed to message them again because I did not go through the right way. I messaged them again and it has been 2 months and they have not responded at all! So I decided to message them again after that telling them they haven’t done anything and I wanted my money back. They emailed me this automated response saying they were going to check it out, it has now been almost 2 months since I sent that and I have gotten no reply back! They obviously do not care about their costumers concerns, I will not be using depop anymore!

title: DOESNT ALLOW ME TO POST LISTINGS
review: so i’m sitting literally right next to the router and my listing says failed to post, every time i re try to post the listing, everytime i go back and add all the details and pictures it just says failed to post and when i press a retry button it doesn’t even load it just stays at failed to post. it only let me post two listings and then now the app just doesn’t work to let me post listings. this never happened to me before and i think depop is a dope app but it’s not being so cool right now and i am getting frustrated.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17657006, 'body': " 
Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-02T21:10:05Z'}

title: NO SALES HORRIBLE UPDATE
review: I remember giving this app a 5 star review. I loved buying from here, I transition to buying mostly second hand and depop WAS my FAV app. I would be on it more than instagram. I started making good money and payed off my credit card. I really loved this app, but now that there’s been an update it has completely ruined everything. Both sellers and buyers are complaining. The search engine is horrible, people are barely getting likes or traffic in their shops. Top sellers seem to be the only ones making sales. Those of us who depend on the app for our income are really struggling. As a caregiver i had to quit my job to take care of my mother, I really depended on Depop. Now I’m desperately looking for another platform, I think Mercari is really good so I may transition to that.
developerResponse: {'id': 8502556, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback. We believe PP is a great way to add additional coverage for our seller's and buyer's. However, we always believe there's room for improvement and our currently looking into adding additional payment methods to our platform to increase user experience. We got you. \n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-05-04T04:33:39Z'}

title: A Suggestion
review: I love this app!!! I’ve been using it for over two years as a seller and have found a new community. I have one suggestion that would make things as a seller so much easier. I would be great to see how many people have saved your item (like on Instagram analytics). Saving has become the new wave on Depop, as a way to hide special finds from the public, and it would be so cool if sellers were notified when their items were saved to get a better sense of how their customers are liking their products!
developerResponse: {'id': 10130656, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for the rave review and incredible feedback. We love hearing from our users about what we can do to improve Depop for everyone. I'll be passing this one along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-08-12T14:45:34Z'}

title: Needs fixes!!!!
review:
This is a very simple app to use but needs fixes! Every single time I get a notification and check it in the app, it still shows the red notification bubble above the app when I exit out. It takes 3 tries just to click the app, refresh, exit out and do it again just for it to go away. Please fix this because I can’t tell when I haven’t checked a notification or not since it never goes away!!! 

I also hate how users follow and then unfollow accounts just to get for followers, I’m trying to sell clothes not get the most followers ugh.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12297970, 'body': "Hey there. I can totally feel your frustration with this. I've escalated your issue to our Tech team who are going to look into why this is occurring. 

Check out our Seller's Handbook for some tips on how to be the best Seller out there, head to ‘Settings - Need help’ and type in Sellers Handbook.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-09T16:27:12Z'}

title: Literally the best app to sell/buy things on.
review: If you don't have this app yet, get it. It's extremely easy to use and learn. They make sure all purchase are secure and go through the "buy now" button which is linked to your PayPal. It's literally Instagram for selling things (but better). The simple layout of depop allows your products to speak for themselves and it also gives the app a modern feel. They have revolutionized how people will shop in a way that doesn't pressure you and is very familiar. I am honored to write this review. ❤️
developerResponse: {'id': 3458985, 'body': 'And we are honoured to receive it, thank you so much! We hope you keep loving the app. Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-05-14T12:05:42Z'}

title: Don’t expect a refund on an item never shipped
review: As many mentioned before if you end up coming across a seller that is unresponsive and you never receive your purchased item, don’t expect a refund. When you contact Depop they’ll just direct to PayPal however making a claim with PayPal under the circumstances it is actually impossible to get your money back because you have to have a way to prove it and stating the person never sent the item isn’t a good enough reason apparently. When I emailed Depop on multiple occasions saying this they sent me the same message over and over again. I really did love the app but I’ll never use it again in fear of losing money and I suggest you do the same. Read the comments below I’m not the only one this happens to.
developerResponse: {'id': 4753648, 'body': "Hey there - we generally find that PayPal's dispute resolution process is fair and that in the instance you've outlined you should get your money back. Depop Protection does also exist to fill in any gaps PayPal may have left, and so we'd encourage you to contact us on support@depop.com wit a summary of your issue and screenshots of your conversation with PayPal to see what we may be able to do. Thanks - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-21T14:47:16Z'}

title: Wish I could give it all 5 stars
review:
I love this app, first and foremost. I put off using it for ages cause I knew how much I'd love the idea of using an app like this. So I've happily purchased a couple of items from sellers who looked like they were selling straight from their closet, digging hours through a search to find that right match to my new summer wardrobe. Well... These purchases are great, thus far. Two have arrived already in great condition and the next one comes tomorrow. In brief, this app scratches a type of itch that I and many others seem to relate to. We wanna buy cool clothing from other people like us or independent clothing businesses. 

Here's where I took a star off. The explore page could use... um.. work.

When I open it, there are great colors, great quality products, and great photography...

By the same f---ing sellers, every day. It seems like some sort of favoritism that entirely discourages me from wanting to post items of my own.

That's all I have to say. Thanks Depop.
developerResponse: {'id': 3801208, 'body': "Hey there! Thank you for this honest review and we're glad you did finally join us! The Explore page is a function that we are working hard to refine, as we hear that more users want more visibility on it. Please rest assured this is a common aim we have here in the office, and we hope you'll notice improvements as the year wears on. Thanks again - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-11T16:21:16Z'}

title: Simple interface but still needs improvement
review:
I’ve been using this app for about a year and I’ve sold and bought items no problem. I just wish there were more specific categories and some more “unisex” options for clothes like t shirts and hoodies. Also a category for toys and collectibles which is mainly what I try and sell, but since I have to put it in the kids or home category every post usually gets lost. 

I see a lot of complaints about the feature/explore page and I agree to an extent. Why have sold items there? And why feature the same big sellers when there’s plenty of small accounts with great items/images. 

Another suggestion would be to let sellers send images through private message and to be able to add more photos to the original listing. I like to see a gallery of images and I’m sure many other buyers agree as well. 

Overall this app is great for what it’s supposed to do, but it still needs to smooth out the kinks. It’s got potential to be a great selling app.
developerResponse: {'id': 3800547, 'body': "Hey there! This is all very useful and relevant feedback. We're experimenting with new ideas for the Explore page which we hope will bring some improvements. Whilst we don't have plans to implement some of the other ideas, we'll definitely be bringing this up with our product teams here in the office, so thank you! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-11T15:18:37Z'}

title: Great at but we need more stuff from the website added to the app
review: The idea for this company is great and making an app for it makes it easier for new people who aren’t often on their computers to sell what they need to sell. But this switch from computer to app is missing a few things. Things like rearranging your listed items and moving sold items to the bottom is not something that’s been added but we need these things to make our jobs look neat and professional.

title: It’s okay but needs a lot of work
review: First, items disappear from my saved and likes on the daily and they are hard to find after. And, they weren’t even deleted because when i search again they come up. Also, when i was selling an item, the shipping label was not attached in any of my emails that you receive when someone buys. Which they had before, but they didn’t now and i had to pay seven dollars for shipping myself even though it was on the option “buyer pays shipping.” Finally, this app REALLY overcharges for shipping when you don’t include in the cost of your item. It’s cheaper if you include it in the cost of your item and just buy the shipping label yourself at the post office.

title: All is Fun & Games until you Get Screwed Over
review: At first, I genuinely enjoyed this app. While the posts were never in order, the items people listed were so unique and fairly cheap depending on the seller. I made a couple purchases, one of them having a couple bumps but it quickly being sorted over. I then decided to buy a shirt from a seller for twenty dollars but came to realize about two weeks later she was creating fake listings and not shipping out orders. Her page was taken down and Depop did nothing to alert me that the seller, who had my hard-earned money, was fraudulent and was not planning on shipping out my item. Still waiting on a refund. If you want a good selling & buying app please download Mercari.
developerResponse: {'id': 2933324, 'body': "Hey there - sorry to read about this experience with a seller. When things like this do go wrong, PayPal's dispute resolution process will protect you and help you retrieve your money. If you need any help on how to go about this, then please don't hesitate to contact our support team who will be best placed to help. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-26T11:15:22Z'}

title: A little bit of honesty
review:
If you want to sell clothes and overprice your stuff (because they take 10%), this is your app!! Their costumer service for sellers? Non-existing ( I still have unanswered requests and emails since 3 months ago).
You might not sell a lot since they from time to time have problems with the algorithm (giving small stores ZERO chance to gain followers or likes). 
And again, the percent they take is ridiculous compared to the awful costumer service. 
Overall if something goes wrong during the transaction, the experience with Depop it’s frustrating.
developerResponse: {'id': 19468818, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-01T15:35:20Z'}

title: Almost Perfect
review: I’ve had Depop for almost two years now, and it’s been my godsend when it comes to finding what I’m looking for at an affordable price. There’s just one problem: the search. When I search up a key phrase like “combat boots” (seems vague enough to pull up many results), it shows me items that have NOTHING to do with my search. This is making it very frustrating for me to look for specific items, and I instead have to rely on friends telling me about different shops. I’m not sure if this is a hashtag issue or just Depop itself, but it’s enough to dock a star.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18829998, 'body': "Hey Nik,

As we speak, we're working on some exciting new updates that will prioritise accurately described items, not those with irrelevant tags. It's something we're constantly developing changes around. Highlighting the items our community want to see is a top priority. 

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-11-01T16:45:00Z'}

title: I like the app, but...
review:
I really do like Depop, but I’ve been having major issues with posts popping up on my Made For You tab that aren’t actually selling anything. It almost feels like they’re taking over.

So many “In Search Of” and “stop overpricing Brandy Melville clothes” posts have been clogging up my feed making it very hard to enjoy looking through the app.

I think this could easily be solved with a “Not Interested” option on posts. This could help make sure that the posts shown truly are tailored to the viewers tastes and make it an over-all more enjoyable experience.

title: the updates are worse not better
review: The app is getting worse with the new updates. It isn’t that hard to just leave the app be.😌 It was great before, just change it back! The update removed the ability to pick a bunch of sizes from different categories and shop all at once. “My sizes” doesn’t work, it shows other sizes and I like to choose different sizes depending on the brands/ clothing styles I shop from because different brands have different sizing. Also, there has to be some way to stop people from misusing tags and tagging a bunch of different things/brands that have nothing to do with what they are selling. Every time I search for a brand that I like, there are people that are posting different items and just tagging that brand.

title: ADDICTED!
review: I love DEPOP! It is a really great way for me to sell my product! I have been using depop for about 3-4 years now and since using depop my product has sold even more than I honestly expected! Depop is very, very diverse and the support team answers all of your questions efficiently. I couldn't ask for a better app to sell my art. They also feature your product to allow exposure which I think is awesome! I wish I still lived in NY so that I could attend depop events & etc. *crosses fingers for Colorado events* I honestly wish I could hug a depop team member!!

title: i love depop but
review:
i hate the rating system. i use and purchase from the app frequently, but whenever i need to leave a review i am forced to leave a 5-star even if the experience was not worthy. i feel forced because if i leave a bad review and they haven’t review yet, they usually just give me the same 
rating. if you give them 2-star for that, NO MATTER WHAT, they will vote you back a 2-star. so i wish that you guys could improve the app by keeping the ratings anonymous until both parties have sent their reviews in. it would make it easier for people to have more truthful ratings.
developerResponse: {'id': 8111650, 'body': "Hey there! Thank you for your feedback. We totally believe in fair feedback and this is why you can always reach out to the support team and they'll have a look into your case. The feedback can always be removed should the dispute be closed in your favour.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-04-08T12:18:03Z'}

title: Worst buying and selling app
review: As someone who uses Poshmark, which I love, I figured depop would be similar. I’ve bought things from multiple sellers, luckily everyone I have bought from has been legit but I’ve seen other people who have gotten scammed. It is so easy to scam people as depop has a hands off approach. They shift the blame to PayPal and force users to have disputes with PayPal. I’ve had awful experiences with PayPal but to use depop you must use PayPal. In addition to this, there is often no tracking on the your order and if it gets lost many users claim they aren’t responsible after shipping. Depop could solve this by including tracking on all orders, like Poshmark. Overall depop has a tempting aesthetic but I believe it could be better. I would advise people to avoid it if they can.
developerResponse: {'id': 6885405, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for getting back to us. As part of our T&C's we find a valid proof of postage to be tracked, if there's any issues with this we always make sure to let the seller's and buyer know of this. We want to make sure our users are protected so we have PayPal and Depop protection in place. If yu have had any issues with PayPal, please do get in touch with the support team and they will try to support you along the way and find a solution together.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-01-17T13:47:25Z'}

title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
review: First of all, this is a great app to make some extra money and user friendly as well. Their FAQs can be helpful if you just have some simple questions. DO NOT email them for support or tweet because they won’t get back to you on time. I’ve been waiting for a week to get actual help and no one is helping me. DO NOT use Depop Payment and opt for PayPal instead when you’re selling because the Depop Payment is absolutely flawed. I’ve seen people waiting 2 weeks after their sales to receive the payouts and it’s been longer than 2 weeks for me. So yes, I recommend Depop but I don’t recommend their Depop Payment option and also their customer service needs much improvement.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16568336, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-12T17:02:33Z'}

title: Size Update
review: Ever since the new update, my sizes default that are optional in your profile don’t filter out in the search feature. For example, if I search a brand and then slide the bar to show only my sizes within the search, it shows items that aren’t my size. It’s honestly pretty annoying to have to turn off my sizes and then go back and select them each, again. Please fix this as it’s become a hassle, especially because DEPOP keeps messaging/putting on notifications for you to edit your sizes in your profile. Also, having a ton of difficulty shipping with APO AP addresses, which I’ve emailed DEPOP a toooon about 🙄🙄.
developerResponse:
{'id': 12645749, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. It sounds like your app could do with a little refresh. 

Please try removing cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 

Still crashing? Drop us a line by going to 'profile - settings - need help - technical issues - send us a report'.

Let's get this fixed,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-30T10:21:59Z'}

title: some suggestions
review:
I’m on depop everyday. I’m an active buyer and seller. One thing that frustrates me, is that I don’t always get left reviews once a buyer receives one of their items thy purchased from me. I think it would be a good idea to keep reminding buyers in-app to leave a review for specific items. Maybe have a notification pop up saying i.e. : “Have you received your item from ____?” option for yes no, and if pressed yes “Great! Don’t forget to leave them a review”. Or something along those lines. I know that I base most of my buys off the sellers reviews and it would be great to have all of mine in. 

Thanks!
developerResponse: {'id': 2865202, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving this review! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-03-19T12:10:42Z'}

title: Great App but Customer Service Not So Much
review:
I’m loving this app! I’ve sold and bought a handful of things and only been on the app for about 3 months. 
Their guidelines for selling are great and I really like the layout of the whole thing! 
The whole concept is amazing! Love it! 

I do wish I could give 5 stars but I’ve had some problems with customer service. Either there’s no response at all or an incredibly unhelpful automatic email response.  I’ve had better luck finding answers online outside of depop from other users struggling with similar issues than from their customer service. 
 I think a good improvement would be to set up a phone number or a chat room to help users out with easy fix problems.  If it’s a bug problem, I understand all you can do is wait for an update but for questions, concerns, scams, etc. a chat room or phone number would make users more comfortable I think. 
Besides that, I’m loving this app! :)
developerResponse:
{'id': 18051268, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-23T12:33:58Z'}

title: Love Hate Relationship
review:
I love Depop in that it’s super easy to buy and sell things technically, but the explore feed issue I’ve seen people bring up is a huge problem 

The market is super saturated with the most popular accounts constantly being advertised, and shown several times over on the explore feed.

Not to mention the issue of leaving feedback when the item is still in “shipped” mode, I had a seller never send me an item and I wasn’t even able to leave feedback saying that she didn’t. I contacted customer service and they were no help at all, saying that the labels expire after 30 days (which in several instances I’ve seen is not true)

The platform is great if they focused on giving everyone a fair shot at being featured and promoted-not just the 10k+ accounts who resell thrifted items.
And I’m saying this not only as a seller but as a buyer-where it’s hard to find new pages that I enjoy because i’m always seeing the same ones.

Love Depop. Just wish it could be made even better.

title: Super good app
review:
Honestly it’s like a buying version of Instagram (not complaining). It was surprisingly easy to sell and I’ve found some pretty nice stuff to buy on here.
The only thing I’d request is if there was a way we could turn off the explore page and etcetera like a “seller mode” where we mostly only see messages and our own items, and “buyer mode” where we can see everything. Just a preference because I find myself getting distracted on here and a seller mode would help me be more focused on selling.
But this is my go to selling app and it works very well!!!

title: Love it but alas, the explore page ...
review: I really love Depop and I’ve been using it for a while, originally for purchasing unique pieces but now to sell things of my own. It’s very user friendly and has a super engaging interface. However, it’s frustrating how often the SAME sellers are featured on the explore page over and over again. Not only that, but these sellers have tons of followers already. I wish Depop tried to discover newer, lesser known users to feature who are still posting high quality content but just haven’t garnered a ton of traction yet. Please try to do this Depop!
developerResponse: {'id': 4768306, 'body': 'And we love our users! Thank you! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-08-22T13:28:04Z'}

title: Notifications are annoying
review: I’ve had positive experiences with Depop, but I’m not a fan of their notifications. I don’t want suggestions for larger shops or “customized” picks for me, as these tend to be unrelated to the clothes I’m interested in. I’ve tried customizing my settings in the app so I only get notifications for when I get comments, messages, and when I sell an item, but I still get suggestions for shops that I don’t care about, like EVERY day. I don’t want to turn off notifications through settings on my phone because I don’t want to miss an alert if I sell something. Please provide the option to limit notifications!
developerResponse:
{'id': 16865921, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-25T15:59:47Z'}

title: Great for the buyer- NOT for the seller :(
review: I’ve been selling on Depop for over a year now and honestly you’re better off on Etsy or Poshmark. I have had so many issues with the app, whether it’s them blaming me for THEIR issues with Paypal or the fact that they take out a huge percentage of all my profits. It’s ridiculous and after dealing with all of this with ZERO complaints they have suspended my account for not paying “shipping fees” even though that should be automatically taken out. Not to mention they can’t even respond to me in a timely manner to try and fix the problem :( so upset and so disappointed that my account has now been suspended for 24 hours- lol i’m just gonna just keep all the “shipping money” i supposedly stole and stop using the app xoxo

title: honestly .. not good
review: Terrible people on this app. I know the creators can’t control that but they should offer more buyer protection like they say they do. Paypal is a nightmare and if someone scams you (happened to me four time on this app) you have to wait months for a refund. It’s really so frustrating with the depop tax too. Maybe i’m just not finessing the system of selling and buying well enough but I’ve have my fair share of scammers and lack of money earned from selling from this app. HARD PASS. Two stars for the nice layout and cool items ... but cmon people. is it REALLY that hard to refund us directly?! Also take down accounts that are scammers . there’s a handful of them still up there selling fake items !!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 12645912, 'body': "Hey. We moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking the 3 dots (...) top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

As for refunds, we hear you, and we're working on something to make this easier for our users. So stay tuned. In the meantime, feel free to drop us a follow up message through the refund process. We're always happy to update and guide you throughout your journey.

We've got you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-30T10:29:12Z'}

title: Double Check
review: This app has AWESOME listings and frequently I can find a rare item that I just can’t find anywhere else. For example I found a shirt that was a special edition in the 90s of a particular brand I like. I searched all over and couldn’t find one anywhere. I searched a good bit on this app and found it, SCORE! My only advice is be diligent in your research and who you’re buying from. There are some sellers that have given me false info about a product and once I receive it, it’s not what I expected OR what the seller told me when I asked specific questions. Just tap into whether or not you get a sketchy vibe from some sellers. Enjoy Depop!
developerResponse: {'id': 7752325, 'body': "Hey Leah, glad you're enjoying the ride with us. Do know that if an item is not as described, that you as a buyer are protected and able to open a dispute to start a refund process and investigation. Just give a little shout to the support team and they will give you instructions on how to proceed further.\n\nKisses, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-15T13:50:45Z'}

title: Depop is amazing but...
review:
I love this app! I’ve sold so much and have been in love with it for almost a year now. However I feel like there is one major thing that could make it so much better. 

Being I wish they would set up a direct deposit like every other selling app I use. Depops percentage fee is low, however, you have to tack in the PayPal transfer fee too. So if I make $20 off an item afterwards it’s more like I made $16/$17. Still not a horrible deal but other apps would give you more. So competitively it falls a bit short.

Otherwise I truly love Depop. I think the community on their is the best. It’s a lot like Instagram but specifically for shopping.
developerResponse: {'id': 5758910, 'body': "We love our users feedback and we can understand that having an added fee taken is not ideal for our sellers. We're looking more into this to see how we can make this smoother like a baby for all of our users.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-11-01T12:10:32Z'}

title: Can’t find items in my price range
review: This app is soo good , except for one thing. It’s super hard to find items that I like that’s in my price range. Yes, there is a filter that lets you do that, but sometimes shipping on items is like $9 and the item is $8, so if I go to buy the item that’s $8, which is in my price range, it would total to $17. It’s kind of annoying, and I get there has to be shipping on most items but I’m just suggesting to put the shipping price next to the price when you click on the item, and make a filter that lets you select if buyer or seller pays for shipping, that way you know the actual price including the shipping.
developerResponse: {'id': 3224755, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for your feedback - we'll raise this with the relevant teams here in the office. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-23T11:32:03Z'}

title: do NOT use
review: depop was really fun at first and i made some money, but then one day it locked me out and I tried resetting my password but it would never send me an email to reset it. after that i spent hours trying to find a way to contact depop, but I could never get a response from any team member. Everytime i had a question or something that was wrong, I could never get into a conversation with someone from depop or get any helpful information. eventually i gave up and moved over to poshmark. I loved depop for awhile and bought and sold a lot but they have the worst customer service i’ve ever had with an app. I still get notifications, so i have lots of people asking me about products and I can’t respond or get in contact with any of them.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18383016, 'body': "Hey there,

We can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop

", 'modified': '2020-10-09T17:27:46Z'}

title: All fun and games until you get screwed.
review:
I love that I can find things I want at a good price, but I am so sick of being scammed out of my money. Several times I’ve had great experiences with sellers, but I’m done. There is zero protection from PayPal, which is the most useless transaction site ever. I ordered a jacket, which was never sent to me even after I contacted them. I filed a dispute, PayPal made me run around in circles for days trying to get my money back, and they just stopped helping me. The seller blocked me, and I never got the jacket or the refund.
I also ordered a belt, and the seller shipped it, and it got lost. There is zero protection for this either. I’ve wasted so much money on scams and items I never received. 
BUYERS BEWARE!

title: One small detail would make a huge difference
review: I love everything about the app and the community but there’s one thing. I wish there was a section similar to the explore page but tailored for each person. There’s so many great pieces but I feel like they’re difficult to find. If there was a part where they showed you products you might like based on what you’ve liked/ purchased it would be a dream and I would shop there so much more. Also an option to scroll through all the posts on someone’s page or on the explore page would be really cool as opposed to having to click individually.
developerResponse: {'id': 4540711, 'body': "Hey Nicole! One thing we really want to work towards is having an Explore page catered to each individual user. As we hope you can appreciate, this is a huge piece of work, but we do hope you'll begin to notice improvements throughout the year and beyond. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-06T12:03:33Z'}

title: good start but still needs a lot of work
review:
i think my main issue with this app is its overall lack of personalization, specifically with the "for you" section. when you create a depop account and give the app your sizes, the "for you" page should also be catered to these sizes. speaking as someone with an eating disorder, i am waaaaaaay less likely to want to use this app specifically because the "for you" page is full of clothes that simply will not fit me. the sizes of the user should be considered when whatever algorithm creates that page.

another frontrunner for big issues in my opinion is the huge amount of people who are clearly partnering with or simply ordering from shein, aliexpress, etc. who will sell "several sizes" of an item when they are simply getting it from somewhere else. i dont think depop should be a front for these fast fashion companies to make money, and should instead be what depop describes itself as, which is something like thrifting but on your phone.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17329796, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

With regards to drop-shipping, the community spoke and we listened. In an effort to keep Depop a creative marketplace with quality products we have decided to update our policy on drop shipped items. As of March 1st 2020, we don't allow drop-shipping on-app.

If you can report any accounts that you believe are dropshipping, we’d really appreciate it!


Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-17T14:37:17Z'}

title: Love but some suggestions....
review: Love the app I use it to circle my clothes i don’t like anymore and send them to a happy home and get new clothing I do like! I use the money i make from depop to spend on depop haha. BUT, I do think that there should be a section in the app where you can see the total amount of money you have made/spent when you click on the receipt button at the top. That would be very helpful with keeping track of your money and spare a lot of time i spend on my phone calculator trying to do the math 😂
developerResponse: {'id': 10538805, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for the rave review and this super helpful feedback. We love hearing from our users about what we can do to improve Depop for everyone. I'll be passing this one along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-09-05T16:38:19Z'}

title: Good but everyone sees your purchase history
review:
I’ve been using Depop for years and it gets better with every update. It’s a good way to make money/save money on clothes.

My only complaint is that your purchase history is public because the reviews left from the sellers on your profile are public. I understand making sure that reviews are shown so the community knows what to expect from someone but I would love it if the community didn’t know what I bought in 2018 too. Being able to hide items (but keeping star reviews) would be great!

title: No Real Buyer Protection
review: As a seller I love Depop but I would caution against buying anything with the app. I’ve repeatedly paid for items in the app only for a seller to never ship my purchase. Depop’s customer support just redirects you to Paypals(which makes you jump through a bunch of hoops before you even have a shot at getting your money back). Additionally, Depop only lets you give sellers feedback AFTER items have shipped.  Meaning if a seller never ships your item you can’t give a negative rating to warn other buyers. And seller’s ratings won’t be impacted when they steal from buyers. Overall this app lacks any real safeguards to protect buyers from fraud.
developerResponse: {'id': 13156139, 'body': 'Hey. We have very strong processes in place to ensure our Community are always safe when buying and selling on Depop. If you ever need a hand, just reach out. Our Support team are on hand round the clock, and are dedicated to ensuring our Community are happy.\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-01-28T09:57:18Z'}

title: Really enjoy this app
review: Love this app so much. There are a lot of companies on it and I hate that because I view it as a second hand app for the common person, and there are scalpers who upcharge ridiculously on USED items but you can still find some special things on this app despite that for good prices. Also just viewing it as the app alone, and the creators, I love it, I feel like they really put in effort to listen to their user base. Their current update made me thrilled that they put in a swipe feature.

title: Use Mercari or posh mark instead! Depop supports unethical business merely for their 10% profit gain
review: Depop has turned a shoulder to “dropshipping”- where a depop seller sells aliexpress items for up to 10x the price. The buyer ha to wait up to 5-6 weeks for their terrible quality item that made in a large factory, most likely by underpaid and mistreated workers, or children. I’ve reported so many sellers for selling items that they don’t have in their posession, but Depop obviously doesn’t want to lose out on their 10% profit! If you try to contact them on Instagram you get no response, and after reporting someone you get a generic response like “we’ll look into this”. Nothing happens. I would suggest looking into Mercari or Poshmark, where support is far more thorough and easily accessible.

title: plEASE no more iso posts
review: I love depop so much, it’s really easy to use and great to get rid of old stuff+make money. i like how they improved the ‘for you’ section, but the thing i can’t stand is all the ISO posts people make!!! it’s so annoyinggggg to be scrolling and see so many “ISO-DO NOT BUY YOU WONT BE REFUNDED” posts & lists of things people want that they think other users will like... help them find?? if ISO posts are gonna be allowed i think it would be helpful to have them in another section or something- maybe it’s just me but i feel they clog up the search results too much and i’m literally never looking for them. otherwise i love depop!

title: All the problems I went through
review: I got this app about 2 weeks ago, and it was fine at the time and I sold an item and went on about my day. But then after I sold that item and shipped it out and put in the tracking number so the girl can track her order. It wouldn’t let ANYONE buy my stuff. It kept saying there was an error for purchase. So I contacted Depop 3 times until they finally got back to me, and told me to get the latest version of the app, and to disconnect PayPal and reconnect it. So I did as told and THEN IT WOULDNT let me connect my PayPal back. So I emailed them 2 more times after that and still have not heard from them and I still have this problem. They do not care as long as there making profit from you selling.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16786346, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-21T16:31:29Z'}

title: it’s changed
review:
They’ve made a recent update on the app, to make it easier to shop for certain things, but now when I try to look something up it doesn’t pull up what I’m looking for at all. Used to, if I looked up combat boots it’d pull up ONLY combat boots (or a few other kinds) and now the first items are shirts and pants and other things and i can’t find anything im looking for. It could be the hashtags people use but I miss when things were easier to find 
I also contacted them numerous times on different platforms and no one ever got back to me so I was scammed out of items and wasted money for nothing

title: Customer service???
review: I literally cannot find a single way to contact the support team besides Twitter (which I don’t have). I’m in college and Depop automatically defaults my address to one that isn’t mine because it doesn’t recognize my college campus address. I’ve had multiple items I’ve purchased fail to deliver to me, and when I sell things, I have to cross out the return address with a pen and write in my real address because it literally makes one up. Do y’all have an email? A phone number? How am I supposed to get in touch with your customer service? This is super frustrating because I literally have to have everything I purchase shipped to my parents’ house first.

title: Scammed
review: Bought a shirt, seller never shipped it, Depop does not actually do anything for you. They make you do it your own, through going the process of PayPal which takes up to a month. While apps like eBay control the money being sent, so if someone doesnt ship the right item or was a fake item. They force the seller to pay for return shipping if it’s fake, or if it’s a different item/scam they take the money out of the seller and give it back to you in less than 12 days. I’d do 12>30 days.
developerResponse:
{'id': 9899500, 'body': "Hey hey! I can just imagine how frustrated you must be. As PayPal is our payments provider, we have to follow certain protocol however provide as much support as we can.

We ask all Buyers who haven't received their item to follow these steps: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001772448-I-haven-t-received-my-item

Hope we can win you back,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-29T13:38:26Z'}

title: Please fix recent bugs!
review:
This app was great until the last two updates. Recently, it crashes anytime I try to open it and if I do get it open, it freezes when I try to make new listings. Please fix this!!!!
Otherwise, the app is good. It would be helpful to see the amount sellers make after fees when they are pricing though. Also, and I know this is improving, but the explore page seems to often feature the same sellers over and over. Even when other shops also have cool (or even normal but highly desired) items.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17287386, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. 

Rest assured, we’re always looking for ways to discover exciting new users. 
Have a read through our article ‘Suggested Sellers’ by going to ‘Settings - Need help’, for some tips on how to become a Suggested Seller.

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-14T15:12:54Z'}

title: Love love love this app!
review: As a chronic shopaholic, I’ve experimented with many different shopping apps. When I saw Depop advertised on Pinterest I figured it was just another Poshmark (which I’ve never been very impressed by). I was so wrong! This app allows shoppers to search for and buy really nice vintage clothes for GREAT prices. The messaging feature allows the buyer to connect one on one with the seller, making everything more friendly and personal. Depop is the perfect place to find that one of a kind piece that will spice up your wardrobe.

title: Last update doesn’t work...
review:
After you have been scrolling down for a while and clicked on an item to view and then when you tried to click on the back arrow to go back, the app would take you back to all the way to the top of the search page. It’s very frustrating and we can’t shop at all. Please fix this error soon. Thank you! 
(Still rating 5 stars because it’s my favorite app to shop online from home.)
developerResponse:
{'id': 15392279, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 

Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T12:49:36Z'}

title: being able to direct message other buyers would be amazing
review: i love depop i use it almost every day and i have all my friends download it so we can send clothes to each other back and forth via text, but it would me AMAZING if there was a way that people following each other could direct message each other items for sale for easy sharing!!! it would be so convenient and i feel like it would increase sales bc a lot of times when i click links my friends send me it makes the app crash love u guys keep being amazing xoxoxo
developerResponse: {'id': 2745446, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for leaving this review - this is an interesting idea you've written about, thank you for the feedback! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-05T11:46:11Z'}

title: Interface makes no sense!
review: The Depop app/website make no sense. Why can’t I purchase something on the website? I definitely need to see an item of clothing on a large screen before I commit to buying it and I happen to not own an iPad. It also seems that the like and comment functions have been inexplicably removed from the website. In addition, I have had many problems inputting my address when I do try to purchase things on the app because it will not no matter what I do let me input a crucial second line of my address that has my mailbox number. There’s also now a bug where the homepage is blank and tells me it’s because I’m not following anyone even though I’m following 37 accounts. What is going on here?
developerResponse: {'id': 3339367, 'body': "Hey Olivia - the desktop version of Depop is more of a showcase of the many great items you can find on the app, but it is not designed to include all of the features that the app has. With regards to your issue with the address: please reach out to our support team (support@depop.com) - they'll be able to advise the best way for you to input this information. We hope this helps somewhat. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-03T08:52:10Z'}

title: New update
review: Not sure if this is a bug or a new feature but I’m really not a fan of the changes in the style edit. Before it used to update with new items whenever you refreshed it, now I’m stuck with the same items no matter how many times I refresh it. It’s really annoying when I’m trying to find new items and all I see are the same ones. Please fix this. Otherwise, I enjoy the app, but this update makes it hard for smaller sellers to get their items out there. Not to mention the style edit can sometimes be really inaccurate to the items I actually like.

title: Trash
review: Good concept but TERRIBLE customer service & HORRIBLE app. It glitches nonstop , logs you out for no reason, and locks you out of your own account for literally no reason (this has happened to me twice now). I don't know much about coding but I'm pretty sure I could make a better app than this trash. Not to mention, you have to pay a monthly fee to use Depop, give them a % of everything you sell, & they upcharge shipping by $2 - it's a giant SCAM. I wouldn't mind any of that if the app didn't malfunction ever 10 minutes or if customer service would actually do ANYTHING about the issue , they legitimately do nothing. Not sure who's paying them or how much but I'm 100% they're being overpaid. Hate this app, hate their pathetic excuse for customer service.

title: Search algorithm is HORRIBLE
review: The way tagging and searching works on this app is useless. I can post a brand new item, name it the exact search terms, then search the words and items from over 6 weeks ago show up WAY before my item. The search feature seriously needs to be changed. I also think it’s messed up how people end up on the explore page and top sellers are given information on what is trending so they can post more items that sell and nobody else is given that info. The explore page needs serious changing and there needs to be way more search features/more advanced algorithms.

title: Customer service is awful.
review: The sellers themselves are really great. Most I’ve talked to are super friendly and helpful but if you try to reach out to customer service it’s a nightmare. They’ll ask you to send a video or screen shot of what is wrong and then they don’t even bother to look at it and give you a random answer. For some reason the app was telling me they couldn’t find my email and I sent them a video showing what was wrong only to receive a lame answer which I already knew and demonstrated but wasn’t working. Then when I emailed again they didn’t bother to read my email they just told me to send another video. Very unprofessional and unorganized. It truly ruined my entire experience on this app.

title: depop betrayed me 🥺
review:
I have done so much good for this app! I’m a five star buyer and seller. I’ve gotten this app at least three sellers by talking people into downloading it, and selling their things. And THOSE people have become five star buyers and sellers.
 My phone does this thing where if I don’t use an app enough it uninstalls it. Well, I realized this was the case for Depop, reinstalled, and the app kicked me out of my account. Then, it would not let me change the password and log back in. I really don’t understand why I was kicked out when I didn’t want to uninstall it in the first place. I’m just really sad because there are things I would like to sell and I thought it was a great app and great community. But this has really changed my mind😔.

title: Won’t accept my address!
review: Says “address could not be found” the first time i actually try to buy something. Doesn’t matter what shop from, any time i press “buy” it says i have to add my address (even though it’s already saved in my depop info?????) then when i enter that same exact address (which is my home address) the correct way it says it cannot be found. I even tried my dads work address. Still the same message. I love this app but please fix this problem!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 6591189, 'body': 'Hi there! This is definitely a problem we want to fix for ya! Can you let us know your username? We can investigate the issue further.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-28T13:20:19Z'}

title: Nice app
review: This app is really nice. There’s a lot of unique clothes that you can find as well as accessories or whatever. You name it, you can probably find it here. You can connect with people all over the world so that’s pretty awesome. My only issue with this app is the process of buying. Although it is a really simple process, and easy it is sometimes hard to get in touch with sellers and that makes it complicated and can sometimes be stressful when it comes to shipping processes. Other than that, the app is dope.
developerResponse: {'id': 4406723, 'body': "Hey Josie, thanks for the review! We're working behind the scenes at the moment to provide more clarity to our buyers on the sellers themselves. We have our review system but we know there are many more indicators we can provide buyers about what kind of seller is on the other side. Stay tuned! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-07-26T10:41:24Z'}

title: It’s great, but...
review: I really love looking through this app everyday to find great deals and creations from people online. I’ve gotten my favorite pieces of jewelry from there, and it is my number one online shopping app. My only problem at the moment is with the paypal. Whenever I try to buy something, the paypal is unable to be processed, and I can’t check out as a guest either. I hope this bug gets squashed; because I really love this app and want to buy more secondhand clothes from this great platform.

title: mixed feelings
review: depop has been one of my favorite apps for a few months for the simple fact that i can not only make money easily, but buy cute items that i wouldn’t be able to get my hands on any other way. now onto the cons, many of my posts were removed for “violating guidelines” so i took the time to read the guidelines to figure out how to fix my problem & literally NONE of my posts were out of the ordinary nor breaking any of their rules. just today i tried to get on depop because i’m in the middle of multiple sales and purchases AND MY ACCOUNT WAS SUSPENDED. i am beyond upset and the depop team’s replies take SO long!
developerResponse: {'id': 3800977, 'body': "Hey there! Could you please update this review to include your Depop @username so we can properly take a look at what's happened here? Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-11T15:59:21Z'}

title: Cool Shopping App
review: I love this app, it’s great for finding cheap yet quality fashion. But I wish the tagging system was more clear. It’s hard to discover new stores and items using the search engine.
