I come across many items through other people’s likes that have the same tags yet never show up in the search results. Also, once you’ve liked a certain amount of items, it’s practically impossible to see them all as the app doesn’t load the rest of your likes. But overall it’s a very nice app, most sellers are very nice and communicate well!

title: Cool Concept, but Hard To Sell Due To “Exclusivity”
review:
I’ve been selling on Depop for a little over a month. The app shows great promise, but it’s a bit exclusive when it comes to who you see on the featured page. It’s the same people over and over again. Nothing wrong with that, but they should make another explore tab that features more items from everyone, rather than the exclusively chosen popular ones.

How about having a newly posted, or randomizer option for the view? Give us more options to discover the rest of the Depop community.

Seeing the same people in the featured page gets old real fast, and a bit unfair to the rest of the community. It kind of creates a divide between the Cool and the “not-Cool-enough” sellers. 

If that divide can be gapped, and everyone gets more of a chance to show what they have this app would be amazing. Right now it just feels limited. 

I’m not giving up on Depop. I think it’s a great alternative to eBay. I’m rooting for you guys to get better!

title: Not a good for selling or buying
review: They take so much money of what you sell (more then they say they do) and also have horrible customer service. I bought an item from a seller who then became inactive and never shipped it (I had communicated with her about buying it, bought it , she said she would ship it and then never heard from her again) she also had many good reviews but like literly dropped off the face of the earth and became labeled as inactive by Depop a few months later. Depop never gave me my money back or anything and it was IMPOSSIBLE to reach them
developerResponse:
{'id': 17357482, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but if you've sent us an email we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
 Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.


Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-18T15:31:00Z'}

title: Love it! A few bugs though
review: I very much enjoy buying things on depop and have been for about a year now. There’s two bugs I want to bring up though. One is when I try to leave seller feedback I get stuck on this page asking me to share their profile. I can’t click out of it without closing the app entirely and my feedback doesn’t save! Also when scrolling a tag I frequently get pushed back to the top of the list which makes me scroll a lot. I hope these bugs get fixed soon because I love depop otherwise!!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15472648, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-21T15:43:21Z'}

title: Unique platform- Great Community!
review: I’ve been on Depop for a couple of years, as a buyer. I haven’t tried selling anything yet, but I think the App just keeps getting better. They have added some much needed buyer protections, and changed up the explore page to get more variety. What makes it unique is the camaraderie and sense of community among the shop owners, and the ability of the sellers to really build a brand with their stores to attract people who are specifically looking for a certain style. Love it
developerResponse: {'id': 5561484, 'body': "Mr. Matt Majoe, can I call you Mattie? Probably not. Thank you for such an amazing feedback. Our community is honestly our pride and joy.. we couldn't have such a great time if it wasn't you guys. \n\nMuch love, Depop", 'modified': '2018-10-18T14:13:16Z'}

title: Notifications haven’t worked
review: I’ve had Depop for awhile and I love it! I get majority of my clothes on it. However, the last couple of months, i haven’t received any notifications from the app. my notifications for it are on, ive tried restarting my phone, i’ve tried deleting and redownloading the app – nothing works. because if this they are multiple items i wanted to buy but couldn’t because i never got a notification from a message back from the seller and i can’t be on my phone all the time to check back.
developerResponse: {'id': 7620739, 'body': 'Hi Claire, we are currently looking more into what this little issue might be - we understand that this can be frustrating so we apologise for that. Our team is working hard to crack this straight on. You can always pop over a report via our in-app support Settings - Need Help? - Technical Issues and then we can get this sorted together. Keep us posted <3\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-03-07T12:14:23Z'}

title: Almost perfect
review: I’ve used this app a lot to buy stuff and attempt to sell. I have no complaints as far as the process of buying but I feel as if the algorithm needs some updating. A lot of times I’ll look up one specific item, for example plaid pants, and although pants will come up, I also get a lot of other unrelated selections. I’m not sure if the algorithm shows them because the seller is popular or if there’s some other reason. I wish smaller shops had more recognition.

title: Customer Service ruins the experience
review: I’ve used depop for many years and until this point I’ve loved it and recommended to friends. This is however, until recently when i’ve had to contact customer service about receiving payments for items i’ve sold. For over a week I’ve been explaining in depth the issue/glitch that has been occurring, and have been met with nothing but the same automated response to check if my paypal is verified, despite me clarifying it is in every single email. It breaks my heart because I’ve really loved this platform until now, but I’m at the point of deleting the app all together unless they can resolve this issue so I can actually receive the money for my sales.

title: Worst experience ever
review: I ordered two items from a seller that I had been searching for. I got a message from the seller minutes later saying “read bio”. I obviously hadn’t because I didn’t know that’s something that people do on there. I just read the item description and purchased the items. In the bio the seller says “shop closed, do not buy, no refunds”. Why the heck does the seller have stuff for purchase if they aren’t selling them. Why is Depop allowed to do that? The only way to get my money back because the seller is ignoring me is to file a PayPal dispute. It will be over a month according to PayPal before they even review the dispute. I am out $55 for trusting a crappy app. eBay and Mercari are much safer. Do not use this app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19470948, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-01T18:11:43Z'}

title: Plz undo the search changes
review: I love this app but with the new update it feels harder to find things i search for as they’re all 2x2 now instead of smaller pictures. this makes it seem like i have to do some digging to find the product i was looking for, which i’m not really about, it feels more cluttered. Almost like you chose the zoom option when your iphone asks you how you want things displayed. My eyes are fine i think this should be an optional display. I am someone who knows what they like and “seeing detail” in pieces i don’t care for just get annoying. do i NEED to look through absolutely everything to find something I simply enjoy? change it back. this does nothing for the people lol
developerResponse:
{'id': 18383840, 'body': "Hey there,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-09T18:43:10Z'}

title: Item not as describe! First time buyer
review: I would be very careful trying to purchase something on this app my first purchase didn’t go very well!! I purchased a pair of mother jeans which they are very expensive and the seller put on their listing that the item was in excellent condition which when I received the item it was definitely not as described on her listing it was ripped on the inside and I couldn’t even get in contact with Depop for a long time and I keep going back-and-forth with them no one will help me with a dispute and trying to get my money back and mail this item back to the seller!! Please be aware that they will not help out with no dispute if you do not have a PayPal account!! The worst customer service for retail ever!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 17298832, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-08-15T20:51:31Z'}

title: Some bugs need to be fixed :(
review:
So far the app is freaking great I love it to sell my items it’s super easy and I’ve been making some money on it BUT sometimes I try to open the app and it’ll close itself and go back to my home screen and I haven’t been able to delete any old messages either. Not sure why but hopefully that gets fixed soon. ( Also have an iPhone if that helps. )
UPDATE:
As soon as I submitted this review the problem stopped occurring so for right now it’s been working fine. Developers if you see this. Thanks!

title: Depop’s staff actually listens to their community
review: I have really grown to enjoy this app for the year that I’ve been on it. Having the opportunity to start my own little shop and seeing others love the styles I personally chose is a great feeling. The Depop staff are very active in the app and are quick to clear up any miscommunications or issues that inevitably comes from any buying/selling app. They are also very supportive to their users and give recognition where it’s deserved. I love this app and how far it’s come.
developerResponse: {'id': 6883747, 'body': "Hey Kay, how lovely to hear and glad you're still with us. Users like you make our community amazing.\n\nKisses, Depop", 'modified': '2019-01-17T12:02:53Z'}

title: Horrible. They suspended me for no reason
review:
I bought 3 items totaling $103. I try to open the app to contact the sellers and I’ve been suspended. I followed all the rules and have done nothing wrong that I know of. Very upset and worried my orders might not come in.

Update: one of my 3 items came in. I understand I was suspended because I used a different email account for Depop and didn’t respond to what they sent. Still wish I would’ve been given a warning so I could contact the sellers. Might reinstall
developerResponse: {'id': 5794375, 'body': 'Hi there, sorry to hear about this. Can you let us know your username? Have you been in touch with the support team about this? We can try to figure out what the issue was behind the suspension. Even so, you can still contact the support team about your items as we will reach out to the sellers for you no matter what.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-04T12:33:18Z'}

title: Unique Community
review: DePop is a corner of the internet where I go to get a breath of fresh air. You won’t find basic, Kardashian-obsessed, cookie-cutter accounts here! The community is so interesting and nobody here is afraid to be different. I find great quality, one-of-a-kind pieces and love the intriguing sellers behind them. I have never purchased on apps like Poshmark or Letgo, but DePop? I can hardly resist all the cool things I find, and have purchased two things and listed one item myself. Small, maybe, but for me it means this app is wonderful. Love it💕

title: Love it ! But ..
review:
I love the new video feature but I’d love it more if I could upload previously made videos . There’s no room to really edit and record how I’d like and I have videos already of me wearing certain items I’m selling that’d do it justice . Also it’d be pretty cool if by the purchase button there could be an offer button - so items your willing to negotiate can have that button assigned next to ‘purchase ‘
And it can either be accepted or declined w a clear offer already presented without the whole “ how low are you willing to go question”
developerResponse: {'id': 2865198, 'body': "Hey Chariah - thanks for this feedback. Whilst we can't give an ETA for when these things might be implemented we just wanted to let you know we're aware of this kind of feedback from users and hope to improve your experience in the not-so-distant future. Thanks for bearing with us! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-19T12:10:31Z'}

title: Excellent app!
review: I have been on depop for a little over a year and I have no complaints really!  I have worked my way into a top 500 seller and have been picked several times for the explorer page.  The PayPal connection makes it so easy to use and all of the customers I have had have been amazing!  There was an issue one time with a scammer, but it was resolved in a timely manner!  Great app for those wanting to get their business out there or for those that just like some retail therapy!  Rock on, Depop!

title: Horrible Experience
review: I am very disappointed in this app. I purchased an item and never received it from the seller. My account was charged instantly. The staff was extremely unhelpful; claiming it's my responsibility to file a dispute through PayPal, which makes no sense bc I didn't use PayPal to purchase the item. Which I explained to them; but they didn't seem to understand. The buyer protection on this app is horrible. They could honestly learn a thing or two from Poshmark, which I strongly recommend over this horrible app any day. If you're fine with losing money and not receiving items then this app is for you.
developerResponse: {'id': 3052861, 'body': "Hey there! Even if you 'paid by card' this is still handled by PayPal and therefore they will still judge the dispute resolution process. They have plenty of experience in dealing with these cases, but if we ever find their judgement to be unfair then Depop protection steps in to fill the gap. We hope this makes things a little clearer, but please do let us know if not. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-06T15:16:36Z'}

title: great but could use a few new features
review: I’ve been using depop for about 5 months now, both to buy and sell items. The process is easy and quick. However, I do think that it could use a few features to improve the process. As of now, you are not able to get notifications when you sell something or receive a message. This has caused a couple of my purchases to be unnoticed by the sellers for several weeks. Other than this, the app is great and I would definitely recommend it.

title: Best online store ever!
review: Amazing store with great people!! I love this store I get about half of my clothes off here and pon to buy more. The people are very trustworthy and very specific about the fabrics and product descriptions. You can also make bargains. But you do have to watch out there are some sellers that will trick you either give you a products that completely different from the description or an overpriced product. Other than amazing store to buy and sell off of but please be aware of the risks!!

title: Suggestions
review:
Please make it so you can edit collections more easily. It would be helpful if you could remove, move, and add multiple items in a collection without having to unlike and re-like. 

Another helpful thing would be able to save certain searches to see if new listings are added to those searches. 

I think this app is awesome and these are just a few small suggestions that would making using it easier & smoother for me. :)
developerResponse: {'id': 11103782, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-07T15:25:19Z'}

title: I’ve been scammed twice
review:
I just lost 230 dollars on this app and I can’t get it back. A few months ago I lost 18 dollars. With that being said both sellers I bought from “don’t exist” which is odd because now I can’t get a refund due to my item never existing because Depop decided to get rid of my seller while my item is still “on its way.” I would say be careful because I just lost over 245 dollars and that’s not fun. 
I will however admit the app is very easy to use and I gave this 3 stars instead of 1 because I have gotten some pretty nice vintage things on here too, so it’s a gamble.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15395143, 'body': "Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Head in-app to 'Settings - Support - Need help - Buying - My purchase - I haven't received my item'.
We also moderate the app 24/7 to ensure scammers are kept away. If you notice anything suspicious, please report the item/user in-app (by clicking on the 3 dots top right of their profile/item) so we can investigate.

We're here to help,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T14:43:52Z'}

title: I love Depop BUT one issue
review: I love depop it’s such a fun app I can spend hours on and I found a bunch of unique clothes and jewelry that I can’t wait to buy there is ONE problem though I really wish I could filter out brands. I dislike Brandy Melville and whenever I do a search I need to weed through the one size fits all to find items that will have a higher likely hood of fitting. This happens even though I use the my sizes filtering option. If there was an option to take away brands then it would easier to find more desirable size inclusive items.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15248453, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-11T18:25:52Z'}

title: THIS APP IS AMAZING
review: I saw a review that said Depop’s explore page wasn’t updating and that they favor big Depop sellers and I’m writing this review to say that’s completely false. Maybe that person who wrote that review had some technical difficulties that had nothing to do with Depop because Depop on my end, is constantly switching things up on the explore page and they promote small sellers as well as big sellers. Honestly, you get what you work for so if you want to gain recognition then you have to work for it too.
developerResponse: {'id': 3270813, 'body': 'Thanks for this review, we really appreciate it! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-26T13:11:00Z'}

title: Young company
review: The refund system is terrible - you have to exchange multiple emails and there isn’t a system for it. AWFUL TO PROCESS A REFUND and they limit the number of people you can follow but followers = sales. They also charge 10% commission which is abhorrent. Their social events are cliquey and even depop social media promotes people who are already popular instead of promoting underdogs or growing more new people’s follower/buyer base which would effectively create more sales for them........ they are open ears to suggestions but have little resources to implement- also since they are based in UK everything takes forever to communicate. Lots of growing pains and room for improvement.

title: Not the best
review: Like one of the other reviews said, depop doesn’t feature smaller accounts on the explore page, also it doesn’t help you ship either you can find out your own shipping like packages, labels, and pay for postage or get the depop paid postage and waste money on the packaging & putting the label on, plus a 10% depop fee and a 5% PayPal fee. I think depop should only charge 5% because PayPal is taking some of your money too plus shipping doesn’t leave you much money at the end especially if your items are between $8-$25. Imagine selling something for $10 minus depop & PayPal fees you’re left with $8.41 minus $3 for shipping I only get about $5.40 for an item I sold for $10
developerResponse: {'id': 3877153, 'body': "Hey there! We're working hard to address the feedback around the Explore page, and we hope you'll have noticed some positive changes in the last couple of weeks. With regards to our fees: at this moment in time the 10% goes a very long way to funding our business and allowing us to keep growing. We hope this is a worthy compromise for our users. Thank you - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-18T11:41:13Z'}

title: Love the app, have one problem
review: Frequent buyer/seller. Have had the app for + years and don’t expect to delete anytime soon. I NEVER review apps. However, the newest update made it so that if you search for something and you select an item out of the search results you get, then back out; it takes you to the top of search results instead of the section where you were just looking at. Very annoying part of the new update, does not making searching any more efficient; if anything, its an inconvenience that can and should be fixed to how it originally was!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15395342, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 
 
Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-18T14:52:59Z'}

title: Meh. Cool clothes, not so great service.
review: Kind of hit or miss with buyers, like most apps that sell used products. I’ve bought several items off of Depop, and I’ve had to get refunds for quite a few things as the sellers just never shipped them or it was taking wayyyyy too long. I also wish there was a way to only see items that are available instead of items that are already sold. Especially if I’m looking to buy something and nearly every item that I click on is already sold. It’s really annoying and makes it frustrating to try and buy clothes.

title: over priced items
review: i’ve had this app for a while and i used to be able to buy USED stuff at a reasonable price (which it should be considering it’s used) but lately people selling things are selling them above retail and way over priced. the more people who over price their items the more likely others are to do the same. depop also takes a sorta big chunk out of the money when someone buys something from you and it’s very annoying. i sold an item for $10 and was hoping to get $10 from it but depop took some out of it and i got $4 which is annoying

title: All my clothes are gone
review: depop has always been my favorite place to buy clothes online because i can find what i want easily, unfortunately i went into the app today and it logged me out so i logged back in, but i tried to look at the clothes i had bagged but they were all gone. all the clothes i was gonna buy disappeared and i don’t know why? this has never happened before but i can’t seem to find the clothes i had bagged again. so that’s annoying, it’s probably a glitch but asking if they could fix it

title: Best place to sell or trade your clothes
review: I’ve been using Depop for a few years now and it has consistently been the best place to sell my clothes and earn some steady pocket cash. I’m very frustrated that there is no help line, as emailing help has not been able to fix my problem, but when downloading Poshmark out of frustration I found out that place is a burning trash heap and a bunch of thieves. Depop despite its flaws is very user friendly and has a FANTASTIC community. It’s a no brainer. Sell your clothes on depop or donate them. Anything else is a major waste of time
developerResponse: {'id': 9131896, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for the feedback. Any issues on the problem can be reported through the app and you can always send ussome love via support@depop.com and our superhero team will get back to you.\n\nKisses, Depop', 'modified': '2019-06-12T13:26:41Z'}

title: Drop Shipping Should NOT be Allowed!
review: Drop Shipping is the bane of shopping on depop. Sellers should not be able to sell something on depop that they are not physically in ownership of. I've had a seller who after I bought her item she updated the picture to a new version of the item that was a lower quality and scraggly looking. Saying the woman she buys her items from "changed designs". Through depop I was able to get a refund and buyer protection because at the time Depop didn't allow drop shipping. Now, knowing that depop dosent protect us buyers from sellers like that anymore is unsettling. Not to mention an app that prioritizes the importance of thrifting and ending fast fashion now seems to be sponsoring just that with its new rules and regulations. Stop Drop Shippers Depop!

title: So many shady sellers
review: I’ve been using this app for 2 weeks, and in that time alone, I’ve encountered so many shady sellers. One keeps trying to scam me by asking me to resend my payments through other money transfer methods. Another says she misplaced the item but she accepted my payment and won’t refund it. More than one have non-functional PayPal accounts. I’ve been buying from resale apps and sites for years (Poshmark, Mercari, eBay, Tradesy) and never have I encountered so many problematic sellers. The app itself is wholly unhelpful when you have problems, they just tell you to take your issues up with PayPal so what on earth is even the point of this app? I am very turned off by my experience so far and disinclined to continue using Depop.
developerResponse: {'id': 3419261, 'body': "Hey there, sorry to read you've had such a negative initial experience. We work hard to eliminate the presence of accounts that are going against our rules and would encourage you to report these users to us when you come across them. Any issues with transactions are handled by our payment provider, PayPal, who have comprehensive buyer/seller protection. If for any reason we believe that they've judged a resolution unfairly then Depop Protection exists to fill in those gaps. We'd love you to stick around, so please do let our support team know if you have any other current doubts or questions. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-10T08:49:12Z'}

title: Great but could use some work
review: It’s a great place to buy because things are most of the time priced really well, but I wish the items that are not for sale would get taken down like “ISO”s and collections because they make it hard to find something to buy and the rating system should be changed so that both buyer and seller rate after the buyer has got the item. Also the posts of people saying don’t buy or you won’t be refunded should also be taken down because they are basically scams.

title: THE WORST APP AND CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
review: I got scammed 360 on this app and the depop people take forever to respond first of all. Then they same the same thing, “oh we’re sorry to hear this, we’ve disabled their account.. blah blah blah”. That don’t do anything to help there customers and act like disabling an account will do anything when the scammer can make another account in 10 seconds. My cousin also got scammed for 900 DOLLARS‼️‼️‼️ and guess what depop did about it. NOTHING. They said the same exact thing a week later, “oh we’re so sorry. We can’t do anything, blah blah blah blah blah. It’s all bs and they don’t care about you. Crazy how we follow all they instructions and still don’t get rewarded for following the rules. If I could rate negative stars, I would 😤
developerResponse:
{'id': 18739448, 'body': "Hey Kaymalll,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button.

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-10-27T16:13:52Z'}

title: Customer service improvement?
review:
I enjoyed the app to a certain degree until my account was suspended. 

My account was suspended because of my own mistake which I totally understand and have nothing to complain about the 48 hour suspension, during this I have learnt my lesson. However it’s been more than 48 hours and my account is still not reactivated and there’s no email about how to reactive my account after this 48 hours suspension, I reached out to Sonya, who sent me email about the suspension, however there’s no responds from  her/his end even though I  apologized profusely and expressed my regrets on what I did to lead to the suspension of my account. 

I would really appreciate it if someone can reach out and help me with this suspension issue as I have already got the 48 hours suspension punishment for violating the Depop guidelines. 

Sorry to bring  this issue to the app review, but I really don’t know how to get help from Depop support team since no one at all is replying to any emails to help me reactive my account and fulfill all the orders before the sudden suspension of my account.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15396031, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
We're here for you,
Team Depop

", 'modified': '2020-05-18T15:26:44Z'}

title: Good but i was there was an update to allow quick view with touch sensitivity
review: I have been using depop for about 6 or 7 months and i love the app. very diverse, addresses any problems quickly. very safe and easy way to buy and sell, but i do wish there was a feature to let me do a quick view. maybe they could use the touch sensitivity? That would be greatly appreciated and i think it would make the app a little better than it already is. WOULD RECOMMEND THIS APP AND YOJ WONT REGRET IT
developerResponse: {'id': 2913243, 'body': "Hey there! This is something we've been thinking about and playing around with recently - we hope to implement it at some point so thank you for (re)bringing this to our attention. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-23T11:04:22Z'}

title: Private Message Needs Improvement
review: Overall I’ve been loving Depop. The community on the app is great, and it’s very easy to start selling and get exposure on your items. However, I really wish there was a way to send pictures though private message. Many buyers want to see more in depth photos of the item before they buy which is not possible. It’s not like we can just add another picture to the original post either since there’s a four photo limit. Otherwise I’ve had a very positive experience with Depop.

title: THANK YOU FOR CREATING THIS
review: Throughout my three years of high school, I have been desperately searching for a place to sell vintage or find vintage things to buy. Forever 21 is life but so is looking around and not seeing someone else with the same exact top at you at the same party (trust me, it's happened)! I know for sure with Depop that when I buy something it will have buyer's rights guaranteed and that you will be the only one in the who has that item in your small world in which you live.

title: So far so good!
review:
Pretty cool app. Only real complaint is we should be able to upload more than 4 pictures per post. We should be able to post at least 10 pictures per post--just a suggestion! I do like the app.

Edit: Selling is pretty easy. You just need to post listings with good pictures and detailed descriptions. You can sell 3 items one day and absolutely nothing the next. You certainly need a big following to make a decent amount of money on this app. This seems doable if you’re willing to put in the effort. 

Rating: 4.25/5

title: Idea?
review: My birthday is coming up and people keep asking me what I want. Tbh, the older I get, the less I want. If anything, I’ve been really getting into fashion and clothes, although I hate buying from fast fashion companies, yet I don’t have enough money to buy from sustainable companies (like re/done, reformation, etc). Then I came across the idea of a Depop gift card. It would be so cool to buy them for your friends birthdays, holidays, etc; I think it’s an interesting idea to say the least.

title: Login Failure
review: I really like this app. You can support people who are looking to make a little money. It’s nice and I enjoy the things I can buy, especially with the holidays coming around. But I accidentally deleted the app when I was cleaning out my phone, and now it refuses to let me sign in. It said that my username/password was incorrect, even though I know I entered the right email. So I assumed I had the password wrong, and had it send a link to reset my password, but the link itself refuses to work. I can’t make a new account either. I’ve tried everything, and I don’t know what to do.

title: Best app for selling used clothing
review: Do not be fooled, though it is used clothing, Depop does not offer regular “thrift store” prices due to the super high Depop shipping and fees, and the culture on the site. I love this app, it makes selling super easy. The only thing I’d suggest changing is the way the “made for you” page is altered. I’d really enjoy it if it was made based on the items you like and save, rather than on the brands and styles you chose at the beginning. Other than that, great way to make a couple bucks!

title: Depop is great so I’ll probably edit this review later on but...
review:
Edited: Thank you! It’s stopped glitching for now and i got to sell my item:)
Is the app glitching for anyone else majorly right now? Any item i opened said cannot open right now, check back later. So i deleted and redownloded the app, but now its not even letting me log in, saying this operation could not be completed please try again later. I had a potential buyer yesterday so I really want to try to get into the app asap.

title: Bugs that need to be squished ASAP
review: I will forever support this app, however I’ve noticed some not so nice bugs I’d like to mention. For some reason the app likes toload most of the time, and when I try to edit or delete a listing it will either show me the listing and not allow me to do ANYTHING. Most of the time it just shows me a blank screen altogether, I tried deleting thw app and reinstalled it and this did not help at all. Would love if this can be addressed and fixed!

title: Do not get this app
review: There is virtually no support. I have asked for help several times and the response I get it just a copy and paste of the help section. Like, yes I already read that. Thank you for reiterating like a bot. They double charged my girlfriend on their “one time” fee they take out on four items and told her to dispute it with PayPal. This makes no sense, as we have never had this problem with PayPal before. This app is a scam. Use Etsy or make your own website. Even with a lack of coding knowledge, you could probably design an app better than this one :) don’t download. Save yourself the hassle.
developerResponse: {'id': 7216427, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback. Can you let us know your username? We will make sure to get in touch with the support team about this in order to try to resolve this. As for the issue with your girlfriend, can you please tell her to report this with her own account? we can then tackle this as well.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-02-09T05:03:56Z'}

title: Annoying fees
review: I really like this app. It’s been a great way to find new stuff and get rid of old stuff and make some money. Although, I’ve found that the apps 10% fee along with PayPal’s fee really adds up. I understand they need to make money somehow but it seems like 10% is a bit much. I could literally tell the buyer to send the money directly to my PayPal account and then Depop wouldn’t make any money off of my sale. Sellers on the app have to raise their prices because of these annoying fees and I just think it’s a bit ridiculous.
developerResponse: {'id': 3269245, 'body': 'Hey there! Thanks for your feedback. Our fee currently goes a long way in covering the many costs of running a business of our size, so we genuinely want to thank you for helping us make Depop grow. Please be aware that not paying in-app is against our Terms of Service, and doing so also offers buyers and sellers alike much less protection with PayPal should anything go wrong. Thanks again. Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-26T10:53:26Z'}

title: Great shopping & selling app!
review: Depop is a great app for buying and selling pre-owned clothes. It has some features that I think make it superior to similar apps like Poshmark and Mercari: processing fee is lower, shipping costs are lower, supports direct messaging between users, and excellent search interface. I have confidence that transactions I make through Depop are safe, protected, and verified, which makes me feel comfortable purchasing on it. Big plus in that everything can be done on mobile.

title: Constantly crashes & fails to notify me when a buyer sends me a message
review: This is a great app to shop and clean out your closet but there are always problems with the app itself and it’s getting frustrating. Before the search bar wouldn’t bring up my keyboard, messages wouldn’t load until refreshing multiple times and having to restart the app. Now it’s at a point where the app crashes as soon as I open it and I can’t do anything. I have orders to fulfill but the app itself is not letting me do so. If you are going to get this app, only get it to be a buyer and never a seller. The app works agains you as the seller and taxes you 10% of every sale you make. Good market, not user friendly.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15249033, 'body': 'Hey, we had some temporary outage but it should be fixed now, so you get back to Depoping.
 
Keep exploring,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-05-11T19:06:19Z'}

title: Lack of sizes
review: I recently downloaded depop and I really like it, especially while thrift stores are closed. The way it’s set up, how simple it is to search for what you’re looking for, the purchasing process. I’m really disappointed though that in the women’s section, sizing only goes up to 35” (there‘s up to an xxxxl option but that only works for sweat pants/stretchy material). And sizes higher than that (mixed in with many other sizes that are definitely not above 35”) fall into the site’s “other” section which feels incredibly insulting. I’m sure this lack of sizing labels discourages sellers from posting about larger sizes, and it is definitely discouraging me from looking.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14972749, 'body': "Hey, thanks for your review, and we completely get that it must be upsetting to see your size listed incorrectly.

I'll pass this along to our product team, so keep an eye on future updates.

Stay you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-04-28T17:15:07Z'}

title: Lacking in support and customer service
review: Depop please fix your app and take responsibilities for when your app has a glitch. My account being suspended along with many other users is not cool. I was told the same thing as some other users, that there was a issue with my PayPal. This is not the case. When I asked for more details in email I am still yet to receive a response. I’ve been a manager for years and this is not how you provide customer service and support. Depop, please test your updates before you push them to the app. This will then prevent as many glitches and a bad experience for users. I’ll be happy to change my review once my account is up and running again.

title: New font is BAD, hard to read
review:
Is anyone else really bothered by the new text style? It's super hard to read, and strains my eyes. Not to mention it's just plain ugly. I can't believe someone decided on that font and other people working at depop approved of it.

Another issue I have is that my page won't refresh. When I've edited or added a new item I want to be able to go to my page, scroll down to refresh and actually have it show the changes. Instead I will refresh multiple times, try closing and opening the app, and it still won't show the changes I made. Why do pages have the option to scroll down to refresh if it doesn't even work?

I also have an issue where the app will sometimes show red notification bubble even after I've checked all notifications/ messages etc. in the app.

Other than that, depop has a great format and is super simple to use compared to some other buy/sell apps.

title: 4 stars
review: I actually like depop and it’s a nice way to de clutter and sell clothes/items that i never use! it so easy and simple to use, the reason why im giving it 4 starts is that sometimes the tracking number takes a while to show up and i worry because i want all my buyers to be satisfied and to know that they aren’t being scammed so far all items ive sold have arrived it 4 days which is pretty quick on my end but it also depends on where they live. but so far they have been pretty nice and understanding:)!

title: One of the best selling apps out there!!!!
review: I have been using Depop for years now and it has been such a great experience! The community is welcoming and it’s so easy to sell and buy and track everything right from the app. I have tried other selling apps like eBay and Poshmark, but in the end I always came back to Depop! If you’re looking for an easy and fast way to sell anything, I highly recommend Depop and I hope you have a wonderful experience like I have 💕🌱

title: Great for Extra Income, But Needs Work
review: I’ve been selling through depop for over three years and I’ve been dealt some frustrations. I’ve been hacked as has many other users, which seriously shouldn’t be happening. Mercari and Poshmark don’t have these hacking issues. Also too many times has posting sales “failed” and I need to wait days for it to work again, which defeats the purpose of making money at a steady pace. I also don’t like how they refuse to do direct deposit and strictly rely on paypal. It’s a great place to start selling, don’t get me wrong, but it has its problems.

title: Two bugs
review:
First off everyone is talking about the main issue where it takes you back to the top after you click on an item, so I don’t really have to go into that.
The second issue I have is that I can’t leave feedback anymore!! I feel like I’m losing my mind because the red message telling me to leave feedback is still there but when I click on it there is no longer any way to do so!! I’ve redownloaded the app already and it hasn’t been fixed. :( please fix it I just want to tell sellers that they did a good job lol
developerResponse:
{'id': 15443675, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.

We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-20T11:11:37Z'}

title: Disappointed
review: This app has soo many good deals & clothes, loved it I only used to for two days & than it started giving me a really hard time with payments. I tried to contact PayPal & they literally said to me they couldn’t help me. Keep contacting Depop but getting ignored everytime I try to explain my problem. So upset that I have to delete after only using & falling in love with this app after only 2 days!! If they fix this problem it would be 5 stars!
developerResponse: {'id': 8502468, 'body': 'Hey Gigi, sorry to hear about this. Have you been in touch with our support team? Can you let us know your username? We will reach out to them for you and see how we can help you fix the problem.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-04T04:09:12Z'}

title: Mediocre Support
review: Selling on depop started off alright. I wouldn’t recommend for long term growth of your store. After making over 100 sales, they suspended my account, I had to go out of my way to contact them and figure out why. They claimed I had “two accounts” and “sent an email to the one linked to the second account”, when I explained that there must have been a mistake, they lacked ANY evidence in such claim and I never received an email. They gave little to no response in return. I’m not sure why they would suspend me without even being able to explain the reason. For this reason, I lack trust and respect for their “support” team.
developerResponse: {'id': 5758890, 'body': 'Hi there, sorry to hear this! Can you send us your username? We want to reach out to the support team and take a further look into this and see how we can explain the situation for you.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-01T12:09:14Z'}

title: Glitches
review: I love this app but I have to constantly be checking my listings because out of nowhere it will change either my shipping method or the quantity of items that I have. I usually catch it before someone buys but once someone bought something for $10 which I should have made $9 from but because the app changed my shipping method from Depop to Arrange my own shipping, I ended up being out .85 because to ship it it ended up costing $9.85. It would be nice if y’all could fix that so this doesn’t happen to anyone else.
developerResponse: {'id': 2616669, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the feedback. The email you received is to tell you that your items would have gone inactive because you hadn\'t been using the app. This is not "suspension" but just a way for us to ensure buyers don\'t purchase items from sellers who aren\'t using the app. So if you list something, and you don\'t use the app for 3 weeks, you will receive the email to tell you your items will go inactive in one week\'s time. Hopefully that makes sense. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-02-19T11:10:08Z'}

title: good to buy not to sell
review: if you plan to sell on here one word, dont it’s a scam they take out so much for the depop fee they took out almost half the price i listed the item for it’s unbelievable and causes sellers to overprice their items by so much and then i had a problem recently where i had to refund a buyer because i had covid and couldn’t go to the post office and they didn’t give me back the fee they took out even though i never shipped the item i emailed them 3 times about it i never got a response so i had to take it to paypal and they still didnt answer on the paypal dispute thankfully paypal ended up giving me back my money but after that i can see the people who work for depop are so unhelpful the only reason why i gave more than one star and even continue to use this app is because it’s more ethical than fast fashion and i find some cute stuff on there even though stuff can tend to be very overpriced and i don’t blame the sellers because of how high the depop fee is

title: Please Fix Notifications & Include Profit
review:
Dear Depop 
Please PLEASE fix your notifications settings!! I will check the notifications I receive, but they will not go away from my screen afterwards. 
When we list something, it would be so much more convenient to actually know how much we would make if our item sold for the price we list for. It is already confusing to learn how much, and all other platforms inform us how much we could make on a set price or an offer sent
Also, it would be really nice to be able to send private offers to oilers
Thank you
developerResponse: {'id': 19046076, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-11T15:41:52Z'}

title: Horrible UX
review: I hate the UX and UI of this app. For one it constantly needs to be updated to function, every single time I open it i get a message to update which makes me not even want to engage. And with every update I feel like I have to relearn the app. The typeface is so hard to read and the design soooo hard to navigate. I feel like this app was designed by a first year design student for people who are desperate to be “avant garde”. Your items constantly expire and your password needs to be updated all the time to access it. I don’t get why users have to jump through so many hoops to use this app. It’s almost as if it’s trying to be as impenetrable and inaccessible as the New York fashion world.

title: Their customer service is garbage.
review:
I sold an item a few months ago and never received payment  but their customer service said it would arrive in a week. After emailing their customer service for over two months I have yet to see a cent. I’ve talked to ten different people and each say that it’s my fault and that my PayPal isn’t connected. My PayPal is connected because I’ve made sales since this. They don’t care about sellers and would rather take your money during a recession and spit on you.

Update: thanks depop for replying and telling me to do exactly what your customer service department has. I’ve provided all the necessary information to them via email. I repeat....useless.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17719446, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Seller Protection for all items sold in-app. 
Read more about this by going to ‘Settings - Need Help’ and typing in ‘Seller Protection’.
We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-09-06T21:50:25Z'}

title: There needs to be many improvements
review: Depop is my favorite app on my phone and I SWEARR it has the most unique stuff you won’t find anywhere else! This is where I go for all my clothes now and I get compliments all the time on them! However recently I haven’t been able to get in half the time, I’ve tried reloading and restarting with WiFi and data but nothing works. It just blanks out and takes me back to my home screen. Also the app freezes and blanks out all the time while in the app too. Please fix this problem and all the bugs! Love depop so much tho!
developerResponse:
{'id': 17246936, 'body': ' 
Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 
We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-08-12T22:57:17Z'}

title: New Post Lags
review: It takes me forever to make a new listings . When writing for a new listing, the text lags for so long that it takes me 3x times as long to write a description. Also seems to be a bug when making multiple listings sequentially. After the 3rd or so posting, I receive a “limit of 0 photos” warning when adding photos to a blank listing. I have to exit and re enter for it to go away.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17348889, 'body': "Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is and we’re currently working to resolve this issue. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report leaving your username and details regarding your listings. 
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-18T09:22:40Z'}

title: I like it so far
review: I really like this app so far I’ve only been on it for almost a week and already sold one thing so that’s pretty cool. Very easy to list items. I did have to print my own label even though I’m sure I picked the prepaid option on depop but hopefully it works out next time. As a shopper they have a lot of good options from tons of sellers which is nice. Overall I like it better than Mercari and customer service seems better. I’ll update this review in the future once I’ve had more experience and use.

title: Needs improvements has potential to be great
review: Needs to allow more than 4 photos! 4 is not enough to show more details on the items. The app needs an “offer button”. Search results should have more filters. Needs unisex and plus sizing and petite and tall size options! Since there is a lot of vintage clothing many brands don’t exist anymore and aren’t found under the options given. The app should let us input and add more brands. Still a great app just needs improvements that hopefully will come with future updates.
developerResponse: {'id': 19351400, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-25T17:28:10Z'}

title: Unrelated tags, organizing search options
review: What’s the point of adding filters for searching for “relevant” items when almost half of the items that come up in the search are unrelated? It would be great to have a feature where you can add only limited characters or something, that way only relevant items pop up in your search. I also noticed that some items don’t even show up when you search for them, even though they’ve been tagged correctly, but I can see it on a seller’s page. Can we also get options to change how we view items when searching? I preferred the three items in a row rather than what it updated to now.

title: This New Update
review: So this app was perfectly fine 10/10 but then they updated this thing to when you click on an item and then click out it takes you back to the top of the screen which means i have to keep scrolling and scrolling to find where i was again and continues to do it on every item and thus never happened before it used to just leave where i was at but now it takes me back to the top each time please change this depop‼️
developerResponse:
{'id': 15340439, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this! The good news is we've got a fix for this bug on the way. 

Stay tuned, 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-15T12:00:20Z'}

title: Literally useless
review: I have been using this app for a pretty long time for inspiration, but as a size large: it’s useless. I literally can’t find any cute items that would ever fit me. The “filter” selection doesn’t work since it continually shows me small items that the filter doesn’t pick up on. Force sellers to mark their items correctly or fix your filter. It’s incredibly disappointing to see such a cute app so biased towards a certain body type. I never found anything I liked, fit me, and wasn’t incredibly expensive as well. Also there are items on the feed that are already sold? What’s the point?
developerResponse: {'id': 16194417, 'body': "Hey. We're sorry that you weren't able to find what you were looking for. As a growing e-commerce platform made up of fashion entrepreneurs, we cannot enforce there be a minimum number of items available for sale per seller. Quality not quantity, after all.\nTeam Depop\n", 'modified': '2020-06-24T12:36:31Z'}

title: needs some improvement :/
review: they should add more hashtags to be honest, maybe allow ten. but also the currency issue. like people are saying that my items show as Canadian currency even though i only ship U.S. So, it's supposed to be USD, and i even rechecked my currency in settings. It's been happening to other people too. I'm sure it's a bug, hopefully it'll be fixed. also hope they can let us delete messages to people in case we made a word error please. don't know why they haven't done it .

title: Room to improve
review: I’ve been on the app for months trying to make a little extra cash. It has been extremely difficult to get myself out and noticed and gain followers. It’s also hard to make money when not only Depop but also PayPal takes a portion. I don’t want to sell for as much as I am but I still have to make money thats the point. Depop seems to be doing pretty well therefore should lower the percentage for people using the app trying to make a little cash. Also make a way for the people like me with a lower amount of followers to get noticed.
developerResponse:
{'id': 14214654, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 

See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees'.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-03-24T12:34:38Z'}

title: Need better customer service
review: I like depop. They have a lot of good clothes for a decent price, which is why I got it originally. I even sold through it and it went great. But then, I bought a necklace and the user deleted her account before she shipped it. I bought it with my debit card and contacted depop/PayPal through email and phone and they didn’t give me much useful information. They kept saying that I can request a refund through PayPal but my purchase didn’t show up on my history. Thankfully it wasn’t too much money but I did not get a refund or anything. Will no longer be using since I am afraid of this happening again.

title: Don’t use this app
review:
Two of my sold items were refunded the money that was given to me, my customers were happy with the product and they still have the items I sold them. I contacted paypal to see if I could get my money back but they said the transaction would have to go through Depop. I reached out months ago to Depop customer service and I still have not received any help or my money. 

I’ve had the app for a year now. Starting three months ago they started charging me ~$10 each month for “advertising”. This issue plus the refunds made my funds decrease instead of increase. If I am selling my items I shouldn’t end up with less money than when I didn't sell on Depop.
developerResponse: {'id': 1916200, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the review and feedback. If you could send your username to productfeedback@depop.com we can take a look into this further for you. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-12-04T10:14:06Z'}

title: LOSING MONEY
review:
STOP MAKING FREE SHIPPING AS DEFAULT, I AM LOSING MONEY 😡🤬. Before the update I had the liberty to choose free shipping in my own accord which was easier to manage. After the update when i post listings it is defaulted to free shipping and it is easy to overlook it and not notice it. If people want free shipping then they can toggle it themselves not all seller wants to provide free shipping

Often times I am losing the money because the shipping is deducted and i legit make $2 instead of $10. And on top of that im getting charged the 10% depop fee from shipping price using depops very own shipping service!! WHY???! Its ridiculous as if they are trying to milk more fee money. In the end i am losing money and depop is profiting more money from my mistakes

title: Worst Customer Service Ever
review: Depop’s app is filled with several glitches, along with that Depop has the absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. You have to basically beg these people to get in touch with you, even if they were the ones that initiated the communication. It typically takes days to get any sort of email or Twitter response, even if you’ve responded to them within minutes. The “international fees” that come out of your account if you do not live in the UK are insidious as Depop only states it takes 10% when you sell an item. The service is completely worthless if it did not have a platform of buyers. Absolute disaster.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18051553, 'body': "Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
 
 Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-23T12:44:18Z'}

title: i have some suggestions
review: i love this app so much, it has helped me make some good extra cash and i am excited to keep growing my shop! although a constant struggle that i have as a seller is that when people ask for extra pictures or try ons i have to decide which of the pictures to keep or get rid of since the limit is only 4. though adding more slots for pictures would be nice, a feature i would find more helpful is being able to send the requested pictures to the potential buyers themselves. like this i can keep all of the original pictures in the post and the customers get what they want! it is also a faster way to interact with customers and their specific needs. i hope this could become a reality soon, meanwhile i’ll keep enjoying the app☺️

title: Bad update
review: ******RATING EDITED TO REFLECT NEW UPDATE-problem is now resolved.******** The new update crashes constantly and doesn’t allow me access to my messages or purchases/sales which makes it very difficult to manage transactions. Sometimes the app will log you out without prompting. It is also impossible to message any other users.I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app several times and nothing has changed. Please fix this!
developerResponse: {'id': 16719103, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-18T21:31:22Z'}

title: Needs a better communication method for Depop support!
review: I love the app! It’s an awesome way to make some extra money on the side while receiving inspiration from other sellers! However, there needs to be a better way for Depop user support. It’s incredibly difficult to get into contact with Depop for help and the instructions available are often not entirely helpful. I think a live chat option would be incredibly helpful to users when they need assistance!
developerResponse: {'id': 7620568, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback! You can always get in touch with our support team by reporting via the app itself, sending a mail to support@depop.com or get in touch with us via social media such as Twitter. We also do have live chat! We try to keep you cover.\n\nKisses, Depop', 'modified': '2019-03-07T12:00:54Z'}

title: IM ANNOYED
review: So, I put the title in all caps because I needed this review to get attention. I’m very annoyed at the fact that you need a phone number I do not have service on my phone and because of that I can’t get this app just like multiple other apps I wish there was an option for using your email so you didn’t have to use your number if you didn’t have one. I’ve had this app before when I had a number and I would log into my old account but I deleted it and forgot my login. But I overall liked the app but it was just like any other shopping app.

title: Amazing but missing one thing..
review:
I love shopping on depop. If you love thrifting and finding vintage, rare, and limited clothes for cheap, this app is perfect. Every store is unique and it’s easy to find awesome stores with different styles and brands, current and vintage. 
The only thing that would make this app better is a cart feature like on ebay. I hope depop considers adding this feature as it would make it easier and faster to shop for multiple items.
developerResponse: {'id': 6142090, 'body': 'a Little handy basket is a great idea! Dangerous for the pocket but easy to keep track. \n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-28T10:10:51Z'}

title: APP ADD INS
review: obsessed with the curated board update! i love being able to separate by season, style, whatever. I've realized though that you can only add things to the boards by liking the item (then a pop up appears asking if you'd like to add to board) problem is i have TONS of stuff i've already liked before this update was put in place. I think it'd make it a lot easier to add a separate button (such as like, save, message) to add to new or existing board.
developerResponse: {'id': 11103329, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the amazing feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-07T15:06:53Z'}

title: No real customer support
review: I’ve been using depop for over a year now and have successfully bought many things, but for some reason when people purchase things from me the purchase does not go through to my PayPal. All depop has is a short video telling you the four things that could be going on when you don’t receive payment, the last of which tells you to contact PayPal (which I’ve done, to no avail). I feel very unsupported as a seller using Depop. I love the clothes and the options and I know it works great for other people, but my experience with seeking customer service has been very disappointing.
developerResponse: {'id': 3459761, 'body': "Hey there! Super-strange that you're not receiving payment despite having checked the most common reasons mentioned in our video. We're sorry to say it, but PayPal really are best placed to help you find the root of this problem. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-14T13:05:10Z'}

title: Scams everywhere.
review: I spent $400 on 2 items, which were supposed to be authentic and sent to me. I was told a bag I bought was authentic and when I received it, I immediately knew it was counterfeit. I then ordered a sweatshirt and was told by the seller that “it was sold 2 weeks ago.” Now he won’t respond. Both payments went through immediately so I’m not sure why this is the case. I tried to call someone to speak about this and there is no telephone number, only an email and twitter url that I’ve been waiting on a response from for hours. This is ridiculous and I am immediately deleting this terrible app as soon as I get my money back. Thanks for wasting my time on more than one occasion.

title: Good but needs some improvements
review: It’s nice that Depop is trying to be competitive with a lower selling fee, however they need to REQUIRE that buyers rate sellers like on other selling apps. I just sold my first item and the buyer doesn’t seem to care to leave a rating even after it arrived, which may make it difficult for me to build a good reputation with other potential buyers. There is also no way to report people mistagging brands “for exposure” like there is on other selling apps. The look and feel of the app is off to a good start, but please consider the above improvements.

title: There are Hackers From United Kingdom!!!
review: Today was my breaking point for this app and let me tell you why. I got HACKED by someone in the uk pretending to be ME. They tried to scam people by posting MacBooks, Gucci, and other expensive items. Me and this hacker went back and forth with changing the password. HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE HE DOESN’T EVEN KNOW MY EMAIL. This is complete bs and I had to remove every listing, paypal (so he wouldn’t hack my stuff), and email. I am disappointed in the way this app is!!! why can’t you let people delete there accounts right away so they can prevent other things like their PayPal accounts which is connected to OUR BANKS. NOT COOL.... if anyone is reading this beware and I advise you to not sell from this app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15248673, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.
Check out our article ‘Suspicious activity on my account’ by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing it in.

We've got your back,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-05-11T18:41:15Z'}

title: Impressed
review: I’ve been very impressed with the merchandise & merchants on here. The artists are amazing too. Every item I’ve purchased so far has been nicer than promised & I got great deals. It has a lot of vintage items u just don’t see anywhere else. They’ll bundle things for you or if it’s a small item my seller didn’t charge shipping. As soon as I’m able to get out of bed again I’m gonna sell some things since nothing I own fits me anymore. Thanx again!!
developerResponse: {'id': 4374166, 'body': "Thanks for the 5 stars! We're delighted that you're reaping the benefits of our wonderful community too. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-07-24T09:39:33Z'}

title: ok
review: i’ve made some $ from this app. it’s pretty easy to use. within my 2 years of using it i’ve never gotten on the explore page which isn’t all that great. in order to get on the explore page you have to have a popular account & items. but to have a popular account you have to get on the explore page. do you see my problem? also, when i try to open the app it constantly closes out so i don’t know if i sold something. + it says i have 26 notifications and when i’m actually able to go onto the app and open all my messages, clear all of the likes, follows & check if i sold anything t still says i have that many notifications. i hate it. and last, it takes 10% off of every purchase yet the free shipping it rarely offers is only for purchases with $20+ shipping or items over $50-$75 yet i’m trying to run a cheap shop so none of my items are over that amount.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10010627, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for this super helpful feedback. We love hearing from our users about what we can do to improve Depop for everyone.

To stop your app from crashing, can you please try removing any cached data by going to your phone Settings > Apps > Depop > Storage > Clear Data and then completely delete the app and re-download this again? If it's still crashing, drop us a line at support@depop.com and we'll try to sort you out.

To give some context, our fee allows us to keep Depop running safely and efficiently. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features that you’ll love and improving the user experience for our Community. To understand a bit more, read up here: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001791127-What-about-fees-

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-08-05T10:44:59Z'}

title: Buying experience has been worsened by "bag" feature
review: This app was previously flawless, but now that they've updated with the "bagged items" feature the buying experience has become frustrating. You're required to enter your bag & tap checkout for each item just to see what shipping would cost. I don't mind the bagged items feature if working properly, because this was implemented for easier bundles. However this shipping issue has become a huge nuisance & is preventing me from purchasing more items than previous.
developerResponse: {'id': 7523262, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us feedback. We believe the bagged items feature is a great addition to our platform to help our buyers and seller with their purchases and listings. However, we do understand that there's always room for improvement so we appreciate this! I will make sure to pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-01T08:53:39Z'}

title: good, but could improve
review:
i’ve had depop for a while and have sold a couple things on there. the platform is simple to use, but it’s not one of my main selling sites, and there are some things i believe depop could improve upon:

1. more than 4 photos per listing max.
as someone who likes to be thorough with their listings & photos, the 4 photo limit per listing is definitely inconvenient. it would be nice if i could upload more than 4 (perhaps up to 8 photos like mercari & poshmark).

2. built-in profit calculations
depop states that it takes 10% commission and paypal takes 2.9% + $0.30 per transaction. i remember reading on depop’s zendesk that the depop fee deducted will vary depending on your shipping method (i.e., whether or not depop will take 10% from the entire transaction total or just the cost of the item(s) w/o shipping costs). it would be nice to have a built in profit calculator that tells you how much you’ll make after depop + paypal fees based on your listing price and selected shipping method.

3. web support
although depop is currently supported on a web browser (you can edit and rearrange your photos online), adding an option to list from the web would definitely be beneficial, especially to people who list quicker on laptops/desktops.

i know depop is constantly improving its app, and i hope these improvements will be implemented in the future!
developerResponse: {'id': 6340162, 'body': 'These are some amazing feedbacks! We love it. Very clean and pragmatic. We definitely will take this into consideration and pass this on to our team.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-11T14:16:17Z'}

title: Great App!
review:
This app is awesome! It's easy to use and fun to shop. There's so many interesting items. I've only been using it for a week or two and already sold a few things. Plus, you can trade with people! I definitely recommend this app.

Update: I've been a buyer/seller on this app for over a year now, and I still love it! It's a great way to make some extra money while supporting recycling as well as other individuals out there looking to do the same!

title: Just One Thing...
review: amazing app for purchasing and selling second-hand but there is a problem with the blocking feature. when you block, it still lets the blockee see your profile — they just can’t purchase from you or message you about your listings. this makes it hard to avoid buyers who have patterns of bad depop etiquette. it’d be so much nicer if you could make this feature more effective in this way! i read on reddit under r/depop that many other users agree with this!

title: Thoughts on Depop after a couple months of use
review: I made a Depop account about 3 months ago. It is the first time I have used a selling app. I love how easy it is to post items for sale, and it is fun to curate your own little shop. The frustrating part, is that it is very slow going to actually sell. It seem that if you don’t already have a large on line following, or run a vintage business it is pretty heard to stand out and get your shop seen by many people.  I have sold 1 thing so far, and bough 2 things. In each transaction my experience has been great!
developerResponse: {'id': 3316250, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for the review! We've found that users are able to sell more when they really put creative effort into the pictures (and video!) they're taking. If you want some tips around this then please do check out our Help Centre or contact the support team via email: support@depop.com. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-01T13:40:10Z'}

title: Selling Fees
review:
Depop claims that 10% of the sellers item price counts as a fee, SELLERS BE AWARE that not only do they take 10%, but also take shipping costs, AND PAYPAL CHARGES YOU ALSO THEIR 3.7whatever% 
so you’re ultimately making LESS than you would on Mercari. only reason im still using this app is because you get instant payment and dont have to wait for an item to be delivered and a review to be left for you to get the funds from the transaction.
1/5

edit hence the developers response: The money for shipping is never returned back into my paypal, you guys take a percentage of the item which is 10% then paypal takes their % and ontop of that you take an initial fee % from the shipping cost so in total it’s almost as much as posh’s fees.
developerResponse: {'id': 2878880, 'body': "Hey there! Please be aware that if you add the shipping option to your item, you'll be charged initially but this money will then be returned to your PayPal. Please reach out to us if you need any clarification on how this works. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-20T15:28:06Z'}

title: VERY FRUSTRATED💨
review:
The problem that I’ve been having for the longest time, is that every time i’ve tapped on my/other items/posts  it’s completely blank and refuses to load. Now this really affects me and my shop as I can’t delete/see my items. Now this doesn’t only affect my shop but also me as I am trying to of course look at other items/posts. 

I’d like to again say that the problem is I cannot select/tap on an item without it going blank which prevents me from deleting my own item, looking at an item that I would like to buy or simply look at, and simply looking at my own item. I have of course found other ways that I’ve had to do to get around the bug but it’s simply irritating and defeats the purpose of the app. 

 Now with this review I hope to get another solution because I’ve been seeing other complaints. 
I HAVE gotten feedback from the Developer and they have given instructions but directions that they’ve given was not fitted for my iOS IPhone.

title: They protect drop shippers
review:
Aside from the amount of bugs, bullying, and useless updates; Depop continues to burn small businesses and verify drop shippers (which is against their rules but rules only apply to small shops apparently). Reporting drop shipping does nothing. Since Depop makes so much money off these scammers, they won’t remove them and even go so far as to remove their negative reviews / verify them.

UPDATE: IF DROP-SHIPPING IS AGAINST THE RULES STOP VERIFYING THEM. DEPOP CONSTANTLY CONTRADICTS ITSELF AND USES THE SAME GENERIC “Depop updated its policy on dropshipping..” BSSSSS. I’ve reported well over 10 accounts for obvious drop shipping and nothing has ever been done. They’re still verifying, scamming, and Depop still backs them. Reporting does nothing.

title: Add story’s?
review: Depop is great and I love the app. But when I have an announcement to make or something I have to make a whole new listing with a random price and stuff because I can’t fit it in my bio. So I was thinking what if we got an update where we could make story’s like on Instagram and Snapchat. That way we could post announcements on our story and not have to make a post to our feed of things we’re selling. It’s just a thought though!
developerResponse:
{'id': 18129253, 'body': "Hey there,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-27T20:22:25Z'}

title: Good but major issues
review: I love the format and layout but I have a major issue. The search bar. When I am looking for something in particular and I scroll down the results and click on one, once I click the arrow to go back to the results, it brings me all the way to the top of the results again. This is annoying because I can be very far down in the results and be forced to scroll all the way down again and find where I was.

title: STILL LOVE IT
review: I am in love with this app I have never found all of my favorite brands for better prices but I’ve really hit the jackpot using depop. I also sell, and have achieved basically getting my money back from clothes I don’t want anymore. The ONLY ISSUE with this app is the lagging and glitching. I understand that many people use depop which may cause some slowness, but it’s unreal how much the app glitches. I will scroll through any page and in the middle of this the screen freezes. This happens every single time I use depop no doubt. Love the app, but that should be fixed!!

title: Have my followers capped out?
review:
I’ve had my Depop for a few months and have sold a couple things. I get notified of new followers all the time but MONTHS ago I hit 157 followers and ever since then the number has never changed (even if I get a new one and immediately check it)
