developerResponse: {'id': 7752415, 'body': "That's some great add ons you're bringing to us. I will make sure to pass this on to the team for ya and see how we can make some magic happen.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-15T13:59:29Z'}

title: easy to sell but not easy to earn
review: selling and posting on depop is easy and all but the fee depop takes is so excessive and frustrating especially if you’re selling things that you genuinely like but need the money . i sold two pairs of jeans for $20 and earned $5. might as well just keep the pants . poshmark is better if you’re really trying to make money.

title: Not selling as much....
review: I used to be ranked in the top 1K percent and have completely stopped selling for no reason. I hope it’s not an algorithm issue otherwise I will not be using the app 😖
developerResponse:
{'id': 13537313, 'body': "Hey. We get it, this can be frustrating. However, we've created a dedicated Seller Handbook on our Help Centre to help our Users shoot, style and sell. 

Learn more about highlighting your shop by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in Sellers Handbook.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-02-17T14:21:39Z'}

title: Terrible! Do not buy from here!
review: This “company” has no customer service whatsoever! No phone number, no email, and no chat. You have to find the answer to your question in their FAQ page. And if you have an issue with your order, they direct you to go through PayPal. This is a scam. Do not order from this cheap site!
developerResponse:
{'id': 11688758, 'body': "Hey. We're here and we're listening.

If you need to talk to someone from Support about not receiving your item, you can find us in app by going to your Profile > Settings > Need help? > Buying > My purchase > Select your issue there. I promise there's a real person on the other end of you submitting your report.

We've got you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-06T11:30:25Z'}

title: Good luck trying to make a sale
review: I’ve tried this and 3 other apps for selling items. So far I found it impossible to sell anything on here. I would get offers from potential buyers trying to get items for free by only paying the shipping cost. The only way to promote an item is to make the promotional sale.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10646993, 'body': "Hey. We get it, this can be frustrating. However, we've created a dedicated seller handbook to help our Users shoot, style and sell. Check it out here: 

https://sellers.depop.com/SellerHandbook_UK_18.12.18-1.pdf

Keep exploring,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-09-12T09:15:38Z'}

title: Difficult
review: Sign up was confusing and ended up not working so I went to browse without an account and it was just uk sizing and you can’t see the price until you tap on it. I prefer Mercari they have a lot more filter options for sizing, brand, color, price, and shipping.

title: Depop Review
review: All and all a really good app everyone I bought shirts from are super cool I get exactly what’s in the picture I have had zero issues using Depop

title: Really nice stuff
review: You can find a lot of 70s-y2k clothes for a really low price and it’s like a thrift store in your pocket but a little bit better
developerResponse: {'id': 9942589, 'body': 'Yeessss! I love that explanation.\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2019-07-31T13:41:12Z'}

title: Kind of glitches
review: So I just got this app and it’s working lovely, but it does randomly exit out of the app sometimes.
developerResponse: {'id': 8920906, 'body': 'Hi there, please pop over a report via our in-app support Settings - Need Help? - Technical Issues and then we can get this sorted together. Keep us posted ❤️\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-29T15:24:25Z'}

title: Dropshipping
review: Allowing dropshipping is not only extremely hypocritical but also it renders Depop’s advertising and brand image deceptive ploys which push the idea of creativity and sustainability while actively working against their app providing either of those things. They don’t care about sustainability or creativity as long as they’re making $$$. Funny how that works, huh?
developerResponse:
{'id': 9361953, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for your feedback on dropshipping, I can imagine it must be very frustrating for someone like you who is on Depop for all the right reasons however I can assure you that we do our every effort to ensure Depop remains a safe space for our amazing community of creative entrepreneurs.

If you notice anything unusual pop up, feel free to report the seller/item and we'll do some digging.

Let's turn this around for you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-06-26T11:04:19Z'}

title: Selling depop items
review: I love being able to sell my clothes on depop , this really helps with me getting extra cash !
developerResponse: {'id': 7620164, 'body': 'Summer is coming... get all that cash monies ready for fun in the sun.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-03-07T11:29:29Z'}

title: Good App - Will Be Better Over the Years
review: One thing that will make this app better over the years would be adding US men sizes 4-6.5 into the app instead of “other”
developerResponse: {'id': 8619707, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback. I will make sure to pass this on to the team for you.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-11T11:36:06Z'}

title: Bag checkout error
review: Ok this app is great and all but I’m having an error when checking out.  When I press PayPal or debit/credit option it loads for a second and returns to the bag. So yeah it’s worked for me before but I really wanna get this item 😓
developerResponse: {'id': 7601222, 'body': 'Hey TGMS. This would indicate a failed transaction so the seller needs to contact PayPal ASAP and make sure their account is all AOK. If you (or they) need further help, just hop on live chat through our Need Help section on the app, or pop over an email to support@depop.com - we got you!', 'modified': '2019-03-06T11:28:29Z'}

title: need inseam measurements!!
review: i absolutely love this app, i’m a buyer and seller, and it has such a funky, family feel. my one wish is for a place where sellers can enter an inseam measurement for pants/jeans, and then to be able to choose an inseam measurement when sorting search results! i’m tall and so many things have super short inseams - i spend so much time looking thru it all! otherwise, this is a great app.
developerResponse: {'id': 6634373, 'body': 'Hey Zo, you guys are a giant family to us <3. Love your feedback! I will definitely be passing this on to our team.\n\nKisses, Depop', 'modified': '2019-01-02T08:40:56Z'}

title: So Happy!!
review: I’m so happy I found this app. It is really easy to use and a great way to make money off of items you don’t want anymore.
developerResponse: {'id': 6356587, 'body': "Who doesn't want to have a little rainy day funds?!?\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-12T13:23:28Z'}

title: Good af!
review: This app is so dope. You can always find great clothes on here and depop is good at making sure everyone gets noticed. Definitely check out this app!

title: Only a couple (big) issues
review: Not a lot of filters for how massive the range of products offered is (i.e. you can’t search by brand, size, color, etc) and other than a handful of FAQs, no support options.
developerResponse: {'id': 5198035, 'body': 'Hello Manny, great to have your feedback. I will definitely be passing this on. As for the support options, any questions you may have, you can report throuh the app and one of our beautiful support team members will get back to you with whatever needs answering.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-09-24T11:28:39Z'}

title: I love this app
review: I’ve used a lot of buying and selling websites and apps and this is by far the most user friendly!
developerResponse: {'id': 4515565, 'body': 'That means a lot to us; thanks Maria! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-08-03T15:52:13Z'}

title: Lit
review: Awesome site! Like insta but better bc u can make $ or buy! Also customer service is great at getting back to you and easy to use

title: i like this app
review: i like this app and it has a very open surface for finding dope products to buy and also sell, but the only thing i don’t like is when you are on the explore page. the explore page has many cool items set for your preferences, but it also has products that have been sold. so when i see an item i like a lot and see that it’s already sold, it’s kind of annoying.

title: It’s great
review: In the beginning I couldn’t find a way to filter anything but when I found out the app was really great
developerResponse: {'id': 3419538, 'body': "Hey there! You are able to search by size and price range on the app - if you're unsure on how to do this then please reach out to our support team (support@depop.com) who will be able to advise. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-10T09:11:43Z'}

title: Good App
review: I love the app but I do wish that I could go through someone’s inventory by scrolling down like on Instagram. On Depop, I have to click on a photo then go back and click on another one.

title: Scammers 30% of the time
review: It’s annoying how easily you can get scammed on this app and how the seller won’t get into real trouble for not shipping an item someone bought. I feel like there must be a better way to monitor this and a better way to help the people who have been scammed..
developerResponse: {'id': 3339323, 'body': "Hey there! We work hard each day to take away the presence of any scammers on Depop, but would welcome any further feedback or ideas you might have. If you're keen to kick off a conversation, please reference this review and drop us a line - support@depop.com. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-03T08:50:44Z'}

title: Very underrated app
review: The only thing this app needs is a dark mode feature like Instagram. The white hurts your eyes after a while but other than that it is a great app.
developerResponse: {'id': 19351375, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-25T17:27:05Z'}

review: I am not able to download this app. I’ve turned off and restarted my phone. Downloaded different apps, but for some reason this app is not wanting to download to my phone. What should I do ?

{'id': 19444699, 'body': 'Hey, we’re sorry to hear this and we can imagine how frustrating this must be. Could you please submit a support request via this link http://bit.ly/depoplockedout

title: please change back the layout
review: the searching layout right now is unbearable— making it so much more difficult to get through what i’m looking for with the amount of listings that flood the search results! if there was an option to choose the layout by 3 listings per row i, and so is the rest of depop users, would be ecstatic. depop is one my fav shopping apps to use but with this new layout update, i rarely even use it nowadays! :(
developerResponse:
{'id': 18528485, 'body': "Hey Justin,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-16T16:27:21Z'}

review:
You guys used to be so much better, I have no clue whose idea the new update was but you should re consider going back to how you were before! You’re losing us sellers and without us, you don’t make much money! Please hear us out as we truly love the app and want it to be great for you and for us. 

Please be what you used to be!

{'id': 18831902, 'body': "Hey there,

title: liteally a scam
review: I been deleted this horrible app but they still continue to charge me 29$ everyday for no reason never bought anything off this app sold 2 items and stopped . customer service is horrible never responded to my emails honestly the worst app I’ve ever downloaded in my whole life
developerResponse:
{'id': 18530196, 'body': 'Hey there,

Rest assured that Depop can only take payments for sales and shipping labels, so you won’t be overcharged. Check here for more info or to contact our support team.

Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-10-16T18:40:45Z'}

title: Fix it or at least reimburse me the extra $2.
review: This app needs to tell you how much you will earn before you set a price. I sold two items on this app 2 or 3 dollars above retail price when the item was new, and received money that was below retail price! I feel ripped off!! I’m not sure I even want to continue selling on this app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18214528, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 

See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-01T11:44:25Z'}

title: If I could give 0 stars I would
review: Let me start off by saying these people suspended my account because of a payment problem with PayPal, it is also hard to ship items out as it will say you cannot print the shipping label, this app to say the least is horrible don’t get it

title: The scanner thing
review: Oh my god, this is so annoying please bring back the scanner thing that let you find clothes from photos I literally had it five hours ago and now I can’t find it. I only joined because the scanner thing was accurate so like, please fix it or tell me where I can find the scanner thing
developerResponse:
{'id': 18129491, 'body': 'Hey there,

Sorry about the inconvenience. Please contact support@depop.com and we will resolve your issue from there.



Thanks,

Team Depop', 'modified': '2020-09-27T21:02:48Z'}

title: Nothing works
review: So far everyone on this app is rude and disgusting. Everything is so over priced and is filled with scammers. I try to put in my address but says it’s the wrong thing when it’s clearly correct. I changed my region to us because that’s where I am and still stays in Canada. If I could give this zero stars I would. Don’t get it.

title: Take your stuff elsewhere
review: Unfortunately Depop communication with PayPal is the worst. Do not sell you clothes on here. You will be harassed by 12 year old girls trying to buy your clothes for $5 via messenger. You will also sell clothing and will never see the money you made off it. Will never use this app ever again.

title: The App Itself Is Lovely
review: The app is very good! The only thing wrong is the people who take stuff from thrift shops and sell them for super expensive on here. Chile what?

title: PM PHOTOS
review: Can you please make it so we can PM people photos of products when the buyer request more images/ videos of the item or just add it so we can post like 10 images of the item and 2 videos

title: becoming a seller is the grossest hassle
review: it’s not easy as it seems and I’ve lost 50$ already and will be losing more because it is so hard to become a seller. Shipping is only 4$ and the amount I pay is not cheap. Also I don’t receive the payment till 2 months if IM LUCKY
developerResponse:
{'id': 17001950, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Seller Protection for all items sold in-app. 
Read more about this by going to ‘Settings - Need Help’ and typing in ‘Seller Protection’.
We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-07-31T10:46:09Z'}

title: Entertaining moneymaker
review: Easy fun and lucrative. Insta meets fb marketplace meets Pinterest fashion! Enjoyable as a buyer and a seller. Read up on refund policies though, you can get screwed if you’re not careful.

title: I don’t like it
review: It is very accessible and easy to sell things to a lot of people but I can never sell them because I can’t access my shipping labels even though my PayPal is verified and when I email the company they don’t send me my label they just send me the same email telling me to go to the help desk when that doesn’t help at all.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16730520, 'body': "Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-19T20:18:02Z'}

title: glitching
review: I love this app but every once in a while it glitches and i cant open it for a couple days to answer orders and questions. everytime i click on the app it logs out and returns to my home screen.

Let’s get this sorted,

review: Would be fantastic if I could elect to exclude “one size fits all” results, as they don’t fit me. I find it extremely frustrating that when I’m looking for plus size clothing all I can find is brandy mellville — which doesn’t fit me. Otherwise the app is fine, this is just a pretty glaring flaw in their filter system. :(

title: Get this app
review: Depop is improving with every update and it’s just a great app for selling and buying. Seriously my favorite place to sell stuff.

title: Logging in
review: Used to love this app. Opened it back up after a while and logging in seems to be an issue. States “The operation could not be completed. Please try again later.” Please fix this ASAP
developerResponse:
{'id': 16189067, 'body': 'Hey. Could you please try resetting your password from a laptop or PC. This provides a more secure connection, and should do the trick. Remember, you can use either your username or linked email address to login. Just make sure you’ve typed it correctly with no spaces. 

Let’s get you back on the app,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-06-24T09:23:27Z'}

title: Meh
review: What a great platform for people who buy stuff from the thrift store for $8 and sell it for $45+! Really cool if you are a size 24-26" waist! The app itself is okay but there's so much stuff on there you have to kinda know exactly what you're looking for. I'd rather go to my local thrift store when it opens.

title: laggy
review: one of the laggiest apps i’ve ever used. i have very good wifi but whenever i use it, there is always a huge lag which makes it difficult to use. additionally, when i open a message, it still won’t be marked as read. i feel like the app should be easier to navigate and should be easier to scroll through people’s pages, similar to instagram. i also think it would help sellers advertise if there was a forum section. also, there is no notifications center which is annoying!
developerResponse:
{'id': 15443373, 'body': 'Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 

We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-05-20T10:55:15Z'}

title: Depop
review: This app is incredible. If you dislike going out shopping which I do, this is the app for you.  It’s fast shipping, unique clothing, and affordable prices.

more room for the photos! 
Also a way to edit your store feed without having to go on the computer, because I like to edit them by color or outfits. Other than that great app (:
I really love this app! An easy way to make some money especially as a teen although a “checklist” option for sellers would b nice!

title: Amazing app!
review: I would recommend this app for purchasing things you really want like collectibles or stuff like that! Amazing app 💖

title: Amazing App!!
review: I’ve bought and sold some very nice things to and from some very nice sellers. Depop is secure with payments and is very easy to navigate around!

review: I love the platform this app gives to creators. Although i believe DEPOP is extremely over saturated with DROP SHIPPERS. Which strangely enough is against their terms of use but they seem to do little about this issue because a lot of drop shippers are depop a best sellers. (Making Depop the most return)

title: Love it!

title: Trustable App

title: Horrible Service
review: I’ve made an account before and I got banned because there was a miscommunication between me an the buyer. Later on I make another account with a different email and they ban it for no reason. And they never answer their emails after that. horrible horrible service, do not recommend at all.
developerResponse: {'id': 3316315, 'body': "Hey Justin - once a user is banned we don't allow that user to make a new account. We enforce actions against users if we find they've been breaking our rules, and creating a new account would simply be circumventing that. If you think we've acted in error, then please respond to the original email sent to you about the account closure and we'll double-check this for you. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-01T13:45:41Z'}

title: Depop = huge scam machine
review: I will never sell anything on Depop ever again — might not even but anything from there, on that matter. Paypal takes out a partial fee - alright, fine. Then depop takes out a larger chunk (way more than 20%), that only leaves me with what I barely earned. It’s ridiculous. I have never had to deal with this kind of issue on Poshmark.
developerResponse: {'id': 1700466, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the feedback. The Depop fee when an item sells is 10%. If you were charged more we can look into this for you. If you selected to use in-app shipping with USPS, the fee for the shipping label would have been taken with the 10% selling fee so this might explain it. Please send your details to support@depop.com for us to look into. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-11-08T14:23:14Z'}

title: Great app
review: Great app for designer brands at a reasonably low price, scams are of course an obstacle to avoid but as long as you stick with highly reviewed sellers your experience should be very pleasurable.

title: scrolling issue

title: Cool, but.

title: Meh...
review: It’s cool for making some extra bucks by selling items, but the Depop Explore page is a hoax. It’s the same people in there every day. Every item those same people post gets featured. I’ve used Depop for years and it wasn’t always that way. Also, the app force closes a LOT.

title: Great app, slow process
review: Love the app and how quick the sellers are! There is sometimes an issue of the app slowing down and shutting down if you are in it for a while though. Good app.

title: Never Received Payment
review: I sold 3 items in which I never received payment. Each time, I contacted both PayPal support and Depop support with no help. I basically sold each item for free, and paid for my own shipping because Depop wouldn’t let me view the labels. Terrible costumer service, and really disappointing

title: Fun and Addictive!!
review: I probably shouldn’t be shopping as much as I am (I’m not buying as much as I feel but still). Fun and easy! Good just for outfit inspo too.

{'id': 18359401, 'body': 'Hey Cocopopop,

- Phone operating system, example iOS 13
 
Let’s get this sorted,
Team Depop

To all my friends out there going through the same thing I promise they will not win. This app is corrupt. I said it.

{'id': 18781546, 'body': "Hey there,

Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-10-29T13:17:50Z'}

review: Depop is a joke. They allow scammers to rip users off and Depop doesn’t even care, no will they lift a finger to help. depop has been super receptive to my concerns. 

i had this one bug where my screen kept turning white when i’d click on items. i send a report immediately and they had me screenrecord my issue. within days, they sent me another email saying they had fixed the problem. 

thank you depop! ur the best

title: Selling on depop
review: This app is an absolute scam. They take money out of your account without telling you the reason and without any warning when you try to sell your things. Better off to do this with another app. No way to tell if your actually getting what you order. A joke.

We're currently working on developing several projects to tackle this issue much more stronger as we want to make it smooth sailing for our users searching for their lovely items.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-09T04:06:37Z'}

title: Great except for bundling
review: Great app but annoying you can’t bundle without manually having to do it after messaging the customer what they want and then reposting it with them all together
developerResponse: {'id': 7055699, 'body': 'We hear you, life would be much easier if we made automatic bundles. Will make sure to pass this on to the team as this is great feedback.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-01-29T03:42:35Z'}

title: “Report Transaction” button needs to be fixed!
review: First time buying something on Depop, seller does not reply to any of my messages and it has been 8 days. I am trying to report the transaction so I can get my money back but the “report transaction” is nowhere to be found! Please fix this.
developerResponse: {'id': 6548750, 'body': "What an awful experience! Please try to report through Profile > Settings > Need Help > Buying > My Purchase >Item didn't arrive. Hopefully this works and we can solve this together with you. If this doesn't, work please let me know.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-26T03:04:42Z'}

title: Decent for what you need it for
review: Not exactly user friendly, but it works ok. Also had a super hard time finding where I could leave a rating for the seller.
developerResponse: {'id': 2866221, 'body': "Hey there! We'd love to know a little more about what you don't find to be user friendly. Feedback in app shapes and sizes is highly valuable for us and it would be great to hear your thoughts in more depth. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-03-19T13:47:54Z'}

title: Support refuses to investigate a scammer
review: I was scammed by a seller who refused to ship an item after I purchased clothing from them. I filed a report on the app and support said that they would investigate the issue and get back to me within 24 hours. It has been over 2 weeks and no response from support.

title: It works
review: Depop isn’t the perfect app, but if you want to clean out your closet it’s a great way to make some cash while doing it. The limitations don’t outweigh the benefits, just be prepared for frustration while getting coin.

title: This app is getting worse and worse
review: I can’t even post a listing without getting a single glitch. And now I CANT EVEN PICK PHOTOS. The stupid drop down just keeps on glitching out and closing so Im’ve been stuck here for 10 minutes just trying to list something
developerResponse:
{'id': 17690264, 'body': "Hi, our community spoke and we listened. In an effort to keep Depop a creative marketplace with quality products we decided to update our policy on drop shipped items. As of March 1st 2020, we don't allow drop-shipping on-app.

If you can report any accounts that you believe are dropshipping, we’d really appreciate it!
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-09-04T09:07:54Z'}

title: updates are awful for everyone
review:
recently there have been a lot of new changes that are making it hard as a buyer to search for things bc of the search filters, the 2 photo layout in the “style edit” is unappealing and the app often crashes when i’m using it. not to mention that the new algorithm has been plummeting sales for small and big sellers alike, and there’s almost little effort to push out dropshippers or spam tags on listings. 

depop keeps making these updates, but who is it helping??

title: Great Platform
review: I love the platform, Straight to the point where seller gets paid. Buyer is happy after shipping.
developerResponse: {'id': 16267944, 'body': "We couldn't agree more.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-06-28T22:29:19Z'}

title: Help me pls
review: I am a first time seller and I had sold my very first item the other day but there is no proof that she purchased it on my PayPal or bank account but my item still says so I do not know if she canceled it or something is not going through and I know I filled everything out correctly on my PayPal
developerResponse:
{'id': 17000421, 'body': " 
Hey, we can imagine how frustrating this is. Please get in touch by going to 'Settings - Need help - Technical issues - I've still got an issue' and send us a report.
 
We’ll take it from here,
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-31T09:37:59Z'}

title: Easy to shop
review: Love the app. It is very user friendly. A nice variety of items.

title: amazing app but needs some things fixed.
review:
so i’ve used depop for a good two or so years now. i love it. it gets me cute clothes for a cheap (excluding the people who make you pay $70 for a $10 brandy tee 🥴).

but i’ve been having issues. the app will randomly freeze and or crash at random points. i can’t figure out if it’s my phone or if it’s the app itself.

much love. xx
developerResponse:
{'id': 16191110, 'body': 'Hey. We can imagine how frustrating this is. Please remove cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. 
We’ll get this sorted,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-06-24T10:36:30Z'}

title: if you had an old acc, forget about it
review:
cant even log in or create a new account if you had your phone number connected to an account, so permanently stuck at first sign up step of entering phone number just for these morons to constantly tell you theres an issue which you cant resolve because apparently the phone number is worthless to the account regardless. 

my review based on memory is that its just a bunch of up-sellers.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15871009, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this. If you can submit a request via this link we'll help you get onto Depop ASAP.

https://bit.ly/depopsignup

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-06-09T10:01:31Z'}

title: Payment
review: I love this app, but I can’t buy 95 percent of the stuff that I want because I don’t have pay pal... it really bothers me that I can’t buy stuff I love! Only 5 items out of over 300 went through and it’s just really annoying

title: How much of a cut does Depop take from a sale?
review: I’ve been using Depop for some time now and i’ve done research but I can’t seem to find a definite answer.

title: FIX THE APP
review: this app is fun to buy stuff off of but it’s a terrible app. it wont let me log back in at all i’ve tried changing the password on my laptop and it doesn’t work. thanks a lot i can’t see what i sold to ppl and what messages i’ve been getting. the bugs are also interminable god FIX IT
developerResponse:
{'id': 15395204, 'body': 'Hey. Could you please try resetting your password from a laptop or PC. This provides a more secure connection, and should do the trick. Remember, you can use either your username or linked email address to login. Just make sure you’ve typed it correctly with no spaces. 

Let’s get you back on the app,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-05-18T14:46:50Z'}

title: Pretty lit
review: So far the app has been really easy to use and I’ve found a couple pieces I like so it’s pretty lit

title: Exceptional
review: Great and easy app to sell things you don’t need and buy what you absolutely love!!!

title: Price slider
review: The changes to the price slider make it impossible to use which decreases the usability of the entire app
developerResponse: {'id': 12336459, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for flagging this. We're looking into this as we speak, stay tuned, we're on it.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-12-11T10:28:07Z'}

title: Amazing and easy
review: This app is amazing it lets you have a choice and many varieties of what you want.

title: Cool Vintage
review: This is the best app to find cool second hand pieces! Every seller I’ve bought from has been super helpful & timely.

title: Ugh
review: It asked for my sizes for shoes and clothes while signing up and now everything it’s showing me has been in sizes that don’t fit me and are sold. Very annoying. Very disappointing
So many unique items it’s hard to choose❣️

title: Frustrating
review: It’s good for buying but selling is difficult and confusing and there are so many fees you end up getting barely anything from what you sold. I get frustrated every time I try to sell something because there is always a problem.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10837889, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience.

Read up here for more: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001791127-What-about-fees-

We've also got a Sellers Handbook to get you tips on how to sell: https://sellers.depop.com/SellerHandbook_UK_18.12.18-1.pdf

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-09-23T11:30:06Z'}

title: Update
review: The newest update ((where the filter bar pops up every time you stop scrolling)) is honestly the most annoying thing.

title: I am highly upset
review: I purchased an item on this app and it has not came .. the woman took my money and blocked me and I reported her and all and nothing has happened. I will most likely be removing this app and telling all my family and friends to remove it as well. People on this app will scam you .

title: Great
review: The app itself runs very well. The people behind depop are very helpful if there is an issue with a user.
developerResponse: {'id': 6471501, 'body': "That's lovely to hear Gerry. Glad to hear we have been helpful. Thank you for being part of our community.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-20T02:36:53Z'}

title: BEST APP EVER!
review: Honestly guys I dont really have the money for some of those high fashion brands out there but this app makes it affordable and also a goldmine for some dope vintage pieces! Get it!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 5794228, 'body': 'Geddit papi....\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-04T12:07:47Z'}

super great app, kinda hard to get into it though because people can like your items but that doesn’t mean you’re gonna sell it. you kinda have to promote yourself for people to actually see it or find it. but still i love this app and i use it daily 
~oliviasclthes is mine⚡️

{'id': 17654351, 'body': 'Hey. We get it, this can be super frustrating. Rest assured, we’re always looking for ways to discover exciting new users.

title: Shipping Label
review: I tried multiple times to view the shipping label but it wouldn’t let me. I did everything it asked me and tried to contact them and it wouldn’t work. So I ended up having to do my own shipping and it cost more than the shirt did so I lost money. Wouldn’t recommend this app.

title: Good app — as long as nothing goes wrong.

title: Scam! Do not trust this platform!
review: I purchased a hat from a vendor. They never sent me the hat and they did not give me a refund. I reported it to depop and there response was just to send an email to that vendor. title: horrible customer service

title: no

{'id': 9705757, 'body': "Hey there! We definitely do offer Buyer Protection as long as you have followed these steps: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001827248-Buyer-Protection

Let's get you happy again,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-07-17T11:07:49Z'}

title: Good sometimes
review: Only like to sell when it has a no fee event.
developerResponse:
{'id': 6250271, 'body': 'Hi there,

I understand that you may believe that the Depop fee is high and believe me if we didn’t have to charge a fee we wouldn’t!

The 10% fee may seem like a lot for your sale but, when we break this down into what the fee contributes to, it makes a lot more sense. The fee is in place to keep the app up and running, with general up-keep costs and to pay all of our employees, from engineers to us in support. 

Unlike many other selling platforms, at Depop only charge you when you make a sale, this means there are no fees for the length of time your item has been listed for or any initial costs to list the item, so list to your heart’s content because its all free!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2018-12-05T08:52:27Z'}

We always encourage our users to send items tracked and covered so a file can be claimed through the shipping provider in order to get reimbursement for any items that have been damaged during transit. If you pop over a message to the support team, they can let you know more information or try to solve this with you.\n\nLove, Depop", 'modified': '2019-02-17T13:38:51Z'}

title: TERRIBLE APP
review: I have had a Depop for a few months now and I’ve had a few sales and I never had a problem with my registration with my PayPal account connected to my Depop everything was perfectly synced and I was all approved. I was able to ship all my items having the shipping labels all fine but in my last sale I have a perv a problem that I have not been able to print out my label because of a problem with Depop and PayPal. When I reached out to PayPal they say it’s not their problem and that to reach out to Deepak I reached out to Depop several times throughout the emails and I’ve gotten responses back and then been totally ignored over email!! Alongside this a Depop is a very hard app to manage you cannot just delete your account you have to email the company which is very confusing why there is a point in doing that!! And there is a lot of hidden fees that are in Depop you may think that using Poshmark is worse because there’s a 20% reduction in pay instead of a 10% and the pop is actually tricking you and taking a bunch of money once you see it in your PayPal. Overall I am very disappointed with the customer service in Depop ignoring me several times having no one to call no phone numbers if they don’t even respond to their emails! I’ve had this problem with a buyer over a week because of Depop to be able to give me my shipping label which I’ve been able to do so many times before and I do not want to get bad reviews because of an issue that I have not caused! I have to give five stars a rest my review won’t go through hmmm fishy
developerResponse:
{'id': 18359309, 'body': "

Hey, sorry about this.
 
If you can follow this link and submit a request if you're still struggling that would be great. https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360046290994-I-can-t-access-my-shipping-label-USPS-MyHermes-
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-08T22:23:19Z'}

developerResponse: {'id': 17671264, 'body': 'Hey, rest assured that Depop can only take payments for sales and shipping labels, so you won’t be overcharged. Check here for more info or to contact our support team https://bit.ly/depopfee\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2020-09-03T11:46:07Z'}

title: Not Great
review: Doesn’t show a way to delete an item at all, and to delete your account is very difficult. The user interface is shaky and all the transactions are a little sketchy.

title: Fees
review: The fee when u sell something is kinda crazy but other than that it’s amazing
developerResponse:
{'id': 6783940, 'body': 'Hi there, I understand that you may believe that the Depop fee is high and believe me if we didn’t have to charge a fee we wouldn’t!

The 10% fee may seem like a lot for your sale but, when we break this down into what the fee contributes to, it makes a lot more sense. The fee is in place to keep the app up and running, with general up-keep costs and to pay all of our employees, from engineers to us in support. 

Unlike many other selling platforms, at Depop only charge you when you make a sale, this means there are no fees for the length of time your item has been listed for or any initial costs to list the item, so list to your heart’s content because its all free!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2019-01-11T06:50:58Z'}

title: I absolutely love Depop.
review: I've been using Depop for about a year and a half now, and I've personally done well selling and purchased some awesome items. I've been featured twice on the explore page, and I'm not by any means "Depop famous". I have a little over a thousand followers. One of my items was featured when I had about 400 followers. I've noticed in the reviews a lot of people are complaining about not getting their items on the explore page. If you're not getting featured it's because your photos or your items don't meet certain standards, not because you're not "Depop famous". If you really look at featured items, plenty of them are owned by small accounts, sometimes with no reviews. "Depop famous" people are popular and get featured often because they have great photos and items. I've used every selling app available, and Depop is BY FAR my favorite. Insanely easy to use, with a unique, generally very friendly, vintage-appreciating community of people. I've had small problems with only a couple of buyers, but none with sellers, and I've worked the issues that did arise out with Depop, and the buyers, and it turned out just fine. The Depop team has always been helpful and kind when I've communicated with them. Before Depop, I used Mercari, which I got scammed on numerous times as a buyer and seller, and ultimately had my money stolen from me by the app itself, and only had robots to communicate with, who were of no help. (Not to mention, Mercari is full of children, rude buyers, and thousands upon thousands of counterfeit item sellers.) Depop is so, so so much better than anything else out there. I love it, and I hope it continues to grow, yet maintain its unique atmosphere. You should try it, if you haven't already.
developerResponse: {'id': 4729517, 'body': "Thanks for the really great feedback here - it's very useful to see such good tips for new Sellers so we appreciate this and super happy to have you on Depop :)", 'modified': '2018-08-20T09:05:07Z'}

title: I do not like this app.
review: When I first got it, I thought it was great. However, when I began to sell I discovered you barely make any money. You have to upcharge everything so much in order to even make a decent amount of money. I hate it.
developerResponse:
{'id': 6005800, 'body': 'Hi there, I understand that you may believe that the Depop fee is high and believe me if we didn’t have to charge a fee we wouldn’t!

The 10% fee may seem like a lot for your sale but, when we break this down into what the fee contributes to, it makes a lot more sense. The fee is in place to keep the app up and running, with general up-keep costs and to pay all of our employees, from engineers to us in support. 

Unlike many other selling platforms, at Depop only charge you when you make a sale, this means there are no fees for the length of time your item has been listed for or any initial costs to list the item, so list to your heart’s content because its all free!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-19T11:10:57Z'}

developerResponse:
{'id': 8258728, 'body': 'Hey Emlynn, thank you for your feedback. Please know that payments go straight from the buyer to the seller when making a transaction. If you did not receive payment this could be due to your PayPal account needing extra verification in order to receive payments. If you contact our support team they will give you a hand with this. 

If you feel an account that has reached to you may not be fully a real account, please do report this to us and we will take action immediately. 

We want to make sure our community feels loved, supported and protected so do reach out to us for any help you need!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2019-04-17T10:49:20Z'}

title: Rip off
review:
I’ve used this app a few times to sell things, I recently sold a $90 item 
And Depop CHARGED me $17
So basically I only got 73 for my $90 item. What a rip off! 
A Depop fee + shipping that I wanted the buyer to pay for. 
When you select “buyer pays for shipping”
It really means that YOU (the seller) will pay for shipping. So disappointed they ripped me off. I’ll be selling my things on other apps that don’t take so much from you.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5805756, 'body': 'Hi there, this might jus be a slight misunderstanding. So, any sales made in Depop has a fee taken out of 10% of the price you have listed your item for.  It seems you have also opted for the shipping label within the app. 

Whether you have chosen for the buyer to pay for shipping, the payment would still be taken you from your Paypal. In turn you will receive the payment of the item alongside the payment of the shipping from the buyer. 

Hope this clears things out a bit, if not, please let me know your username and we will reach out to the support team for you and see how they can clarify this.

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-05T09:57:44Z'}

title: Amazing customer service+quality
review: I don’t usually write reviews on apps, but the service and help I’ve received from the Depop team has been INCREDIBLE. I got into a really unfortunate situation with a buyer whose real goal was to scam me into selling a beautiful prom dress for almost free with promise to not just to pay a discounted price I offered because her own prom was approaching, but also promise to pay for the $50 express shipping to her remote town in the middle of nowhere. She lied many times that she would send me items from her own Depop to pay for the shipping but eventually just turned rude and abusive, harassing me and calling me unpleasant names before blocking me after receiving the dress. I was pretty upset, as I had really loved the dress and it was hard enough to part from it, let alone get scammed into losing almost 80% of what I paid for it by some mean girl. I tried to figure out my options, but with her having me blocked on basically ALL social media accounts, it was hard. I reached out to customer service, who promptly responded and gave me almost unbeatable service and help. They were kind, responsive, and seemed genuinely interested in helping me figure out this situation. Eventually, after giving some screenshots forward (and even though they were quite old by the time I pursued the case) I was able to find them helping me by reaching out to her account requesting she pay me back. Eventually her account did not respond (typical of her at this point lol) and they had her account suspended, which is an amazing amount of dedication to the real buyers and sellers on Depop who don’t scam and who just want to do real, true business. Not only did they protect future Depop users from getting scammed and harassed too, but they also offered to fully refund me for the entire shipping cost. All in all, an amazing experience with the Depop app and customer service. If you’re looking for a buyer/seller marketplace with genuinely and thoughtful admin, look no further!! I will definitely be using Depop far into the future. <333

title: Occasional good find, otherwise abysmal
review:
Although Depop can be a resource for the occasional great vintage find, the customer service, and the expectations placed on sellers is garbage, and is certainly what’s making it harder in the era of “everyone can do everything”/rampant mediocrity for those of us that actually sell online professionally and with service standards to get by.  
Although there are some great vintage, professional vintage sellers on the app, the vast majority of clothing and accessories are 90s-era thrift store trash listed by 22 year olds.  I’ve been using this app for about half a year or less, and I’ve had to contact customer service at least 5 times for purchases items not being shipped, sellers ignoring my messages and requests for information after purchasing, items arriving with undisclosed damage and stains, and so on.  A great example: I had to contact CS just this morning for an item supposedly shipped (the seller would not provide tracking) 2 weeks ago from someone in the SAME CITY as me that still hasn’t arrived.  Depop’s response?  “Looks like this customer sells a lot on Depop, so they’re probably just a little behind!”  ... are you kidding me?  How hard is it to put a piece of lingerie in the mail and ship it, especially if they’re such an “active seller”?  I’m fed up with this app, and dealing with idiots who lie about the condition of their clothing and shipping status with NO repercussions from the app.  For reference: I’ve been selling (and buying) clothing on Etsy and EBay for years and have NEVER experienced anything like this, much less in a 4 month span.
developerResponse: {'id': 3316382, 'body': "Hey there - sorry that you're not having a good Depop experience right now. We appreciate that in the example you cited you'd definitely expect the item to come sooner, but we do have to treat all sellers as the same which is why we normally suggest reporting such an issue to us anywhere between 7-21 days from the date of purchase. Nevertheless we'll take this feedback on board when planning and amending our policies and communications to users who are repeatedly sending items 'not as described'. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-01T13:54:31Z'}

title: UnFu**N-Believable!!!!
review: Unbelievable. Have to put five stars just to get your review Viewed!!! Zero stars or magazine for that matter Bc that how much they care about you and me. Unreal that people can buy trash bags full of used donated stained clothes & model & sell them for 50$ a pop. And get away with it. Be promoted for great photo ‘editing & style’... smfh But yet in the past 18months I have been kicked off DEPOP platform for next to nothing & with No Explanation countless times. No emails for why or how, Or what I had done. After second time around I was told by a chance support response Iv had too many ‘complaints’ against me 🤔 That funny bc I didn’t even know there was one.?! If someone files a complaint against another user, the ‘alleged’ is not informed rightfully; & given chance to defend themselves against, bots spams haters or spiteful claims?? Bc I have proof of authenticity & have a real stalker in life, that blatantly searches & destroys my every attempt at success in life. So give this is the most applicable reason for my complaints, anybody can say anything bout another user and they are removed? It is funny bc they are not only platform to do this to me. MERC did. Etsy did. And it is quite disheartening when nobody gives you benefit of the doubt. Only platform that has ever showed regard for my say is posh. I’ll forever stay faithful to them for so. With no regard for your sellers you don’t deserve to make such money off these people trying make a living it is quite disgusting & highway unjust robbery. Hopefully posh buys you out sooner than later. Peace
developerResponse:
{'id': 18577196, 'body': "Hey there,

 We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-19T17:20:40Z'}

title: love depop, hate depop rules
review: i love depop, i think it’s so much fun and so interesting to find handmade items, jewelry, art, antiques, all different styles of clothing, wigs, etc. everyone is so friendly, prices are cheap & shipping is generally fast depending on the seller. This app is like a trendy thrift shop, just you can shop in your bed. However, it can be VERY irritating at times. I was logging in and forgot my password, i tried probably 4 times before getting the notification that i had to wait 23 hours to get back into my account. I found it extremely EXTREMELY ridiculous:/ most apps send you an email and have you reset your password. this is so much more convenient. I also during this process was informed that i had an account that i genuinely had no idea existed. it’s a depop rule that you can only have one account. so even though i had no idea i had an old account, i was suspended from the account i use for around 36 hours. this again, was absolutely ridiculous. it took depop a very long time to contact me back, and they have no number to call and talk to a customer service representative. the actual app is awesome. the rules and customer service.... not so awesome. i highly recommend fixing and chilling out on some of these rules because i think you could definitely lose some depop users over the excessive nature of the rules. however if like me you would like to use this app until they fix it, don’t do what i did and just hit the accept button on the rules, read them all, believe me it’s worth it, the trouble you go through to fix it all isn’t worth it!! hope this helps

title: quality of life?
review:
overall, this is a great app. i started my resale journey on a much smaller app, and although depop has gotten me more sales, there are some QoL pieces that would be great to see in the future.
one being a kind of vacation mode. this is what led me to write the review. if we had a way of flipping a setting on and off that made it obvious to any potential buyers viewing your page/items that things cannot be shipped/messages cannot be responded to for the time it is on, i think that would ease a lot of sellers’ minds and destress buyers who realize only after purchasing that the seller is not currently available. i think it is unfair to assume buyers will look through someone’s feed to see if they’re out of town, etc.
second being a way to see what has sold. not just by viewing and scrolling a specific sellers’ page, but perhaps as a search filter. it would be a nice way to get pricing ideas based on stuff that /has/ sold and not things that haven’t yet. 
third: the ability to list items under multiple categories. i struggle to list what i’m selling because often clothing can be worn by all genders. this in turn affects searching as well. i find tees for my boyfriend while searching women’s wear. y’know, unisex stuff and all. 
these suggestions aside, i really appreciate how easy it is to use depop. the message feature is a game changer and there’s no begging for reviews. i experienced a spam bot, and the account was deleted less than an hour after i reported it. so!! wonderful in the grand scheme of things, but improvements can always be made. ♡

title: Depop is good, but not as good as others.
review: Personally, I like depop because of the awesome creativeness to it. All the photos are nice and colorful and pop out, its fun just to look at how people photograph their items without even wanting to buy anything. Overall, for a buyer, it's great. As a seller though, I have some issues. The main issue being the payment methods and process. As someone who sells on Mercari and Poshmark as well as Depop, I've found that Depop makes receiving payment overly complicated. The first thing I don't particularly enjoy is that payment can only be through paypal. Both Mercari and Poshmark do direct bank transfers. This eliminates the 2.9% + 30¢ that PayPal takes on top of Depop's 10% commission. The second thing, and probably my least favorite is that when you make a sale, Depop  transfers you the total price of the purchase, including shipping (regardless of who pays) and Depop fees, then takes the shipping price and Depop fee amount out of your bank account. Why Depop can't do like Mercari and just give the seller what they earned, is beyond me. It makes finances more complicated to keep track of. My third issue with Depop is the explore page/feed. It only ever features the same people who already have thousands of followers. They never seem to give the little guys a chance, even when they have just as good or better pictures than the big guys. A fourth issue of mine is being unable to SEARCH for sold items. While you can go on someone's page to find what they've sold, it's not the same as searching for an exact comp of what you're selling. However, aside from these issues, Depop is a great platform with some great features, such as being able to refresh your posts without dropping the price. Communicating between buyer and seller is also very easy on Depop. Overall a good app, just wish some things were tweaked.
developerResponse:
{'id': 7522484, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for giving us some feedback. We love that you're enjoying our platform and we appreciate the feedback you have given us. The idea of PayPal is to have double protection for our users, both for our sellers and our buyers. We understand that this may not be a friendly experience, so we're making sure to have a further look into this. 

As payment our send direct from the buyer to the seller, the cost of the fee and shipping needs to be taken from the seller's account as we cannot interfer in the transferring of the payment to your account as a seller. 

We love you and are happy that you're part of our community, so I will make sure to pass this on to the team.

Kisses, Depop", 'modified': '2019-03-01T08:12:39Z'}

title: As a Seller & Buyer
review:
I have found my favorite clothing items from Depop. It has helped me curate a closet almost entirely second hand from this site, other resell sites & thrifting. 

As a buyer, the prices can get outrageous and honestly annoying knowing most items are sourced for more than half the asking price (but if you sort by price, do a lot of digging etc and it’s no big deal). And most times the items are crazy unique, vintage, beautiful and hard to find and as a seller I know why the prices are so high. Most shop owners put a lot of care into their brand and customer service more than any resell app. It’s fun to shop on this app; the same fun I have with thrifting. 

As a seller, this app easy to navigate. The fees can get annoying but not as expensive as other resell apps (Etsy, etc). The profit margin can get pretty slim with all of the fees and shipping costs, and often times you need a large inventory to combat that. Right now i’m just a small closet seller and only selling old items from my personal closet so I’m not losing money from buying inventory. If I was my prices would hike up and buyers don’t often understand why, creating a lot of hate off app. The Depop buyer demographic tends to sway younger and if you market the item right, can sell successfully with time despite being a smaller shop. Depop has worked on lessening the amount of dropshippers present on the app, though there are some that are still some drop shops taking advantage of buyers on here (Depop needs to make a warning guide for buyers. Tips on how to know which shops droppship and how to avoid them would be helpful). Customers are generally well mannered and this app has good buyer/seller protection. There are a lot of flaws but overall this single app has created a crazy creative and diverse community of fashion lovers. It’s one of the bigger apps that has popularized second hand fashion and I have more pros than cons.
developerResponse: {'id': 19391245, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-27T11:31:33Z'}

title: Pretty amazing
review: It’s a very great app with people who are trying to recycle/sell used clothes AND most of the items are very unique looking, in style, and overall affordable. I would recommend to anyone. However, I am only giving 4 stars, not because of the app itself, but it seems a little too easy for someone to rip you off (it hasn’t happened yet but it can get pretty close). Luckily there’s a communication system you can use between buyers and sellers. Almost all the sellers I’ve met on there is very nice, keeps you informed about shipping, and are very honest about small defaults in clothing (I.e small holes, stains, sizes). However I did come into contact with one person who did not keep me informed about shipping and took nearly two weeks just to get around to shipping it, if I had not messaged them asking/reminding them to do so, (because of the their own policy that sellers can make themselves, such as no refunds) they could have blocked me and I would have had no chance of getting my money back unless i directly filed a complaint against them to depop. However, I did resolve it, by asking politely and offering help. As a buyer, you should be very particular as to how you treat the sellers (I’ll elaborate as to why in a moment); but try not to let that situation steer you away from the app, I would just use the app with caution (you should real the sellers policy/reviews before buying from them, then you should be good). Anyway, last point to make is please, as a buyer, be respectful and patient toward the sellers, and share concerns and questions. It will benefit both you and the seller if you approach a situation with an open mind, patience, and respectfulness. Also, not only do seller have reviews, but buyers do aswell. Almost every seller will make a review on a buyer, if you have a low review BUYERS CAN REJECT THEIR SERVICE! BUT if you think a seller is being unfair you can report/block them.
developerResponse: {'id': 6451249, 'body': "Thank you so much for taking the time to give us some feedback. It's all very handy ofro ur users to know and we appreciate you taking the time to write this to us and them. Please do know that any payment made inside the app will be covered when instructions are followed so if there's any questions you have on the refund process then do give us a shout! If a user has blocked you during a transaction, do report this as well as the support team will open an investigation against this user.\n\nMuch love, Depop", 'modified': '2018-12-19T02:21:31Z'}

title: Really awesome app— some thoughts about reviews
review:
I’ve been selling on depop for just a few months now and really enjoying the app. It’s for the most part a very positive and supportive space and very user friendly. I really like the aesthetic of the app and how the shops appear. 

I just wanted to leave some feedback because I think that depop could greatly improve the buyer experience by removing the option for sellers to rate buyers. I’ve noticed that there is a stigma around shops with less than 5 star ratings, and a pressure for buyers to rate sellers 5 stars no matter what. I have seen many examples of buyers unknowingly giving a 4 star review that is often very kind and respectful and provides genuine helpful feedback for the seller to make their products better, just for the buyer to retaliate with a one star snarky review that greatly impacts the buyer’s own star ratings. As a seller myself, I geatly value feedback from my buyers and I know that many other sellers on depop feel the same way. As a buyer, I would like to give honest reviews that are helpful and constructive to the seller without fearing retaliation or punishment that would harm my own shop image. The best solution to this problem is either to remove the option for sellers to rate buyers, or to make all reviews completely anonymous. Personally, I would prefer both. Everyone likes having all five star reviews, but It’s unrealistic to foster an expectation that ALL shops maintain that kind of streak. Businesses grow and develop, and honest feedback is part of that. 

Hopefully this feedback is helpful. Overall, I’ve really enjoyed this app and I hope that it can continue to become better and be a great place for selling secondhand products !

title: It's great but... there are a few things
review:
Shipping cost needs to be put next to the price cause most of the times shipping isn't free and my cart is full with a billion things that I added just to see shipping because shipping cost definitely matters to the consumer and there is no reason why we shouldn't see it upfront. 
 A make an offer feature would also be wonderful, that can be declined or adjusted by the seller, or even disabled on certain items or the shop as a whole. 
 Not that this is too important but I should also be able to choose whether men's or woman's or both appears on my explore I have my sizes set to men's yet the majority of the clothes in explore are women's clothes, I get the majority of it is from the "things we love category" but I have no interest in woman's clothes. 
I would like to suggest that there is infinite scroll besides the search bar and explore. Sort of how on instagrams explore you click on a post and then can keep scrolling through that way I can consistently see larger pictures other than just thumbnails through the search bar or explore, because sometimes an item that I don't think looks good but then click on to see it larger is more appealing.
 Other than that great app I've only made one purchase so far but it's great just to look around and gather inspiration but -2 stars cause it's only average as of writing this review but I could change depending on the future of the app. I've got my friends to download the app and they all enjoy it as well but we have similar views on these features. I see a bright future for the app and hope it's success continues :)

title: Fees refund
review:
The site is ok but the advertisement fee they take out of Paypal (after deducting the fee from the original transaction on the receipt page!) seems a bit excessive. ESP when you see they have directions on how to refund the seller but then they don’t tell you that you need to directly contact depop (in the same article) to get your refund for the advert/sale. It’s like they WANT you to forget/ not realize that you are owed that money back should the sale not go through for any reason. wether it’s the buyer who wants a refund or the seller needs to cancel either way, you need to manually go in and refund them through Paypal and Depop isn’t linked and has no way of knowing unless you contact them directly with the info they require to refund the fees. Ie your UN, the customers UN, the original date of the sale, the amount of fees they charged you and a photo proving you provided the customer refund. So 6 things total. I’m still not clear if they keep the money they took out of the sale and we just get the advert fee back from Depop that came out of Paypal separately? 

I think the fees and refunds part is a bit shady in that respect incase you run into an issue like I did and need to reverse several sales for whatever reason you need to remember the fee you paid out directly to them at the time of the sale. So if you refund anyone for ANY reason be sure to contact them with the 6 pieces of info above so they can refund your fees bc it no where states they get to keep that if the sale doesn’t finalize. Also in some of my transactions they took out as much as 30% (or somewhere close) for an advert fee. $9 for a $30 sale not to mention the $3 they take out of the original bill. Also the receipts in the sold section where the label comes up it still says “leave feedback” so you are able to receive and leave feedback for cancelled sales. This is a bug they should have worked out long ago and they should be affiliated with Paypal so that we automatically get refunded fees and the sale stops showing on my feed. 

Other than that issue it’s an all around solid app. I just hate anything having to do with Paypal and wish they processed their own transactions like Mercari or poshmark.
developerResponse: {'id': 3269392, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for taking the time to write this. We agree that the fee refund process for users (and us!) is a little laborious at the moment. We're currently working with PayPal to understand whether there is a way to make this a more seamless experience, and we hope that you'll spot some improvements this year on that front. With regards to taking more than 10% as an advertising fee: it sounds like this is the shipping cost of an item you sold. As we can't take the money from the buyer, this is initially taken from the seller and then refunded to you. If you need a little more clarity on this, don't hesitate to contact our support team. Thanks! Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-26T11:07:07Z'}

title: Great app-needs improvement
review:
Ive been selling/buying for almost a year and I do love it. There have been some problems but they have been resolved, though they took some time to do so. I've never really dealt with any horrible rude people, everyone's been very nice. I do have a problem with the explore page. I've been featured maybe three times but haven't in a really long time. The same people get featured; I was just scrolling through the explore page and the same girl was on there 5 times. I have updated all my items with try on photos since Depop says that's the best way to get featured/sell items. Some other things; 1)the delete button on photos when editing is super super difficult to click. I will press it a bunch of times right on the nose and it takes like ten taps for it to ask if I want to delete. 
2) PLEASE PLEASE FIX THIS PROBLEM. I always do the shipping with USPS option and never the my own shipping. Idk how this happens, I saw another reviewer have the same issue, but when I go to edit an item, for some reason the items says I'm selling using my own shipping when I definitely DID NOT CHOOSE THAT. And when I go to change it it doesn't work. It only does when I restart the app. I just sold an item and do not have a shipping label because the shipping option was changed and I DID NOT CHANGE IT MYSELF 
3) please please P L E A S E  put an option to rearrange items IN THE APP. The only way to move your items around is to log onto the computer. Why can't you just do it in the app?? 
4) the amount of spam/scam comments and messages I get is so annoying. I know that's a problem on all sites/apps but it happens so often. 
Other than a few problems I love this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 925265, 'body': 'Hi, thanks for the feedback. We had a backend bug that meant likes were not being shown temporarily. This has now been fixed so it should be back to normal now. If you have any other issues please contact us on support@depop.com', 'modified': '2017-08-02T14:59:16Z'}

title: meh
review: the app is cool for getting unique piece but prices for other things are ridiculous. 70 for a simple pair of jeans or 34 for a simple crop top. it’s also very hard to sell bc depop doesn’t help smaller or less known sellers. plus, the app is always glitching now, even after updates.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10699888, 'body': "Hey there. Thanks for the great feedback.

Sellers choose what price they list their items as, we'd suggest using the Price Filter in Search to find amazing items within your budget.

We also get that struggling to sell can be frustrating. However, we've created a dedicated Seller Handbook to help our Users shoot, style and sell. 
Check it out here: https://sellers.depop.com/SellerHandbook_UK_18.12.18-1.pdf

To stop your app from glitching, try removing cached data by going to ‘Settings - Apps - Depop - Storage - Clear Data’ on your phone. Then, completely delete and re-download the app. Still crashing? Drop us a line at support@depop.com.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-09-16T10:33:32Z'}

title: Love the app
review: Just don’t like how high the fees are then PayPal takes more :/
developerResponse:
{'id': 5905680, 'body': 'Hi there,

I understand that you may believe that the Depop fee is high and believe me if we didn’t have to charge a fee we wouldn’t!

The 10% fee may seem like a lot for your sale but, when we break this down into what the fee contributes to, it makes a lot more sense. The fee is in place to keep the app up and running, with general up-keep costs and to pay all of our employees, from engineers to us in support. 

Unlike many other selling platforms, at Depop only charge you when you make a sale, this means there are no fees for the length of time your item has been listed for or any initial costs to list the item, so list to your heart’s content because its all free!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2018-11-12T11:35:16Z'}

title: Great! But need more brands!
review:
Highly recommend this app for any vintage clothing sellers, it’s a super easy platform to use, and one of my favorite features of the app is being able to mark things as sold instead of deleting the item if it sold on another selling platform. It takes the same percentage as EBay, but in my opinion it is a lot smoother of a design than eBay and is great for people who want a more curated environment to sell in.

I do have some critiques however:

1) PLEASE ADD MORE BRANDS, unlike other selling apps who have a great database of brand to chose from when you list an item, depop has only a few. For example, if I was to list a shirt from the 80s thats branded “Short Hills Tee” or “Sport-Tee”, I would have to chose a different brand instead of those because they don’t have such options, despite them being a very mass produced shirt. Same goes for other well known brands made today. Please add some more brand to chose from so I can have more specified listings!!

2) You can’t filter to see items that are already sold, even though you can see sold items on sellers pages. This part just doesn’t make sense to me logically. In every other selling app I’ve been on, there is always an option where you can filter though the sold and available items, in order to get an idea about how much the item your about to list will sell for on the platform, however this is not an option for Depop. I would highly suggest adding this feature, as it would help a lot of new buyers to be able to price there items accurately, instead of having to use another app’s resources to do so!

Please recommend this comment and like if it was helpful! Help get the attention of depop to see this comment!

title: Severe Spam and Transparency Issues
review:
I’ve been using Depop for a couple years and for the most part I’ve enjoyed it, most buyers/sellers are great, and I think Depop’s customer service is really wonderful, but the app has a lot of problems. As far as selling goes, the only issue I really have is the 4 photo limit for a listing. 4 photos definitely isn’t enough and it would be nice to see 8 photos allowed instead, like it is with most other apps. 

The issue with Depop mainly comes from buying. The app is absolutely FULL of spam. People will leave a giant paragraph of random keywords in their description boxes, most of which have nothing to do with the actual product they’re selling. So when you’re  searching for an item, the vast majority of items that come up in the search results have absolutely zero relation to what you were searching for. You have to spend ages combing through listings hoping to EVENTUALLY find something related to your search. And people frequently tag items as being brands they aren’t for “exposure”, so even if you select to search through a particular brand, a good portion of what comes up isn’t even that brand  either! 

 And while I hate that Depop allows drop shipping, the very least they could do is require transparency. People will frequently list drop shipping items as “handmade” or “vintage”, when they aren’t. Also, another issue is people aren’t informed about WHERE drop shipping items are coming from. The item location is where the SELLER is located. Not necessarily the item. So you could purchase an item thinking it’s coming from New York, then come to find out its being shipped from China. I think Depop definitely has strong points, and overall I’ve enjoyed selling on the app, but they just really need to find ways to cut down on spamming, and enforce some transparency guidelines.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10627443, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the review. With regards to spam and brand spam, we've recently introduced some new listing requirements that will limit unnecessary tagging and spam. You should start to see the benefits of this now. Thanks for the photos suggestion, also. We're looking into alternatives here, so stay tuned.

Thanks for also sharing your concerns on Drop Shipping. We acknowledge that this may be having an effect on both Buyers and Sellers. We're investigating our options on a company-wide level to assess its impact on our Community. Our priority is to ensure that Depop highlights the type of items you want to see.

We will do our best to give our Community the answers and policy they deserve. This article should be closer in line with the transparency you're looking for: 
https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360026573794-What-is-drop-shipping-and-is-it-allowed-on-Depop-

Stay tuned,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-09-11T09:16:49Z'}

title: This is my 2nd review attempt to get yall’s attention
review: Okay, so I’ve had an issue with my notifications on depop for the past 2 months. For some reason, I only get a notification if an item gets sold or my depop payments is notifying me of money that is going in the bank soon. I have all the notifications that I want set in the in app settings and obviously on my apple settings (since I get notified when an item gets sold). I never get notifications when someone messages me, which is really inconvenient now, and it has been like this for the past few months.. I’ve contacted you guys both in-app and through email and through instagram comments AND made a review to discuss my issue but I have still gotten NO response. Last time I made a review, your “developer commentator” seemed to respond almost right away, telling me to go in-app and try to request help there. But I have still have yet to have gotten help. I get that we’re in a pandemic and I get your platform isnt that big compared to Ebay, but at this point, it’s as if you guys have no customer service at all. Please invest more money in it because yall are clearly slacking in this area. Just as you guys say in your seller handbooks... “customer service is key.” So please reciprocate that same energy into your own practices... Rather than focusing on protecting your brand’s image through the app store in your developer comments, try actually helping the customers. I love your platform but you guys are seriously lacking and this seems to be a very prevalent issue within the depop community. Thank you
developerResponse:

Hey, our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we'll be in touch ASAP.
