title: Some New Feature Ideas
review:
Depop is an amazing app and super easy to use. I’ve made plenty of sales and it’s definitely the platform that I’ve made the most profit off of. However, I believe that there should be more features to make the app even better.

First suggestion: be able to see the sold items while searching

I believe that this feature would be useful because from a seller perspective, it’s nice to see the price of items that are similar to the items you’re selling go for. It would give you a nice price range to know what price would be most ideal for what you’re selling - and would probably boost more sales too as sellers know what’s reasonable and what’s not. It may also help seller’s make more money by not pricing it too low either, so it’d be for the best on both spectrums.

Second suggestion: have “free/seller pays for shipping” as an option in the filters while searching

I believe that this particular feature would be useful because as a buyer, you like to know what the price is of the item prior with the shipping included in the original price. If you are on a budget and only are willing to pay a max price that includes shipping, this would be perfect. Too many times I’ve been browsing and found something I’ve wanted to buy, but found that it was $7 for shipping for a simple shirt. This would prevent this from happening by knowing whether or not shipping is already included within the price.

Thanks Depop team! I really appreciate how much you listen to the feedback your users give - it’s not something many apps do in this time of age.
developerResponse: {'id': 3074457, 'body': 'Hey Ru - this is great; we love reading reviews like this because they give us a great idea of what our community wants in future editions of the app. Thanks again! Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-04-09T10:58:17Z'}

title: buying & selling on DEPOP
review:
the app is great! overall, it’s a great community of people, there’s nice items to see, and there is plenty of fantastic sellers! 

BUYING EXPERIENCE: it’s very simple and nice. BUT, no seller is the same! some will be interactive with you and some will not message you at all. either way, you can easily message them on your concerns about your item(s). also, SOME sellers will not admit to damage of an item, so make sure you know the condition of your item before spending your money on it. For the most part, sellers are honest and will admit to anything about the item. Plus, many (not all) are willing to negotiate prices with you! 

SELLING EXPERIENCE: this process is simple, as well. You can choose to “ship with Depop” which is Depop setting the prices and making the label for you (which you have to print out somehow) and it’s all through USPS (unless you’re located in another country). You can also set your own shipping prices and create the label another way (i.e. Paypal). Setting your own prices can also include international shipping (if you desire to ship that way). I have been selling on Depop for a few months now and i’ve sold quite a bit of items. it’s fun because i love making packages for people and it makes me happy to know that i’m decluttering my closet! The things I have noticed: getting things going when it comes to selling (this process will be slow considering you’re new. you need to take nice pictures, set good/fair prices, and make your shop appealing), and some buyers will attempt to low ball you. now, if you’re okay with any price, be my guest! if not, do not let them low ball you because remember: it’s your items, your shop, and your rules! Once you get things going, you and the buyer can easily leave reviews for each other, and when you start shipping items out periodically (i.e. i ship almost every day), it will put on your profile an estimate of how fast you ship. My profile says “often ships in 1 day”. Overall, it’s been going great so far. ALSO*** Depop takes off a 10% fee from any purchase. For example: if you are selling a shirt for $10, you will receive $9 from that because it’s 10%. They take 10% off the total of the item(s), this does not include the final total with shipping! 

My advice is to be creative with photos and captions, give insane amounts of details (things you would like to know if you were the buyer), and be friendly! Make sure you’re doing what you like while having great customer service + ensuring your customer is happy! 

I hope this helps! Thank you again, Depop.

title: Awful customer service and operations
review: The only reason I’m giving 2 stars is because I really enjoy the curated aesthetic of clothing that’s promoted on the app. The buyer market is also so huge which is a plus, although many platforms like Ebay are actually better and bigger. The customer service and seller protection is god awful. Getting help from support is a complete joke and they will never, ever side with sellers that make them 1K in fees and up, but somehow they will choose to side with rude buyers that offer them nothing in terms of sale fees. I’m not the first and certainly not the last seller to be treated awfully by Depop customer support. They make it extremely difficult to contact them and purposely hide their customer service email so their agents can be the lazy people they are and avoid the many, many issues their customers want to discuss with them. They also purposely hide and censor comments that demonstrate their inconsistent policies. The development team purposely ignores and even belittles complaints about the app (crashes, bugs, algorithm changes that hurt big and small sellers). I’ve also seen so many top sellers get away with breaking rules while Depop goes after smaller accounts, it’s just so hypocritical. I’m only on the app because it’s the one platform that can cater to my style, but if a similar app came out without all the issues I’d move in a heartbeat. I’m considering making Mercari, Poshmark and Ebay my main platforms because they all have stronger aspects in customer service.

title: Nice, but some improvements would make it better...
review:
This is one of the easiest apps to use for sellers and resellers. 

Improvements I’d like to see:

The ability to add more than 4 photos. Sellers can add a video to a listing, which is helpful in some instances, but additional photos would be great.

In-app photo editing. Switching between depop and editing apps to add text, etcetera, is time consuming. 

Having an “offer” option would increase sales. If a potential buyer wants to negotiate a price, the process is clunky. 

If a buyer could just click an offer option and make an offer (like poshmark and Mercari) instead of having to get in touch with the seller, wait to hear from the seller, maybe negotiate the price some more, wait to hear from the seller again, agree on a price, wait for the seller to adjust the listing to reflect the new terms, contact the buyer to let them know the listing has been adjusted, before a sale occurs.....whew!!! That takes a lot of time! An offer option would streamline that process a great deal.
 
Also, if a seller could set a minimum price (like eBay) when an offer is made, that’s at or above the minimum, the sale would automatically go through. That would speed transactions up a bit, too. 

There could be more space in the bio section. It would be nice to have more space for important information. Shop policies, personal environment (does the seller smoke or have cats or have cats that smoke?? for instance) need to be at the very top so there’s a better chance of a buyer knowing these things in advance. 

Overall, this is a nice platform for sellers with hopes for an even better interface in the near future.
developerResponse: {'id': 4950855, 'body': "Hey Chelsea, \n\nThank you so much for the feedback! That's some great insight for us. We always enjoy some fresh eyes on our platform. Will pass this through to our team! Love, Depop", 'modified': '2018-09-05T14:29:21Z'}

title: Customer Service??
review:
Update: Issue resolved and my listing was put back up! 💛 Thank you for reading the reviews, very much a appreciated. I love depop! 

Although love this app better then all the other resale apps... I have had a few incidents with it. One, when I sell an item it doesn’t mark it sold that’s happened 3 times. Second, they removed an item and because of this 

I've had a look and it seems like this was removed due to improper item description.
We know it might be tempting to reference other brands like Chanel, Gucci, Supreme...etc in your item description, but this is improper use of trademarked brand names.

I did not improperly label or write in the description any misleading brands I had all the proper brands in the description as well as a picture of all of the tags on the items. They are not fake ties, they were actually my fathers. I emailed customer service and got that response above. I asked how I can repost without getting in trouble and having it removed again and wasn’t answered but told there was already a final answer to the inquiry. Not sure what to do about reposting still and not only that but it is a shame because I really love depop and want to continue using it. If I can’t trust their gonna remove things for no reason or strike my account even for that matter how could I use it freely as I was before. I have sold a lot of items on this app and have 41 reviews all 5 stars and great, if you look at all my descriptions I’m as honest and transparent as they come.

User: Cassie2007  Shop Name: Cassie Rey
developerResponse: {'id': 4797645, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for letting us know your username. We've looked into this and agree that there was an oversight on our part - most likely because when the item was banned the description wasn't properly absorbed (i.e the number of ties). The item should be up within the next 24 hours, and we hope this hasn't impacted your Depop experience too badly. Many thanks - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-08-24T15:53:28Z'}

title: Sellers don’t have to ship the item you bought!
review: I bought some pants from a seller on this app and the moment I bought from them the seller immediately stopped responding. I didn’t think much of it until two weeks later and the pants still weren’t shipped. I tried to check up and make sure everything was cool, it wouldn’t have been the first time someone took that long to ship an item, but I don’t usually care how long it takes the seller as long as they keep me updated. This seller, however, did not. I attempted messaging them four other times, but I didn’t get a response, keep in mind that you can see the user’s activity on the app, and they were active. I gave up with them and tried to issue a refund through the app. Depop claimed to have buyers protection as long as you purchase items through the app, so I didn’t think it would be a problem to get my money back. I was wrong. I received an auto reply the moment I issued the refund and they said they’d get back to me via email. That never happened. I tried issuing a refund a second time to see if the outcome would be different somehow, but i found out that you can’t issue a refund on the same item twice, so I tried emailing Depop directly. That time they didn’t even bother to acknowledge my email. Turns out that I’m not the only person this seller has done this to. I went to give this seller an honest review to warn potential buyers, but for some reason that feature isn’t showing up for that item anymore, so basically you’re able to post items, have people buy them, keep the money and the item, and nothing will happen to you... I’m disappointed with this situation as a whole.
developerResponse: {'id': 7216367, 'body': 'Hi there, this does sound like a very unpleasant situation. Can you let us know your username? We want to reach out to the support team and have a further look into your report.\n\nLove, Depop', 'modified': '2019-02-09T04:39:12Z'}

title: Haterz plz. I only have one complaint.
review:
People get so mad about the explore page, it’s ridiculous. I have no problem with y’all featuring the same people multiple times. Guess what, if someone continues to post quality items with good images I LOVE that depop continues to support them and give them exposure. They deserve it. If the app saw an awesome item but refrained from sharing it via explore because the person already had followers, that would be silly. The point of the explore page is to feature sick items and sick shop owners regardless of their following. I also saw a few comments saying only “wannabe Instagram models” and “people who are already famous on insta” are the only people who can succeed on this app. That’s just not true. Depop gave me a platform to become more successful, and because of depop I’ve actually gained a following on instagram, not the other way around. 

This app is DA BOMB. I’m so thankful for this platform. The community is great and I love that they actually care about having a well crafted aesthetic, it makes it such an inspiring and fresh app to be a part of. This app has made me NEVER want to go on eBay/poshmark/any other apps because this app is just so much more user friendly and appealing to young adults and teens. 

If you use common sense, scamming is rare. Let’s face it, people: scamming can happen on ANY selling platform. That’s just what happens when you’re working with people. Some are good and honest, others aren’t. If you’re afraid of being scammed, ONLY buy from sellers you trust, ones that have good reviews and a solid reputation. There are PLENTY of shops like that on depop. 

My one complaint is that I do agree with the fee, it’s ridiculous that they take 10% from the item price AND the shipping price. They should not be able to take a percentage of the shipping money..that money is TO SHIP THE ITEM. 

Anyway, thanks for creating a great selling platform and a space to make your own shop and become a boss all by yourself, depop!

title: could use some improvements
review:
overall this app is solid for vintaging clothing. however there’s a few improvements that could be made. 
1. the new “DNA” section of the app- i was excited to see this because i thought it had meant that the depop algorithm had changed. not the case. i’m still getting the same overpriced brandy tank tops, bodycon dresses, and used checkboard vans that i did before. It doesn’t make sense that the algorithm is supposed to be based off of what you like/save, because i never like or save anything close to those. i feel like depop could get a lot more $$$ as a company if they worked on improving their algorithm so buyers wouldn’t have to go through heaps of garbage to find one good item. also, the “for you”/DNA section doesn’t update regularly, which is kinda annoying. 
2. speaking of which ... misuse of tags/keywords- this is a huge one for me, although idk how depop could fix it. but it is the most frustrating thing to look up “cottagecore” or “vintage 70s” and find stuff no where CLOSE to those. there should be some way to prevent this, maybe by limiting the amount of keywords people can use? idk it’s just super annoying, because sometimes i’m not exactly looking for a specific item, more so just wanting to find style inspo. 
3. overpricing etc- this is a common frustrating that i feel like no one can really fix bc it’s not depops fault, it’s just kinda how the free market works unfortunately. but maybe for pieces claiming to be vintage, the seller should be required or encouraged to post a pic of the tag? because that’s the most telling sign that something’s vintage. idk! it just might help. 

that’s all !

{'id': 18531781, 'body': "Hey Polar Bear,

Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-16T20:54:05Z'}

title: Was good then turned bad.
review:
Was a seller for 2 years on there and recently my account was taken down because i posted a warning about a scammer. Ontop of that even saying the word “paypal” gets you banned, yet this site runs through paypal. Doesn’t make much sense. After i got the warning i changed my listings but still got banned. Also, I could not report the person properly because the options did not fit what i needed to report. Maybe add an other button with an explanation box. Tried emailing the team, and as always no response. I have reported people who never get taken down or never get an email saying that something was done about my report. Also can we talk about the fees? You guys took 12$ out of the total when that was literally the amount needed to ship. I lost money by posting it! That’s why everyone wants to go through paypal goods and services because you guys take WAY too much! Buying can be okay but i seriously don’t think you should allow people to resell USED LINGERIE. Do you guys realize the risk that is? I think you should go through listings more because people can catch stds from that! If it’s not new lingerie unused don’t let people resell! Disappointed as hell now, i love using it to buy stuff, but often on hashtags its cluttered with stuff that has nothing to do with the hashtag. I do report it but again, nothing ever comes out of it. I used to recommend Depop to everyone. Now I say to steer away from it as a seller. Multiple emails sent after they say “Go ahead send another one” and still no response. This was happening before the panademic too might i add, so thats no excuse. I think something else you guys should consider is if you delete a user who bought something from someone, now there’s NO WAY to contact that seller! I don’t know if i’m getting the stuff i ordered or not!
Edit: As you can see from their response to this they aren’t gonna do anything about it. They said the same thing from before. Did not even address any of my other concerns.

title: Depop Ruined My Only Source Of Income
review: Hey! I just want to say Depop is an amazing app! The best app to sell your items and buy as well! Personally I’ve never sold any of my items on another platform, only Depop. The community is fantastic and not only that but how they format the app is astonishing. I’m a journalist at my school and I write articles about fashion and shopping. A couple weeks ago I decided to write an article about online shopping! I didn’t write about Urban Outfitters, GRAILED, or SHEIN. I decided to write about Depop because I love what they are doing and how they encourage you to sell the cloth you don’t use so it won’t go to waste. I wrote how before this epidemic I sold on Depop as my only source of income. It help me a lot to my day to day life. After the article was written I got a lot of feedback! Many of my fellow students and friends love the app and started to buy and sell. As well as family members started to use the app. UNFORTUNATELY! SOMETHING TERRIBLE HAPPENED TO ME! A couple days ago I went on Depop and I was log out. But how?!? I didn’t log myself out nor did anything like that. I went on my email to see if there was a reason they did that. There was nothing! And I checked on the App Store if it needed an update and nothing! After a couple of days I decided to contact their customer service. They got back to me after a day or two and to my amazement they said they deleted my account for violating their terms and service. From my memory I did no such thing! I have all five star ratings, great seller, and no customer didn’t have a problem with me. Then I decided to ask what terms and services I violated and they said I was using another account and that account violated my terms and services. As well I only have one account! I’ve never had another Depop account! They mentioned some name I’ve never heard of and supposedly that was me! Me! I said I was never associated with that user and not sure how they see contacted to me. The customer service seemed to ignore what I said and they still said that I’m not allowed to have another account and I violated their terms and services (And I want to say that they NEVER I MEAN NEVER sent me an email for why they deleted my account and didn’t mention anything). I was lost with words and I was worried that the customers that I sold to weren’t going to have the ability to contact me. I sold 3 items a couple days before this happened and now am I supposed to have contact with them?!! As well I bought one thing and now am I supposed to know the shipping number or have contact with them if anything is wrong about the package! A lot was going through my head but especially how my business was ruined. I’ve spend so much time to get where I was and all those ratings for nothing! To see it get deleted. Now I have no source of income and all the jobs I’ve applied to said they don’t need new employees. Depop ruined my only source of income. All that time I put into the app was all gone! And I’ve never had any other Depop account besides mine! For my last article I’m going to write about this incident and have my title as the same as the review. Say why you should be carful and how the customer service isn’t helpful at all! And they confuse you with other users. This is just horrible and I never thought this would happen to me. All the time I put into it and I gave the Depop community back with money with the commission they got. Sadly I’m disappointed with you guys and you lost a trusted seller. Thank you and I hope this never happens to anyone.

title: Suspends accounts and gives little to no reason for it
review: I’ve had my account for more than a year now and I was getting steady following and had 21 5 star reviews nothing serious but it was still something to be happy about. Always treated everyone with kindness and respect but out of nowhere I get a temporary suspension notice for abusive behavior which I’ve never done before. The email said I could appeal it in 3 days yet I had to wait 5 days for just a response to why I got the suspension. During that time I was emailed at least 15 times asking for an explanation and never getting an answer just the same automated customer service blah blah. The final response was that they weren’t even going to let me appeal it because I somehow threatened someone on depop. What kind of customer support is this where they don’t even investigate anything they just take someone’s word for it and destroy the other persons account for no reason. I have no idea where depop got that reasoning from it honestly never happened and I’m still baffled as to how they just permanently banned me for something that never happened and made me wait 5 days to tell me this. Truly the worst place to sell items at. If you’re hoping to find a good app that values customers and has your back don’t go here they delete your account for no reason and tell you it’s your problem afterward. Also there’s big accounts that literally scam people and don’t send out orders and steal from people and depop does nothing about it but when someone doesn’t like the prices you’re putting out for your items and puts up Faldo claims towards you you’re automatically shut out. Customer support is laughable I don’t know how they hire them but you can see how much they don’t care by their responses and attitudes if they even respond at all.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18359392, 'body': "Hey there,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.
 
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-10-08T22:36:36Z'}

title: Garbage customer service, shady employees
review: Let me start by saying that I’ve been selling on this app for several years, I have 25K followers and all positive feedback. I sell vintage clothing, and recently they’ve been removing some of my items for no apparent reason. I tried contacting them several times and got to response. Finally a few days ago someone responded saying my images didn’t belong to me, which they do because I took them myself. I explained that to them and asked them to have someone else look into it and reactive my listings bc obviously there’s an issue with their system or someone is reporting me and therefore they need to do something about it. they completely ignored what I was saying and just forwarded me a list of their community guidelines, then stopped responding. I am so beyond frustrated and blown away that they literally have no respect or care to help resolve an issue for someone who makes them thousands of dollars. I also contacted them a few days ago to get my depop shipping fee refunded to me as I had to purchase my own shipping label since wherever someone makes a bundle purchase and one or more of the items is shipping with their labels, it always ends up weighing more and therefore you can’t use the provided label. They got back to me right away asking for proof of purchase and my email, both of which had already been provided with my initial request. I provided the info again and now it’s been 3 days and still no refund or response...Their customer service is absolute garbage and if things don’t start improving I will be closing my shop and taking my business elsewhere. also if you don’t like being constantly bombarded with low offers and people wanting to trade then you probably should sell on this app.

title: It’s alright so far
review:
I’ve been using this app for about three days, just as a beginner and testing out the waters... first thing first I wish they didn’t have to go through just PayPal, I wish they had more options with how to transfer money such as; cash app, or Venmo. My PayPal is the biggest issue I’ve dealt with. Not everyone is comfortable with going by just one alternative to receive their money especially if they’re not familiar with it. 

Second, I do see that there’s a certain aesthetic to this app, almost everyone or (at least the items I’ve seen,) has a certain photo quality, or the way people look to advertise their clothing. it’s almost like Instagram, but selling items. People and their “feeds,” I guess, just reminds me of all the famous people on Instagram, the explore page looks saturated and condensed

Lastly, they do want you to sell your items! Which is a good thing. I’ve used offer up for almost 1.5 years. Offer up takes awhile, you can accept or decline someone’s offer on the spot, and some people are spotty. With this app, when someone buys something, it notifies you right away having you feel like you have to pack your item right away and ship it off! I’ve already sold 3 things on here with the amount of time I’ve only been using this app. However, I wish depop could take less of a percentage, there’s already so much fees (bank transfer fees, shipping fee, depop fee,) I’m sometimes split if I do make money or not because I don’t actually know how much I should charge for shipping on my listings. 

Recap (for depop); please have more diversity on the explore page and feature more people with not just the same aesthetic, reconsider going through different banking apps to work with, and lower fees! More people would want to sell more things, and have more solid things to say about depop
developerResponse:
{'id': 12252422, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the amazing feedback from only being on the app for 3 days. Let us get back to all of your points.

1. Good news, we're currently looking into alternative payment methods for our users. Watch this space. In the meantime, please continue to use PayPal in app as this is the only way to ensure your sales/purchases are protected.

2. We'll pass the notes on to our Curation Team to see if we can expand who we're featuring.

3. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.

And finally, well done on already making sales. It's not easy being a Seller but you seem to have cracked it.

Keep on doing you,
Team depop", 'modified': '2019-12-06T12:37:28Z'}

title: Poor user culture and customer service
review: I’ve been using the Depop app for years and in the beginning it was great to use as it was easy to post items and set prices. The app was also relatively new at the time! Yet for the last year the user culture has really deteriorated the experience. This includes scammers that are both buyers and sellers. On the seller end some never ship out their items or sell counterfeit items. On the buyers end they state their item never arrive especially if they are small items and are shipped through usps. Buyers also tend to send spam messages about items to either make purchases outside of Depop, continuously ask about when the item is shipped if it isn’t shipped within a day, or ask many questions throughout the course of a week and yet not purchase the item because they “don’t have the money right now” essentially wasting sellers time. Disputes are also not handled through Depop and must be completed through PayPal which have no connection through Depop sales or individual store policies. Although I have been an avid Depop user my store has also not grown much albeit avid posting, selling, reviewing and purchasing. I can see that those who work on the app continue to promote and praise bigger/ more popular sellers as that’s where they obtain the most revenue while leaving smaller stores behind. Due to all of   reasons I will not be returning to this app or promoting it whatsoever. There is minimal regulation of a variety of problems that have been building up over the years. They are more focused on monetary gain than the user experience!! Beware!

title: depop doesn’t care about sellers
review: i have been selling on depop for around 2 years, consistently only a little under one year. depop was a lifestyle and it had saved my life. i cleared out a whole room in my house to make my little depop warehouse. i received the email that said i was one more month from being a top seller and receiving the blue check mark and getting an account manager. i woke up every morning, thinking of ways to improve my shop, it was the first and last thing i checked on my phone, always before imessages or any other social media. i wrote a five star review a few months back saying how depop saved my life and they said it was the best review they’d received and “we got you boo.” well turns out you really don’t. i went through a huge learning experience when i was messaging a girl in my depop messages and turned the conversation personal, telling her to “shut up.” it’s probably one of the lowest points i’ve ever reached and i know that i would never do anything like that again. yet depop permanently banned my account because of it with no chance to appeal. the thing that o have dedicated my entire life to, was going to move to Los Angeles to get a job at the Depop office, everything I’ve been working towards. gone down the drain because of a silly dm, that i could have made right, had i gotten the chance. i have never been so lost in life and confused and disappointed and after dedicating so much time to something, i have to reinvent my career path and choices and depop has absolutely no remorse.

title: NO BUYERS PROTECTION!!
review: I used Depop for about 5 months and had a great overall experience the whole time until I encountered my first shady seller. I always read reviews of accounts before I make a purchase to ensure other people have had good experiences purchasing through that seller. This account had all positive reviews so I didn’t think twice about the purchase. Before you know it, 9 weeks go by I hadn’t received anything. I messaged the seller numerous times and they never responded. I tried to be so understanding/patient and hoped there was just a delay, but I issued a report to Depop and they didn’t do sh+t and the seller deactivated her PayPal account and my receipt never came up through PayPal, but she definitely took my money. I had to call my bank personally and it was really just a ridiculous process. I left a review on that account saying “Never received my package be careful with this seller she’s a scam,” and so many other people started reaching out to me with the same issue asking how I got a refund because Depop wasn’t doing sh+t to help them either. That in itself is pathetic because Depop should be helping them not me. Of course I didn’t mind helping them out at all, but there’s clearly an issue if people can’t even go to Depop to resolve their Depop problems. I’ve also been reading the reviews of this app and so many other people have expressed the same concern and Depop doesn’t care to actually do something about it. They make up the same claim that their process works and they don’t need to change it and it’s safer blah blah, but NO. They’re just freaking lazy and they don’t want to have to deal with buyers protection cuz they just want to protect themselves and save their own money and watch them not even respond to this because they know I’m right. And after all that, I tried to let it go and make another purchase after everything settled down and the same thing happened. And what did Depop do to help the situation? Nothing. You have to request your payment back through PayPal which obviously if they’re scamming you they’re not going to pay you back. I didn’t even call my bank because I felt embarrassed after I literally just dealt with the same sh+t so I literally lost $80. I know this is so long, but I’m really sick of Depop sitting here and doing nothing to offer buyers protection. Love the concept, but unfortunately they don’t care about their customers.
developerResponse:
{'id': 17690561, 'body': "Hey, we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-09-04T09:18:16Z'}

title: WORST CUSTOMER HELP EVER
review: I’ve loved using Depop for the past year as both a seller and a buyer. When transactions between the seller and buyer are smooth, this app works okay and the interface is constantly improving. However, as soon as you run into a problem (i.e. seller does not send you the item, there is problem with payment, etc.), Depop Help is an absolute nightmare to deal with. If you reach out to them for help, they will give verbatim responses that are not specific to what you are asking or they won’t respond at all. After a month of paying and not receiving my item and going back and forth with Depop Help, I reached out to them again and asked for a refund. After a week, they did not respond and I filed a claim with my bank. It was only after I filed a claim that they finally reached out, offering a refund, and asked that next time, I try to resolve it with them before I file a dispute.......which is what I was trying to do for the past month with no response on their part. They asked for me to close the dispute before I can get a refund and threatened to take action against my account if I do not,  even though I’ve tried my best to resolve this in-house as peacefully and smoothly as possible. Depop Help has not been reliable or consistent in any of my interactions throughout this whole dragged out ordeal so it’s hard for me to trust their word and close the dispute since they might refuse to refund me in the end and then I would have lost the money that I paid and the item that I paid for.

{'id': 17287299, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback and we’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan.  Our support response times are currently slightly longer due to the current pandemic, but we will always aim to respond if you contact us. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed so we'll be passing this feedback along to the relevant Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-08-14T15:08:01Z'}

title: Could use some improvements
review:
Overall, the app is wonderful! There are a lot of reasons to use this app over many other online thrift stores. But some things that I don’t like about the app are as followed:
1. Setting sizes- you can save your sizes in your profile, but 9 times out of 10 it doesn’t carry over as a filter while browsing added items. That’s in searches, Picked For You, and Things We Love.  Every now and then it does, but it gets really annoying FAST when every time you want to view a different category of clothing you have to set the sizes again.
2. Setting prices- this is almost the same as the size settings. There’s no option in settings to set your max price or anything, which is very normal and fine! But when browsing through the Picked For You, you can’t set a price. You can set this in other spaces, but most of the time it won’t set the filter and continues to show every item. 
3. Sold items- items that are sold are constantly still displayed in all categories. I understand that the listings will stay on the website, but often I’ll view very specific items and they’re already sold, which gives me no point in saving them. There should be an algorithm that removes them from general searches, or allows you to choose “available items”, “all items”, or “sold items” tabs in filters. 

These are my only issues that I have with the app, but these things are very important to me and over time I feel the usability has actually decreased, which is my reason for three stars. I still very much enjoy using the app and will continue doing so, but these fixes would make the buyer experience much better!
developerResponse:
{'id': 16866377, 'body': "
Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. We'll be passing this along to our Product Team.

Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-25T17:09:09Z'}

title: Worst customer service ever
review: I swear I’ve never talked to more robotic people in my entire life. Their responses aren’t genuine or personalized at all, I sent an email about a refund I had to send and how it finally worked but my account was negative because of them charging their fees and she had some sort of nerve asking for screenshots I had already sent in a previous email and ended it with some sort of emote which I felt was inappropriate for the situation. The customer service is so bad I swear don’t even bother with them they don’t want to help you. On top of that I got several emails saying my items would be taken down and they NEVER WERE which is what started my issue in the first place. The girl bought an item that I had sold to a friend in person and I hadn’t taken it off Depop because I assumed that their email was correct and they had removed my items. Well they didn’t and she bought it and I had to go through the embarrassment of explaining that I needed to refund her for her money. After MULTIPLE days of playing tag with PayPal and Depop I finally managed to get the poor girl her money back, but now my PayPal balance is negative $23 for ‘advertising’ fees and I don’t have money to cover that. How’s that fair Depop? Contacting your customer service is a dead end because they keep asking me for the same information I’ve already sent and I’m sick and tired of dealing with your company at this point. It’s a wonder you stay afloat with your horrid customer service. I’m done here. The second I get that refund my account is getting shut down.
developerResponse: {'id': 4754656, 'body': 'Hi there - if this issue is yet to be resolved could you please update this review to include your Depop @username so we can better understand what we can do to help? Thanks - Team Depop', 'modified': '2018-08-21T16:05:50Z'}

title: Employees are monsters
review: Depop is a nightmare. I literally have trauma from their employees terrorizing me over a period of 2 years. I joined when it first became available in the US. They had US employees. It was laidback and easygoing. They would warn you if you went against their terms so you could fix it. It felt like a community. I used to post tutorials to help new sellers learn how to ship items. Then they fired their US teams and the UK employees took over. One decided she didn’t like me for some reason. She kept mass deleting my items and closing my account. I would have to email over and over and over until finally someone else would read it and fix it. I never once got an apology. Potentially buyers would be really wary of me, obviously. I would finally get a few sales, and they would do it again. I would have to refund my sales. Paypal doesn’t refund fees, so I LOST money. Actual money that was mine to Depop. I told them every single time that I am disabled and literally survive on what I make online. I went without food and suffered serious psychological trauma because some horrible employee in London decided that she didn’t like me. If you think it’s easy to get help as a disabled person, you are clearly not disabled. I relied on my depop sales to survive, they knew that, yet they kept attacking me, gaslighting me, defending their bully of an employee. I would gave sued, had I been heathy enough. I spoke to a lawyer and I had grounds because I had an agreement with them that she wouldn’t be allowed to mess with me anymore, but they kept doing it. They know exactly what they did, but never apologized, never offered any sort of compensation or gave my account back. All they do is twist the facts and keep getting my reviews removed. I have all the emails with them clearly lying about what I said when my message is right there. That’s gaslighting, which is abuse. This company is absolutely shameless. If they were decent people, they would have reprimanded their employee and made things right with me. They reply to my reviews but refuse to reply to my emails, 2 years after the last time, so this is what, 4 years total now? There are many other apps out there now, thankfully; try one of those instead. These are bad people, plain and simple.

title: Need ACTUAL buyer protection
review: I made a purchase through this app after looking for another poshmark/mercari. I didn’t realize how much weight is shifted in the sellers side. The seller I dealt with was selling name brand knockoffs, then tucking it into the description *not said name brand. I messaged seller 2 mins after purchasing & explained this was my first purchase & I didn’t realize they were dupes until purchased. They take over a day to respond to messages (multiple times) & told me “you can resell it” which basically means to me: you accidently bought a knockoff & i finally got it off my hands so it’s on you now. In reality, these will never be sold because there’s a ridiculous amount of knockoffs of this specific product I can’t even tell if half the products are real (unless they come with tags). It’s ridiculous the sellers are allowed to put the Brand as the brand they’re impersonating, then hide in the bottom of the description *not (brand), then on top of it buyers have 0 protection for not understanding that selling knockoffs of name brands & making the brand as the description tag is allowed & losing money because of it. Poshmark offers a BUYER PROTECTION which allows the buyer to cancel/ with hold payment, & it actually protects both parties. Depop’s “buyer protection” seems to be unless it’s a complete lie of what the product was described as & what comes, you’re stuck with whatever you bought because you screwed up & we will not help you. This is awful, & there’s 0 buyer protection here. I’m also getting two completely different stories from their help on twitter & help on email. Help on twitter says to open a paypal dispute for counterfeit merchandise & email just says i’m stuck with it. How easy would it be to just put a middle barrier to let buyers cancel for a short period of time. Really? It was 2 mins before I realized it was a dupe product & now i’ve lost $30 I won’t get back. I will be deleting this app & not recommending it because of this purchase, the difficulty of the app & this entire experience. If you’re already on other buying/selling apps, stay there.
developerResponse:
{'id': 10552982, 'body': "Hi there! Sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection as long as the item was purchased using the BUY button in-app. Please do follow the Twitter advice and open a dispute with PayPal.

We also recommend following these steps so we can put things right: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001772448-I-haven-t-received-my-item

We're here to help you,
Team Depop ", 'modified': '2019-09-06T11:30:08Z'}

title: Needs improvement
review:
I’ve been selling on this app for over 3 years and I’ve done fairly well when it comes to selling on this app. However, over the years I felt that this app needed some room for improvement and I hope they consider this review and others to make some changes in the next update. 

1.) There seems to be a glitch that still hasn’t been resolved yet. There’s some reviews I have that I can’t seem to leave a review for them. Yet it still pops up the notifications for them. It’s a little annoying and I really want to get this fix because I know I’m not the only one that has this problem.

2.) I’ve seen this complaint roll around in the reviews and it’s about the explore page. I too keep seeing the same old people popping up on the same page. It would be really great if we can start seeing new people every day instead of the same people we always see.

3.) I think Depop should start doing what Mercari is doing where a user buys something from you and you don’t receive the payment until the user confirms the item has arrived (and if they don’t confirm soon the app automatically gives you payment after a few days). I think it can help protect some users from scammers and users who delete their pages after the purchase is made. Also protecting from false claims but that’s just my thought. 

4.) Depop really needs to start busting through these scammers that are on the site. There’s too many of them and it’s very discouraging for future sellers/buyers to use the app. 

Overall, I think it’s a nice app but there’s always room for improvement and I hope Depop takes consideration to these reviews and help fix the problems it keeps having.
developerResponse: {'id': 3315563, 'body': "Hey there - thank you so much for taking the time to leave this review. With regards to the glitch around notifications - if you haven't done so already could you please reach out to our Support team so they can investigate what we may be able to do to help? They're available via email on support@depop.com. We completely hear you on the feedback around the Explore page and we're currently in the process of re-evaluating the exact purpose of this part of the app and how it can be more effective. Thank you also for points 3 and 4; we'll be sure to consider these ideas in future. Thank you once again for writing this. Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-05-01T11:35:31Z'}

title: Explore Page Trash
review: I’ve had many successful and fruitful transactions on Depop. My fellow sellers and buyers are pleasant to interact with, and very diverse! BUT, the Depop team itself does not value true diversity. If you are not a half naked woman or your items do not fit into their very unique aesthetic (90’s hipster baby meets Urban hottie), you will not get featured. The same people get featured over and over again. A lot of beautiful items go unnoticed because the same wannabe instamodels are shown repeatedly. I am more upset about this than any other annoying glitch or scammer- and Depop has MANY of those as well. A few improvement suggestions: — make the follow limit the same fore EVERYONE. Why are some people able to follow 500k+ and others can only follow 7500? - We should be able to filter out sellers from other countries. So much spam! - Take notes from Poshmark. If an item isn’t shipped in a reasonable amount of time, the sale should be reversed. -Depop commission should be taken out of the item price, not shipping! Please do more to make buyers and sellers respect each other and be efficient. When I first discovered Depop I truly thought it had what it takes to LAST and beat out the other shopping apps, but I really doubt that now because it’s problems are deeper than tech. This is the MySpace of shopping apps, take that how you may. Many wonderful things, but can you depend on it? No. Depop has no problem bringing in users, but keeping them? Not so much. Happy shopping!
developerResponse: {'id': 1692013, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the feedback. We completely take this feedback onboard and we will strive to do better in the future. If you would like to send anymore feedback to us please don't hesitate to email productfeedback@depop.com as this will only help us to improve the app. Thanks again, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-11-07T21:20:29Z'}

title: Seller since 2015
review:
Pros
-Fee free and free shipping promotions. These really help when selling big ticket items. They could be longer or more strategically placed, such as during the first Friday of the month when many people have just received paychecks and have money to spend.

-Upcycling culture, where choosing second hand clothing over new clothing helps reduce waste and pollution.

-Each seller’s “brand” / style can be showcased well. Tags, filters, and subcategories make it easier for buyers to find what you’re selling.

Cons
-10% seller fee deducted by Depop, and 2.9% + $0.30 deducted by mandatory use of PayPal. So if I sell a $10 item, I only make $8.61. If I’ve offered free shipping to entice buyers, I’ve only made about $4. Depop, implement use of an app like Venmo, which has no fees, and generate your own buyer protection.

-If I want to arrange a payment to a seller via PayPal’s non-fee Friends and Family so they can afford to eat, I don’t want to risk consequences for this action.

-Featuring the same sellers, re-featuring the same items

Suggestions:

-Make a rearranging function available through the app, not just on the website.

-Reduce seller fees and offer free shipping more often / at better times.

-Offer sellers a chance to respond publicly to poor reviews, or contest / remove inaccurate ones.

-Implement use of / offer option of using an app like Venmo, which has no fees.

-Generate your own buyer protection.

Depop: Understand who your target audience is, and understand that many of us are young and using this app as a way to feed ourselves, pay off student loan debt, afford college, afford a car so we can hold down a job, or use this app on top of working a job / jobs. I’m sometimes shocked when I sell an item and open up PayPal to see how little I’ve actually made. Most of the time, this app just feels like another corporation profiting of the millennial and gen-x condition.
developerResponse: {'id': 3877936, 'body': "Hey Cass, thanks for letting us know your thoughts. We have our fee in place because there are a huge number of costs involved in running our business. We'd love to be in a place where we could cut the fee, but this simply isn't a realistic proposition right now - for that we apologise! We're working on giving more users more access to the Explore page and we hope you'll notice some improvements in the coming weeks. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-06-18T12:35:46Z'}

title: Love/Hate - User for 4+ years
review:
I’ve been using Depop for years, and with the recent design update, I’ve finally decided to leave a detailed review. I never felt like I needed to before, because the problems that I faced were easy to deal with/resolved quickly; but now I have a bit of a bone to pick with Depop.
For those wondering, I have an iPhone 5s that’s updated to the latest iOS and I have the newest version of Depop. 
Issues: 

-  I used to spend hours diving into the app and finding so much stuff. Now the app crashes when I just explore it for about ten minutes or so. (UPDATE: this is still an issue after several months.)
-  This may come off as a personal issue, but it’s been bothering me more and more over the years. The “explore” page caters mainly to one sort of style, which is Y2k, vintage “high” fashion, sporty, etc. It’s cool and all, but I wish the explore page could represent the app as a whole instead of just the more so top sellers who sell the same styles. I’ve decided to only use Depop to sell anything “aesthetic” and use other apps for more “normal” products.
-  This is what I’m the most annoyed with: they took away the activity page??? I used to LOVE seeing what people I followed liked because it helped me find shops similar to those that I followed. Also, a LOT of my activity used to come from that page. If someone liked something of mine, it’d create a chain reaction of people checking out the item/my shop so I’d get more activity, including more sales. 
-  Sometimes when looking through items on certain pages, such as likes, it won’t show something as sold until I click on it to see that it’s marked as sold under the photo? This makes exploring the app a lot more annoying and difficult.
-  My feee doesn't usually update when I add/change listings so I have to cancel out of the app for it to refresh. And, I guess it’s because I’m still using a 5s, but trying to refresh my profile is SUCH a hassle. (UPDATE: the added “filter” tab on my profile now makes it COMPLETELY impossible for me to refresh my page! Now I have to completely cancel out of the app to refresh my page!) You have to pull down on the bottom third of your screen, and my phone is too small for me to accurately pull it down far enough for it to refresh. PLEASE move the refresh to the top of the profile!
-  (UPDATE: I recently painted my walls off-white and now take all product photos in front of it. I’ve now been on the explore page several times and sold nine items in less than a month!) Sales aren’t up as much as they used to be. I’ve used this app off and on since 2013ish but nowadays, it’s much harder to sell things. I don’t know if it’s just that less people are using it, or there are less people looking to actually purchase through the app (due to no interest/users being afraid to because of all of the scams that’ve happened) but the only shops I see getting huge sale numbers are the few that are hyped by Depop. The more you list, the more you’ll sell, so if you plan on only selling a few things at first, it’ll take a long time to build up a shop. 
-  I can write an essay about how much I don’t like the look/feel of this app. I can speak volumes about how much I LOVED the past UI. I personally don’t like the direction that the app is going because, again, I think they’re only catering to specific styles/aesthetics with this update. I’m looking at it right now and it just doesn’t sit right with me and it kinda turns me off from using it sometimes. I’ll just say, it’s pretty blocky and it doesn’t look/work right on the small screen of my 5s. 
-  I personally feel like there should be a “policies” page on the profile, like the “likes” page. After all these years of us trying to fit our policies in our bio or trying to keep a policies listing at the top of our profile, I’d love for there to be an update that adds a policies page! It could even have the policies pop up when someone hits “buy” right before they make the purchase. I think that would help TREMENDOUSLY with the misunderstandings/confusion that occurs during some sales. Some buyers seem to just refuse looking for policies before purchasing, leading to some angry reviews. 
-  Fees are high, but it’s expected. DON'T sell though G&S to avoid this. It isn't worth it.

Pros: 
-  It’s a reliable app for selling (when done right) and it’s so easy to post things for sale! The community is a lot more inviting than other apps and it’s not as frustrating as selling on eBay, where you never know who you’re selling to until it’s too late. The community on Depop is mostly people who are buyers as well as sellers, so there’s a lot of understanding between sellers and buyers. 
-  The company is very helpful. I’ve yet to have to open a case with them, but I can tell they do their best to fix issues, though they can’t fix ALL problems. They’ve always been quick to respond to me! 
-  I don’t know... I’ve never gotten into the other selling apps. They had way too many confusing features/confusing interfaces/mean people that would always turn me away from using them. Depop is SO straightforward and you get your money RIGHT away. That means you can charge buyers an accurate shipping price depending on the item and it gives you the flexibility to ship your own way. 
-  It’s perfect for established shops as well as people just selling straight out of their closet! 
-  The shipping labels that you can make within the app are actually very useful! I personally make and print my own, but they’re useful for those who need them. They’re especially good for when you have something heavy to ship. 

I would recommend Depop to anyone looking to sell online, despite it’s issues. It’s the best selling app by far—app-wise and community-wise.

title: Getting better, but needs some work
review:
I’ve been an avid seller on Depop (and also a buyer) for around 3-4 years now. Now I see ads for Depop on multiple platforms, trying to get more people to use the app. However, I feel that Depop isn’t ready for an influx of new users and should fix the current problems it has; sellers have been waiting for a solution!
1. Safety
Recently this has been a BIG issue where many accounts, including mine, were hacked into. The hackers tried to promote their own items and selling outside the app so they could scam buyers. This is a huge blow to both Depop and the reputation of my shop! Security needs an upgrade, 3rd party authorization could have prevented this.
2. Shipping
While they tried to fix the cost of shipping, prices are still abnormally high. $6.50 for 1lb? Mercari will ship it for you for $4.99 with the same carrier USPS. 
3. Bundles
BUNDLES NEED A FIX!!! Not sure what the point of the “free shipping on all bundles” option is when you lose money most of the time. Have us record the actual weight of the item in oz, etc. so that you can calculate the total weight of the items in a bundle at checkout instead of overcharging for shipping weight we don’t use. Also, add an option to disable purchases that guarantee you losing money; It’s disappointing to get a bundle purchase only to look and see that a $9 item was added when shipping is $14 somehow (and I could probably ship for $7 on my own!). Plus, Depop doesn’t subtract shipping fees on bundles when they take out their 10% fee, so while Depop isn’t losing money you, the seller, are. Yikes.
4. Customer Service
This is a HUGE one. If you don’t have an adequate customer service team, you can’t handle a surge of new users!! Recently MANY accounts were hacked and I was unable to get my account back after a full week. A phone line where you can speak to someone would be great for emergencies. Also, I’ve had several technical issues on Depop’s end that have taken way too long to resolve with Depop’s customer service team. I have never dealt with a company that takes a week to fix something, it’s usually the same day!
5. Dropshipping
Another issue that they have tried to address (thank you for that!) but that has not been anywhere near resolved. I still see the same volume of dropshipped listings (items you can get from Aliexpress for $2 being sold for $20). I feel like it would be beneficial to have a team manually go through and remove these listings.
Not sure if writing this review will change anything but I guess I have to try! Love the uniqueness of this app but I have been getting better results with other websites and will probably make the switch soon. Stay safe x

title: i love this app but needs improvement
review: i love depop & its the only app i use to sell & buy from other sellers, its the best place to find things i actually like. the only thing about depop which most people dont mention & neither do depop themselves is they always charge after your money is sent to paypal & i was never told they would, i never get the amount of money i even sell something for ever bc depop takes out of it and its frustrating. where does that money even go to & why do you take it? first its a depop fee then an automatic payment which is usually always $4-$6 and if it's something more expensive its $10 like what am i paying you for? using your shipping? idk if that applies to the people who use their own shipping but i like using depops shipping to save me the trouble of making my own labels unless depop gives you a label when you use your own shipping too. thats another thing, i wish they could tell us about that too, how both shipping works & if they make the labels for us whether its our own shipping or theirs. theres a lot of things depop doesnt inform us about that i wish they could bc i end up finding it out on my own and getting frustrated about it. depop is the best selling app out there for me but this just makes me mad, i wouldnt use any other app bc i can find anything to my liking on depop and ive just used it for so long but selling is just the worst on this app. i hate not making full profit for my sales, like whats the point of it then. i can sell something for $5 & like $3.50 shipping and then just only get $3 out of it, im not just speaking theoretically either, this has happened. so if you plan on still taking money from us sellers like this depop, at least inform people before they start selling. i would also like to know why it's even being taken, i thought apps got their profit by being promoted, advertised & from their amount of users, & yall have enough of that, so whats the extra money taken from sellers for?
developerResponse:
{'id': 16866873, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-07-25T18:26:14Z'}

title: great community but algorithm works against smaller shops
review:
I’ve only been on depop for a year or so, and while some things have changed for the better (now you can save drafts for items you haven’t posted yet, limited hashtag feature & video posts), the algorithm still somehow gets worse. Many of my items don’t show up in search results even after scrolling to the very end which is a complaint I’ve seen from many people. For some reason, the search results prioritize items that haven’t been updated in weeks AND spam tags/irrelevant brand names. That, or only top sellers’ items are listed first which doesn’t exactly help smaller shops. 

Next, and this is more of a personal issue,  I used to get featured every now and then, and it was so motivating considering I didn’t have many followers or sales. I would spend hours updating my shop, going outside and taking photos, and coming up with descriptive captions for every item. Ever since last summer, I haven’t gotten on the explore page once. I know there’s more people on depop now and tastes change, but it’s led me to spend less and less time on the app. No exposure means no sales, after all. 

Also I’ve noticed that most items getting featured have little to no description which puts me off buying anything from there. It all feels very plain. I know you can just message sellers for more details, but now it’s hard to find a caption that isn’t only two words long. For example, there was one that just said: “beige pants.” No size or brand or measurements lol.

Hopefully depop will improve on the algorithm and find some way to promote smaller shops. This is a great app, don’t get me wrong. Often I’ll come across some beautiful displays in sellers’ photos and it inspires me. Beyond that, the people I’ve interacted with, sellers and buyers alike, have been so sweet and professional. It’s a great community and tbh I’d like to see more of an emphasis on that, perhaps in an official depop forum where people can share tips, discuss fashion and help each other out. The reddit page does this already to an extent, but it would be nice to see something like it within the app.

title: Good Community, Mediocre App
review:
Depop is great and it’s core functions work well, the people are generally trustworthy. Prices vary from absolute steals to extortionate, but are generally fair. Unlike other secondhand/vintage buying and selling spaces most of the people on depop are amateurs, so items tend to be under or over priced and, slightly more annoyingly, people often don’t know how to accurately describe things. Measurements aren’t always trustworthy, some sellers don’t know how to describe them (this is especially a problem for suit sizes, the “s” means short, not small, guys), and sometimes descriptions are actively unhelpful, like one seller I found who describes nearly everything as “fits xs-xl depending on desired fit” and won’t post the tagged size. If you’re looking for something specific, or you’re an enthusiast for something specific (say, watches), this app is not for you.

The app has a lot of quality of life issues. You can set your size for some things but not others, so depop knows my shoe size but not my size in outerwear. There’s no way to set a size in suit sizes, and no way to list an item by its suit size, which makes it nigh impossible to search for blazers etc, and some categories just don’t exist. There’s no explicit category for vests, for example, and categories that are nested in more competent platforms like cardigans inside sweaters simply aren’t, when they exist at all. You can search in the sweater category, or the cardigan category, but cardigans won’t come up in sweater searches unless the seller has listed it wrong (which many have). Theres no built-in way to make an offer or combine posts into discounted bundles, you have to message the seller and they have to manually lower the price or make a new listing entirely. There’s a lot of design flaws and minor inconveniences that like this that other platforms just don’t have, and some lingering bugs, though they seem to be getting better.

Depop doesn’t really have its own moderation and all payments are processed through PayPal, so if you don’t pay through your PayPal account and you get scammed it’s possible that you’ll just lose the money since PayPal might not keep a record of the transaction. Rules against dropshipping don’t seem to be enforced. I’ve only had one problem on this app where a seller marked a listing as shipped and deleted their account, but I got my money back through PayPal’s dispute process. If you’re smart about it you’ll be fine; there are bad actors on all platforms so I can’t hate depop too much for this.

All in all if you’re a buyer there’s better platforms out there. I’d suggest poshmark, or good old fashioned eBay. Most of the large depop sellers sell on other platforms anyways. If you know what you’re looking for there’s gold to be found, but there’s gold everywhere else too and depop doesn’t have much else going for it. It... works.

title: A purely honest review of Depop
review:
Ok so I forget how long I’ve been on Depop. Maybe a couple months or so? A good friend of mine introduced me to it and I’ve been a little obsessed. It takes me a while to buy things because I like to save money. I look for something literally everywhere to see if I can find it at a cheaper price. Why pay $90 for something that’s worth $40?? Anyway... though I haven’t sold anything yet, I have a love hate(not really hate but more of a meh) relationship with this app and I feel like there are some things that can be fixed.

1) Buying more than one item at once

So I’ve tried to buy multiple items from multiple buyers or multiple items from one buyer and to keep it simple...it’s hectic. I get that bundling is an option but that’s complicated ESPECIALLY if the seller takes days on end to reply to a simple question. But that’s a whole other issue. I know it would take a lot of time but seriously, I’m sure they can find a way to have some sort of a shopping bag feature so I can buy like 10 things at once. 

2) The explore page 

I’ll keep this one brief. It’s come to my attention that the stuff on the explore page is from Depop famous people. But if I don’t like it, I don’t think it should be the first thing I see. So, maybe Depop should reconsider. The explore page should be personalized to fit each and everyone’s style and find things that people like at a price range that best suits them.

3) WARNING: NOT ALL BUYERS AND SELLERS ARE COOL

Though Depop is a cool app, and I’ve had good interactions with sellers, some buyers (and sellers too) can be straight up rude. So tread lightly... 
I’ve seen fights in just the comment sections?? If you’re mature enough to start an online business, you should be able to deal with an annoying customer properly. And if you are mature enough to have a paypal account or a debit/ credit card, you should be able to handle yourself if a seller  is being a jerk. Business is business, I suppose.

title: Developers should read
review:
Depop is an amazing concept. In the recent months I've noticed a huge decline in the apps quality. And many people are making the same comments here. It's bothered me so much so that I'm actually leaving an app review. I've had multiple tech issues that I've sent requests for which have been completely ignored.
1️⃣ The app is very glitchy it will unexpectedly close or not load all your saved items and the list goes on. But that's not even my main reason for this review. 
2️⃣ The explore page is so frustrating the same people get featured constantly.  The times that I have been featured were completely wasted. They have posted items of mine that were already sold on the explore page TWICE. Meanwhile I had tagged them in items that were super nice but didn't have exposure that they needed. Instead of considering posting those they posted two items that I had already sold. Like what's the use? 
3️⃣ I think the amount of people on the app has grown and they really need to figure out how they are going to give smaller accounts with potential the rightful amount of exposure. I started selling semi regularly and decided to up my picture quality and put more effort into the app. Since then the app's population has grown so my items are really getting lost in the madness. Things need to be set up in an appropriate matter so that everyone can sell things comfortably. I've done everything that I can on my end. They need a better way of promoting their sellers and posting the same 4 people daily on the explore page is not the way to do it. 
4️⃣ Like I said more people are on the app and so buying things is also hard. They need to find a way to streamline things more effectively so that people can find what they are trying to buy. The new "brand feature" was a mediocre attempt at that. So from the perspective of a buyer it's also getting difficult to navigate around the app. The more they grow the harder it will be for them to organize that but it's very necessary. 

I used to be excited to use the app the last thing they want is the app turning into the mess that poshmark is. An old clothes graveyard. To protect the integrity and efficiency of their app they need to find a better way of doing things. More deals on their end I love the newsletters on what's selling, or things like the cyber Monday hashtag. Buyers should get notifications when someone discounts something 50% off. These things would be regulated and monitored so that they aren't excessive and messy like poshmark is but something along those lines. Do better depop the ignoring tech issues and the huge gap between big sellers and smaller accounts is horrible and making faithful app users like me rethink the amount of time we put into the app.

title: Long time user
review:
Depop is great for online thrifting. There are a lot of unique pieces to find from individual sellers who are able to build their platform from the ground up. However, being on this app for a couple years now, I have noticed many changes and issues.

1. SCROLLING ISSUES
This one is not a BIG problem but I believe it’s some kind of bug. When you browse, scroll down and click on an item, the page will be brought back to the top at the start of the listings. It’s super annoying and I hope this gets fixed asap.

2. TOP SELLER FAVORITISM
This next one has been a huge ongoing issue - depop does not cater to small sellers NEARLY as much as they do to top sellers. For many of these top sellers, negative reviews (in fair use) will be deleted to preserve a top seller’s pristine respiration. They ARE making depop the most money after all! And yes depop is TAKING a portion of the seller’s profit. I have noticed some sellers had their set percentage (for depop) changing without notice or any information beyond that, but it has never happened to me before so that is unconfirmed. Just be wary, I’d say.

3. DEPOP STAFF IGNORING REPORTS
Depop does not stick to their own rules. There is a ban on dropshipping (sourcing items from cheap fast fashion websites and price gouging) which was enacted quite recently (late March I believe) and they banned tons of accounts that do this. However there are still tons of drop shippers that are more “discreet,” and reporting them constantly WITH proof will get you NO response from depop.

4. EXCESSIVE TAGGING
This is another example of Depop ignoring sellers who break rules. Almost everywhere you will see excessive tagging on posts that have NOTHING to do with the description. A seller could post a listing for a book and tag “vintage 50s 60s 70s 80s deadstock shirt dress pants” etc. and if they are reported, again you will most likely get NO response whether it is an email or an action on the staff’s part.

5. FAKE RARE ITEMS AND PRICE GOUGING
One of the most infamous communities on Depop is the Brandy Melville community. While most are in fair use, be warned that most clothing/accessories from Brandy Melville when posted as listings on depop will be described as “rare” or “discontinued” and the prices will be gouged excessively. By “rare” I mean the BM website could be down for two weeks or so as they’ve been known to do recently. $15-$30 clothing can be seen as expensive as $300. Even if the clothing is not rare. They are in their rights to prove their items however they want, but be warned if you’re looking for these clothes.

6. AUCTIONS AND RAFFLES
Depop allows free prize competitions. This means one could “enter” a seller’s raffle through liking the post, following them on other platforms, sharing their posts, etc. (anything FREE). However, you will see a lot of raffles that although don’t REQUIRE payment, many sellers will accept payment for extra entries. I personally have seen people accept money through Venmo and cashapp, but since it isn’t “required” it is not against depop’s rules. This is kind of a loophole on the seller’s part which many people deem as unfair. This is another issue users have reported on without getting so much as a response from depop staff.

7. PAYPAL
This is just a warning for those wanting to BUY from sellers. ALWAYS USE PAYPAL. Do NOT make transactions outside Depop! Do NOT message a seller outside Depop! If ANY seller tries to engage in any of these activities it is a SCAM! AVOID THEM AT ALL COSTS THERE ARE SO MANY SCAMMERS ON DEPOP.

Overall, Depop is a great app! I find that there are more unique, vintage and alternative pieces than Poshmark. I have also seen AMAZING deals! I DO recommend Depop as a buyer, but as a seller all I have to say is to be WARY! Know the rules, follow them, and if you ever find yourself in a situation where you absolutely need help from Depop staff, well, I hope you’re religious because you might need to pray for it. Lol. But seriously. That is why I rate this app 3/5 stars. I hope they don’t delete my “bad” review.

Thanks for reading.
-Mads

title: Extremely frustrating
review:
I love the idea of this app. I think it’s a great idea to have platforms like this for unique clothing from small businesses and individuals.

 That said I have had multiple ongoing issues with trying to sell clothing and accessories with this platform. 
I am a vintage and costume clothing and accessories collector looking to down size. I spent a good amount of time coming up with a branding, marketing plan for my shop and spent time taking photos, having a friend over to model, etc. So I was thrilled when I finally made a sale. 

I had issues with the shipping label through depop and the costumer service was irritatingly slow and asked the same questions multiple times. The services is all Through email and messaging, you can’t call to talk to a person. 
Now I am having issues with getting the payment through paypal. Which could be unrelated to depop, but seeing as I can’t get answers from anyone I felt it relevant to include here. 

In addition to this I feel that the algorithm they use for sellers favors bigger established sellers that have big followings already. I don’t pretend to know anything about how algorithms work, but this one seems to make it impossible for little sellers to gain any significant sales unless they spend 24 hours a day updating and marketing their store like a full time job. 
Take this review for what it is worth, I could be an odd seller out. 

I have already deleted my listings and as soon as I get paid for my one sale I will be deleting my account. 
Not worth the stress it caused.
