title: Frustrating.
review:
Depop, I’ve been working with your app for over 2+ years. It’s a great platform for selling, I’ll admit, as it’s very easy to make a listing and get a label made for packages. However, that seems to be your app’s ONLY redeeming quality. Hence the 2 star review..

I CONTINUE to have issues with your support team. I CONTINUE to have listings removed when they don’t break your rules/guidelines. I CONTINUE to struggle getting my shop out there- getting followers and making sales. I’ve been very consistent with following the “advice” your top sellers give; I always post products that are similar to what’s trending and on the featured page, I make sure to include high quality photos with great lighting and backdrops, and always post within user guidelines. Yet, somehow, it is insanely difficult to make it on the featured page. It is insanely difficult making consistent sales. And I’m not the only seller who’s vocalized these problems before. 

So many sellers, myself included, work incredibly hard on their shops: doing our absolute best to ensure customer satisfaction, keeping track of inventory, keeping up with what’s in demand, etc. only to receive LESS support. 

Your team is nearly impossible to get in contact with. I’m genuinely convinced that the staff for this platform are using the pandemic right now as an excuse to do even less for their users. You have one contact- which is your support email, yet, upon reaching out, I’m constantly met with automatic reply’s that give “support links” as if that is going to resolve the issues at hand. I and many others have reached out to your team on issues that are very impactful on us as sellers and buyers alike, yet you continually ignore them. 
People reach out via Instagram, email, and even in the comments section on your shops within the app. 

It’s disappointing. 

You really need a support number for people to call when they need to contact someone.

Another thing to point out here:
To become a top 10 seller, you either have to own a thrift store, have your own team, be a part of the official Depop team, or own a warehouse. It is incredibly unfair. ALL of your verified sellers have the upper leg on this platform, they can even get away with going against the community guidelines. A great example of this are the people who drop ship, but make it appear as if their work is “one of a kind”.

I know this for a FACT because I know someone in Miami who owns a warehouse, and works with an ENTIRE TEAM, that has a shop on your app that is masked as an “individual seller”. 

Depop, please do better.
It’s 2020.
Get it together.

Hear out your customers and stop avoiding the problems at hand. It’s ridiculous. Seriously.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15871031, 'body': 'Hey. We get it, this can be super frustrating. Rest assured, we’re always looking for ways to discover exciting new users. 
Have a read through our article ‘Suggested Sellers’ by going to ‘Settings - Need help’, for some tips on how to become a Suggested Seller.

Keep exploring,
Team Depop
', 'modified': '2020-06-09T10:02:33Z'}

title: Shipping Choices..
review:
Ok so I love this app & all as a seller BUT what there was something that I noticed that REALLY irked me and I thought it was really nasty of this company to try and sneak this in .. 

When a seller is posting an item, there’s the different types of shipping options you can choose—that’s if you choose to go with Depop shipping. Anyways, once you choose the parcel size NORMALLY you’d carry on with posting your item. What I noticed though, was that if you scroll down the ‘free shipping’ option is ALREADY SELECTED (with a recommended right above...) If it was recommended, then it shouldn’t be selected. That’s money that’s being taken away from the buyers sales without their consent. In which this case happened to me.. This option was selected—automatically selected—for several weeks until I noticed that so much $$ was being taken from my sales. I think this option was created in a very discreet dirty way. 

I HIGHLY advise this gets fixed. You could be gypping sellers from making money they intend. 

1. The ‘Free Shipping’ option should be displayed so the user doesn’t have to scroll down in order to find this option. Otherwise they’re not aware and this can cause money being taken out of their sales without them choosing this option...
2. If it’s a recommended option then it should NOT be automatically selected. There’s been several times STILL that I post something and I forget to DE SELECT this option. I shouldn’t have to worry about this every time I post something /: 

I really do like this app but I don’t think this is something that should be taken lightly.. this is people’s money who are trying to make a living by bringing in extra cash. 

Thank you.

title: Needing improvements ASAP!
review:
So let me start off by saying that I have been a depop buyer for over 3 years, ( I used to also be a seller.) so I was a big fan of depop and its fashion but now I have grown out of that 80s fashion doc martens/high waisted jeans with windbreaker style.
(Which is pretty much what Depop’s fashion is. It’s very exclusive.) so for a while I LOVED what depop offered, but as we grow up we often change which is what happened to me. 

So here are some negatives I have noticed
The for you page doesn’t include things I’ve ever even bought or liked. Things I’m pretty much not interested in. 
The explore page I believe needs vast improvements too. buyers don’t want to see what the company is loving, we want to see more of what we like and of sellers that aren’t so popular because it’s not fair that we get to see the same people over and over getting many chances to sell their things when there are really good sellers with great prices for their items. And if you’re doing an explore page for the company I believe the fashion should be broader, it’s often catering to those 80s/90s or weird fashion lovers and there are many people who are NOT into that so therefore the explore page is useless to them and EXCLUDES many sellers of different fashion varieties. 
Please improve on this

Some positives,

Depop sellers usually sell their items very cheap which I enjoy and they go the extra mile to be kind? polite and negotiate offers. And I deeply appreciate that of them.
developerResponse: {'id': 11639008, 'body': "Hey. Thanks for the feedback. We love hearing about what we can do to improve Depop for our Community. When you succeed, we succeed. I'll be passing this along to the relevant teams.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2019-11-04T12:12:50Z'}

title: Terrible Support, no accountability for bad sellers, risky for buyers, fake items are rampant
review:
I’ve made about 10 purchases in the last two months through Depop. Have had multiple sellers not ship my order until I email them to ask them (after waiting at least 3+ days before contacting them). 
An IG influencer told me she shipped an item multiple times but never did...I finally got a refund after waiting almost a month after buying the shoes and she emailed me two weeks later asking if I still wanted them. What?? Lol. I emailed customer support about the issues twice and they basically didn’t care show awful she was or that she put me through tons of trouble. 

Another seller sold me an item wrongfully labeled as designer but it was actually a really bad cheap off-brand. She changed the listing info after I asked her for a refund and claimed I was incorrect. I informed her that I screenshot the listing prior to her editing and she said I was “making her uncomfortable” but would handle the dispute in PayPal. Child, if you listed your items accurately, honesty and were not a terrible liar, I wouldn’t be bothering to “make you uncomfortable”. I’ve worked in resale for 15+ years and if she tried that offline, she would get a bad reputation very quickly. Unfortunately there are a lot of entitled, inexperienced, deceitful jerks on this app and they ruin it for the honest sellers and buyers.
Also I tried listing an item had issues. They could use a new UX designer.

Long story short, as soon as I get my last refund I am deleting my account and never looking back. In the meantime, I signed up for Poshmark a few days ago, have 260 followers already and made my first sale. The interface and features are excellent. Was super easy and everyone seems cool on there so far.
developerResponse:
{'id': 19075041, 'body': "Hey Mariella,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-11-12T22:00:03Z'}

title: The worst resale app
review:
UPDATE:
It happened, my first time being scammed. Purchased an item, messaged seller multiple times with no response, finally opened a PayPal dispute and OVER A MONTH later got a refund. Depop barely helps with refunds all they do is direct you to use PayPal. I can’t even leave a review to warn others that this person scammed me, and how long it took to get my money. The sellers bio says “no refunds all sales final” (which is NOT allowed!) so Id like to warn others about how I got a refund, but can’t bc my “purchase” is still pending shipping, so there’s no way to give this seller a negative rating. I left some comments on their other items to warn others, and have already gotten messages about other people who this person scammed and i helped them with the refund process as they were saddened by being scammed out of their own money. 
So here we are, the buyers going through ridiculous steps and the seller gets no repercussions. 
0/5 stars. 

The WORST resale app. Every item is listed as the wrong brand to get attention, not for sale, an in search of post, or people are putting the item up for bid and say “do not buy will not refund or send the item” which is all very misleading. It makes it extremely difficult to search for an item. A lot of sellers also do not offer refunds or returns, so if you receive your item and it’s damaged, doesn’t match the description or possibly has a strange smell (because most people buy from goodwill and resell as a “vintage”) there’s not way to return it and you’re stuck with the item. Depop does not have any seller or buyer protection which means if you sell and send an item and don’t get paid, then you’re out of luck. I highly recommend poshmark or mercari for buying and reselling, they actually care about they’re users and is so much easier to navigate and find items that you’re interested in.

developerResponse:
{'id': 8624500, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback. 
I understand that you may believe that the Depop fee is high and believe me if we didn’t have to charge a fee we wouldn’t!

The 10% fee may seem like a lot for your sale but, when we break this down into what the fee contributes to, it makes a lot more sense. The fee is in place to keep the app up and running, with general up-keep costs and to pay all of our employees, from engineers to us in support. 

Unlike many other selling platforms, at Depop only charge you when you make a sale, this means there are no fees for the length of time your item has been listed for or any initial costs to list the item, so list to your heart’s content because its all free!

Love, Depop', 'modified': '2019-05-12T07:56:04Z'}

title: No longer my favorite app, here’s why...
review:
If there was less than 1, I would leave it & I do NOT leave negative reviews lightly, if ever...

I’ve been selling on several other platforms for YEARS; including Vinted, Mercari, eBay, Poshmark & some popular local selling apps, but Depop USED TO BE my favorite & had a great community. 
NOT ANYMORE. 

Id been an active seller on this platform for about a year & last year, I became one of their worldwide top sellers on Labor Day. Up until the last time I accessed the app, I also had a 4.7/5 overall rating... 

However, over the last several months, a lot of deception has taken place...
Namely, this platform is NOT supportive or protective of its SELLERS. 
If you ship something & it takes awhile to get to the buyer & the buyer is not a good communicator (a lot of teenagers on this app that are still green to having an effective communication style) other than complaining to Depop, then Depop will tell them right off the bat to report the seller & get a refund. 🤯

I’ve been in sales & marketing over 17 YEARS & what you generally do in a sales environment, is ask buyers to COMMUNICATE with the SELLER FIRST... on top of the fact that I was very active in DM’s & made it clear on my profile about communication with any questions or issues...

Depop does not do this, so BE CAREFUL.
I’d written to them several times about this, but they were always very careless in their response.

Second thing, 
They changed their policy’s sometime over the last month or so, which I was not aware of & I don’t qualify to be a seller but they went & blocked me from accessing my own profile- which still has my personal & bank account info attached - so I had to warn my bank to block them, because I can’t log in to remove my personal info now 🤯🤯

BE WARNED.
I would NOT recommend this app & this is NOT based on some single incident, but MANY that brought me to the point of this review. 

I hope they become more balanced when it comes to taking care of the SELLERS, who are helping this app make money in the first place. 
It’s just way too much deception to deal with.

title: Awful Service
review:
I’m extremely conflicted here. I have been using depop for YEARS and loved it but now... I hate them more than anything. I recently (6 months ago) made a post with cannabis as the PICTURE. The description however, was asking about resin earrings. The clear art product made for creating objects? I wanted PLUGS made of cannabis and resin. That was IT. I woke up this morning to an email saying my post has been removed, fine that’s okay. I can find it somewhere else. But then I got another email telling me my account was entirely closed because my activity violated their rules saying I was selling TOBACCO, bongs, pipes, etc. MY POST WAS ASKING FOR FREAKIN EARRINGS!!!!! And my account was deleted. 
4 years of Depop loyalty, never breaking a rule, AND I DIDNT BREAK ONE YET EITHER!!! And they delete my account regardless. I know they didn’t even read the description of my item beforehand because they said I was selling tobacco products. If they HAD read the description they would know I was looking for earrings. So they deleted my account based off an IMAGE rather than my actual activity and I am DISGUSTED. 
Depop, I was literally asking for cannabis resin made EARRINGS. Not cannabis, not a bong, not a pipe, EARRINGS. So tell me why none of your employees actually READ my description? 
Thanks for ruining my second form of income, and deleting my account and everything I wanted to purchase with it. 
I insist next time you READ THE DESCRIPTION before acting like robots and just deleting everything. 
I can’t imagine what kind of people are behind this app... brainless and heartless.

Also, fix your app. It’s sooooo glitchy, even OfferUp works better. That’s sad.

Thanks for ruining my entire day at 7am!!!

title: depop hates legitimate sellers and buyers
review:
i’ve been a vintage seller on here for 6 months and i’m ready to move to a different platform. the new algorithm makes it really hard to actually find what you are looking for. cheap earring shops and fast fashion resellers clog up the search results with spam tags and unrelated key words.

depop doesn’t care about their sellers and they refuse to ban spam tags and drop shipping. it’s people like that who give this app a bad name. “vintage” sellers who try and sell clothes as 70s are also the worst.  i have seen some of my favorite sellers leave this app for etsy or ebay and i probably will too. 

some of the users are really mean to sellers and will harass you for not getting their way. i have received awful comments about some of my prices which are fairly cheap compared to other vintage sellers. i clearly state that i don’t take offers but i receive them all day anyway. i have received messages accusing me of “ gentrifying thrift stores” even though my area the thrift store have an excess of clothes. if you have a problem with reselling thrifted clothes then this is not the app for you. i have had some lovely customers, but overall it’s not a very friendly community. 

i have had several bad buying experiences on here as well. the first thing i ever bought was from the verified seller betterdaze. when i got it, it had three large tears in the back from them squeezing into it to model it and it was also missing a button. none of these things were discolored in the ad. when i told them about the problem they were unapologetic and rude. i don’t recommend buying from top/verified sellers because they don’t care about you. i have also had several other bad experiences with top sellers since.

title: Improvements
review: I love depop, it's easy to use and they only take 10% which compared to other platforms, its basically nothing. However this app needs many improvements. One would be the ability to zoom in and out of pictures to help us see the details better. Another problem is the explore page! I have been on the explore page a few times (3 times maybe?) I know you have to have great pictures to end up there but most of the time I see the exact same users getting featured instead of newer ones. Maybe it would help if there was  something the users can do to put their names out there. It seems like if you don't end up on the explore page you don't sell at all. Another thing (which I know the app can't control) is that there are SO MANY sellers yet theres only a few buyers. Everyone sells but no one buys, i wish more people knew about this app so it could move quicker, like mercari or posh. One big tip I have is to NEVER pay outside of the app. There are many scammers here (just like everywhere else) that try to make you email them or pay them through other apps, this should not be an option. I'd rather have 10% removed than lose my item to a scammer. Other than that the app is pretty great. I just wish they had more focus on newer users instead of focusing on the already popular ones.

title: I have some suggestions!
review:
I love depop but I have a few ideas that I think would improve the app.
Firstly, I've noticed that it doesn't always tell me when an item was posted/updated. Sometimes it's covered up by the recommendations (probably a glitch) and sometimes it just doesn't show it at all. I like to know when it was posted so I know if I should grab an item quickly or if I'm likely to have some time before it sells out.
Secondly, I think it would be nice if it showed the prices of items in the search results, recommendations, and on sellers pages like it did in the old version. That way I'm not spending time clicking on items I can't afford and it's easier to filter through what I'd like to buy.
Finally, I think it would be interesting if in addition to saved items, you could also add items to collections the same way you can on instagram. I use the saving feature for items that I am seriously considering purchasing in the near future, but I think it would be cool if I could also make collections for shoes, dresses, shirts, etc. that I like instead of scrolling endlessly through my likes to find them.
I've also noticed that after using the app for about 20 minutes (esp when changing search queries and going back and forth between pages multiple times) the app crashes. This isn't a very big deal to me though and I'm more interested in seeing these other features being implemented as I feel they would make the app easier to use.
developerResponse: {'id': 1062226, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. We really appreciate the detailed feedback you have left and I have passed this onto the design team. Sorry to hear you have had some issues with the app crashing and the timestamp not being visible. So we can get to the bottom of these issues, it would be great if you could send a message to productfeedback@depop.com with more information about which device you're using and iOS version? Thanks in advance, Team Depop.", 'modified': '2017-08-21T08:27:41Z'}

title: Great app for selling !
review:
I love depop, it's a great community of artists and fashion lovers who are very excited about what they do and are supportive of each other. The app is user friendly and easy to get a hang of. As a buyer, I'm impressed with the quality and selection of the items for sale. As a seller, I highly recommend this app. You can connect really well with your customers, and listing an item is as easy as making a post to any other social media platform. I love the transparency of their rating system. I used to sell on some other online sites, but my home computer isn't as reliable as it used to be. I know I can rely on my phone and it's so helpful that I can work on my shop while sitting in a waiting room or riding the bus! 

The only down side is the frequency of lil glitches like notifications staying after being acknowledged and the app just quitting out. but over all the bugs seem to get fixed in a timely manner and its not that bad. 

If I could recommend an improvement, I think the ability to send a tracking number to someone via a submission form on the sale page would be amazing! It could be like the star ratings/review. Right now I just message people their tracking numbers, but I like the idea of the tracking number being attached to the transaction form.

title: Almost perfect
review:
I love this app and use it daily as a seller and a buyer. It's the most user friendly market app I've tried and now that the ipad photo album display problem has been resolved (apple's fault), it's better than ever. Support is very responsive as well. 
I've only ever had one problem with a seller not delivering, and resolved it with a polite conversation and a refund. Seems like the majority of problems stem from bad trades and taking transactions outside the app, both easy to avoid.
I hope Depop continues to attract makers and sellers of unique things, and they've done an outstanding job on that front. The biggest improvement for me would be for Depop to expand its user base to include more older 18+ folks willing to pay a reasonable asking price for items- haggling with 15 year old kids who then ask you to hold until they can get money from their parents gets old. Other than that, I'm a depop user for life- I really enjoy interacting with other users and the Depop team, and it's helped me conceptualize how I'd like my dream vintage shop to run.

title: Nice people overall - app could use some simple fixes
review: I’ve been using depop for over a year. I have to say it really works for buying and selling things. I have only dealt with honest and normal people so far (buying/selling mostly kids stuff). That is a big relief. Shipping is always a big cost so finding people in your area is advantageous. The fees are not low but I guess in line with eBay. Though the app is much less flexible than eBay and my gripes are: 1. Not possible to insert children's sizes or search by specific child size. 2. Not possible to copy text (at least from iPhone 6) - very annoying when inserting the same hashtags in items (like for kids). 3. Now that I am buying as well as selling I would appreciate keeping the funds in depop to avoid the 3,5% paypal charge every time (maybe this is possible in some regions, not sure). 4. Photos have to be in square format (good to know before you photograph everything you want to sell in the wrong format). The positive point is that you can gain a following and have a better chance of selling to the same clients since they see your new posts if they “follow” you. Good app, but definitely room for improvement by fixing these relatively simple things. 5. Why not have search alerts like shpock - this works SO well and helps buyers and sellers transact quickly.

title: Definitely a fan
review: The 3 experiences I've had with purchasing items have all been perfectly fine. Items received matched the photo, prices were okay, and owners were nice. I was more than pleased with all 3 purchases. Most other experiences I've had as far as conversation about certain items, questions, etc. have all been with super friendly and helpful people as well. And I love that I'm able to basically thrift anywhere I want. However, there are certain times when I've become annoyed by "trolling" (the only word I can think to use for it). Everyone is trying to make a buck if you're posting on the app, that's no secret - whether you're trying to save up for something specific or just trying to make some extra $. I can't help but get annoyed, though, when I get bombarded by message after message asking if I'm interested in anything and on and on after I've followed or liked someone's post. This doesn't happen all the time, but when it does, it just turns me off from buying from that person; just gives me that "car-salesman" vibe. Idk how you'd realistically be able to regulate that, but I wanted to give an honest review. When I receive a message, I usually just don't respond and stop giving attention to their shop. All-in-all I love the app and have had no major issues with it.

title: Prefer old Depop
review: The new update isn't that great, the red is pretty obnoxious and not pleasant to look at. When refreshing my own shop, it gets pretty annoying since only half the screen can be pulled down to refresh (so it's really awkward to refresh when I get such a small space to swipe down). Most of the time, a lot of the buttons and part of the text will glitch out and I won't be able t see it and it's really hard to click. I really enjoyed the old setup where I could see what other people liked and not have my notifications at the top. For the looks, I prefer the green buy button from before as this one doesn't really have a nice font choice. The letters are ultra bold and look flattened, the contrasting colors are also distracting. Really not a fan of the font, doesn't look very neat.  The bottom buttons look a little off and aren't as nice to click (sometimes it doesnt feel like you clicked them but you did or the other way around). Even though Im not a fan of the color, I dislike the font choice even more because it looks like the fonts from high school presentations that were thrown together. Still leaving 3 stars though because I hope they'll be able to have a new update and fix these. Especially the glitches, refresh screen size and font.

title: Love it! But too many bugs..
review: This is seriously my favorite app that I've ever downloaded. Not only have I bought from great people, but I've sold to them too! However, for some reason there's been too many issues with this app. For starters, it won't load properly. The last item that's loaded is over 4 hours ago when I know for a fact that there's a lot more items that have been posted. Another thing is a recent bug with buying. Sellers have to set their items as meet in person only and include the shipping price within the total, so the buyer doesn't receive the "error purchasing" popup. Which is another inconvenience for buyers since they have to individually message their address. Another bug is that if you mark something sold (like sold outside of depop) then it will leave an annoying notification that you can not get rid of unless the sold items list gets deleted! A major suggestion is to add a filter so you can find what's in your own country! I'm tired of finding cute things only to find out it's overseas and twice the amount wanting to be paid! So unfair! Also, there should be a separate report button for scammers!! This would help so many people rather than waiting on depop to reply to individual messages. Don't get me wrong, I LOOOVVEEE this app, just needs a lot of help

title: Scammers everywhere & depop takes a massive fee
review:
No matter what you say/do on this app someone is going to criticize you. The buyers are so cheap and snide, they think you're being rude and when you tell them your price is firm or your item is over like $20. I used to like this app, but the more experience I get I dislike it more and more. People get especially caught up with shipping prices, like they expect it to be free like with a big retailer. THESE ARE REAL PEOPLE SHIPPING OUT OF THEIR POCKETS!! SHIPPING IS NOT CHEAP! 

Also, there are scammers everywhere that will ask you to email them/PayPal f&f them. It is your own responsibility to find out who's a scammer and who's not, because Depop does nothing about it until the scammers actually make their move. They also take a ridiculous %10 of your earnings. 

A classic situation: You sell something for $20, cheap users ask to lower it to $19, which seems like they're just doing it for fun, it's so ridiculous. You use your own shipping for $5, the buyer asks why shipping is so expensive. They either say "no thanks... too expensive" or if they're considerate enough they'll buy it, but then Depop takes about $2, and you're out $5 or more from shipping. What you thought you were selling for $20 makes you about half that in the end.

title: very solid selling app
review:
good app overall! favors vintage/handmade stuff (for getting featured) and unique stuff--definitely caters to a certain type of style/aesthetic. 

buying: smooth transactions all around, you can find rlly cheap stuff and more expensive things here. I'm not familiar with the return policy since I've never returned, but one con is how people can rate you. I think depop should adopt something more similar to the selling app Mercari where the buyer and seller can't see what they rated each other until AFTER they have both put in their ratings, that way you don't get a bad review as a buyer simply because you have a seller a bad review. 

selling: I've done better with selling on some other apps, but I've still sold a couple things on here. you have a huge advantage if you're selling things that depop likes (see what I said before) because features items are almost instantly sold. anyways, the rating system again is frustrating, but still fine. depop frowns upon using photos that are not yours (like taking from a website's modeling photos) which I like because that's not necessarily an accurate display of the item, but I can understand the frustration too.

title: Beware of scammers!
review: Depop is a great concept, but the app seems to be filled with tons of underage teens wanting to swap items, or convince you to pay them with concealed cash through the mail. I've also come across a lot of scammers. I'm still waiting on PayPal to return my funds from a person that never intended to send me the item I purchased. Depop doesn't do much about it unless you report the person, then they'll send you a generic email after a week telling you the scammers profile was deleted (can't they just create another profile and scam again?). Then you're on your own to get your $ back. There's also a lot of lowballers and people that will insult your prices, even if they're collectibles. The worst thing though is I've seen is cyber bullying on the app. Seriously, on a selling and buying app! I had a 16 year old call me names because she didn't like a question I asked, and I've seen one woman's account be harassed by a few specific girls. And Depop does nothing about it. It's kind of ridiculous. But hey, it's cheaper than eBay! And I like that it looks similar to Instagram but you can swipe photos. I think Depop needs to crack down a bit on scammers and start enforcing an 18+ rule and require a paypal account or credit card.

title: Glitch, Scammers, and will not issue a refund
review: Depop seemed amazing at first, but the first time I purchased something on the app (this entire transaction was completed in-app), there was a glitch and the seller did not receive the prepaid shipping label and the purchase did not show up on my profile. Therefore, the seller had to pay for shipping a second time at the post office and we could not leave feedback for each other. I contacted Depop so the seller could receive a refund but it was so complicated and she decided that she did not want to go through the trouble. I then asked Depop for a refund of the money I paid for shipping which did not end up being used for shipping due to the glitch. Depop is telling me to contact the seller to initiate the refund but I do not want her to go through further trouble for me. Besides, it has been over two weeks since I made the purchase and originally contacted Depop. I am severely disappointed at the way Depop has been handling the glitch, making it so complicated to receive a refund, and replying to my emails so late that this problem has been dragged out for so long. Furthermore, I have seen more scammers than buyers on the app. I do not feel safe using the app because Depop does not verify users. I hope that these issues can be solved quickly or Depop will experience a drop in users.

title: Used to love, now I hate
review: This new update is AWFUL. Not only does it look terrible but it functions terribly too. Nothing refreshes like it's supposed to anymore. Any time you make a change and refresh, nothing happens for at least a few minutes or a few hundred times of pulling down on the screen. AND they took away the BEST feature. The "activity" to see what the people you follow have liked recently. It was the only way I found shops I actually like. Or items I'm actually interested in because it's based on who I follow so therefore it's my style rather than the god awful single style they promote on their explore page. It's all about thrasher and flames and totally unwearable clothes. They also never choose my photos for the explore page anymore which they used to constantly as soon as I posted. This used to be an app to help anyone clean out their closet and make a little extra money. Now it's all about status and models and popularity, just like everything else. And it's extremely disappointing 👎🏻👎🏻

title: Easier Than EBay or Storenvy
review: I used Storenvy before but it was too difficult navigating and getting attention and almost tried EBay but that was too much work and had high fees. This app I discovered when a blogger began selling her clothes and invited her followers through tumblr. I began selling my clothes on here and I can honestly say its one of the best experiences I've had because it has an Instagram-like format and is very easy to use! The only downsides are the scammers and swindlers. I've been victimized twice :( The only problem I have that I think needs to change is the popular page where the items that have been sold need to be marked. Other than that it's really good :) Oh yeah, also I think there should be filters for which country I want to view and filters for shirts, tops, band merch, makeup, etc. I keep trying to look for a certain vintage camera but when I do find it, all the sellers are Italian and I have no idea what they're saying so it's hard to communicate with them.

title: WHY
review:
honestly depop, I'm not angry, I'm just disappointed. but seriously, this new scrunched up font is GIVING ME HEADACHES! the older version was so much better and easier to understand. I NEED to clear out my little review/notification thing but I can't because some sellers automatically use depop's shipping service (the set prices) and then don't use the shipping label. I have almost every item I've purchased with me, and I can't review them/the sellers because the products are "awaiting shipping." I don't even know what else changed but my sales have gone sooo low and I'm tired of random items getting removed. The whole "used makeup" removal of items is completely random. In my experience, I very rarely get "customer service" from an actual person! So many more scams on the app as well ☹️

Originally got depop to sell some things I haven't used, don't need anymore, but now I feel like I'm constantly reposting things that get deleted! I think someone else mentioned that their sales have gone down as well. I was really digging the whole idea of an interactive buying/selling experience, but these updates are driving me crazy!

title: great
review:
it's good love this app but itd be cool if it could have like different folders you could save stuff into! that would be really nice! 
also maybe filter settings on peoples profiles like on someone's profile you could see what sizes they have price etc 
ALSO ya a big one is if y'all could somehow make it so with returns there's some way the people could have an option to choose if they want to have a return policy on an item or not if not then that's fine but if they checked that they could have a return policy an item and they ignore someone when they want to return and they agreed to it before hand so they wouldn't get ripped off ya feel bc i hear that's a big thing w depop and if something like that could work out that would be really cool bc ive been ripped off and people saying they have a return policy but ignore/ block

title: Ok but needs work
review:
As a buyer, this app is ideal. It's not bogged down with all the junk items that Poshmark and Mercari are now. It's kind of like a really good online thrift store-- I've had the best finds on here.

As a seller, I would like to see improvements. Mainly, I don't like that we have to use paypal to sell products easily and accept payments. Can you guys update and allow us to do it straight through the app. First of all, PayPal charges us another unmentioned fee when we're selling through Depop, so I never really know exactly what I'm making off the sale. Plus, Depop already takes a fee so there's two fees we're hit with automatically. Secondly, I haven't had the best protection through PayPal and up until I began using this app, I was boycotting it. I simply don't trust it. It has trusted scammers over me on multiple occasions and makes me weary that with every sale I make, I might come across one of those horrible buyers that takes advantage of the system and get screwed out of clothes or money. 

Other than that yea it'd be nice if the upload process was a little smoother.

title: Avoid this app
review: I used to love this app, sold on it for over a year. Had loyal customers and 500 all positive reviews. THEN one day depop emails me saying my account has been permanently deleted because it was reported for "abuse" I emailed them back, asking them to clarify the abuse. They responded a day later with a 2 sentence email, saying I named and shamed someone. I reported a buyer for leaving me a 1 star review and clearly lying in the review and not offering prof of there claims, then this person got hostile with me when I would t offer a refund, I screen shooted our conversation and posted it, I was warning other sellers about this person, because I when I reported them depop just said "sorry we can't do anything" So my entire shop was deleted because I wanted people about someone screwing sellers over. Hope depop enjoyed ALL the money I brought them the last year since they take 10% of everything you make, and sometimes depop "glitches" and takes the 10% twice, but they always claim it's a mistake, even though it happens 80% of the time. Don't waste your time with this app, it was going down hill anyways and hardly anyone was still managing to sell anything.

title: Old app support + Fix search issues
review: I don't have enough GBs on my phone for iOS 10, and it won't let me upgrade to a higher version of iOS 9 (currently running v9.2). So, I can't install the new app since it only supports 9.3+, and the older version of the depop app has become incredibly glitchy, to the point where I can barely use the search. It will only load a specific amount of items for each search, even if there are more items to be displayed - it just doesn't load anymore past a certain point (even using a simple, widely used search like "vintage", it will only load the last 4-5 days of items uploaded). Also, the search queries have become way more specific, and trying to find things using multiple keywords won't work, unless those keywords are all next to each other in an item description (which people rarely do). Please don't drop old app support, and please fix the search issues. I loved using depop, and I don't want to have to use a different shopping app.

title: overall good app
review:
i do like this app. the way the app is laid out makes it super easy to ship out items and contact other users. it's super convenient that depop creates shipping labels for you and provides tracking. i find that it's very easy and quick to list & buy items. however, that doesn't mean that this app doesn't have its issues. it does. just to name a few:
1) the fees- it can be very frustrating when i list an item at a relatively cheap price (way less than what i bought it for) and then when it is purchased i lose even more money because of depop's fees. frankly, i don't understand why they take money out of our profits and for what? the app still crashes, and has its issues that aren't getting fixed.
2) usernames- please please please let us change our usernames after we've signed up!
3) it crashes- depop crashes pretty much every time i use it for 10 minutes or more. seriously needs to get fixed.
~ i could name more but honestly i don't even feel like it, the list goes on. this app does have its good qualities but there are minor things (like what i mentioned) that i'm guessing would be very easy to fix. forget the aesthetics of the app, the logo, design, etc. first make sure the app runs smoothly and doesn't crash. but that's just my opinion. i really would love to see some things change on this app and i hope you take my feedback into consideration! :)
developerResponse: {'id': 1085411, 'body': "Hey there, thanks so much for your review and feedback. You make some great points and of course we want the app to be bug and crash free. It would be really helpful if you could send us details about the device you're using (e.g. iPhone 7) and iOS version to productfeedback@depop.com. If you have any other details about what you were doing prior to the app crash that would help us to fix this issue. Many thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-08-23T12:11:40Z'}

title: Lots of scammers and children buying on here
review: I do use this app regularly and have been using this app to sell for the last two months but I must say that there are a lot of buyers/sellers still in high school and are not willing to pay the minimum amount for used items. On that same note, too many buyers selling USED ITEMS for full retail price which does not make sense at all. Also, many users are trying to buy outside of the app so that they can keep your money without actually selling anything. I also think it's ridiculous that the app takes 10% out of every purchase. Considering it's a smaller app (NOT EBAY) you would think they'd lower the price. TIPS: 1) don't BUY if seller wants to you want pay through PayPal friends and family. 2) don't "swap" your items with other users as there is absolutely no guarantee you'll get anything in return. 3)used items are used items. Unless it's an item that is truly being sought out for, NO ONE IS GOING TO BUY. Don't over price your items!!

title: Warning super awesome addictive app!
review: I love depop, I actually started using it more than Etsy because my art and things were being lost in the massive amount of people and products are being sold on there nothing against Etsy, I still love it to shop, but my stuff was just getting lost I lost a lot of traffic as well. it's not like that on Depop I get a lot of traffic I was featured on the explorer page only once but at least they pay attention to the little guys and we get noticed which is always nice! i've never had any problems with the app itself or the people who use it I love to swap and to haggle people it's my favorite and it's a completely addictive app that you should definitely go download because you have nothing to lose! Highly recommend! ❣️✌️

title: Recent update
review:
This new update is TERRIBLE! The entire design is ugly and now nothing even works right. It keeps telling me I have a notification when I don't I even deleted and reinstalled the app and it's still there. I hate how they removed the option to delete comments. I'm honestly considering deleting the app completely and never using it again after this. I see a lot of users also complaining and depop obviously doesn't care how anyone else feels about this terrible update since they haven't addressed it. If you still haven't updated the app yet don't even bother you'll save yourself a lot of trouble.

Edit: I think it's really shady that depop won't address all the valid criticism it's getting even going so far as to delete users comments and even the reviews on the app store so they won't have to confront how unhappy everyone is with this update. At least be honest with your uses who are making YOU money in the first place. And bring back the activity page there's literally no point to the app without it.

title: Horrible Customer Service Support
review: I'm writing this because I'm so so disappointed with depop's customer service. I've been buying and selling on the app for a few months now and have built up a decent following. It's unfortunate that the customer service is so poor since the rest of the app is really great. But one of the first items I purchased, I never received and was never contacted my seller who was probably a scammer. I've reported and emailed depop's customer service about a hundred times now and nothing has been done. The only thing I ever receive is a pathetic automated email stating that I must report the item through the app which again, I've been doing repeatedly since I bought it and without any reply. I'm very very disappointed with the customer service and hopefully something will be changed. Until then, my advice to people using the app is to make sure you connect all purchases to PayPal since they have much better customer service and will then be able to help you out even if depop refuses to.

title: Okay but I prefer poshmark
review: This app definitely has its pros but I think it's got a few cons as well. What I like most is the look. It's minimal and very easy to use/streamlined much like Instagram. That familiar format definitely helps. I also like the private messaging feature. Other than this I don't like that there isn't set shipping. I also just don't think it's easy enough to get your stuff out there on depop. I was on the featured page and still have barely received likes or followers, let alone purchases. I don't even know if there's really a method to gaining followers/making sales because I think majority of accounts are small businesses and they're not looking to sell. So really my favorite thing about it is just the look. I think Posh is easier for shopping and selling and I think the community is friendlier. Plus it's easy to gain followers and make sales there if you follow their tips. Overall eh.

title: Great! Few suggestions..
review:
• Search by brand/category/size.. You can easily type in "nike" or something in search, but people tag things that arent related to get more views. Also category to specify on shoes, pants, etc. like we fill this stuff out when we are selling so how do we search it? 

• Accept the product.. I like poshmarks concept of accepting the product after you receive it so you dont get scammed out of your money. 

• Selling continous scroll.. I dont know what this is called but when you look through a persons closet, you should have the option to browse thru by just scrolling (like on instagram) but you can only see the description of items by clicking each individual one.
 
• Start up tutorial?.. Maybe like advice for shipping because when i started i lost some money because i wasnt charging the right amount for shipping. Maybe just me though. 

• Prepaid shipping.. If this is possible please consider it! Poshmark has a $4.99 shipping priority and it makes it much easier to ship, so you dont have to calculate it or go out of your way to print out a label.

Other than that, good app, doesnt charge too much. I like the visual appearance of this much more than any other selling app. 😊

title: Love!!!
review:
Such an easy app to use! It's safe and secure and so reliable. I've sold more things on here in a fraction of the time than eBay or Instagram. Definitely would recommend. My only problem would be that the app takes out 10% as opposed to PayPal or other sites. It does add up and I try to accommodate the fees into my prices but people just want it cheaper :( in all I do like the the editing post feature because it allows me to update my item and relist it instead of deleting and reposting again.

UPDATE: my only problem is I hate how they take out 10%! It's more than eBay and they keep telling us to not use friends and family through PayPal to be safe which I understand but people don't want to buy things because they don't want to pay the fees

title: Eh
review: Depop used to be cool. I've found lots of great things for ok prices and for that they get 2 stars. But they changed their layout and looking at it now gives me a headache. Selling is also a nightmare. They rob you with these fees. I once listed brand new Doc Martens for $99. And because of Depop's dumb fees, I ended up getting only $70. Like....what? Ridiculous. What do they need so much of our money for if they don't even listen to their users' feedback? The spam mail is getting out of control. Every day I receive messages from scammers, multiple times a day. Also Depop will do nothing to a user if they scammed you out of any money even if you paid through the app, so you might as well sell through PayPal that is actually quite proactive in those situations. Beware of this app.

title: Good app, iffy community.
review: I really like this app but the community can be a little annoying to deal with. I've sold 20 items and bought 10 so far and i have found some good people and good things! Have not been scammed either which is great! My only suggestions as of right now are 1) there should be a "viewed ____ times" feature so you can see how many people have viewed your item, also there should be a way to categorize items by brand when you post and when you search so people can look specifically for urban outfitters or brandy or whatever it is they are trying to find without having to sort through the search results. All in all i love this app and i wish there were more users on it!

title: Fun App, Good Finds... But 10% Fee Is A Lot
review: I sell and purchase items from this app and there are truly amazing sellers on here with very unique items. Easy to use, PayPal makes it safe and fast and clean layout to navigate around easily. I love Depop more than other app markets. However, Depop takes away 10% from your selling price which is a LOT for people who are just trying to sell their pre-loved clothing or buy pre-loved clothing for inexpensive while trying to still make some money back. Also, if Depop could make it a thing to include pictures in private messages that would make communicating much easier, more reassuring for the buyer and less of a hassle for both and if they had the option to leave a review. TIP: Always buy from people with good reviews (such as 5 stars). Read their customer reviews.

title: It's decent
review: I enjoy Depop's layout, and it is user friendly (still some people don't know what the hell they're doing, mainly people who are selling). It's not hard to figure out. I like that when someone buys your item, you get your cash asap. But that is bad if you buy from a scammer. If they released funds after the item is shipped out through usps then maybe that would be better for everyone. I like that buyers can get rated because some buyers are really rude and try to low ball you. I enjoy this app way more than Poshmark, and I wish that it got as much traffic. I also wish that you got a notification when someone lowered the price of an item. Depop only takes 10% from your earnings and Poshmark takes 20% + $2.95 which is a ton omg. If Depop were to fix these things then it'd be a perfect app

title: i hate dealing with teenage girls
review: i use the app and have sold a few things and have a found a few great things as well, but honestly the depop staff needs to be monitoring their app better. it's basically an average age of 13 year old girls selling brandy melville for retail price or higher demanding you pay through paypal and only using stock photos (all against policy). if you do decide to list something, you get message after message of "lower the price!" "the lower the shipping!" "swap???", and don't even bother making shop policies-they will not get read. also, you find listing after listing of almost gone cosmetics being sold for about the same as they could be bought new. selling used make up is just GROSS and shouldn't be allowed. so, if you have half used tubes of MAC lipstick, AA tennis skirts, and a brandy melville jada dress you need to get rid of; this is the app for you.

title: Love this app!
review: I downloaded this app last January because a GF of mine recommended it. Initially I was only a buyer. I have an Etsy shop that's pretty good and I didn't have expectations to make very much money and at first I really didn't. But I gradually started to put more time into It and posting the same items I was listing on Etsy and and now, less than a year later there are months when I make more money on Depop than I do on Etsy. It does have occasional glitches (every app does though) and sales do vary based on each sellers amount of followers but just like anything else you get you put in. Overall though Depop is an excellent and powerful seller platform with a savvy and attentive staff who actually care about their users.

title: Too many email scams/unfair tagging/items not showing in searches
review:
First - I LOVE selling/buying on the app - I have NO issue w their policies and abide by all rules.
My issues- 
the Gmail/Yahoo Scammers are WAY out of control - one day I received 30 messages from diff individuals- today I received a message from someone that had been removed and made ANOTHER profile, I could tell because it was the same gmail address as another message I received the other day- there needs to be a better verification process - I miss messages from potential buyers due to the email scam ring. 
TWO- I've listed items that follow all rules-tagging, allowed items etc and have items THAT DO NOT SHOW UP WHEN SEARCHED OR SEARCHED BY HASHTAG! This is a HUGE inconvenience- I've asked for HELP multiple times - to NO AVAIL! I've lost sales on many items due to this.
THIRD- TOO MANY PROHIBITED ITEMS. I could report seeing weapons and irrelevant hashtags all day- but they'll flag my profile for NOTHING- I follow the rules and find it highly unfair I try to search for a "Unif" item and a bunch of second hand CRAP shows up! 
I DO like that the moderators are there to listen. I DO love the community, the app and love belonging it to it. I've made some great friends and business relationships. 
HOWEVER-Let's fix these issues!!!!

title: No customer service. BUYER BEWARE!!
review: I've been buying and selling on depop for years now. I have all 5 star reviews, actually enjoyed the ease of the app and getting the money right away. However, my account was suspended for adding too many hashtags on my listings (which I thought you were supposed to do?) and they refuse to reactivate my account. I purchased 4 things on the app this week and I basically have to go through PayPal to get in touch with the sellers because they told me tough luck, even though they already took a percentage of my money for the sale they refuse to provide any customer service. I'd suggest listing on poshmark or Mercari, depop has been less successful for me. Too many spam accounts and the items just sit, get over 100 likes and never sell even if they're super cheap. There's too many teenagers on the app who have no money to shop or use their parents PayPal account which creates problems. Overall waste of time. I'd stay far away.

title: truly the best app to sell pre loved clothing and find unique treasures!
review: I have sold a lot of different items on etsy and eBay, but their apps and web interface are not as functional and fun as depop. I find it incredibly easy to search exactly what I'm looking for (with tags and hashtags). Buyers and sellers alike communicate in a community based environment which makes doing business so fun. Plus, it gets people together by collaborating with friends and shooting their clothing!  I have found my shop becoming increasingly successful by the explore page (something etsy makes a shop purchase and I believe eBay doesn't have this function).  a worthwhile download and creative application!

title: Better than Poshmark. More focused than eBay.
review: I love the idea of having an app for at-home thrifting. I also sell on Depop. It's user friendly, but there are things here and there that can be tweaked. It refreshes at random. If I'm in the middle of listing an item and go to a text to respond, when I get back on the Depop app, it will have refreshed, not saved my item listing, and have gone back to the home page. Another thing is the scammers, but report them and it's easy. I'm sorry to say, but there are a ton of low ballers. You go out thrifting for on trend items and spend your hard earned money on your day off when you should be resting, only to go home and list & list & list. It takes work. So charge and pay accordingly. Otherwise, this online marketplace rocks. Try it!

title: Expect Drama! Sellers are Rude!
review:
Total hype. Prices here are super inflated by everyone claiming "vintage" and "rare." Sellers don't give accurate descriptions of damage or message you back? Customer support will not email you back for days. 

On one occasion I purchased an item for $20 and the seller disappeared. It took me 40 days to receive my money back and I had to file the claim myself on PayPal, Depop doesn't do anything to help in situations where items are not shipped or don't arrive. 

After purchasing a $240 bikini from one seller, she messaged me and asked if she could refund me and if I could send her the payment again Via PayPal so she could avoid the 10% Depop fee. When I refused and wrote an honest review with my experience, the seller left me revenge feedback, lied and said I accused her of being a scammer and called me a "weirdo." 

THEN mentioned my @ name on the listing saying "if you're anything like (me), do not purchase this item." With the same seller, a buyer left a review claiming they never received the item, the seller literally replied "not my problem." ARE YOU KIDDING ME.

I don't understand why Depop would allow the opportunity of revenge feedback on buyers. I was simply trying to buy a bikini and the sellers on this app will treat you like trash and get away with a 5 star review in their bio, DESPITE numerous negative reviews.  

This is not a positive place to shop or conduct business.

title: Just a couple things!
review: I really have been loving this app, there's just a couple things I would change to help improve it. First, I wish there were a way to filter your search results, such as by price and size. I also wish there were a way to view the items you have liked so that you could easily go back to them and purchase them at a later time. The last thing I would change is the ability to hide things that have already been sold. Sometimes you see something you really like and its either no longer available or not the right size. If these things were added I think this app would be even better! I love that it is already connected to PayPal making buying and selling easy!

title: So Far So Good
review: I was a regular buyer and seller on Mercari, with no negative feedbacks, and over 100 great ones, but they still decided to delete my account. Mercari is quite awful. A nightmare, actually. I had to look for a new place to sell, and DEPOP fits the bill! So far it's much better than Mercari and poshmark. The whole social aspect isn't really my thing, but a lot of people like it and I can work with it. It's easy to use, users seem friendly, and they don't have absurd rules like other selling apps. I have only been using it for a couple of days, but I think it'll work for me! If you're fed up with Mercari this might be the place for you. 8.5/10 in my book.

title: awful
review:
First transaction: I buy a watch from a local guy. He takes 2.5 months to ship it. I message him asking why it took months ( we both live in the same city). He just blocks my account.

2nd transaction. I buy an item. It never gets here. Months later I ask depop for help. They tell me to talk to paypal. I reach out to paypal and win the case and get my money back. Three months later the seller dms me apologizing and blaming the buggy app and saying how it's a nightmare to sell on it.

3rd and final transaction: I buy a hat. Keep getting an error message. Seller suggests I just paypal her instead. Her email bounces. She gives me another. I paypal her. She says she'll ship the item tomorrow then she blocks my account and stops responding to emails. I cancel the transaction via paypal and get my money back. I try to report the 3rd seller to depop, they respond with a generic copy and paste bs email. 

Basically the app is super buggy, the system is awful and does not protect the buyer nor the seller. Customer service is nonexistent. Although you can score a few rare vintage and modern finds it's just not worth it to bother with this app. I say stick with ebay/etsy/craigslist/brick & mortar for at least the next 5 years. Btw I'm using it with iphone 6s, super fast wifi and my paypal works great with other apps. It's not me, it's you.

title: UPDATE
review:
UPDATE: I ended up deleting the app because I got extremely fed up with the severe lack of customer service. My feed was FLOODED with shops I DID NOT FOLLOW. I would miss deals from shops I DID follow because of it. Customer service said it was a bug and they were working on it. That was DECEMBER OF 2015. It still was not fixed when I just recently deleted in early July of 2016. 
There's also a buttload of drama and spammers on the site. Not worth it, at all. 

ORIGINAL: I do really love this app, just browsing through items is super fun. It does bother me how buggy it is and how they don't seem to even try and fix them. Most recently, sellers whom I have NO interest in, nor am I following, keep showing up in my feed. They say they're "working on it," but the last update didn't fix anything. I'll keep it around to browse, but they need to fix things that are broken.

title: Very useful, unique, and just plain great!
review: I absolutely love this app! I use it every single day. I would, however, like an update. It would amazing if there was a section on the "Explore" page where you can search exactly what you're looking for. For example, "size 10 shoes," "medium size shirt," etc. It would fit perfectly with the update you put where you can size your items and categorize them. However, I really don't like how there isn't a "XS, S, M, L, XL," etc. section to categorize your tops. Also, for the jeans, it would be a huge improvement if you could have the sizes also in "00, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6" etc. Honestly, if these changes were made, I'd absolutely love this app even more! I really hope you make these changes.

It's my 1st time writing review on a app, that's just how unhappy I am with depop. I spent 2-3 days using depop excessively, the idea is great, but someone please just walk me through the algorithms, seems like there's none. If you want your account to be seen, you are basically on your own, you have to comment and DM strangers to hustle a sale. Are we still doing "cold call" in 2015? What about big data and all that? The amount of time you spend on the app, for example, liking other 100 photos, doesn't reflect on the chances to be seen on the explore page. The explore page doesn't really explore related items,most of the time, it just show you items that you look at and didn't buy. Explore page is not Google ad space guys.

Other reviewers already addressed the main issue, the crowd just doesn't have much spending power.

title: Long live the Depop Kingdom!
review: This app is life changing! I have been able to sell many items through this app and it has created so much opportunity for me- I even landed a job doing menu art for a company in Philadelphia through a post of my illustrations. I live in NY so I was able to meet with some of the Depop managers who are an amazing team of friendly, awesome people. They gave me tips on how to improve and will help me to grow my shop every chance they get. I've made friends with humble, talented curators and artists through this app and have met some rad people at their meet and greets that are held every couple months. Depop is a devoted community I'm so happy I joined!

title: Awesome.
review: I really like this app. It has a lot of great features and I love how simplistic it is. But there are a few things that could improve: being able to send photos over messages instead of having to add to or make another listing for someone to see it. Also, I think the Depop fee is too high. I also wish there was a "sale" button or "option" when making a listing. Ex: having a sliding button to make your item 20% off without having to manually change the price. And once your sale is over you can slide the button off and it it will change your item back to the original price. But other than those things I believe this app has great potential!

title: Great Way to Make Extra Cash
review: Overall, I love Depop. I have referred a number of my friends to it and they seem to enjoy it as well. The app works very similarly to instagram, in that you can like and follow people, but you can buy whatever item they are selling in their photos. The app is very easy to use and keeps things simple (unlike Vinted, which is just tweens selling junk no one wants). I also like that they have a number of fashion bloggers and popular boutiques also selling on their app. My only qualm is that the app crashes quite a bit! Hopefully this is just a problem that will be resolved with the next update.

title: Good in theory
review:
Great for selling, buying, and it's aesthetically pleasing compared to other selling apps. Some criticism: there's tons of bugs, it runs slow (I know this isn't my phone because I check other apps to make sure), I wish you could view things in list mode as it'd be ten times easier to view things (like Instagram has rows then list). I think the app would be a lot smoother if there was some sort of shipping label pdf printable via E-mail, like mercari. Perhaps having the price on the bottom corner of the thumbnail would make the user experience easier as well. 

Overall decent app, but could really use an update UI wise and some kinks need to be worked out.

title: Great app!!! Only problem is a tiny glitch!!
review: I've been using this app to sell a bunch of my items since 2015 and I've made more money selling on this platform than any others- I've used eBay, poshmark, etc, but Depop takes the cake. They have great customer service and a A+ support team, which I love. The only issue which I wish they would fix is the fact that the notifications for buying/selling reviews are still showing up even after myself and the buyer/seller have left reviews! please fix this asap, it's the only reason why this review is missing a star!!!

title: let me change my shop name!!!!
review:
i've been using depop for several months now and i've used ebay in the past. ebay is better by fees as depop take 10% out of every order(plus paypal fees plus the amount i paid for the item in the first place) so im not making as much as i'd like. however i have sold a bit more then on ebay as i think younger people are on it and they want to buy new clothes. depop  could still make plenty of money if they lowered their fees! also I WANT TO CHANGE MY FRICKEN @ NAME!!!!! it's currently my name and i want to have a name for the shop itself!  
other than those two issues i don't really have any other problems that are as important.

title: Loved the App, Hate the Update
review: Prior to the latest 2017 update, I loved Depop, had great experiences with all sellers I purchased from, and used it frequently since the fall of 2016; for this reason, I'm giving three stars instead of one or two. However, the new update is terrible. It freezes and closes out frequently, especially when trying to view seller profiles, which makes it almost unusable. On top of that, the design is aesthetically unpleasant. If nothing on the update is fixed or improved, I will probably look into closing my Depop account and looking to other secondhand shopping apps because the freezes on the new update aren't worth it. The old design worked great, but the update is dreadful.

title: Fraudulent charges / SKETCHY
review: I love the concept of this app and I find such unique items at great prices - it's a great community. BUT BUT BUT this app has been STEALING random amounts from me. Their customer service is incompetent, and it's impossible to get issues resolved. No phone number to call. Just mindless email drones who don't know anything, making it extremely convenient for them to take forever to resolve anything, probably purposefully so that you'll forget while they continue fraudulent charges. They have withdrawn the sellers fee from me, and my PayPal shows that they have withdrawn nearly 3x that amount ON TOP of the sellers fee per item separately. That's inexcusable and straight up ROBBERY. I am disputing each charge but it is taking forever and they keep responding with totally vague, roundabout answers. Beware of this sketchy app. If you use it, KEEP TRACK OF EVERYTHING.
developerResponse:
{'id': 819520, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the feedback. Really sorry to hear you have had a poor experience using Depop. One of the reasons why the Depop charge can appear higher is when you use integrated USPS shipping for your listings. The cost of the shipping label is taken out of your PayPal account along with the Depop fee. Perhaps you could check to see if this may have been the reason for the apparent higher fee.

We definitely want to get to the bottom of this so please follow up with us at support@depop.com

Thanks,
Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-07-20T17:06:39Z'}

title: Honestly..
review:
The app is great. Don't get me wrong. The platform to sell and buy items is good, it's easy to send and receive money through the app. 
HOWEVER
In the event that a customer may try to scam you or send false disputes, There is no way to contact Depop other than through email or through a "Depop Official" within the app, which, I'm sure, don't even exist. There is no customer service number, no way to report fraudulent accounts, nothing. So if you're willing to trust people to buy things properly and you are prepared to handle all of those cases outside of Depop, then go ahead. But it's clear that Depop is only in this for the profit, and want to part of dealing with buyers or sellers who run into trouble using THEIR APP.

userName: The Girl Always Had Good Taste
title: Full of scammers; horrible customer service
review: Much like eBay in its first years, this app is full of "part-time" sellers who will gladly take your money and never send you your item. On top of that, unlike Mercari or Poshmark, you CAN'T cancel your purchase after 7 days of non-shipment, so you're then stuck filing a claim with your method of payment. PayPal has a claims system, but I'd imagine it's 10x more difficult if you paid with a debit card/bank account. Depop customer service is woefully inadequate. Depop imagines itself as a safe haven for the "odd" to sell crap, but without an actual system to mitigate fraud and with 0 customer service, I suggest avoiding this app. I've made 10 purchases and had an issue with almost EVERY SINGLE ONE. That's endless wasted hours, alone, with no "Depop assistance". Avoid this wasteland of unprofessional, part-part time sellers.

title: New Update 👎🏽
review: Okay, I usually don't do this but the new update is so bad I had to. The design is hideous. It's literally gotten so bad that traffic has severely halted. I even find myself lacking any sort of drive or motivation to open the app when it used to be my favorite. Everything clashes way too much and in no way represents the users of the app. It looks like a website design I would've done when I was ten and that's not saying much. Also, why does "sold" have to be plastered over our photos?? The font and the placement look so harsh and screws with the layout of people's shops. The only thing I do like is how the notifications and receipts are on the same page as your shop. Other than that, I really don't like it. I hope ya'll fix this soon.

title: DePOP-ROCKS!
review: Super new to this App, and whole "scene" for that matter. It's quickly becoming a simultaneously fun, stimulating, and not to mention profitable way of networking, selling some stuff you've got lying around that could be someone else's next treasure, or actively going out and hunting for treasure yourself to put up and sell. Depop's layout and format is so easy for both buyer and seller that it's really simple to just jump into it and get started! Another great thing is the fee they receive from sellers is so little! I'm already spreading the Depop word and am still having a blast with it. Thanks Depop!

title: Deleting likes
review: I have been using this app for over a year now selling and buying things. It has always been good to me, with a few ups and downs here and there. But about a month ago the app deleted every single one of my "likes" (liked items) and I was furious. All of the things I was considered buying were gone. An hour ago it just happened again after re-searching things just to find them and like them. When I find items that I have liked in the past but don't appear in my "likes" the app says that I HAVE liked them. Why aren't they appearing in my likes?? This makes me more angry then I could describe, and I am considering deleting the app. Fix this.
developerResponse: {'id': 3268385, 'body': "Hey there! This is super frustrating, and we do believe this issue should be fixed now. If it's not, could we ask that you contact our lovely support team (support@depop.com) who will better be able to investigate. Thanks - Team Depop", 'modified': '2018-04-26T09:50:33Z'}

title: Eh
review: There are still issues that need to be fixed and all you guys are doing is focusing on aesthetics. The users tell you what we want on the many posts you guys have been making. The improvements are downgrades for a lot of us because it's so harsh to look at. The main things that we want fixed are the sellers can't expect buyers to rate and base their rating off of the buyers rating AND there are purchases that many people have not been able to leave feedback for because there isn't an option to - even when it's been shipped. I, personally, can't stand the feedback notification that I have. I want to get rid of all of the feedback for products that I have received and I can't because there is no option to.

title: Amazing, but improvements are needed.
review: Let me start by saying that I love Depop. I spend entirely too much time on this app. However, the app could be if it from improvements. First off, I think the explore page should be catered to your likes. Not just randomly selected items. Next, customer service should definitely be better. I have been waiting quite a few days for Depop to get back in contact with my regarding an issue where I never received an item I payed for. Lastly, I would love to be able to just search by categories. I was able to do this at one point but the option just disappeared.

title: The community is great, the customer service is lacking
review: I've been using this app for a while and I definitely do prefer it over the other selling apps because I find cuter/cooler stuff on here and find the layout to be easier. There's tons of great sellers including bloggers and celebs which I also love. The downside to this app is people ripping you off from time to time/trying to scam. "Swaps" should be avoided if the person asking to swap has no reviews. The customer service is also barely there, I had a few questions for the depop team and they never got back to me. Overall though I really do love this app, I'm addicted.

title: My opinion on Depop
review: Honestly love this app it's a great easy access to clothes I'm in search for. there's also a structure built between purchasing or being the seller very simple and easy. It is not an app that is too complicated to understand and is an easy way to make money out of things you no longer want you can put whatever up for sale and can even swap items with other users. The only flaws I would say about this app is the fee's they charge out of your sales there's plenty of apps that take much less I can also say some of the people on here can be a bit aggressive or shady so beware!

title: Really great but could use some work!
review: I love this app because it's where I spend most of my free time when I'm bored and I love how you can search by sizes because most other stores don't which makes it a lot easier to sift through the unwanted searches. I think it could be worked on to be even better if there was an option for "items related to your likes" or "items related to your searches" or "items related to your viewed items" because it'll make me like a lot more things and possibly buy more things.

title: Easy, too easy
review: I like this app a lot. I have sold a few items and have purchased more. It's very easy to list things and make purchases. Almost too easy I think. anybody can have their own online storefront. Lots of young girls on this app don't know how to run a store properly. A lot of sellers think it's acceptable to ship things two weeks out or when they find the time. I've left countless one star reviews for terrible customer service, not getting my packages, packages aren't properly labeled and I have to purchase the rest of the shipping they didn't pay for, receiving non-genuine items when they are listed as authentic. I'm done with buying from this app and trying to sell my gently used items to time wasters.

title: Love Depop but..
review: In this version of the app they have the *cancel* button right where the *back* button usually would be on most apps and browsers etc, so there I am; I spend 30 minutes meticulously creating a listing but want to change something then my brain gets confused presses the cancel button thinking it's the back button and BAM, 30 minutes I'll never get back.. it has happened at 5 or 6 times in the last two weeks and it's honestly making me just be like "eff this.." and not list.. I love depop and support them full heartedly but this is becoming a huge problem for me 😭

title: Love the app but u will get scammed a lot!!!
review: Depop needs to do something to help when sellers don't send items!! Something anything !! I've lost so much money on sellers who never sell or have no communication at all.
