Depop should require all sellers to use tracking numbers until then item is on hold and not paid for in full. Tracking numbers are free, at least in cali and its not hard to do !!! Don't bother getting this app if u don't have money to loose. If not all sellers be required to use tracking maybe have an option like verified seller of tracking, so sellers who would like to use tracking for all purchases be verified. I'm sure many will accept terms considering it will make more people be interested in their shop.

title: Decent Experience
review: The user friendly app makes the process of posting your items very simple, but the problem is that the app has a few annoying bugs that just won't go away, including notifications that never adjust, even once you have clicked on them. Very annoying if you are like me and don't like seeing little red notification dots, when you've already seen the notification. Also you have to be prepared to sell your items for cheap, as the demographic is very young.

title: Perfect to sell your stuff!
review: Depop is an okay app to use to sell your used or never worn clothes/items. Don't get me wrong, it's easy to use because the interface is very much like Instagram but better. Depop does a really good job in protecting their sellers and buyers by using Paypal and deleting scammers. What Depop doesn't do right is giving other regular people support on their "explore" page. Often you will see bloggers getting advertised than the average person on Depop. Also I've tried to buy from these bloggers and they are down right rude. In addition to that, ever since there was a 10% commission fee, a majority of the buyers on Depop complain about prices but don't take into account of these fees and try to bargain you down to the very penny. I love how Depop is laid out but the community is a headache.

title: Wonderful App
review:
This is a fantastic app. It allows users to connect with people allow over the world who want to sell their clothing or personal equipment second hand. I have been able to find so many great purchases at incredibly discounted prices. It is like shopping at a thrift store but all of the tasteless junk is filtered out!

The app mimics larger social media trends like Instagram. There are some obvious improvements that could be made to the app-user interface, however, this doesn't effect the in-app experience or capabilities in anyway. 5/5!

title: Long time user!!
review:
I've been using depop (buying and selling) for a couple years now and have not had a single bad experience. The app is super easy to use, although it does have small bugs sometimes (such as message saying not read when I've already opened it) but overall it is great!! 

My only desire is for them to have read notifications so I can know if the other party saw my message or not. This would be very helpful when settling disputes. I've never had to settle a dispute so I don't know how helpful depop is on that front. 

I would totally recommend people to use this app!!

title: It's okay
review: I personally like the app's look to it because it looks cleaner, however it crashes sometimes when I'm simply browsing. It is also little annoying how much money they take out for selling on here. Also USPS loses sooo many packages come on why do they even use them? I've gotten my package lost twice already with sellers using shippo. It's hard to gain followers or exposure to your item when you have so many spamming people writing and using incorrect tags to describe their items so please be more strict about that. Overall it's an okay app but someone I blocked myself and can't comment on my page and the app support doesn't know how to fix it and claimed it's impossible but it happened so fix it.

title: A great selling app for small shops
review: Depop is a great place for people who want to sell their own wardrobe or maintain a small business.  It's easy, and the staff really help push new users' items forward to buyers. Make sure to post your own original photos that are high quality, and you will grow very quickly!  The only downside has to be the customer service--they are polite and nice but very slow to respond.  I try to avoid reaching out to customer service as much as possible, even when I encounter problems.

title: Depop is my new addiction
review:
I ALMOST love the app..

Just a couple suggestions...for the search it'd be awesome if you had categories instead of me typing in a keyword and then sorting it out through there..sometimes I just like to browse around and see what they have instead of always having to look for a particular item. Second suggestion, when you're viewing items for buyers it'd be awesome if you could scroll through the pictures. We only have the option to view it as tiles or with details. Other than that..this app is my new favorite. Def. addicted.

title: If real housewives had a garage sale
review: This app is not user friendly at all, whatsoever. The new update is hideous, and made it even more difficult to navigate. They would've been better off leaving it with the instagram-like interface. And the people who use it are entitled, rude teenage girls who think they're running a Prada store instead of what they're really doing, which is selling USED items for discounted prices. I've been attacked and blocked for simply asking questions about pricing, which is insane because everything is self priced. The girls on here get so defensive, and even insulting. I see this happen a lot on this app, with people posting nasty comments about other users trying to "expose" them. It's catty, and unprofessional. I'll be using LetGo from now on. Thanks.

title: So far, so good
review: I've only used the app a handful of times, but have enjoyed browsing this far. Search filtering could use some refining with some options added. I attempted to search for items with keyword Military and only wanted to see men's items but rather than be able to see all men's items with "military" associations, I was forced to select a specific category-outerwear- and had to go back and select each category individually to see the order items and found it annoying. Pardon the grammar and spelling errors, not the most patient iPhone user.

title: could improve
review: okay, i'd like to start this review by saying i would love to use this app to buy and sell; however, some factors are keeping me on poshmark. i wish depop showed the price on small picture and filtered listings by size so you don't have to click on every individual listing to see that info. also, poshmark makes shipping labels so that's what's mostly keeping me there. i wish you could use the balance you've earned from sales on purchases on the app. that's my favorite thing about poshmark. although, i LOVE that you can connect your depop to paypal. plus, they don't take out a huge portion of your earnings and it seems easier to get rid of things on here... but i'm still team poshmark.

title: Too Good
review: Using this app feels like getting lucky at the thrift store over and over and over. It's so addicting and I've gotten the best stuff that gets so many compliments. It's like a ton of people who enjoy 80s and 90s fashion all coming together to sell you great finds from all over the place. I love it so much... Also everyone is really nice. They are real people however, so sometimes life gets in the way and packages may take a little while to show up but typically I've had great experiences and I believe it's a very trustworthy app.

title: Great idea!!
review: I haven't bought or sold anything yet but I'm planning to once I get my stuff together!! I'm so excited to use this app and I'm glad that they have paypal as an option. One thing that sort of irks me is the app design though...it's honestly just a personal thing but I think the profile button should lead straight to your store profile and the settings and all that other stuff can just be accessed someplace else... But yeah this is a great alternative to etsy, it's like the Instagram of mobile shopping!!

title: Depop=Instagram of Shopping
review: Depop is the Instagram of shopping. I wish the search was more detailed like Ebay's where you can exclude things that you don't want to show up in your search results. Double tap to like things, very clean set up. They make sure you receive your item and if you don't they refund you and all that. The one thing I don't like is that they have the same mainstream Urban Outfitters esque asthetic as Instagram for the explore page, I wish they would choose weirder more interesting things to feature. Over all a very trustworthy useful app.

title: Modern
review: This app applies to the younger generation or anyone who's familiar to Instagram. It's easy to buy things through safely. Only issue which I don't blame the app for is since the app is mostly run by younger folks there's a lot of rudeness. Almost a sense of unprofessionalism from both sellers and buyers. If you can get past that and find a decent seller or buyer then consider yourself lucky. I for one like the way the app works as far as selling and buying goes, just move on to the next person if they have a stingy attitude. :)

title: Depop is revolutionary, design lacks
review: I think depop is the best market place app on the App Store. This is because it's personal, there is a younger age group, and users are promoted to take unique and good photos. 5 stars in that regard and I weigh that heavily. However, this new update is ugly. The red is too dark, the black text doesn't attract me, and the font does not look good at all. It makes me uncomfortable. I really loved the old icon with "hello were open", and the light red it has was eye catching and attractive. I like the formatting of the update, but when it comes to colors and typography Depop is seriously lacking.

title: Pros Don't Outweigh the Cons
review: The app is quick and easy for selling. However the amount of shops that are doing things that are against the supposed app policies is ridiculous, and the depop team won't do anything about it. Whether it be harassment or a pre order shop, they just don't seem to care about the users putting money in their pay checks. I find it quite ridiculous how much favoritism is on the app, I've been using it for over a year and have made over 200 sales with no bad reviews yet they won't put me as a suggested user but they will suggest you follow users with 4 reviews two of which being negative. Just seems as if they aren't supporting and boosting the good members of the community because of petty reasons to me.

title: Great app.
review: I've been selling, not buying yet. I wish there was a way to reserve an item for someone in case they were interested but couldn't pay right then and there. I also hate the fees because it's weird to mark your item up 10% to make up the  difference because people usually ask you to lower to an even whatever. I wish they're was another way for Depop to get their cut. Which they deserve because it's a great app overall! I love selling on there. I'm just being picky.

title: Disgusting Customer Service
review: I am absolutely disgusted by the lack of customer support & concern for customers these people have. I had tried for a month to connect my Paypal to the Depop app, to no avail. I contacted Depop customer service 11 times, and only got a response twice. They then told me that if I don't stop contacting them, I won't receive any help. Can you believe that? They claimed to be sending their issue to the Tech Team, however I contacted many other individuals who had the same issue, and they all said they contacted Customer Service months and months ago and STILL hadn't gotten a response. Although this app works well for some, I'd advise you not to use it to save yourself the risk of EVER having to contact Customer Service.
developerResponse: {'id': 967490, 'body': 'Hi gsophi. Really sorry to hear about the experience you have had. If you could send your username to productfeedback@depop.com we will have a look into the logs to try and understand the connection issues in more detail. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-08T11:45:25Z'}

title: Really great but…
review: Every time I get left a review / done with the purchase, it still leaves the number there and it keeps adding up. No matter if I keep clicking it, it just won't go away! Also, it doesn't give me a notification if I get a private message or a comment/like. I even have the notifications on for it in my general settings for the phone and the app. I really love the app other than that, I use it just like my social media apps. Always keep your transactions in the app, no matter what the person says and read reviews. Hope they fix the issues I stated soon, then it's a 5 stars.

title: Hands down best selling app, nothing compares
review:
I've tried all the other selling apps.. Even the popular 'posh market' and not even posh market compares to how good DePop is! Super easy communication, super easy to find products, mostly everyone has ratings, great prices, they only take 10 % out of your sales unlike apps like posh market which take 20 %.. Leaving you to price your items higher, therefore harder to sell on those other apps.. 
Plus if you get scammed or for some reason need a refund for whatever faulty item you bought.. They'll refund you! 
Also I really like how you get instantly paid and don't have to wait until the buyer accepts your item in the mail, or reviews you.. So if you need the money to ship their item.. It's right in your PayPal account.. 

This is always my go to selling app! 
You won't regret selling on here 😊😘

title: WHY? What were you guys thinking??
review: So I never write reviews for apps. EVER. But this update has been so disappointing that I had to say something. Depop at one point was a very pleasant and intuitive app to use, but with this new update it has become a total mess. It's now so difficult to navigate and has made the whole experience so much less enjoyable. I was a very active user on Depop and I can officially say I won't buy a single thing off of here until they go back to the old design. I've never seen an app miss the mark on concept redesign skills quite like Depop has with this update, in my opinion it's honestly awful now!! It was a sleek, easy to use app and now it's not only confusing but also very displeasing to the eye.

title: Great, but hard to buy
review:
I love the app, It's like an online thrift store but easier to access. You can easily search up keywords to find items. The one issue with it is it's hard to pay. Sometimes it's pretty easy; credit card info, address, phone, email, done. Or (if you have an account) you can pay through PayPal; email, password, next, done. But usually it says: "Sorry, we can't complete your purchase at this time.
Please return to the merchant and choose another way to pay." It's really hard to buy what you want.

title: I LOVE DEPOP
review: I've been selling on Depop now for the past 3 months and the last month has been really good! I love the app so much It took me almost a year before I decided to actually use the app. My total loss for not using! I now have 80plus 5 star reviews and expecting much more as I sold a bunch of items in the past week and half. This app is very easy to use and navigate! I love that you get your payment immediately through PayPal/Depop! I super suggest this app as a great place to shop and sell! A+ app! I love Depop!

title: Needs an update!
review: Honestly I love this app! It's super cool & easy to sell & buy stuff but it could use an update. It keeps crashing everytime I get a notification & I try to open it. My comments don't seem to send & I keep thinking that they are purposely being deleted by the seller. But I asked around & I'm not the only one this is happening to. It's happen to many users several times. Its annoying sadly. Sometimes my items don't want to pop up either. It takes forever to load. Idk if it's my wifi though, so that might be my personal issue haha but yeah please fix this. & I will rate you a 5 star! :) because I love this app besides the issues I mentioned..

title: Decent could use some fixes
review: Depop is amazing. I haven't had any bad experiences (so far) I am a seller and all my transactions have gone smoothly! Although I would suggest verifying sellers and buyers like someone else stated so people do not get scammed. Also. I think it would be a good idea to include a video option for selling items if u want to show off swatches and clothing. Just a suggestion though. I was reading the comments and first thy should fix all the glitches and bug fixes first before adding something that may create more glitches.

title: Just gets worse!
review: I've been using Depop to sell for over a year now, have liked it ok so far. Have only experienced minor issues before, like not getting notifications all of the time. But since the latest update, it's HORRIBLE. The simplicity that drew me to Depop in the first place has been replaced with an unnecessarily complicated lay out, and an extremely unattractive one at that. Also, there's a weird glitch that makes it so that when I get a notification, the big red notification number sticks around even after I've opened the app and checked the notification, which I hate. Please depop, do everyone a favour and fix the things that need to be fixed, instead of just changing the 'look'.

title: It gets the job done
review: It gets the job done.... but not very well at times. The app itself can be quite laggy and is prone to crashing. I got annoyed by this so I tried shopping via desktop, but purchases can only be made through the app. I think adding the ability to purchase through desktop and improving reliability of the app would do wonders for satisfaction. Other than that, i really like Depop and the community feel of buying and selling.

title: Needs a bit of work.
review: Depop definitely needs to crack down on scammers and fake merchandise. They also need to work on the popular page. I don't find it fair that some people have had 10 items featured at the same time. That makes it harder to discover other great sellers. Depop should also consider giving an option of filtering by country, to make finding merchandise easier since at times their hashtags don't work. Other than those minor details, it's very easy to sell on Depop, especially if you have a paypal account!

title: My account band for not using paypal and prefer exchange by hand
review: This apps deserve -0 star. I've been using this apps for 6months sold luxury bags by exchange by hands because i prefer exchange by hand transactions instead of shipping and paypal transactions. Then today a lady name valeria band my account and being so rude on my messages when i request to unbanned my account. Don't download this apps. It's hard to sell things and staff of this company are very rude please avoid it. And whoever that valeria is she's a f ing B. Why that B shoesn't be working rude and uneducated. By the way i live in rome italy. Just incase depop search for this B valeria. She's probably work as a customer service based on italian. Please avoid downloading and using this app. Total rip offffffffff. Avoid avoid avoid.....

Awesome buying/selling app! I have been a seller on Depop for almost a year now and have sold (and occasionally swapped) more than 60 sales. I'm not only a seller but an active bought (I have purchased over 50 items) and I have usually received great service with the exception with one scammer and some lazy sellers. But the Depop community as a whole is amazing and better than Mercari and Poshmark. The only thing that I would love to see Depop improve is if they created shipping labels like Mercari and others.

title: The best app for buying/selling
review: I've tried several other apps for buying and selling, and nothing is better than Depop. Super easy to find items, sort through them, save items, contact users, and easy transactions! I also had a problem with my account and contacted support, and they were able to fix the problem! I always tell my friends about Depop. The only app you should need for buying and selling:-)

title: Tweak It
review:
This is the perfect secondhand shopping app if you don't mind a few crashes here and there. A great concept, but poorly executed. The interface is more technical than user friendly, but if you're a self learner, you'll appreciate it.
It could go for some updates like a search button for individual shops, or a way to quickly and easily report scam PMs. 
I've been using it for seven months now and haven't run into any major problems, although the shopping experience leaves something to be desired.

title: new update is trash!
review: So i usually never leave a review unless something is extremely horrible and this new update is exactly that! The design and new color scheme are ugly! Changing the layout and look of the comments/messaging/notifications makes things difficult to navigate through. Not mention this new unwanted update literally crashes every time i try to send a message or view certain sellers pages. This used to be one the most simplistic seller/buyer friendly apps now its worse than poshmark. Word of advice, remove the new update and put back the old version and fire whoever thought this new update was remotely a good idea before you lose all your business to mercari.

title: Steps Above Poshmark, but Needs Tweakin'
review: I like that there are fewer restrictions, that the fees are half that of Poshmark and the private messaging - heck, even being able to delete comments (like someone who negotiates prices down and does not purchase) is a plus. Instant payment is wonderful too! However, I think the filter based on location needs improvement and I wish I knew the formula for getting an item or two featured. Hope my sales pick up as it grows in popularity in the US. Truly recommend as I think it's the best resale app out

title: Great But Needs Tweaking
review: SO much easier to buy/sell than Etsy and eBay. However, I wish the selling fees were closer to Etsy's because Etsy's are a fraction of the price and the price of goods on here are typically closer to Etsy's and aren't nearly as high as eBay, so I think it's too high.  I understand the company needs to make money, but I think it's pretty unfair. I also wish there was an optional filter to only see items from the US because it gets frustrating to see things that are sold internationally that can't be obtained by a buyer.

title: Needs a few improvements
review:
(1) The popular depop page seems to be very biased and showcase a certain aesthetic look and seller.
(2) The mail should be changed from First Class to Priority-- it would save a lot of complications with USPS and we end up having to pay for our own shipping making it almost not worth it to sell the items in the first place.
(3) Occasionally a sold item will not show as sold, another customer will buy the item and I have to refund them. I'm still charged the fee. It's hard to contact depop for a refund on their fees.
(4) You get an excessive amount of people trying to low-ball you constantly. You'll post an item that's worth maybe $100 and list it as $30 and the buyers will offer $5 LOL
(5) Also an excessive amount of people asking to swap items and spam.

It's nice for extra cash once in awhile but altogether the hassle you get shipping things makes it not worth using depop to sell.
developerResponse: {'id': 1046871, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the review and feedback. Sorry to hear about some of the issues you have been facing. So we can get to the bottom of some of these issues, especially the complications you have experienced with USPS and the sold items not always showing as sold, it would be great if you could get in touch with us at productfeedback@depop.com with more details about the issues. Many thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-18T09:34:12Z'}

title: DEPOP UNEXPECTEDLY DELETED MY ACCOUNT👎🏿👎🏾👎🏽👎🏼👎🏼👎🏻👎
review: When I first downloaded this app, I had high hopes of selling my stuff and making good profit. I later found out that they take 10% from what you sell, which in my opinion is a little high. I sold a jacket and the buyer changed his mind and when I emailed Depop for a refund from the percentage that they took they told me that it was non refundable. I sold a few more items and was successful with the sell but yesterday I checked my account and it would not let me log on nor would it let me see other people's pages. A customer had told me that my page no longer existed when he went to check it. Without warning they deleted my account. 👎🏿👎🏾👎🏽👎🏼👎🏼👎🏻👎

title: New update is disappointing.
review: I love Depop and will definitely continue to use it. However, the new update is terrible. You can't just suddenly change the whole layout of an app; you do it in chunks and improve as you go, receiving feedback from users. It's an awful color scheme and overall design that confuses and frustrates users even more, especially those who have been using Depop for a year or more. I really miss all of the old features which were so much more user friendly. I hope Depop switches to the old layout, but they most likely will not.

title: Beware
review: The app is great; finding items, commenting, and sending private messages are spot on. It's the people who are selling that you have to beware of. There are a lot of scammers and trying to get refunded through depop won't happen, you'll have to do it through PayPal and that takes a while or sometimes you won't get the refund at all. Read reviews and don't send money to people through email. Just stick to the safety of the app and buy through there. I'd had both success and failure with this app.

title: DO NO UPDATE
review:
First off, I do love this app. Even though they take a percentage off, I've heard it's cheaper than other places. I've gotten some very rude, vindictive people and scammers, but I'm sure in any selling app, you're gonna see that. Despite all that, I love to sell in this app. 

The only thing I HATE is the new updated. The layout is absolutely horrible. It all looks like a mess now!! I've gotten other selling apps, just to see what other people are selling, and they all have this stupid layout. So what do I do with those apps? Do I continue with it? Try to buy something or try selling? Nope! I Delete it and go back to depop, because it was nicer and more professional. NOW ITS JUST LIKE THEM😭

PLEASE CHANGE IT BACK!!!!!! ITS HORRIBLE🙏🏼
developerResponse: {'id': 809973, 'body': "Thanks for your review and feedback. We know change isn’t always welcome, so we appreciate you’ve taken the time to detail what you don’t like as it helps us make improvements in the future. It would be great to understand what you don't like about the new layout in more detail, so please feel free to send a message to support@depop.com.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2017-07-19T18:02:29Z'}

title: slow shipping & hard to get refunds
review: I bought 10 shirts last month and I still haven't received 3 of them. Some sellers don't even answer back your emails, some will give bullcrap stories on why they haven't shipped yet. And at least half of the shirts I purchased it took forever to get them. I'm waiting to get my money back from PayPal for those 3 shirts and it's been about 4 weeks now. Some sellers are great and some just don't give a ship.

title: It's good and bad
review: It's bad because when you sell an item. They take a selling fee and then all of the sudden they take a random withdrawal from your account. It's random each time you sell something. It's good because it's different items are in here Unique. I hate the fact that I sold an item on here and I got my own label and now it won't let me leave feedback because it shows I never made a label. Which is annoying because I have buyers wanting to leave feedback and it won't let  them because of that. Please fix this so they can leave feedback if you don't use the recommended usps shipping label.
developerResponse: {'id': 1012526, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the review and feedback. We\'re sorry to hear you haven\'t had a great experience using the app. We charge a 10% selling fee when an item sells and this is taken from the PayPal account you connect to Depop. If you are selecting the USPS shipping option when listing, this will automatically generate a shipping label for you to use when the item sells. There is a charge for this service, dependent on which option you choose (e.g. small parcel, medium parcel, etc.) that is taken from your PayPal account too, along with the Depop fee . If you don\'t intend on using the USPS shipping label then you need to edit your listings to the "Arrange my own shipping" method, as otherwise you will continue to be charged for the service. We are working on a fix so that users can leave each other feedback when the USPS shipping label isn\'t used, however in the meantime I definitely recommend editing your listings if you don\'t wish to use the USPS shipping labels. Please contact support@depop if you require a refund for any USPS shipping labels you haven\'t used. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-14T17:28:51Z'}

title: Awesome App!
review: I personally have had nothing but amazing experiences with this app! I have both bought and sold on this app and it's great! The only thing that is annoying is all the fee's because you have the Depop fees and then the PayPal fees on top of that. So it makes it more difficult for me to price low, because you have to take all the fees into consideration. Other than that nothing but good things to say about this app. I have suggested it to many people!

title: clean and easy to use
review: I really love this....very clean, very easy to use, simple but effective selling app. Its true there are a lot of teens swapping stuff but there are plenty of good sellers as well. Its just in its "new" phase. They really focus on pictures and thats really the hardest thing to teach a new seller, but it would be better if we could add more than 4 - JS. Overall very well laid out, I plan to stick with this one and watch the community grow, its got a ton of potential, DEFINITELY WORTH A DOWNLOAD

title: good app
review: I like this app but there's some things I would change.. For one the 10% commission is kind of annoying.. I'm not saying they shouldn't charge you fees for anything but that on top of the fees PayPal charges you for selling things kind of adds up.. if it was less I would be happy.. considering how many things are sold I'm sure they can afford to lower it.. Also there seems to be quite a few inactive sellers that don't reply when you try to contact them or buy their stuff.. it's a pretty good app but there's still things that can be improved

title: nothing but positive things to say!
review: I've ordered from two different users so far, and interacted with four, each one providing useful, honest information. The items I ordered were shipped right away and I love them very much. I feel that if you didn't look into in a account's reviews, or bought without thinking, your experience could go poorly. Overall, some of the deals are amazing, and the people are great!💖

title: Depop saved my life
review: After being unfairly kicked off eBay I was pretty much dead. Depop was recommended and reluctantly I tried it. One year later its my main source of income and has turned selling shirts into a lifestyle. I could care less what the app looks like. There have been some technical snafoos but every great app has had to learn from their mistakes (looking at you apple and your U2 album fiasco) so don't be so quick to demand a beheading yo. Seriously tho depop is tight!

title: The best!!
review: Literally my favorite app! It's full of creative people expressing themselves through their profiles and the types of items they sell. I find so much cool stuff I've never seen before and get great deals on stuff I really want! I even sell more on Depop than most other apps I've used. The people are great and I get my money immediately through PayPal instead of waiting for the app to release and transfer my funds or take crazy fees out :/. I love Depop!!

title: Good but could be better
review: I love how it's a combo of ebay and Instagram. It's so convenient! However, I wish it'd only show items in the explore area that were still for sale. Also I wish they'd allow you to turn on notifications when certain people you follow post something up to sell. That way you have a better chance of buying that seller's items before it's sold to someone else. Overall though, it's a good app. I've never had any glitches with it or crashes

title: They take a chunk out of sales
review: "The seller of any Sale Item will pay us a commission equal to 10% per cent of the purchase price received by the seller in respect of any such sale concluded by an In-App Transaction (the "Commission"). In addition, PayPal will also charge a fee separately plus a transaction fee." If ppl are selling used clothes/items we would have to increase the price to basically retail to get anything enough to cover the shipping supplies, transportation, and such so meh i dont like it already. Only plus to this is that its basically what im already doing on ig iba_btq & iba_btqm so id say its only worth it if you're selling high end items for $20 and up

title: I thought it was going to be a scam
review: I thought it was going to be one of those apps that has tons of pop up adds and makes you pay for a subscription but it's a really great app. So many people have so many different things they are selling and everyone is nice and responds back to your messages in reasonable timing. Almost everything is at least half of what you would pay at the retail store!!!!

title: Great resource, hard on the eyes
review: I really love the easy access this app provides to cool, vintage items and used items from new brands! It can be straight up addicting. I definitely hate the new design - the original design was cool because it was like IG with the option to buy what you saw in the posts. Now it looks like it's trying too hard instead of being simple, clean, and intuitive. I miss the activity feed of people I'm following too. Otherwise it's a very easy way to find cool stuff.

title: Overall Good
review: I find it to be a bummer that depop takes out 10% of each transaction instead of 5% or a steady 20 cents for each listing as I have seen on other apps. Might not seem like much but for bigger sales it can really add up and take away from the amount you actually get after shipping and cost of the item. There have also recently been a lot of scam messages and robots that haven't been taken care of. Besides that it's one of the better apps out there that I have tried and I like the simplicity of the Instagram layout.

title: Not great, be cautious
review: I used the app for about a year, and had no issues.  I both bought and sold items.  There were some scam accounts, but keeping a good eye out helped this problem.   About a month ago, I sold two items and never received the payment.  The money was taken out of the sellers' accounts and sent to another email address that is not mine.  Depop told me that I changed the email, which I never did, and is telling me to contact PayPal.  I have, several times, and the Depop transaction never went through.  I'm frustrated that I wasn't protected as a seller and that my account security wasn't protected.  I would recommend not using this app.

title: Depop obsessed
review: I love Depop. They promote genuinely unique items which is 100% why I shop here. The vintage you can find is OUT OF THIS WORLD. It's nice to find rare items and know your money is going to real people! Also VERY easy to navigate and sell on. I've shopped and tried selling on other apps and I can't get over how terrible their layouts are. The people here are crazy nice, too! Wonderful community. Highly recommend selling and buying on this one! 💗💗💗

title: BLESSING TO US ALL
review: This is the best app to ever come into my life, blessed my friend introduced me to it... what a great human being. In all seriousness you can really get great deals on vintage finds and make easy money selling stuff you don't wear anymore. The saying, "one mans trash is another mans treasure" comes to life. Why shop at the mall anymore when I can get a unique aesthetically pleasing wardrobe sent to my door step for an affordable price! If I could give this app 10 stars, I would!

title: super cute app
review: I love this app, it's easy to buy and sell things and it's fair priced. I only have one suggestion, I keep things on instant buy, and it's really annoying to have to go through all of my items and turn off instant buy when I'm going on vacation or something where I can't ship anything out. If there was a button that could turn everything off instant buy that would be awesome!!

title: Very Helpful
review: i'm 15 and have an eye for what's trendy. i've shopped in thrift stores my whole life, and have built up quite a wardrobe, but i realized it was time to let go some things and depop came through just when i needed it! helped me make some cash and space in my closet. i've recommended this app to all my friends and will continue to do so. this beats ebay and etsy in my opinion because it is straightforward and more on trend.

title: Ebay meets Instagram!
review: Honestly I was very skeptical about this app as I felt that people would just sell overpriced junk I could thrift locally but boy, was i wrong! I have purchased so many cool items in my quest to build my dream wardrobe. Buying is super easy and it's not hard to communicate with sellers, many of whom are open to negotiations on prices. I have already recommended this app to my friends and family. What are you waiting for? Download it!

title: No seller protection
review: As a buyer and a seller of DEPOP I am highly disappointed in PayPal and the DEPOP app I would not recommend using either apps or website  I sold an item through DEPOP thinking I was selling and buying on a secure app well that's not the case be careful guys you can get your money stolen and items stolen through the internet I can't believe it's possible but it is Thanks DEPOP & PayPal for the giant fee of $200 and getting my iPad stolen! So much for doing everything through the app and being safe there is no seller protection!! I don't understand how you guys expect me to pay $200 when the buyer still has my iPad if you guys give me my item back I will gladly pay $200!!

title: I love Depop!
review: I absolutely love Depop. It's fun, it's easy, it keeps you busy when you're bored and it's a great way to make a little extra money. The only two things I ever have trouble with are 1.) not always being able to see or send messages 1.) not being able to log in sometimes when it logs me out due to some error. Other than that, Depop is great. I've bought some really cute things from great sellers, and I've made a couple hundred off this app. I'd recommend it to anyone (:

title: Horrible update
review: Like everyone is saying, the new design is horrible it looks like a 6 year old did it. I love the app itself and the community but it looks so bad. Also I dont like how you cant scroll through a sellers profile like poshmark on on an instagram page. It makes it hard to shop. Also can only upload 4 photos, where 6-8 should be the minimum, and you can only do it one at a time

title: It's great (kinda).
review: It has great stuff on this app. I love buying things off of this app. I just wish, it wasn't a PayPal exclusive app. I also, wish that they'd take the scammers off the website. I've had one occasion where a person took money from me. I would like them to have proof of postage that someone can't take other's money. Also, I wish people didn't price gouge people. Other than that it's a great place to find products. These improvements are just my opinion.

title: Useful app
review: I've been selling on here and honestly, it's one of my favorite apps. The service is amazing and the people on are so nice which makes it even better. They're very understanding and respectful. I love the ease of this app as well. It's perfect because most people purchase through their phone nowadays so it just makes it even better. I hope this app gets big one day. It deserves more users. Glad to have joined early.

title: PEOPLE WILL SCAM AND DEPOP WONT HELP
review: I ordered and item about a month ago and after two weeks I never received my package. I thought this was suspicious so I even messaged the seller asking if there was any problems and when it was supposed to come. Two weeks later I got no reply and the seller is still going on on her page. I've reported a week ago and still NO PREPLY FROM DEPOP they even say in their description in reporting that there is a big chance you won't get your money back. AND PEOPLE THERE IS A BIG CHANCE YOU WILL GET SCAMMED BECAUSE THEY WONT DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT!! This is an app controlled by other people who don't care about you or your money. I would highly recommend more secure shops to buy from.

title: Good app but don't sell much anymore
review: This is a great app although I haven't sold anything in months I try to keep things affordable.  The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because you need to be careful who you buy or swap things from, there are scammers. I've been scammed and I know other people that have been too. And a lot of people sell "vintage" clothing that's wayyyy over priced like $25-$35 or more. Clothes that u could find at a thrift store for $3-$5...Other than that I love it!

title: You Can Do Better Depop
review: I love selling on this app, it's the best one I have sold on yet. But I'm irritated with how our reviews get cut off.. The whole point in someone writing a review is for others to read it and decide if they would want to buy from that seller based on reviews, but now we can't even read the long ones, can't even click on them. I'm very disappointed with the new update, you can do better Depop.

title: I like depop
review:
Depop is nice and I always buy things or find interesting things. 

The thing I don't like is the feedback glitch (or however you'd like to call it). I have given my feedback. I have reviewed it. Please, make the notification that I have not seen it go away. 

This distracts me from more important notifications like PM/DMs I need to reply to or read. It has been like this for almost a month for me. Before that, when I tried to leave feedback on some items, the app would crash and close out on me back to back, restarted and re downloaded. 

Depop, you can use some work in this aspect of the app. 

I was also reading tortiselle's review as well. I agree, the SOLD icon sticker needs to be shown on items that have BEEN SOLD so we can clean out our likes and saved items. 

Thank you for this platform. I do enjoy it. Please do what you can to fix this.

title: New Updates Eh
review:
Was very easy to use before the update, but having to click on shipping address Everytime trying to buy is annoying.
Please fix the bug for not being able to remove the notification with Sold/Purchase Bar.
It would be great if you would allow us to select more than one picture at a time for convenience. Even better if you add additional photos because 4 isn't enough sometime. 
Please make some type of way to verify users because the phishing spammers are very annoying and it seems like they are everywhere!

title: Strange design choices
review: The app is fine and easy to use but the new update is....really weird from a graphic design standpoint. The font and the new buttons and color scheme just seem really amateur, like a high school HTML project :| I just think the look of the update has taken the app in the wrong direction. You've somehow managed to make your app appear more cheap and less trustworthy. It hasn't really affected the function which is good but just...maybe try another style.

title: Horrible update!
review: I looooove Depop, but the new update is not as user friendly or fun to use as the older version. And now once you've liked an item your "likes" don't refresh unless you close out of the app and go back into it. This update is taking away from most of the things I really liked about the app in the first place. Step backwards indeed. Please bring the old version back😩😭
developerResponse: {'id': 1021542, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the feedback. With regards to the likes not updating we will take a look at this with the team and see what can be done to improve the experience. For now you can pull down on the grid beneath "Selling", "Likes" and "Saved items", and this should refresh the product grids. Hope this helps! If you have anymore feedback please feel free to contact us on productfeedback@depop.com. Thanks, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-15T16:30:16Z'}

title: Horrible Update
review: This new Depop Update is garbage. The design is terrible (red and black) with the fonts so blocky and huge. Besides that, there are so many bugs as well. Whenever I sell an item that's 100% taken care of (shipped out and left feedback, buyer gets item, leaves feedback) I STILL have that annoying notification that I am missing something. Restarted my phone twice and it didn't go away. A few days later I turned it off again and it finally went away. Also, there's so many scammers now that needs to be taken care of, it's really annoying.

title: No results, found success elsewhere.
review: I was so excited about this app but had little success. Barely anything was sold and most of my potential customers flaked out because they suddenly realized they had no money. The explore page is also subpar; it seems the content never updates. I moved on to Vinted and sold hundreds of dollars worth of clothes in a few weeks, significantly more than I made during months on Depop. That app also does a much better job of providing you with content and opening lines of communication between you and potential customers.

title: Great idea, but app is sooooo glitchy
review: Sellers are regularly super sweet and helpful. I've only had one issue so far and Depop customer help solved it quickly. And getting your money back if something goes wrong is easy because it's through paypal. However they keep making updates that causes so many issues with the messaging especially. Really annoying. Makes it hard to talk to buyers.

title: Scammers galore and depop does nothing!
review:
I had a few good experiences with sellers early on who gave me /sort of/ good deals but recently have gotten scammed twice and depop has done nothing to prevent this from happening. When multiple customers file a complaint against a user, Depop should do way more to ensure a safe community otherwise it is pointless to even use at all. I have filed many reports to them about a current user and have received no message back for weeks. I was going to sell here despite the high transaction fee but probably not. 

My advice? 
-Don't buy from anyone with no seller reviews or if their reviews are from other sketchy accounts (probably their own.) it's not fair to new sellers but depop does nothing to ensure buyer protection currently. 

-Never pay through PayPal friends and family, if a seller asks for this, report them. They are undeniably scamming you, even if you do end up getting your item. 

-only buy from people with over 50 SELLER reviews.

title: Customer service
review: I've been scammed 3x on this app now I know it's our duty to be careful who we buy from but when it comes to Depop customer service it's absolutely horrible. They do absolutely nothing to help you. They'll just tell you to contact PayPal & they'll have the account "removed" but that'll be it. That's the end. I mean I had encountered a seller who was using ANOTHER USERS ADDRESS, but Depop never emailed me back about it. I mean this girl is over here scamming girls left & right & wheres Depop when you need them? No where. I honestly like the app but don't expect any help from them cause their absolutely useless.

title: Love this app
review: If you are committed you can sell quite a bit. It is growing more in the US, not just uk anymore. Young girls are on here so you will get many questions where the answers are clearly listed on the listing and many likes, when you just want sales. Patience! Other than that common sense, it's fun! If someone asks you to see the item on, it's 90% chance they will not purchase the item. Again PATIENCE. 💖📦👌

title: Super cool
review: I love it more than pretty much every other re-sale type app. The only reason it wouldnt be 5 stars is because there isnt much on there that i would actually buy. Theres a lot of just pretty awful things that i would never buy, and some of the prices are bad, but i guess thats what makes it unique and different because theres all kinds of things on there.

title: Love this app (but)
review: Super great app 10/10 recommend for finding amazing clothes and accessories!!!! however the new layout isn't as visually appealing as the old one but this doesn't make anything harder to use. Also on my "purchases" it says I have an extra notification when in reality there is nothing there and it's been there for a little while but that doesn't really matter it's just a tad annoying. Other than that I love this app

title: 99% Good Experiences
review:
Honestly, I wish I never found this app due to finding so many great things! (My card says no more...) So now it's strictly for swapping/selling/buying Amiibo cards, to which I've had great experiences with.

One bad experience was when I purchased a t-shirt without messaging the girl first (despite her having instant payment on), and ending up never getting it. We stayed in contact as I tried to see what was going on, but eventually she just stopped replying.

In the end, Paypal got my money refunded and Depop closed her account. (It took weeks, but eventually everything worked out for me.)

Just, be careful and communicate the best you can. Always message them before buying so you know for sure they're active.

title: Great App!
review: I was looking for a way to buy/sell items online and this app provides a very simple and straightforward way of doing so. I absolutely love it. It's very user friendly and provide helpful tips to get you started. It also allows you to interact with the buyers/sellers directly which is really helpful if you have any questions. Overall so far I love this app excited to really start using it!

title: Fun way to buy or sell!
review: I recently downloaded the app yesterday and so far I have had no problems using it. The setup reminds me of Instagram. I love the features such as being able to follow my favorite sellers or liking items if I am interested in them or need inspiration for my own merch! I have not sold anything yet but the process seems fair and simple. Would highly recommend!

Absolutely love this app ! I've sold and purchased here and the process is fairly easy and quick! The only thing I'd like as an update would be that we can not only upload new items and edit them on our phones but also on a computer. That would make things a little easier and I think it would be a great addition to this amazing app!

title: Some flaws, but otherwise great!
review: I haven't updated the app, and don't plan to based off of the reactions people have had to it, but my experience on the app has been really wonderful. I've bought various items that I absolutely love and the sellers are always kind. I don't care for the notification to leave feed back though. I find it extremely annoying if I'm being honest. In general though, I really do enjoy the app

Great app, one of the better selling apps out. The selection is curated to people who are interested in art, design, and culture. I've had a really great experience, after my first week I was contacted by depop (so unheard of from apps!). We met up and I learned how to maximize my photos so they'd get featured. Great company, makes me want to support them and have a cool shop to sell cool things (I sold 4 things in the first week!) Thanks guys!

title: dont update !!
review: depop is one of my favorite reselling apps bc it's always been quite easy to use, especially with the usps feature you can simply have your mailman pick it up from your door. However, I recently updated it to the newest version and now I cant even get in the app bc every time I open it it crashes!!! This update is horrendous according to other reviews and I can't even  use the app at all bc of it, so do yourself a favor and don't update it until they fix its many flaws.

title: The future of selling
review: Love this app, wish I started it earlier. And there is still so many people not on it yet. I'm a seller and love it. But there is some improvement needed to shoppers. The search engine could be a bit more specific, I feel like I am not seeing all there is available when I adjust the settings. BUT, I love how the community managers are always on the search to find awesome photos from sellers to put on their explore page.

title: Does what it set out to do
review: This app is an easy interface for selling mainly vintage and used clothes. I like that there's not unlimited options of things to list as, so it makes posting items really easy. I just wish there was more regulation with people hashtagging brands inaccurately. Sometimes I'll be in the market for vintage Chanel shoes, and there's a bunch of things obviously not the brand.

title: Meh
review:
My full time job is selling vintage clothes on Etsy. So, a Depop shop seemed natural to try. 
I have sold a handful of items on Depop while selling 80+ through Etsy in the same time. 
My impression of Depop clients: teenagers who can't afford anything. I am constantly being messaged and "offered" 20% of what my asking price is. Seriously. 
Depop's fees are triple what Etsy charges, and I don't think the client base is worth the trouble. 
I support myself entirely through Etsy, and thank god, because if I only used Depop I'd be making more begging on the street.

title: No maintenance.
review: I can honestly say that this app can be useful in many ways. But for the most part Depop is full of 90% scammers or teenagers that can't be reasonable nor mature. I wish the protection of buying, selling & trading can be higher by the staff of Depop. I suggest you dont download nor trade unless your 100% SURE. This is coming from a person that got scammed. I trusted a guy that had about 10 good reviews and we would communicate everyday and very well. Eventually after a short while i tried messaging him and it didnt deliver. I got on his page but it couldnt be found. I deleted the app and wont recommend or EVER use this app again.

title: texas, united states
review: Absolutely love the app! I love the fact that it looks something like Instagram. I have found great things there that are more affordable and I have created my depop boutique. It is a great outlet to find a new home to things you dont use anymore and at the same time make some extra money! I like the community I find it safe and friendly I hope it continues like that😜

title: Yaaasssss
review: I love love love depop!! It's perfect for the more "hipster" crowd. Your brand new BCBG top will be getting offers of $10, but those vintage 90s Skechers you saw at your local thrift for $6, will sell for $80. I've been making about $100 extra a week and half of what I post is from the 50¢ section of goodwill. If you have the time to take pictures and write a trendy caption, then you'll sell items easily.

title: perfection
review: great app to sell and purchase! you can find so many unique clothes and household items here. very easy to navigate and customize your shop. you can even make international purchases! I've seen reviews where people say there are lots of scammers, but to avoid that, just be nice and honest yourself and try to avoid purchasing from people who have low ratings. :^)

title: New addiction😍
review: I love this app so much. Best app to buy and sell on. Especially great for clothes. The only thing I don't like is that once you sell a product they keep about 10%. However, it gives you protection and coverage through the whole process. So I guess it's worth it! I've made a lot of money on my old stuff already. No other site used to work for me. Thanks Depop!❤️👌🏼

title: Wayyyy easier than storenvy, etsy, eBay, posh mark or tradesy!
review:
This app is basically like shopping on Instagram. It's really easy to use and navigate. There are a few things to be ironed out but with every update comes a solution!! This app has made me hundreds of dollars in two months just from me selling my old clothes and books. 
I will be using this app for a very long time!!!

title: Need to Educate buyers.
review: I absolutely love the concept of this app. It's quite easy to maneuver and it's even easier to sell on. However, the buyers on this site need to understand it COSTS to ship! I have had items priced at 4.99 with 2.99 shipping and been asked to do free shipping. I would make absolutely nothing if I did this. I have come to realize that the majority of the buyers are young and do not grasp the concept of shipping/depop fees. Also, most buyers are not familiar with PayPal. I do not like the "Concealed cash" method and Depop should eliminate this.

title: Good app but has bugs
review: It won't let me leave feedback on some items even though I've received them so I can't get rid of the stupid notification dot . This really should be fixed somehow bc sellers rely on feedback as well . I also don't receive push notifications anymore ? I've messed with the settings on the app and in my phone and still nothing . The app itself is a good concept and I've found some cool stuff on it but the bugs are really irritating .

title: A fun community to sell in
review:
I love Depop!! It's such a unique place filled with so many different people. It's fun selling things on here and has become quite addicting. Many people seem to complain about the customer service on here, but I contacted them recently and got a reply back with 24 hours, so I guess it just depends. I love using this app and haven't encountered any major problems yet, so I highly recommend it!

I do have some suggestions, however:
- Adding a way to repost / share items that have not sold
- An easier way to bundle items instead of doing it manually
- A place to advertise your shop
- Being able to see analytics such as how did people find my shop, where are they from, what item did they click on, etc.

title: Worst Resell App the App Store has to offer!
review: Beware! If someone goes wrong with your transaction (never received the item I purchased), depop will do absolutely nothing about it. I contacted them multiple times and they paste the same message every time!!!!! They tell you to contact PayPal which is a mess because you have to provide proof but PayPal will still refuse you a refund. A week later after accepting the fact that I lost out on $20, I get a notice that Depop charged me a service fee of $4.50 without my knowledge. F this app. Poshmark is the way to go! Their customer service know how to treat their customers right. Depop is a scam.

title: Depop is Rad
review:
I found out about it through a local blogger sale. Downloaded it and found tons of awesome stuff from clothes to accessories and music. So far I have made about 14 purchases, all of which I am very satisfied with the items and services of the seller. If you are looking for rad unique fashion/accessories/music/misc. this app is for you (guy or gal). ✌🏼️
Depop made my closet more rad. And helped me become a seller myself.

title: Amazing !
review: Great app easy to purchase things unlike poshmark where they want all your info just to make a purchase , Depop is so much better but I wish they would set every bodies reviews to being automatically on especially if they are selling things so that people can give them reviews so others know they aren't scam sellers ! Other than great app

title: Addictive
review: Great app and I love scrolling through it. The only thing I wish would change is for it to stop showing me the same clothing all the time. And in the same order too. Not interested in seeing the same shirt for a whole week. Wish the app lets you refresh and find new sellers and clothes more easily. Even if I search for a certain product, the same clothing order always comes up.

title: Limited Clientele
review: If you don't have Unif, BM, band merch, AA, etc., this probably isn't the place for you. Primarily teens interested in stuff of that nature. Very few have cash to buy & end up swapping which doesn't always end well. People try to make everyone pay through Friends & Family, which is against policy, or charge invoice fees, which are both against PayPal policy. So that's a thing. It's not a bad app, it just needs to grow. (@_brooke if you get it! 😉)

title: Cool, but I'd like to be able to use it
review:
This app seems to be a really great idea, but at least for me it's super buggy? I'm constantly getting errors even after restarting my phone and reopening the app. I get an error message ("oops! something went wrong.") when I try to update my bio, when I'm entering my address to calculate shipping, and when I'm trying to view my profile. 

The app itself is easy to navigate and it looks great, I'd just like to be able to actually use it.

title: Love depop!
review: I've had a great experience selling (and occasionally buying) on depop! It's the perfect way to recycle things you don't use/wear as much anymore, things that you got that don't work for you, or just cool finds that you won't use but someone else might. Everyone I've interacted with has been very sweet and I've had very few problems at all. Highly recommend!

title: Loving Depop!!
review: This is the best app to buy & sell fashion. I love the simplicity of it and how the buyer and seller can communicate. This app has also really encouraged users to have well updated photos with the clothes tried on which is different from any other app, I am loving Depop!!! Made my first sale on my first day! The only complaint is I wish they had prepaid shipping labels!! But I know they will evolve!

title: AMAZING
review: Depop is basically Instagram but there's a price tag to each post. I like the idea and it more simpler to use than other selling/buying apps. I never bought anything off depop but I think u should watch out for scammers (check the reviews!) but scamming isn't neccesarily depops fault I guess. If u like a brand that pretty expensive, depop probably has stuff from that brand UNDER $15!  But yeah, lol.

title: Best app for vintage clothes!!
review: Huge selection of reasonably priced vintage and new stuff! I've had great luck both selling and buying on this app. Love it!! The customer service is also outstanding. The only negative thing about the app is there are a lot of spam accounts that send you fake messages but when you report the accounts, Depop always sends a personal apology.

title: Minor issues
review: I love this app so much. It's like a thrift store at the tip of your fingers! I've only seen a small amount of scammers and they are rapidly taken care of. The only thing I have a problem with is that I wish the explore page was refined because I've seen numerous items that I love but are only available to uk buyers or the items are already sold. I think this app is amazing though. One of the best shopping apps I've seen

title: Depops better than any other selling site
review: I've had poshmark, vinted, EBAY, mercari... And I must say, DEPOP is the best app to sell from BY FAR! They don't give you a hard time at all. They're flexible and allow the most for your dollar both ways as a seller and buyer. Can't wait for depop to start growing out to more people, i’m always advertising about how amazing it has been for me. Love it! 100 stars!

title: Pretty dope
review: I've been using it to buy stuff for a couple of months now I pretty much stick to just buying from people that have really good ratings and I haven't run into any problems at all the stuff I've purchased from the sellers I've chosen all came as advertised and quick so overall it's a pretty great app so far it's definitely worth a try

title: Unpleasing Update
review: I love depop, and have had a great experience using it for about a year! While I like the general layout of the update (notifications and receipts being moved to your profile, etc) the design itself is clunky. The font is strange, the blocky "buy" button is off putting, the whole aesthetic is just really heavy and distracting. Depop should focus on the items being sold, but the new aesthetic overpowers the listings. I hope that in the next update they lighten things up.

title: Only issues I have is with checking out
review: The app is great, very useful to buy cool used items for low prices. Some improvements I'd like to see is being able to send pictures between buyer and sellers, also fixing whatever issue that makes checking out remain on a loading sign forever.

title: It's good, but...
review:
I love the app, but sometimes when I'm browsing I feel like I see more UK sellers. I am from Puerto Rico and sometimes when I see a UK seller they don't ship internationally or only sell for the UK region and It's really rare to see a United State seller. I would like you add a option from what region specifically. Like there is "Near Me" "Worldwide" so maybe add something like "United Kingdom" or "United State". 

Again, Love the app, but this could probably make things easier for us shoppers and for the seller to have more clients.

title: Needs a few things.
review: I love the app. I'm on it everyday, and I've made several sales as well as bought some things of my own. However, it'd be awesome if you guys made it possible to send pictures through private messaging. Also, more than 4 pictures on a post please!! And a video feature would be great too in order to show how a product works. Other than that, the app is lovely.

title: Worst shopping site ever
review: I was scammed by a seller who never mailed my order and did not even initiate a refund. I had to file a claim with PayPal to get my money back & it's been 2 months and PayPal has yet to refund my money to me. Despite many emails to their customer service, Depop never did anything to help me. To top it all off, this said seller retaliated against me by giving me a negative feedback filled with lies after I gave her a negative feedback. Again, Depop didn't do anything to protect me as a buyer. Been an online shopper for years on eBay and Poshmark and have never been treated like this. Worst shopping site ever!

title: Love this app!
review: I buy and sell items via Depop and love the Social Media-like format which allows easy exploring and encourages both buyers and sellers to spend more time liking items in order to further their experiences on the app. I also love that it is efficient enough to have attracted some quality vintage sellers. I don't often spend too much time on phone applications, but I'm kind of addicted to this one. 💌

title: Still having problems with PayPal
review:
This app is usually decent, save for a few bugs here and there, but for the past 24 hours I haven't been able to make any PayPal purchases. I updated to the new version that claims to fix this particular problem but I'm still getting error messages.

A seller was nice enough to hold something for me but now I've been unable to pay them for a day. Luckily they're understanding but very it's frustrating to be unable to pay on an app that's purposely made for shopping.

title: This is good. Have one suggestion.
review: This is a really great app. I think it feels more safe and sound than eBay. However, I think you guys should put in an option to see the items you've liked so that you can go back and find them. Perhaps there is one and I just can't find it but if that's the case, make it easier to find lol. Either way, I refuse to go back to eBay because of this app.

title: Complete Rip Off App!
review: I regret the day i downloaded this app. It is not like posh or even mercari. This app doesnt require the sellers to provide tracking numbers so basically if you buy something& the seller doesnt contact you with it, your are fkd. You stay waiting wondering where your stuff is at? You gotta keep messaging them and hope they get back to you. I have to file 3! Yes THREE claims with paypal the first 2 weeks using this because they sellers wouldnt update me and one even sent my stuff in a plain white envelope being cheap and my stuff got stolen in the mail ripped open! Never again!

title: App is great but crashes
review: This app is a new and refreshing online shopping experience. However, nearly every 15 minutes on the app and it crashes. I don't have to log back in, but it takes a moment to reload and I lose my place and search history. It doesn't prevent me from using the app, but it does get frustrating. Would be 5 stars if it didn't crash.

title: New Update is Horrible
review: New red color and logo are ugly, new update is trying too hard to be alternative/hipster. Dont make every button "pop," its like bolding everything on a Word doc - impossible to read. Make it so you can search multiple categories at a time and also by size (multiple sizes at that) without choosing a category. The "Buy" button looks demented now and everything is out of whack. Nobody would be angry if you changed it back

title: Feedback notifications aren't clearing
review: Love the app & I don't usually have issues with it, but with these recent 2 versions I have been unable to clear my feedback notifications. As opposed to before, where when someone leaves feedback you can read it & clear the notification, the feedback option (typically accessed by tapping on 'x user left you feedback') is not showing up, so there is no way to clear the notification.

title: Really cool app!
review:
To me, this app is basically another ThredUp. Pretty easy to navigate and you can find some really cool items on here. Sellers are all really nice and respond super quickly. So far, I've made one purchase which arrived in a week or so.

However, I got a debit fraud a day after I made that purchase. I didn't do anything out of the ordinary other than buying over this app. So now I'm a little hesitant to make another purchase...hope they will up their security.

title: new update
review: The new update is so ugly. I actually deleted the app for a while because it's so hard to look at. The update was really unnecessary and I wish they'd listen to the negative feedback about it. Also- ever since the new update, my depop app always has a red notification dot on the app but there's no notification and it really bothers me.

title: Great! But there's one downside...
review:
I love Depop, the people on the app are all very friendly (for the most part).
The one downside is that you HAVE to have a PayPal. I get the reason behind having a PayPal is so that it's more secure, but when you don't have a PayPal or your PayPal gets hacked, then you can't buy or sell at all :\
Besides the PayPal only deal, the Depop is a really great app. I do really wish that Depop will find some other way of payment.

title: Kinda annoying to sell items on here
review: I like this app but i strongly suggest they get a "my wallet" to put our money in then just transfer it that way to our banks, instead of using PayPal. PayPal is super annoying and to confusing to use. I also think they should include shipping and include a shipping label. It also makes it difficult to sell stuff on this app without shipping included and a shipping label. This is why I like Vinted WAY better! It makes it so much easier!!

title: New update
review: It's unfortunate because this used to be a pretty decent app. Now it is almost impossible to navigate and there is no flow to the design whatsoever. Everything looks zoomed in and it gives me a headache. What's worse is that they got rid of the activity page so you can't see what people buy and like (which was a really great way to see new items other than the crap on the explore page which is always the same stuff). With this update it makes me as a user feel secluded from the rest of depop. I don't even want to use this app anymore.

title: An awful update
review: It hurts my eyes so I can't leisurely use the app anymore. This update is no way an improvement. I also missed the icon of the app "hello we are open" it was nice. anyways, it's not a bad "app" just the design is. Advice: Nice to use to make an extra few bucks but don't expect to be bringing in hundreds right away. It just all depends. Some can sale well because of how their pics are taken, others sell well due to how cheap they charge, or one simply has items that people want. To conclude, a bad bad update. I like the old interface, easy on the eyes and simple.

title: Customer service needs work
review: I've had several issues on Depop since I started using it a year ago. Whenever I've contacted Depop Support for assistance, they've taken forever to respond, if they respond at all. Usually it takes several tries over 1-2 weeks to get an unhelpful response that doesn't address my question. They are very quick to lay blame on the user and often don't seem to understand the issue. I don't know if they're understaffed or if they just don't care about their users.

title: everything! <3
review: love this app so much! imo it's the best selling app out there because it's so easy and you can really connect w/ customers and sellers! format is like Instagram and really fun. the most unique items you won't find anywhere else! if you haven't downloaded this app yet... what are you doing because you're missing out on so much!

title: Buyer/Seller Friendly App
review: I've been using Depop for about a year and I have no complaints. It's easy to use and I have successfully bought and sold items plenty of times. The support team works super quickly when they receive a report and always solves whatever issues I encounter. I highly recommend this app.

title: Ummmm
review: Probably will be deleting this app soon. I made one sale and the process of how Depop gives you the money is very confusing and they don't do much mediation within a sale. So after I made a sale, Depop takes their commission before your payment from the buyer even makes its way to you. And they won't refund you their portion even if the buyer didn't end up paying you. It'd be better if the payment process was better and more secure. Also through the DM's you can easily get harassed by randos.

title: Best Selling/Buying App
review: I've been using depop over 2 years and I love it more than Ebay, Grailed or any other Selling/Buying Platform. The layout is very easy & clean. I suggest anybody who wants to sell clothing to try Depop. Also you find amazing items on there. Depop doesn't have much spam or Glitches & its very easy to communicate. Overall Depop is 10 out of 10 🙏

title: Game Changer
review: It's almost like the Instagram for buyers and sellers. Great way to get rid of old clothes you have laying around. You make your own prices. I'd recommend this to people that need a little extra cash on the side. The only downside is that they take 10% of your profits. Purchases can even go through paypal to avoid credit card fraud.

title: Addicting
review: Super addicting app. Made like, 20 sales my first week and now I've started buying. I will say you should NOT do transactions outside of the app because there are a lot of "scammers". By using PayPal business transaction you at saving your booty if that happens. Also the reason I won't swap. There are a lot of teens and although their cheapness can be frustrating, I've still found the app to be a goldmine.

title: Love
review: This is a great app! Attracts people who have a strong sense of style! As a seller I would like to be able to see other options besides PayPal, like taking debit and credit cards to purchase. I wish the selling fees would also be explained more clearly. And when I like/save an item, I'd like a notification if the price drops the way Poshmark does.

title: Great.
review: Cool items and the sellers are usually really nice. It's easy to avoid scams- just make sure the person has good reviews and has had recent activity. I'm having some problems with the app itself. When I search for products it won't load all the way. I don't know why. But overall it's a great app to buy and sell safely.

title: Little Opportunity for Unknown Sellers
review: I've had this app for a few months and I've only sold one item. Of course, at the exact time that I sold this item, the PayPal system was down on the app so we had to do a transaction without using depop, thus; no positive review for me. I hand make all the items I sell and I'm struggling to get followers or even sell. They give you tips on how to sell, all of which I've done and I've had no success. I may delete it and find an app that does more to support and promote their sellers.

title: Fabulous!
review:
It's a great way to buy some
Cute items of clothing and other items. I have bought at least 10 things from this app and everyone has been so nice and I get my items as shown in the photo. I have sold many different products now and have made a decent amount of spending money.

title: 4/5 customer service could be better
review: 4/5 everything within the app is perfect other than customer service. I bought something within the app and the buyer never shipped yet they couldn't do anything about it even though they say it's safer to buy through depop. Super disappointed when that happened but still better and more fun than posh, mercari and vinted

title: IM ADDICTED
review: I've tried so many selling and buying apps like postmark and what not but Depop is so much different an so much better. It's not at all sketchy like some of the other apps are. All the sellers and buyers are super friendly. It's very efficient and secure. Also it's PERFECT for a vintage fanatic like myself!! it's amazing and I check it as much as I would any other social media. Amazing!

title: Cool but limited
review:
This app is very nice, would love to use it but it's too limited because there are no search filters available. 
The fact that you can't even search by your own country is unacceptable. I don't want to deal with the hassle of international shipping. 
You can't search by price either, which is probably even worse. 
Photos are quality and overall products are quality as well. Will update this review when these changes are implemented, as for now, it's useless..

title: Great app
review: My experience with the app has been great. All my products I have purchased have come as said, but that is because I am careful. As long as you are too your experience should be good. Only buy if they have great reviews and I personally message the seller before purchasing to make sure they are still active

title: Nice App
review: It's a nice app for shopping and selling items. Works like a charm. Although I would recommend adding an option that lets the buyer know that their item has been shipped. I waited a week for my item, thinking it was already shipped because the buyer said they would ship the next day, & it turned out that they hadn't shipped yet.

title: AMAZING
So cool.
