If you could send us further details, including your Depop username, to productfeedback@depop.com we will will take a look into this for you. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-08-30T10:19:43Z'}

title: I love Depop!
review: I have a really unique style and I love to stand out. On Depop, I can find items no one else has and I can find the coolest vintage pieces to wear. I just love this app.

title: Awful update
review: I'm usually a very successful seller on Depop but since the update I have not sold a single thing and have had little to no likes or follows. The new setup is not user friendly at all and is causing buyers to turn away from Depop. I will be using my time to focus on an Etsy shop now because of the ignorance of the Depop staff.

title: Love this app
review: I found some really awesome vintage items and brand new gems through this app at really good prices. Soooo worth it!

title: Love
review: This app is great for a more vintage style. The prices are typically medium-high but the quality is always wonderful. It's easy to use and I've recommended it to many people!

title: LOVE
review: Depop is so amazing! It's so easy to upload pictures and get in contact with buyers. I recommend this app to literally everyone

title: Horrible customer service
review: They Removed my 3rd product ever on the app, even though the item I posted followed their guidelines to the letter. I emailed asking for why it was removed and still haven't received a response.   There are many other apps that do basically same thing, don't waist your time.

title: Love this app
review: This is my favorite app for a reason. It is so fun to sell on and just has a very pleasant atmosphere! You won't be let down.

title: Amazing but
review: I wish their was a way you can search your size without searching for an item

title: It's like opening a birthday present everyday!
review: Love love love this app. My daughter first told me about it. It's not for "just teens" or "just girls".  There is a wonderful surprise for anyone at any age.

title: My first time using it
review: My first experience was great! Found exactly what I was looking for and the price was right!

title: Love it!
review: Wish it was easier to search for products, but that's the fun part.

title: Not bad
review: If you can take a great picture than you can sell here.

title: New update less sales.
review: I was on a roll with the previous depop look. But since it changed to this ugly in your face layout I've noticed Im getting less messages and sales. Change it. It was working fine before.

title: DO NOT BUY ON THIS SITE
review: i purchased an item from this app 2 weeks ago and have still not received a product or heard from anyone. after i payed for it, the sellers account disappeared. when i reported the problem nothing happened. i would've given this site 0 out of 5 stars if i could. DO NOT GET THIS APP!
developerResponse: {'id': 1039780, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review and feedback. Sorry to hear you've had a bad experience on depop. Providing you paid in the app you will be covered by Buyer Protection and will be able to get your money back. Please send us a message to support@depop.com and we will get back to you with more details on what to do next. Thanks, Team Depop", 'modified': '2017-08-17T15:45:06Z'}

title: It's a pretty good app!
review: It's a great app but sometimes it crashes otherwise it's just like any app where you can sell and buy things.

title: Needs improvement
review: ive made decent money off it, but 1. they take too much money away and 2. it doesn't let you post to twitter. very frustrating. besides that, i do enjoy it.

title: Amazing app
review: We love selling and buying on this app! It's probably the best app to buy and sell vintage items. Also, love there new update!

title: Love, BUT
review: Couple issues: can't get notifications that are from a month ago to go away which is super annoying. Secondly, the new update is ugly. Too drastic of a change, I don't like it.

title: I like it!
review: It's a pretty good app overall! I like the format the people, the items! I just love the whole entire feel. Good job depop!👍

title: Solid, yet slightly confusing
review: App itself is very functional and runs smoothly. Slightly confusing on how to secure a consistent buyer/seller relationship. More help perhaps?

title: Slow
review: The app is now taking longer to load things, and no it is not my connection. Everything is taking their time to lod and it has never happened to me before. Please fix

title: One Big Phishing Scheme
review: Every single person who reached out to try and buy an item was a phisher asking me to email them at a sketchy email address. Worse, Depop makes you go out of your way by sending an email to close your account. Total joke. Stick to eBay if you want to sell your stuff.

title: Check it out
review: Make money by posting

title: Amazing!!!!
review: I am in love with this app. I have recommended it to multiple people and will continue to do so in the future. 😊

title: I like it but
review: I think the concept is awesome. There's so much good stuff to find! But the community is weird.. A lot of the sellers are confusing. There's just so many trolls and toxicity. I don't know. I love the app, but I wish it was better regulated.

title: Decent App
review: So far the only problems I have with this app is its kinda annoying to pay w paypal, and there isn't a way to sort my likes or things I'm searching for in price order. :(

title: Fun-but beware...
review: I send 80% of my free time in the app! My first purchase was a pair of doc martens. Would (and have) recommend. Watch out for scammers though.

title: LOVE THIS APP
review: a flawless mesh between instagram & ebay, the app exposes your product to the right market. I've recommended downloading it to all my buddies.

title: Good with a few kinks
review: Great vendors,don't like how DEPOP cuts off scrolling on newsfeed at a certain point. Just let me scroll to my hearts content please... Which may be a couple of days

title: LOVE THIS APP💫💫💫
review: this app is so much fun for shopping and selling. its also super easy to use it looks like instagram lol. really recommend this app for everyone 🦋🦋🦋

title: Nice idea overall
review: I like the way the app works but i think it needs the feature to locate ads around you or eventually select an area range of your choice

title: The new design is the worst
review: I love this app to sell and I used it a lot but the new update is the worst thing I've ever seen. How did it get so ugly? Aesthetics are part of the reason why anyone uses anything anymore. Please work on the design or bring the old design back.

title: Great app
review: The app has been improved and still improving. In general, great app. Provide us good condition to sell and buy.

title: So much fun!!
review: This app is so much fun! So many treasures to find and a great way to sell previously loved clothing, music, books, art! Fun little community 👽✌️

title: Aight
review:
We should be allowed to follow as many people as we like. 
Also Depop claims they don't allow fake items but than on the explore page they'll constantly sponsor fake items.

title: A lot of room for improvement.
review: I can think of 18 ways to make this app better. However I enjoy the fun community and good vibes around it.

title: I love Depop
review: The best buy/sell app! I am more than satisfied, and would definitely recommend to friends

title: just one little thing 😊💕✨🎀
review:
hello! i have been loving this app for ages because it really is a great app, i just have to point out though that every time i review my feedback the app continues to tell me that i have to review it and it is somewhat annoying ): , but this really is a great app i have recommended it to so many people! 
have a good day 💕
-bambi

title: Best app ever
review: Useful and extremely user friendly. Selling has never been this easy.

title: Great and easy app!
review: I am able to sell all old clothing and accessories laying around the house. Extremely dependable app.

title: This app is amazing!
review: I love this app so much! It makes it easy to post, sell and ship items all from home! 😊

title: Fix dat
review: Cool update but too buggy. Please change the sold button colors back to green and yellow, it's super confusing with the update making it look like regular text. Also when I go to my likes, I can't press on any of them to view. Wth breh. Fix dat joint rn!!!!!

title: Awesome
review: Easy to use, great to both sell and buy. Also has a bunch of unique shops I haven't seen elsewhere.

title: I LOVE THIS APP
review: This is an amazing app that I am on for the most part of my day. It truly is awesome it has fantastic features. It is honestly a better eBay!

title: Love!
review:
Love! Best way to purchase and sell used goods! 

Please fix the notifications from reviews. Mine won't disappear..

title: Fun
review: Hip, fun, social app. Easy to navigate, great admin help. You do have to use common sense to avoid scammers, but I've recently seen the developers cracking down on it. Overall, one of my fave apps!

title: Hella lit🔥
review: I sell and buy. Never had a bad experience. The staff is always great, fix anything that might be happening. Great community. 👌🏼

title: Depop
review: I just found depop!  I sold my 1st item a few days ago. Looking forward to future sales.

title: Crashes and messages do not send on new update
review:
Someone needs to look into the new update, it keeps crashing on my 6 Plus and no messages can be sent privately always comes up with a "!" 

Bad for my business!

title: Depop
review: I absolutely loveeee this app. I can literally find all the vintage clothing items I need! To me it's kind of like an newer version of eBay 😂

title: Stars
review: Really great app. Ordinary people with ordinary prices, and you'll probably always find what you're looking for!

title: Love!
review: Haven't sold anything so far but my time as a browser/purchaser has been totally great

title: Good app!
review: I would give it 5 stars, but there is certainly more sellers than buyers so that makes it hard. Also, with the new update you can't see the full review some one gave you.

title: Depop is easy to use and to buy from
review: Very very easy to buy from and communicate with sellers and buyers! It's like Instagram and eBay combined!
I love this app , it is so easy to work with & the people are so nice . However, on the explore page , there's never any new stories . It was be great to see other shops 💕

title: Best app ever!!
review: This app is literally so addicting! I'm usually always on instagram, but now I'm always on here! So much fun finding cute clothes!

title: I like it
review: I like it a lot but I am trying to get things but they sell for too much

title: The version back in June was much better
review: I hated the new update, sales have gone low, and the font reminds me of the ones I used in the 5th grade with Microsoft word. Everything about the old Depop was so much better. Please change it back!

title: Great service
review: I prefer this app over eBay in almost every way, its clean and simple design.

title: Great app
review: Love this app found all my favorite clothes on here but it's up to you to find great items or trustworthy sellers

title: Love!
review: Depop is easy to manage and fun to use! Would recommend selling items on here!

title: Love it
review: Definitely a huge platform I can use to promote my business.

title: In app notifications
review: Sometimes the app glitches and won't get rid of the number of an item even if I've given it a review or read the review they leave me.

title: it's Lit !
review: everything i've bought so far is what is advertised

title: Easy Money
review: Depop is a fast & easy way to make money, haven't ran into any problems & ppl tend to be easy to please.

title: Great app
review: Super easy to use whether your buying or selling. Really nice community of people on the app. I highly recomend it to anyone.

title: Great App
review: I love selling items on here! It's a great way to make extra cash, clean out your closet, AND find stuff for yourself!

title: I will pay $5 to anybody who gets banned!
review: Since Depop gets butthurt over little things and is scared of users offending other users, I am offering $5 paypal , to anybody who insults/attacks/offends another user in the app. Depop may have blocked me from the app to try and protect their users, but I will try my best to still cause hatred in this "Depop community".

title: Depop is amazing
review: The app itself functions very well and the concept is great. It's really easy to sell through depop.
Really simple and easy and you can find some really nice things for a good price

title: Eh
review: Community is annoying as hell, to many people thinking they can get $100 items for like $5. Depop team doesn't know what they're doing and threatened to give my details to the police? They choose the wrong side in an open dispute when I sent the item and proof of postage. To many childish people on the app.

title: Can't view long Reviews
review: Please fix this Depop. I love you guys! But not being able to read the full review, even when you click on it, is frustrating.

title: Cool products, nice vibe
review: Really like this app so far, it's like looking at curated thrift pieces just for me .  Better vibe than eBay or other online resellers.

title: Love this app!
review: They do a lot of updates and it gets better everytime. I've been selling on here for almost 2 years and the Depop community is very interactive w its sellers. Love!

title: Why?!
review: Depop updated the app so now it just constantly crashes. Tried to use my laptop to purchase the items I was about to buy from a seller, but they don't let you pm (private message) while not on the app and you can only make purchases on the app. Fix this.
developerResponse: {'id': 969447, 'body': 'Hey, Thanks for your review! If you update to the latest version of the app the issue with crashing should be resolved. If you still have any issues let us know by sending a message to support@depop.com\n\nTeam Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-08T15:23:12Z'}

title: used to like it
review: It was fun to window-shop on and I bought a couple things and loved them but lately it crashes every time I try to open it. Tried restarting my phone and will try uninstalling/reinstalling the app but if that doesn't work I guess I'm done.

title: Awesome app!!
review: I find TOOOO many cute things on here and it's very trustworthy!!! Also, the items usually come in very fast!

title: Inspiration central
review: I'm always on here looking for inspiration and buying countless new items! Absolutely in love with this app 😩👍🏽

title: Download! Hurry!
review: Been trying to sell some stuff and depop literally saved my life.

title: SCAM
review:
This app is a scam– it's been three weeks and I still have not received the pay out via the app for the clothes that have been shipped.

Never use this app unless you want to be scammed. The reviews on this are all fake and paid. This needs to be shut down before it goes too far.

title: Great App
review: Very easy to use, navigate, and explore. If your looking for an online garage sale, this is the closets thing to it!

title: V cool!
review: Great app for cleaning out your closet or becoming a lil entrepreneur in a way! Even if you just want to buy, I've found some great deals on this app.

title: AWFUL
review: Stay away from this app the customer service is almost nonexistent and when you do get a reply it's passive aggressive. And absolutely useless I issued a return and they would not give me back the commission fee they said in the email they would and then through the PayPal claim they denied the return fraudulent app.

title: I luv depop
review: it is good and fun and easy to use my only comment is I wish I could send pictures over pm.

title: Awesome
review: After being a featured seller, my sales went up. Very easy to use. Love the Instagram-style layout.

title: Simple
review: Super easy to use and a lot of cute stuff. This is my first time selling stuff online so thats about how much my opinion is worth.

title: Love love love!!
review: I absolutely love Depop! It's so easy to sell stuff on and find such cute things to buy yourself! Definitely recommend :)

title: Can't do anything
review: I have tried to create a project over 8 times now. Everytime it either crashes or freezes, when I go back to the app it dosnt have a save project fiction so I have to start all over again. I havnt been able to finish one project, extremely frustrating.

title: Great marketplace!
review: It's my first time being active in this kind of community and its been a great experience so far! This app is awesome.

title: Love this app!
review: Great way to earn extra money, and simultaneously find pieces that perfectly suit your style!

title: Great app
review: Would be better if you could send pictures in private messages

title: Good!
review: The app is a bit glitchy, but overall it's easy to use and safer than paying a seller directly.

title: Really rad!
review: Depop has allowed me to not only sell my clothes but also to purchase safely from other people. Love this app!!

title: Ugly new UI
review: The new user interface is really ugly. Breaking up notifications, sold/purchased items, account settings, and messages from their previous locations makes the app less intuitive to use and more clunky. Depop continues to disappoint with every update.

title: Easy and fun !
review: This app is so easy to use ! Sell, buy , trade. I Haven't had any problems with the app so far.

title: Depop is literally my life lol
review: This app is soooo easy and it's helping me save money for a trip to NYC and also keeping me up-to-date on what's trending rn. I love it!!! ❤️😍😍
I've used many storefronts and this is by far my favorite, it's completely replaced Instagram for me lol

title: UPDATE IS GLITCHY
review: When you purchase a item it won't get rid of the notification even after the transaction is done. Also it says you left yourself feedback and it's also annoying having to enter/ click your address every time !

title: Strangeluna ⚔️
review: This app is so cool I just made an account and I already have purchased and received the stuff I like <3

title: Review
review: Wish we could zoom into photos!

title: Love for this app
review: I really encourage people that are fiends for vintage clothing and thrift or just anything clothing related to hop on now, there are some good deals and it's worth it.

title: Simple and smooth
review: Works well and easy to use

title: BETTER THAN CRAIGSLIST
review: Sold an item in less than 24 hours of making my account.

Every time I click on the app I'm following a bunch of people that I never followed myself... But when I click on "following" they're not even there... So I have to scroll down my feed and unfollow all these people. So annoying...

title: Good
review: Good app. But won't let me send my comments. I have to exit out of the screen until it allows me to tap send. It's pretty irritating. Please, FIX IT!

title: Better selection than other apps, also more expensive
review: They take 10%, which on top of PayPal fees really cuts into what you make, so be sure to price accordingly!

title: Messages
review: I love the app, but I'm in the process of trying to receive my package (2 months later 😒) so the seller and I are communicating, however I can't see her response. Messaging issues.

title: I love it
review: I love it because I can find all of the vintage clothes that I want and that makes me happy

title: Nice
review: It's a good app. They could fix some minor things but other than that I buy most of my clothes off here.

title: This App Is Annoying
review: i'm so incredibly annoyed by this app. i don't understand why it won't let me leave feedback on my buyers or update my shipping on the app. this needs to be fixed or i will never sell on here again

title: I love this app
review: Depop is amazing! I like it better than any buying/reselling app/website I've come across.

title: Super good so far
review: I've had a scammer or two, but it's mostly been a great experience, as a buyer and as a seller.

title: Amazing
review: I've had nothing but success both buying and selling. Love this app so much!

title: Having trouble seeing 'items' posting to Social Media
review: I'm having trouble seeing my items post to (Twitter), Instagram and Facebook..  Also, having trouble connecting my Twitter acct. Am I the only one? Pls hlp

title: eh.
review: the app is alright. the current version of the app, makes it run slow & it takes forever to search for things. the fee is high, so sadly you don't earn much from your sells. honestly prefer eBay than this app.

title: Awful Customer Service.
review: I bought an item for the first time. The seller never sent it and deleted their account, so they basically stole from me. I contacted Depop about this TWICE. Never heard back. I want a refund. I won't give more stars until I hear back from Depop. Terrible experience with this app.

title: Depop
review: Good experience with this application, the best one I have found so far , highly recommended!

title: Ehh
review: Great way to make extra cash, but the staff is foolish and don't know what to do when it comes to easily solvable disputes. As well as replying to emails promptly if at all! The app can also be a bit buggy at times and some people are plain rude on it.

title: Loving this eBay+Instagram combo feel
review: Amazing PayPal integration. I just wish it had more traffic and viewers. Hope this becomes as big as ebay, etsy, craigslists, etc.

title: Infinite scrolling
review: I wish that they had infinite scrolling when scrolling your feed... it's pretty annoying because I miss things that people I follow post

title: Not the best, costs lots to use
review: This site seems like a great way to sell your items but they forget to mention the Depop site user fee which is most of the time, more than what you sold the item for.

title: Best
review: Luv loads,, I've found so many gems on this app it's so great it's ruining my lyfe but that's cool beans 11/10 would app again

title: Ew
review:
The new interface is ugly and has too much red. The previous one was much more clean and to the point. Unneeded change = downgrade and a deleted app.

Wow. After all the negative feedback, depop still REFUSES to change the interface. Typical "I don't care" response to consumers who formerly loved the previous look. Disgusting.

title: Great Community Bad Dev
review: DePop has a great community of buyers and sellers and they take less of a percentage than their competitors. However, the app is painfully buggy and instead of fixing bugs or improving UI they have spent their time doing awful aesthetic updates.

title: Better than etsy and eBay !
review: This app is amazing ! Easy way but items great prices !

title: I love it
review:
This app has so many unique people and items and I love that
But scammers are a huge problem and support is not what it should be

title: REVIEW!!
review: Depop is a really awesome resale app! Very trustworthy with a large following. All it needs now is the ability to pay with ApplePay! That's the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Terrible app lets scammers get away scamming then ban you
review: A user on this app scammed me for over $1000 worth of clothing and then when I posted about it I got banned. Do not use depop it is run terrible and if you do use it never trust user "queertears" he is a scammer. Depop refuses to make any kind of resolution or contact me also. No stars terrible app.

title: Love this!
review: Love this app, but there is a bug where i cant read full reviews! Please fix

title: D
review: The only negative thing about the app is that there arena lot of scammers. Otherwise great to buy and sell I love it

title: Best selling app ever
review: I sell things quickly and find amazing things. Couldn't be happier!!

review: Used this app to sell clothes that didn't fit me anyone. Super easy.

title: Love it
review: Great way to share/buy/sell items in an easy way

review: I sell across multiple platforms, quite a few apps and though I love this app, I do not love Paypal. Escrow payout should definitely be added, would be a bonus! Thanks!

title: Overall a great app but you need a new app designer
review: The overall look & feel of the app just isn't there for me.

title: Refine???
review: It would be great it we could refine the products to already know if they sell to other countries,meet in person, etc. the overall layout is pretty cool very similar to instagram but it gets hard to navigate

title: AMAZINGLY AMAZING
review: This is one of my favorite buying/selling apps. It works perfectly and simply. I very much recommend it.

title: It would be better if there's a location search button of something related
review: The app is so great though

title: Depop Is The Worse!!
review: I sell on many sites, but Depop is the most ridiculous selling site that I've ever encountered. Customer service is BAD, lots of scammers are allowed on there, and you really don't sell that much. If you buy something, be prepared to not receive your item ! AND you receive no help from DEPOP.

title: How I love thee....
review: Not only do I get to sell my pre-owned or thrifted clothing, Depop pushes me to be creative in doing so! Such a fun way to make some extra money!

title: EBay for the millennials
review: Very easy to use!  Truly appreciate the eclectic assortment of items available via Depop!!!

title: Great app!
review: Super easy to use and there's always lots of cool things to find and buy! ☺️

title: Amazing app!
review: So amazing for selling and buying really unique clothing and accessories. So simple to operate and really useful. So glad i found it!

title: Great shopping platform
review: I love this app for the big and friendly market/community.

title: The Best !
review: You will love it if your really into fashion go and off your way even if not and get this app !

title: Title
review: This app is great for buying and selling clothes. Would recommend this to friends.

title: Really awesome idea and great execution
review:
This app is exactly what's advertised; Quick, safe, and convenient thrift shopping. I do just have one suggestion, when sellers are putting up items there should be categories for example if I'm selling shoes.

>clothing
   >shoes
      >vans

This makes it easier for customers to navigate items and find exactly what they want.

title: Great app!
review:
The variety of clothing/stores is amazing!
You are bound to find something that you will like!

title: JUST WOW!
review: Depop is the best selling app that's out there. Really easy to use and so many different things for sale.

title: Great app
review: Easy to use and very convenient for online purchases

title: Good job so far!!!
review: Starting out on online sales, seems to do well!!

title: Good
review: Everything has gone great so far just haven't sold anything. Buying has been great though

title: Ugh :-(
review: This update is just the worst. Not only is it super ugly, the app crashes constantly. I also have issues with giving feedback as others have mentioned. Updates are supposed to make things better, but depop just got worse.
developerResponse: {'id': 925524, 'body': 'Hey, thanks for the feedback. Really sorry for the inconvenience caused by the crash on app open. Thanks again, Team Depop', 'modified': '2017-08-02T15:30:05Z'}

title: New Update Makes App Crash
review: I tried to list an item for sale several times after the new update and each time the app would crash as soon as I try to write a description or add a photo. This wasn't an issue before the update.

title: Horrendous
review: NOBODY LIKES IT DEPOP. This new user interface is terrible! It looks like a group of angsty teenagers just launched a new selling app. Way too over the top, looks like a joke. Who in the world approved this? I highly suggest Depop redesigns this to make it more simplistic again. I hate looking at it, I hate using it. I wish I never updated.

title: terrible customer service
review:
a seller was suspended so now i dont get my item?? thats ridiculous. dont make the customer suffer. the seller emailed me saying they had already shipped and couldnt send me my tracking. what a lame thing to do. also 10% !? thats insane. 

also, they take days to reply and a lot of the customer service people are passive aggressive jerks- whats the deal with that? 

also no 24 customer service?? really??? you charge 10% and cant afford some night shift desk jockeys now ? or a us office ?? so unprofessional!!!

title: Love
review: Easy way to sell items I do not use or want anymore. Absolutely love this app🖤

title: User Friendly

title: Scammed

title: Video!!!!
review:
Depop is genuine already!!! 

We need VIDEO!!!! Would be the best invention yet, I have stuff that glitter and liquid that need to show movement to see the shine..

Thanks!

title: Great App & LGBT Friendly

title: Online shopping has a new personality

title: New update

title: Nope

title: Great community and service

title: Awesome apps

title: Great

review: I am a seller and typically enjoy my experience on Depop. It was intuitive and similar to Instagram in navigation... NOW IT IS HIDEOUS AND NOY INTUITIVE AT ALL. review:
Tried to use this app for the first time this weekend to sell items and there were so many scammers. I reported all of them and the next day depop suspended MY account!

title: Great!

title: AMAZING

title: 10% Kind of a rip off to sell

title: Still functional

title: Pretty Bad
review:
Depop takes 10% of every sale, which isn't great considering how much less other platforms take. They also take 10% of your shipping costs, which doesn't really

I like it but my customers aren't able to leave reviews
developerResponse: {'id': 819236, 'body': "Thanks for the feedback Arelis. Pleased to hear you're enjoying using Depop. title: Pretty good

title: Prefer it over every other selling platform
review: I've been selling vintage and unique clothing for years, but I've only recently started using Depop and I already prefer it over other sites that I have used and it is already more lucrative for me...both for selling and finding cool stuff to buy and connecting with other people with the same hobby. I think the people talking about how they never get sales fail to see that thousands of people use this app and if you post something a month ago it's going to get lost in the search results - you have to consistently update your shop/listings and stay active, which is what you should be doing if you're looking to get paid in any way, depop or not!! Or y'all have nothing unique to offer . My items have been selected for feature several times! I find on other sites it's overly cluttered and you get discouraged looking through but on this app it's clean and minimal and to the point, and it's also easy to keep up with other people's stuff because it's just like an Instagram feed and friends list. I like the simplicity but the only thing I would change is to be able to have the ability to change the order of which things appear in your shop ! That's the only reason I've rated 4/5 because I'm just hoping someone's looking at the reviews for feedback and considers it. Me and many other people have tons of stuff in our shop, it's like a little business and want it to be really organized and having to manually edit everything in a specific order is very time consuming and mad annoying. Other than that, keep up the great work y'all xo

title: Needs more than PayPal
review:
Depop is fantastic for putting items up for sale and meeting a widespread amount of people. However, if you don't connect your profile to PayPal, there is no way to buy instantly and users must message you first to coordinate it with you. It would be much better to have instant payment available for other cash apps like Square cash and Venmo. I've had several problems with PayPal while using depop and I am not even going to use PayPal at all after they finally get back to me about an issue I've been contacting them about for an entire month.
Depop would also be greatly improved if they made an option on a post that allows you to post measurements. A lot of us post measurements in the description but a lot of times customers don't really read it there and ask for it in a message. 
Another great improvement would be to allow for photos that are longer in length. Working within a square for a photo is very limiting, like when taking full-body pics for longer items. If they were able to be longer in length, it would help make the post more attractive and that's really all that sellers are trying to do with their posts. 
Lastly I just think depop needs to find a way to filter out comments from the shop owner and only show the ones from other users. This way, when new people look at the post they can see if their question was already asked and they can click "view more" or something on the comments to see the shop owner's responses. Right now it just looks hella cluttered especially if the item has a long description, and for me that's a big turn off and I don't want new people to be deterred just because of the clutter. 
Hope this could be helpful! Please feel free to email me or contact me on depop if you have questions or anything. Thank you!

title: I choose a different app
review: I sell quite a lot, mostly on eBay, but I've gravitated towards apps because their easier to list on and sometimes, easier to use. I don't mind the fees-I'm used to charging more anyway because of ebay fees and they're honestly not as bad as other apps. As far as scamming goes, there's really nothing that depop can do, and I find it naive of buyers to think that if they trade their items or pay outside of the app and using paypals "friends and family" option that they are protected in anyway by depop or that they think it's depops responsibility to prevent scammers taking advantage of this. That's just dumb. I do feel like depop needs A LOT of work. First, there are no filters or categories. In order for people to find your items, you have to use hashtag spamming and just wait for people to search for your specific item. There's no way to browse different brands or sizes or types of clothing/accessories. There also no way to go back to items that you've "liked," so either buy it now or good luck getting back to it later, with all the hashtag spams and lack of filters. What bothers me most as a seller is the fact that listings end up "dying" after a while. You have to relist the same things over and over in order to try and sell anything, which I'm not willing to do. Selling on depop is much like selling on instagram, it's a lot of work as a seller and completely unnecessary when there are so many other ways out there to sell. In addition to the filters, I also think a good idea would be to filter by country. I like that my market isn't limited to one country, but sometimes there's items I want that I'm not willing to pay international shipping for. It's also annoying as a seller to get requests for free international shipping for my already cheap items. All in all, I have plenty of items listed on this app and have only sold one, which is good enough for me to stay on the app-I might as well- but it's not keeping me active and if it wasn't for that one sale I probably would have deleted the app by now. I find myself turning down trades and lowballs more often than being productive.

title: Best selling app!
review:
I love Depop! It's easy and I have made good money selling items from my closet and home that I don't wear or use.

I was reading through the reviews and noticed a lot of people complaining about fees. Depop takes 10% of your sales, which is far below what Poshmark, Threadflip, etsy and eBay take. It's mind boggling that people are complaining about the amount of commission this app takes — they have employees and developers to pay who created this app for you to make extra money. 😑 if you're pricing and shipping efficiently, you're making far more than you could reselling your clothes to resale shops like Buffalo, Plato's, etc. 

I love that the layout is similar to Instagram. I wish, however, there was an option to push all 'sold' items to the bottom of my feed. Or maybe a way to automatically make a bundle for someone instead of needing to make a new listing!

The major complaint are the pre-teens and lowballers. I sell low, middle, and high priced items (all with free shipping), and it's inevitable that someone will complain about prices or want to take the transaction off of Depop or ask "Swap???". I just ignore these people. I sell a lot of vintage cameras and all these dumb kids ask "does it work?" ... Even though it's a camera that hasn't had film made for it in 30+ years. Kids, you have a world of information at your fingertips. Use it. 

Keep up the great work, Depop! Hopefully we can see new features to keep children off the app and organize our shops and sales. I love it thus far!

title: Worst Selling App
review: Depop offers no help to you as a seller or a buyer if something goes wrong. I was scammed out of nearly $100 due to a buyer opening a false chargeback claim after receiving the item she bought from me and giving me a 5 star rating and Depop would not even so much as remove the person from the app. Their customer service ignores any messages you send to them and only responds with automated replies that barely have anything to do with what you said in the first place. They remove your items for no reason if any random person reports it without investigating. I've had countless items removed for absolute BS reasons (using a stock photo when I was not using a stock photo, etc) and if I relist the item, I get a "warning" from Depop because again, they only offer automated emails. There is no contact phone number to talk to a person directly. They also will not investigate any report I make even when I provide them with details, screenshots, etc, and refuse to remove the one poor feedback somebody left me even though I provided them with more than enough proof to show that the person made up a story and slandered my name. Not to mention, I barely make any sales on the app. I had a few thousand followers and made maybe 1 sale a month. There are tons of "bots" on the app that comment and message you with fake spam email addresses asking you to email them about an item you're selling. The actual people that use the app are also pretty terrible. They overcharge for items they clearly bought at their local thrift store and act like you greatly offended them if you make a reasonable offer based on the brand, condition, etc of the item. The people are very catty and make "name and shame" posts about each other that never get taken down but my account was just removed for making a similar post about the person that actually did scam me.

title: (AVIOD) Better off with Poshmark or Mercari
review: This app seems okay at first but it's not. There's a lot of glitches, it won't open at times, slow to load... or nothing wants to load, the list goes on. Customer service are not helpful at all. They will leave the same generic messages to you if you have a problem. An item was sold, and I had to upgrade my shipping label because I realized that the item was going to be heavier... so, I ended up paying the shipping cost and refunded the buyer because it was my fault. Because I didn't use the their shipping label, I can not rate the buyer and the buyer can't rate me. I've sent proof that it was delivered and everything and all I got was, "we're aware of the issue and weren't trying to fix glitch" this has been over three weeks. Also, the guidelines say "no nudity" but of course if you look around there's half naked pictures of people showing their butts or breasts (most are not easy on the eyes). I don't need to be looking around to buy something and then encounter these types of pictures which are prohibited on their app but they never take it down. If you encounter a bad (or the item you got was damaged dishonest) seller, good luck, depop can't help you, ONLY PayPal can, so every action will be going towards PayPal. Even when you report it to depop, again, you will get a similar message like, "oh, no we're sorry you've experienced this and hopefully you will still like our community because we think it's great... unfortunately, we can't do anything and all refunds or issues will have to be reported to PayPal". This is pretty annoying and it can take forever for the issue to be solved. I prefer Poshmark, better quality customer service and it's more safe, as in, they will and can help you directly with any issues. Mercari, has gotten better their customer service. Both of these apps will get back to you in a timely matter and with "non-generic" messages and it's easier to sell and they make it fair to everyone who is selling. I noticed that depop is very selective in the "explore or new seller" section, it's more geared towards hipsters, vintage, and "their" type of style, that's sad and unfair. Because if you don't really fall into that category it's harder to sell, unless it's dirt cheap compared to a vintage $40 shirt. Depop should be open to everyone and ALL types of styles instead of being closed-minded and only pick "their" types. Lastly, I've been waiting for at least two weeks for someone to get back to me because I would like my account to be closed. It shouldn't take this long, they need to get their stuff together, and be more professional. Now I know why a lot of people don't like using depop and why there's bad reviews.

title: Used to love!
review:
My friend introduced me to this app about one month ago, and I immediately loved it! I would clear out my closet and get excited to list, or search through the activity page to see what my friends have liked and sold. Whenever I reported a scammer I would get a response within the day, where as other customer service from other apps has taken months to hear back from. 
Their choice of what was featured on the popular page was always fun to look through to discover new fairly priced smaller accounts, and was a great way to base what to sell off of what was chosen. I had been featured 3 times and each time it boosted my business! I had sold 12 items in the first week and was instantly hooked!

Ever since they've updated the app and given it a makeover, I've been extremely discouraged to sell or buy as my sales have dropped from 2 a day, to 2 a week if I'm lucky. 
The algorithm for the featured page seems to be more automated based than chosen by hand like it used to be because I've seen the same 4 accounts up there with 2-5 items on the feature page, side by side at that. I'm no longer encouraged to look at it as it seems to be biased towards certain accounts. 

Last night I was searching for other resell apps to use for financial support on the side since I no longer make the sales I used to, and I came across the reviews for depop. I read many detailed reviews about people feeling the same and giving less stars, but it seems as if they are no longer available to read??

I as well as other users just don't feel like the update has been in the best interest of sales. My shop has suffered from 160% less sales as there's just much less activity on it then prior to the update. 

I'm sure this update was a project someone has been working on for a while and was extremely excited to roll out, and all of the negative worded reviews were upsetting. But the beauty of being human is that you can try something out, and if it doesn't work you always have that option of going back. If you don't try you'll never see what the results could've been. 

I just hope depop reverts back to it's true and tried look and feel. It was perfect in its own simplistic way.

title: High Fees/ Scammers/ Bad Place to Sell/ Unreliable and many crashes and bugs!!
review:
The "Depop Team" takes two to three days to reply to you. One slight slip up in following all the terms of service and you get your account deleted and can't make one ever again and can never be part of the community again. Highly disappointed in the inability to have items featured on their explore (popular) page. They only choose to showcase items that'll make them the most money and are either from a new seller to get them excited about the app or a generic seller who already has a big shop. The 10% fee is ridiculous! Especially if you're using their shipping labels and your item is under and ounce, you're still paying WAY more than the actual shipping cost if you were to print a label through PayPal! Depop is cheating You of your money, trust, and time. I DO NOT EVER Recommend this app to anyone. NOT EVER. Even Poshmark with the higher selling fees is Way better than the whole of depop!!!! Thanks for reading and I hope I helped you in your decisions. I don't expect depop to make any improvements about my complaints as they would lose money on these changes. So I'll let them keep losing customers from their "community." Bye bye depop, or how about deadpoop....

FOR BUYING:
Buying is sketchy and there are a lot of scammers on the app. Even if they have 100 5 star reviews, they will still scam you-and depop will SUPPORT them! As long as they are making money, they make returns extremely challenging and aggravating for the buyers. They put money over their "community" all day everyday. Sellers never ship and depop never cares. Sellers make promises in their descriptions of items and none of them are NEVER accurate. The sellers don't care about you and your buying experience; they Only want your money!!! Depop, and their sellers, always always ALWAYS aren't there for you. HORRIBLE BUYING AND SELLING AND OVERALL APP EXPERIENCE. NEVER AGAIN WILL I USE THIS APP OR EVER REFER IT TO ANYONE ELSE. Ever. . . .

title: Depop is the worst selling app to ever exist
review: Most of the buyers are terrible at communicating, try to scam you out of money and get confused over the tiniest things. People have made me add together prices because they didn't know what $8 + $6 was. This is only the beginning of the issues. Shipping is expensive for the seller, at least $6.45 for a package. But most of the buyers expect free shipping even on items that only cost them literally $1. The representatives for Depop are terrible at communicating. I messaged them with my complaint and they responded saying they didn't have time to respond to my message, which was clearly a lie because they could have spent the time they took to send that message to actually read my complaint and respond. The complaint was only two sentences, it's not like I sent them a novel. In addition to this, PayPal is holding my funds for the items I have already shipped out. I am told I have to add tracking info to be able to accept the order, but nowhere on any page does it give me that option. PayPal has a fun feature where if the payment isn't accepted within 30 days the buyer is refunded. But I have already shipped the items so the buyer would end up with both their money and the items they wanted if that were to happen. PayPal and Depop never messaged me saying my account was suspended or put on hold for any reason, so that should not be the case. The first item I ever sold on Depop the girl bought without paying shipping and refused to pay shipping so I refunded her money. But Depop and PayPal kept their commission and only refunded her the part that was mine. Since this occurrence, PayPal hasn't let me refund anything or access any Depop payments. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE, IT IS A TOTAL SCAM AND WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY.

title: Just being honest.
review:
I've been selling on Depop for about 2 years now. There was a moment where I absolutely loved it. Other than minor technical difficulties, if you know what you're doing, it's a great and convenient app to sell on. The platform is super easy to use and it can help so much.
*update- NOT even the platform is good anymore. The new layout is not only ugly but inconvenient. Aside from that, there are many valid concerns
which I hope they no longer ignore.
Sellers are able to get what is called "Staff Picked" which enables your follows to go up dramatically, resulting in plenty of traffic and sales if you're working at it. 
But now, there couldn't possibly be enough new people joining the app for that to function. I think that to be fair, and to keep this app going strong, they need to come up with different ways to help new serious users make just as many sales(and followers) as anyone who joined when the app was booming would've. 
I also find it odd that they will leave either popular instagramers or famous people on the staff picks for months at a time(when they haven't made a sale in months) instead of giving a fair chance to people who are trying to establish a business and could potentially make Depop a lot of money. Another vital thing, as many have stated, is that it ought to have a method of age verification because there are a tremendous amount of under aged kids who steal their parents money to buy, or just flat out waste your time. 
I fear that the app will not function for too much longer due of the complete lack of customer service and total unprofessional decisions that the developer seems to be making. Ever since Edmo left, no one bothers to sustain or help a single user. It almost appears as if the developers don't care much since they're making 10% of every sale in fees. Maybe I'm wrong about that, but I just can't see where that money could be going by what I've observed about this company. 
Anyway, it would benefit the users, and the company as a whole if some foundational adjustments were made to keep this app appropriately fair and a great place to sell for anyone. Rather than being a popularity contest. It isn't IG.

title: App is buggy and inconvenient
review:
Depop is an ok selling platform but the app needs a lot of work. Here are some minor gripes that add up to a bad experience for me...
- When adding a listing you can only select one photo at a time, meaning you have to scroll back through your album each searching for each photo you want to add. This is slow and painful. Every other selling platform I use lets me select all my listing photos at once.
- Photos are square, which unless you took the photo specifically with depop in mind, means your photo will be cropped. There is currently no way to fit a non square picture to frame (without using a separate app) so chances are your photo will just look bad. The app offers really overdone filters, but no rotation.
- The listing categories are a mess, lacking, and confusing. Items have to be listed as either menswear or womenswear (no unisex) so you are cutting off half your customer base for those browsing by category.
- Some people (now i have this problem as well) have an issue where notifications of sold items never go away, uninstalling and wiping data doesn't help.
- Additionally customer service is extremely slow and sometimes nonresponsive. This isn't a problem  with the app, the company is probably just understaffed.

There are other issues as well which is a shame as if listing items wasn't such a chore on here i would add more of my inventory, but instead will continue mostly using other selling platforms, and list only things that I can't sell on other services on depop.

title: Great Clothes, But Know The Risks.
review:
I love the clothes on DePop. I really wish I could love this app and give it 5 stars, because I love what it stands for, the interface, and the people on it. 

However, I'm giving it one star because I found DePop to be unreliable in a way that puts my money, clothes, and rapport with other users on the line with almost no communication from customer support. 

After about 2 weeks on the app, my account got shut down with no warning, email, or notification. Suddenly, I couldn't contact anyone about purchases and sales. I couldn't know if I would receive items I bought, or if buyers would retract their payments after they saw me disappearing once making a sale. 

I emailed customer service right away and got no response. I sent another email with no response. After going on a limb and Facebook messaging DePop, I finally got someone who responded - they were going to reactivate me. Apparently, there had been a "glitch" that shut down my account. 

I can't trust an app that could glitch and put my purchases, sales, money, and items in limbo. Nor can I be confident in a company that does not respond to emails asking why I was suspended. I received a quick email response when asking advice on how to answer a scammer, but when I needed a time sensitive response about my account disappearing, I got nothing. I'm lucky I decided to try Facebook, or I wouldn't be able to finish transactions.

There are other minor problems that show inconsistencies in DePop's interactions with users, but this was one that put my money in limbo. It's hard for me to look past this!! I hope they are better about getting back to emails and preventing "glitch" deletions of accounts.

I want to stress that the items, app design, user friendliness, and buying processes are all very nice. But please, know the risks!

title: ...and I’m uninstalling it
review:
Installed this app about an hour ago. It took me 45 mins and the process was tedious and annoying to sign up, select my styles and sizes, etc. I figure it’s worth it in the name of shopping!
Nope!
There is no fluidity to the app and when I look at an item, I can only see the main picture. My “swipe” isn’t swiping. I searched for some kind of help within the app but there is none available! What happens if I have a question about an item or an issue????
Inthis world of cyber shopping, there are far too many other competitors out there to bother running around trying to find help.
I am a customer service manager and love my job, so I me have high standards when it comes to expecting great service in return- and not having to go hunting for it.Thank You, no.

title: FIX.THE.BUGS
review: The app is super sucky right now. I can’t open it I can’t do anything with it then what good are ya? Come on already. It’s been like this for a while now. Make it work.

title: Login issues
review: I used to have depop a while back and I stopped using it and I just redownloaded it and it locked me out of my account bc I hadn’t used it for so long. So I had to change my password to get back in but everytime I tried it wouldn’t send me the email. I finally got an email for it and I tried to reset it and it said my password was reset and I could login again but I tried and it kept saying invalid username or password And now I’m locked out of my account again bc I tried to login too many times. And ontop of all that I can’t create a new account bc my phone number is already used for my old account. I’m sure depop is a great app if you can actually login but it really shouldn’t be this difficult just to get into your account.

title: SHIPPING PRICES ARE A SCAM
review:
Depop advertised “lowered prices and more shipping tiers” with updated shipping pricing, too bad weight limits were significantly lowered and prices (in reality) are jacked up instead. $10.90 to ship a TWO pound box? LOL even poshmark’s raising rates are more reasonable ($7.11 for FIVE pounds)

Any plans to go back to reasonable shipping rates?

title: Great; could use some improvements
review: I’ve used depop for years, and have had an overall positive experience. While this might be small, the most bothersome issue I have is the method of searching.  When searching for a profile, I find it quite annoying that the profiles I follow don’t show up first. So, when I’m trying to find a friend that I follow, I have to write their username exactly, which I often don’t know. I think it would be very useful for the search to prioritize people you follow that start with those letters.

title: Difficult
review: I found selling on Depop to be pretty difficult I built up a following and got a lot of orders but PayPal together with Depop would find ways to put my payments on hold for the most random reasons and I haven’t gotten paid on more than half of my orders to this day these orders have been put in about a month ago and PayPal’s date just keeps on extending for the day that they’re going to release the money to meBecause of “guidelines” that just don’t make sense.For example on one of the products that I was selling PayPal and Depop have my money on hold for the guideline that “the seller might not like the product” andI currently have my money on hold because of unusual selling patterns (I sold a lot at the beginning of the month and it kind of slowed down) and a change in price of a product that I lowered the price of. All I know I know a lot of people don’t have these problems so it might just be me but depop is a great place to shop but um not so sure about selling
developerResponse: {'id': 19694504, 'body': "Hey, sorry to hear about this. It sounds like it's due to you having a new PayPal account, but I'd suggest contacting PayPal for more info.\n\nTeam Depop", 'modified': '2020-12-11T10:29:59Z'}

title: Duped
review: My first transaction and I was taken for 100.00$. Posted a picture of shoes and 100.00$ by the picture.  She is saying she doesn’t have to give the money back. Please be careful on this app. I thought it was like EBAY and Poshmark. People can put up pictures of items and then receive payments.  Thread lightly. Pay close attention to what is displayed. I still haven’t received my 100.00$.  It does not take one month to give someone a money back

title: FIX THE APP! SQUASH THE BUGS
review:
When attempting to email  support you end up repeating what you've already alluded to, to former support reps. The issue is simply the app is almost unusable;

1. you tap on a members profile, attempt to view a members item and it whites out, you then attempt tap or swipe back and the item whites out unable to view the photos.

2. On your shop when you tap the 3 dots in the top right corner its unresponsive. Meaning you cannot mark an item as sold, share etc.

3. Occasionally when you want to "save"  or "like" an item its unresponsive. Also, there are times when you cannot access a members profile.

I have deleted the app, cleared cache, redownloaded the app it's the same ole song. 

It's frustrating because there are times you cannot communicate to members on an item in the message section. 

PLEASE.YALL HAVE TO FIX THIS. YESTERDAY. RÁPIDO! 

It WAS such an awesome app. 

Whats the use of buying a car if you can't drive it? 

Restore the faith depop team 🙏

title: The Update Significantly Ruined My Sales
review: I am a seller and ever since Depop did their update not too long ago my account has been getting a drastic decrease in likes and sales. I earlier made the mistake of posting a custom piece that had a luxury brand printed on it (I explained it was fake in the caption many times), and I was still flagged for trying to sell counterfeit. Since then, I believe my account has been “shadow banned” because i am no longer getting the same love I did before. I also have been in the top 1000 worldwide sellers for the past month and my rating is going down every week (from in the 400s to now in the 700s). Also I forgot to mention, I never get featured on the explore page anymore when I used to this summer before all of that happened. Anyways, I am very frustrated because I have been working extremely hard to continually post quality items and I still have over 100 five star reviews and yet it seems as if all of my hard work is not paying off anymore :(. I used to love Depop because I really enjoyed selling my thrift finds and receiving great reviews by providing quality service to my customers. It also used to cover far more than my rent per month so it was a great source of income for me. I would just really like to have to my account looked at and reconsidered if I am potentially “shadow banned” or a flagged account and I would be happy to see if I can have any improvement with my sales. My account is @joeybrzezinski. Thank you!

title: More pictures please!
review:
I would really like to make to depop my main selling app, however I’d really like to be able to add more than four photos. I also think that more of the features you can use on the depop desktop site should be available on the app. like rearranging your store photos, and moving all sold items to the bottom. I would also like to be able to offer discount code and promos to likers of items, as well as on instagram. Thanks! 

UPDATE! 
Uh oh! Major bugs after latest phone update on 10/30/2020. Now I can’t access my photo albums. Yes, I have “allow all access to ALL photos” selected in systems. The screen pops down then back up rapidly before I can click on it. 
Also... Still waiting for MORE than four PICTURES to be allowed per listing. Vinted is allowing over 10 photos now!! Poshmark is up to 8. 12 allowed on eBay. Come on y’all are lagging.

title: Depop Issues
review: I was suspended from my account for 48 hours for no reason but said it was because of my misuse of hashtags when i never once misused / inappropriately used my descriptions. While being suspended, i attempted to log into my account many times without the knowledge of knowing that attempting to log in too many times will completely ban me from logging into my account. @doofymandis is my only income at the moment and I see it priority that I need to get back into my account as soon as possible. Please don’t ban me from my only source of income, I need to be able to log back in. I tried resetting my password but it said I have had to many log in attempts and can’t reset the password to my account. I also have people who have bought from my shop and i haven’t been able to print out shipping labels because i’m unable to get into my account because it was suspended for 48 hours then locked for too many log in attempts!!! This is completely unfair to the buyers and myself because like I said, I never was notified or aware that I would be locked out of my account for trying to log in while being suspended. Because of covid, depop has been my only source of income as i’ve previously stated and I really need my account back up and running as soon as possible! My account is @doofymandis on depop. I’ve never received any complaints on my account, I’ve maintained a 5 star review from each buyer and have never misused any hashtags or violated any rules even though many of my items have been removed from your team numerous amounts of times for absolutely no reason. Again, my account is @doofymandis and yes, i have tried resetting my password but am blocked from doing so. i NEED to get my orders shipped but to do that, i need to get back into my account this is a priority. I’ve emailed depop many times trying to resolve this issue but have gotten no response. I’ve contacted depop in every way possible and absolutely nothing on their end.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18830372, 'body': "Hey there,

We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. In order to keep our Community safe, all decisions made to suspend users and items are taken after deep investigation and consideration. If you feel this is unfair, just drop us a reply in the original email thread. We’re always happy to take a second look.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-11-01T17:46:40Z'}

title: Overpriced, misrepresented merchandise
review: Besides for the app being quite clunky and not user friendly, it’s also not a great place to get clothing. My daughter is very into fashion and was excited to try this app, which was recommended on several YouTube channels. She searches for what she liked, and carefully chose several purchases. Literally every item we got was garbage, the kinds of pieces Goodwill can’t get rid of for a dollar. The items were misrepresented as being in good condition, what we got was heavily stained and pilled clothing. The only recourse is to try to work with the seller, or file a claim with PayPal, both of which are a pain. We’ll be sticking to apps that offer buyer protections and actually block sellers who blatantly misrepresent their merchandise.
developerResponse:
{'id': 18550481, 'body': "Hey there,


We’re sorry to hear your experience hasn't gone to plan. We offer Buyer Protection for all items purchased in-app using the ‘BUY’ button. 

Read more in-app about what to do next by going to ‘Settings - Need help’ and typing in ‘Buyer Protection’.

We're here to help you,
Team Depop 
", 'modified': '2020-10-18T22:32:11Z'}

title: Address Change & Refund = Jumping Through Hoops On Fire
review:

Also, good luck processing a refund, let it be via a PayPal transaction OR Depop. PayPal hasn’t reflected either of 2 purchases I’ve made so I’ve no transaction #s although my debit card history clearly states the transactions were completed via PayPal... 

I’m convinced they’re working together to rip people off *Ye Shrug*

THREDUP.COM - DASSIT

title: Beware of Scammers
review:
Had a seller tell me he was selling “Authentic jordan 1s”, got them in the mail and they were fakes. Depop allows sellers to create their own rules such as no returns no refunds, etc. Beware because a lot of people on this app sell fake items, but claim that they are authentic. Stick to Goat, stock x or other apps to buy things from! 
Funny thing is, the guy who sold me the fake Jordan 1s gathered over 60 sales on his profile in a matter of weeks when I had first seen his profile he was at 20 sales! Let’s say he’s selling each pair of shoes for $150( at the minimum, most shoes can go for up to $300), he just made $9,000! Pretty awesome for the scammers, but beware buyers! By the time my shoes were shipped, the buyer emailed me to let me know he had to “delete his depop account due to problem with the app”. Sounds like he creates these random accounts, sells a ton of shoes, erases the account so he can’t be tracked, then most likely continues his hustle! This users name was @julio01 (good luck finding him now, as there is no trace of him to be found), and he also messaged me off a sketch email. All in all, I deleted the app and will warn anyone who tries to download it!

title: WORST PLATFORM (no I don’t mean shoes) TO SELL ON
review:
Here I am today wasting my mortal life dealing with these complicated individuals. They just want money and it’s very clear from the email promotions as well as the percentage they take from sales. Now 10% may not seem like a lot when something is $10, however when it becomes $100 and you lose $10 it’s a little bit more of a dent. Not to mention PayPal tales fees from the WHOLE amount you make, not after the fee depop takes. In actuality you’re losing about 14% of your sales. Making money during this time of uncertainty is hard to come by. The sellers on here are nice, but the customer service blows. 

You have a better chance of making money on selling through Instagram or literally anything that isn’t depop. The help center should be called “company coverage” because all they do is cover the company’s butt for whatever these idiots are doing that they can blame you for.

Sorry to be a Karen, but this actually is the worst thing available on the App Store.

title: Addictive
review:
Depop is built deliberately like a social media app, and that makes it absolutely addictive. I have trouble getting off this app. You might say “that’s a you problem” but I swear this app is built different. Easy to spend hours on. 

Such a great app but sometimes I wonder, why do I have so many followers and not a lot of likes? Where do these followers come from, and why don’t they look at my items? The mysteries of depop. 

I recommend this app if you want to buy sustainably and support individual businesses. You can probably find any clothing item you need on here that you would find on amazon, so better not support amazon.

title: Great except for one thing
review:
I’ve been selling on depop for four years now and only this summer began to take it seriously, but with a lot of hard work I managed to pull in a couple grand. 

Depop has been great except for one thing - their enormous fees. 10% may not seem like a ton but factor in payment processing fees/PayPal selling fees and it’s actually a huge chunk. If a buyer pays $25 + $10.50 ship and I get $21 or so it seems like so much less. I have a spreadsheet of my costs/earnings this summer and depop made about $1000 off of me this summer. I’m sure they pull in a ton of revenue every day. If they could make the fee 5% or something like that it would save me a lot. 

Other than that, all good!

title: ◻️great app with great potential!◾️
review: ◾️◻️i downloaded depop in the beginning of the summer for no reason other than summer boredom. after scrolling through the app for a while, i recognized that it was a pretty great app. depop is a large online marketplace where you can buy or sell clothes, accessories, pretty much anything. it's set up a bit like instagram, but with more selling and buying (obviously). i am both a depop seller and buyer. i recently started my own shop and i'm about to post my first few items! the reason i'm giving this app four stars is because it has one small flaw that i think could definitely be improved upon. depop makes it fairly difficult to find other sellers and get your own shop discovered. the algorithm should definitely have a way to suggest shops to you. instagram has a feature where you follow an account and it shows accounts that are similar to the one you just followed. if depop had something like this, sellers could get discovered more easily! just a thought. and oh, while i'm here: here's my depop! @stuckonaname thanks for reading, now go download depop!◻️◾️

title: scammed
review: terrible app. made me pay 10.50 for shipping when I selected the 6.50 option, twice. i'm the seller, and this happened twice to me. When I made a report to depop, they told me they wouldn't refund because I used the shipping label they charged me for. they expected me know to buy another label. after making my report, they looked through the items on my account and flagged one of my items as prohibited so I can no longer sell if I get another incident. the item did not violate the guildelines that they sent to me, and it had been up for months before then

title: many troubles with the app
review:
i love depop and i think it’s great. i’ve found so many cool things on it, some of my favorite things in my closet are from depop. i have been having a lot of trouble with the app recently. it started on about sunday by me trying to list things several times and everytime i tried, it kept saying ‘failed’. i kept pressing retry and i tried reposting the listing many times. it still wasn’t working so i then, deleted the app and it still wasn’t working. i tried deleting and redownloading the app about 15 times and it never worked. i tried turning my device off all the way and it still wasn’t working. at this point, i was ridiculously frustrated so i dmed depop’s official account on instagram about it three times and they never answered. i then went on to google what was going on and none of them told me any real information. i decided at that point to leave it alone for a few days and then log back in. it kept doing the same thing. at this time i got used to it and i decided to leave it be for a few more days. i tried again to list something, and it still wasn’t working. i then left a review for depop yesterday morning on the app store, in hopes they would reply and tell me what i’m doing wrong and they never replied. i was frustrated but i understood that they were busy and they can’t reply to everyone. then, earlier today, i was looking at buying something off depop, and it logged my account out. i was confused, but i tried putting my account log in many and i thought it would let me in. each time was just the same as the last, it didn’t work and it told me ‘the operation could not be completed. please try again later.’ i tried again a few hours later and it still wasn’t working. i deleted the app and redownloaded it several times. it never worked. i then decided to leave a review and tell you guys what’s going on, and hopefully you guys can get me back into my account. the only reason it’s a problem is because, i have many things on the way and i would hope to atleast leave a review first, or be able to tell the seller if i never receive my item. 
if it helps, my depop is @clikkieemma :)
developerResponse: {'id': 16718247, 'body': "Hey! The good news is we've fixed this bug, if you update to the latest version it should be resolved now. Team Depop", 'modified': '2020-07-18T20:00:44Z'}

review: Customer service is crap. Was told I couldn’t change my username because I did business outside of depop yet they were so petty and stupid that they couldn’t provide PROOF of this. Can’t even open the app anymore. It’s ridiculous

title: Disorganized
review: Made one purchase on this app I will never do so again. There is no search filter when trying to look up specific items or their price. Very dis-organized set up and hard to navigate.Certain tags are filled with spam not even related to the item being searched

title: Depop doesn’t care about its users. Please read.
review: I have been selling on depop for almost a year now. I had 60+ sales, numerous 5 star reviews, and over 1000 followers. Depop deleted my account @denisegraceshop for no reason. Their customer service has offered no help. I have made thousands of dollars for depop, through buying and selling many items. Depop DOES NOT CARE. Other resale apps have never treated me like this. If you are reading this, please stick to Poshmark, Mercari, or Ebay! These platforms are so much better for the consumer and seller.
developerResponse:
{'id': 11515048, 'body': "Hey. We're here and we're listening. If you need to find us, head in app and go to 'settings - support - need help' and follow the relevant steps.

Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 

See our article ‘What about fees’ on our Help Centre: https://depophelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360001791127-What-about-fees-

With Drop Shipping, we're investigating our options on a company-wide level to assess its impact on our Community. Our priority is to ensure that Depop highlights the type of items you want to see.

Team Depop", 'modified': '2019-10-28T14:58:53Z'}

title: Not a huge fan
review: So I sold something for $36.50 and got a note that “Depop is taking $9.50” and I was like ugh but okay, that’s shipping and their fee. BUT you have to hook up to PayPal who will also take a few from you so quite literally went from making money to practically losing money. I ended up taking away $25. And PayPal counts you as a “seller” due to this relationship so depending on how much you sell you could end up having to pay taxes as well?? Stupid and not worth it.
developerResponse:
{'id': 16192973, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review. Our 10% fee allows us to keep Depop running smoothly. It contributes towards the cost of running the app, creating new features and improving our Community’s experience. 
 
See our article about fees by going to 'Settings - Need help' and typing in ‘What about fees’.
Team Depop
", 'modified': '2020-06-24T11:41:57Z'}

title: Scammed !!!!!
review: Becareful on this app, got scammed out of $200.00 and wasn’t able to get a refund. Make sure the seller is legit. Ask for videos and pictures of the item your interested in, especially if it’s electronic items. People steal pictures from anywhere to post them on this app for sale...
